So þat þis guode man &punctelev; in prisone lay ful longue
Atþe laste, þe &yogh;wyle is fader &punctelev; out of toune gan i-wende
his Moder hadde reovþe of him &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te him out of bende
Þo he was out of bendes i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; he ne bi-lefte no leng þer
he wende to þe Dich a&yogh;ein &punctelev; fro &yogh;wannes he cam er
¶ Þo þis housebonde cam hom &punctelev; and ne founde him nou&yogh;t þere
Swiþe sore he beot is wijf &punctelev; and axede &yogh;ware he were
To þe churche of seint Damian &punctelev; þe housebonde wende þo
And fond þat tresor al-hol þere &punctelev; ase he it hadde i-do
And sethþe he wende to þe Dich &punctelev; and founde is sone þere
he axede at him for &yogh;wat þingue &punctelev; þat tresor a-wei he bere;
And þo he i-sei&yogh; al þen ende &punctelev; þat he luyte þar-of rou&yogh;te
he ladde Fraunceys forth with him &punctelev; ant bi-fore þe Bischop him brou&yogh;te
And bad, &yogh;if he alles wolde &punctelev; þe worldes guod bi-leue
Þat he bi-fore þe Bischope þer &punctelev; þat tresor up &yogh;eue
¶ Seint Fraunceis with þulke worde &punctelev; glad and Ioyful stod
Þare and bi-fore god he &yogh;af up &punctelev; al his eorþelich guod
And streopte of is cloþes &punctelev; a-non to is bare liche
And bi-fore þe Bischope tok is fader &punctelev; and bad him beo guod and riche;
he seide, "ich þe habbe fader i-cleoped &punctelev; euere to þis day
And nouþe it is so feor i-come &punctelev; þat non more i-ne may;
Segge ich mot mi .pater-noster &punctelev; heonne-forthþe-ward i-wis
And to mi fader holde me &punctelev; þat in heuene is."
Nakede he wende fram is fader &punctelev; bi-fore heom þare echon;
Worldes guod aftur þulke tyme &punctelev; ne bod he neuereft non
¶ A seli vplondischse Man &punctelev; þat nakede sai&yogh; him go
Gret deol in is heorte hadde &punctelev; for is chele and for is wo
he &yogh;af him ane olde Mantel &punctelev; his bones þare-with to hele;
Seint Fraunceis it vnder-feng &punctelev; to witien him fram chele
his licame he heolede þare-with &punctelev; and in myseise i-nov&yogh;
A-&yogh;en þare he was i-bore &punctelev; to Asise he him drov&yogh;
¶ Ase he hadde er i-beo so riche &punctelev; and so wel was i-knowe
A beggare he cam a[n]d bad is mete &punctelev; þere-aftur in a þrowe
Fram dore to dore he bad is mete &punctelev; and wonede him þar-to;
Some weren wroþe for is dedes &punctelev; and no guod nolden him do
Of þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; he ne made no-þing &yogh;uyte;
he bi-gan in pouerte i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and with luyte pruyte
¶ Men of þe contreie weren &punctelev; a-boute for-to a-mende
Seint Damianes churche &punctelev; þat al a-done-ward wende
Þare ase seint Fraunceys hadde i-beo &punctelev; and tresor bi-left þere
Þo he ne mi&yogh;hte non oþur do &punctelev; þe churche for-to a-rere
he wende þudere and sore swonk &punctelev; and bar morter þar-to
And sethþe he eode and bad is mete &punctelev; &yogh;wane he hadde al i-do
¶ Ane churche sethþe of seint peter &punctelev; men arerden elles-&yogh;[w]are
Þis holie man in is miseise &punctelev; wel sone he was þare
And Morter and ston drou&yogh; þer-to &punctelev; and sore swonk al-so
And sethþe eode and bad is mete &punctelev; þo he hadde al i-do
&YOGH;wane he heorde of ani churche &punctelev; þat ou&yogh;wer was for-ta-rere
he wende þudere, and longue him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; are he were þere
¶ To seinte Marie in desert &punctelev; ate laste he wende wel stille
And criede on ore louerd ni&yogh;ht and day &punctelev; þat he dude bi him is wille
And þat he &yogh;eue him is grace þere &punctelev; in &yogh;wat manere he best mi&yogh;hte
his churche þat a-doneward was &punctelev; best a-rere up and di&yogh;hte
So þat god him &yogh;af þe grace &punctelev; þat he þare bi-gan
Þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; to saui mani a man
¶ In þe bi-guynningue of þis ordre &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;ef þat cas
Ane masse he i-heorde a day &punctelev; þat of þe Apostles was;
As man rat &yogh;uyt a-mong us &punctelev; in þe godspelle it seide þo
Þat ore louerd hiet is desciples &punctelev; þo huy scholden a-boute go
Þat huy ne beren with heom gol[d] ne seluer &punctelev; &yogh;wane huy wenden ouer lond
Ne baggue, ne tweie curtles noþur &punctelev; ne schon, goinde with ouer lond[Ashm. ne staf in hor hond]
¶ In þis manere ore louerd hiet &punctelev; his Apostles gon
Þo seint Fraunceis i-heorde þis &punctelev; he dude of is schon
And poruei&yogh;ede þat frere Menours &punctelev; barefot scholden gon
With-oute bagge, with-oute staf &punctelev; with-oute ani þing to spene
Bote ech frere Menour do al-so &punctelev; he ne halt nou&yogh;t is ordre, ich wene
In stude of is gurdel al-so &punctelev; with rope he him bond
In þis manere frere Menours &punctelev; scholden go ouer lond
¶ Seint Fraunceis bi-þou&yogh;te þus &punctelev; to don þis holie dede
And made þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; al ase þe godspel sede
¶ Bernard, þat was a guod scholer &punctelev; formest to him cam
And þe ordre of frere menours &punctelev; of him formest he nam
he axede at him hov he scholde best &punctelev; þe world clanliche for-sake
To seint Nicholas churche huy wenden &punctelev; ane masse-bok huy gonne take
Þe bok was i-closed faste to &punctelev; seint Fraunceis hine gan vndo
Al on-mundliche he on-dude þe bok &punctelev; and þe furste þat he cam to
Þat was a godspel þat seith &punctelev; "&yogh;if þou wolt parfijt beo
Sul al þi guod and &yogh;if pouere men &punctelev; and sethþe siwe me!"
¶ Al vn-Mundlingue he cam eft-sone &punctelev; to a godspel þat seide
Þat man ne scholde seluer ne gold &punctelev; bi þe weie lede
Þe þridde tyme al on-Mundlingue &punctelev; þe masse-bok he wende
Þo cam he opon þis godspel &punctelev; ase ore louerd him grace sende
"ho-so wole come after me &punctelev; him-sulf he schal for-sake
And is owene rode bere &punctelev; and þene wei after me so take."
¶ "Þov i-fuxt here," quath seint Fraunceis &punctelev; "hou ore louerd in a stounde
Sent us grace ope &yogh;wuche þingue &punctelev; we schullen þis ordre founde
Opon þeos þreo god-spelles, þov fuxt &punctelev; þat we habbeth furst i-founde
We schullen foundi al ore ordre &punctelev; and opon þis strongue grounde."
Opon þis[MS. þis þis] þreo godspelles he maude[maudre] is ordre &punctelev; and is riule[Ryvle on the margin.] for|sothþ
And þe frere Menor brekez is ordre &punctelev; þat þare-a&yogh;ein ou&yogh;t dothþ
¶ Fre Gyles was þo þe ferste— &punctelev; þat guod scoler hadde i-beo
Þat aftur frere Bernard þe ordre nam &punctelev; and sethþe oþur þreo
So þat vnder heom alle sixe freres &punctelev; to-gadere weren i-brou&yogh;t
And þei þis ordre were i-maud &punctelev; i-confermed nas heo nou&yogh;t
¶ Seint Fraunceys þe holie Man &punctelev; þo god þe tyme sende
To confermi is ordre a-ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; toward Rome he wende
Ake swiþe sore he was of-drad &punctelev; laste þe pope were
Contrarious a-&yogh;ein is Ordre &punctelev; þat heo i-confermed nere
Ake forth he wende to fondi &punctelev; he nolde nou&yogh;t beo bi-hynde;
And euere he bad Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he moste som grace finde
¶ Þo þou&yogh;te him in a wision &punctelev; þat [he] i-sai&yogh; a gret treo
So hei&yogh; þat he was a-drad &punctelev; toward þe coppe i-seo;
And netheles on aunture he him dude &punctelev; and nam þar-of a bov&yogh;
Aboue in þe hexte stude &punctelev; and toward him it drov&yogh;
hit bei&yogh; al a-doun to him &punctelev; aftur is wille i-nov&yogh;
For al þat him dradde furst &punctelev; þat it was hei&yogh; and tov&yogh;
¶ Þo þis holie man a-wok &punctelev; on þis sweuene he þou&yogh;te longue
And þare-þoru&yogh; he hopede of þe pope &punctelev; sum grace for-to afongue;
For þe treo þat was so hei&yogh; &punctelev; lij&yogh;thtliche to grounde drov&yogh;
Also he hopede þene hei&yogh;e pope &punctelev; to is wille bringue i-nov&yogh;
To þe pope Innocent &punctelev; þo he to Rome cam
he bad graunti is Religion &punctelev; to amendi cristindam
A[n]t þat he scholde is ordre preouen &punctelev; and is Revle al-so
Þoru&yogh; þe godspel of godes word &punctelev; and þer-aftur do
¶ Þo þe pope is Revle isei&yogh; &punctelev; þat heo was clene and guod
And ope þe godspelle i-founded al &punctelev; ase he wel onder-stod
In is herte he grauntede it &punctelev; ake nou&yogh;t with is Mouth a-non
For he moste is cardinales &punctelev; conseili þare-uppe ech-on
¶ So þat a-Mong þis Cardinales &punctelev; counseil þere was i-nome
Some heolden þare-a&yogh;ein &punctelev; and also þare-with some
Þo was þer a Cardinal &punctelev; þat Bischop was al-so
Maister Iohan of seint poul &punctelev; þat faste heold þer-to
And seide, "&yogh;if we destourbieth him &punctelev; a&yogh;ein þe godspelle we beothþ
&YOGH;wane he spechut al vpe godes word &punctelev; ase we wel i-seothþ."
¶ In Avisioun to þe pope &punctelev; a-ni&yogh;ht also it cam
Þat he grauntede him is Reule &punctelev; to saui cristindom
So þat þe pope grauntede him &punctelev; al is Reule to do
And confermede þoru&yogh; al þe court &punctelev; and bi-hiet him more þer-to
Þo wende forthþ þis holie Man &punctelev; and is freres withþ him nam
And prechede a-boute þe godspelles &punctelev; to amendi cristindom
¶ Þo þe contrei&yogh;e i-sei&yogh; heom ferst &punctelev; gret speche was þere
Some seiden þat Aunte-crist &punctelev; oþur is desciples it were;
So þat in wel manie studes &punctelev; luyte guod men heom sende
And huy weren ofte ofhungrede sore &punctelev; ase huy a-boute wende
So þat huy comen into a stude &punctelev; and ofhungrede weren sore
Þat some of þe freres hadden i-þou&yogh;t &punctelev; in þe ordre to beo non-more
Þo cam þere a wel fair man &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te heom mete i-nov&yogh;
Sone huy nusten &yogh;ware he bi-cam &punctelev; ne &yogh;woder-ward he drov&yogh;
Þis freres i-sei&yogh;en fule þo &punctelev; þat an Aungel it was
Þe studefastore in heore ordre &punctelev; huy weren for þis cas
And bi-hieten god þat huy nolden neuere &punctelev; for miseise ne for wo
In þe ordre bi heore mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; pouerte fur-go
¶ Bi-side þe toun of Asise &punctelev; feor fram eche strete
huy wenden alle to one stude &punctelev; þat was al fur-lete
Miseyse huy hadden þare i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and ofte wepen sore
For defaute of heore sustinaunce &punctelev; and for defaute of bokes more
For huy ne hadde bokes none &punctelev; &yogh;ware-on huy mi&yogh;hten loke
In þe croiz huy bi-heolden al day &punctelev; in-stude of heore boke
And beden god[MS. guod], &yogh;if it were is wille &punctelev; þat he scholde heom sum guod teche
For huy nadden non oþur bok &punctelev; ne nusten &yogh;ware-with any a-reche
¶ To seinte Marie in desert &punctelev; þannes huy gunne i-wiende
Ase huy bi-gunnen furst þe ordre &punctelev; to bringue as þare to ende
Seint Fraunceis wende bi þe londe &punctelev; and prechede a-boute þere
Men wenden, þo huy sei&yogh;en him furst &punctelev; þat of an oþur worlde he were;
For he capede euere upward &punctelev; toward heouene an hei&yogh;
Þat men wondreden and speken þar-of &punctelev; euer-ech þat him i-sei&yogh;
Manie heolden him a truant &punctelev; of þe deueles lore
And harleden him here and þer &punctelev; and ofte beten him sore
Þis holie man ne tok none &yogh;eme &punctelev; ake criede ore louerdes ore
And &yogh;ware men duden him mest schame &punctelev; þudere he drov&yogh; þe more
¶ Idel ne kepte he neuere beo &punctelev; he ne louede no þin[g] so luyte
Ne hatede so muche ase he dude Aise &punctelev; and idelnesse and pruyte
"Frere Asse" he cleopede is owene flesch— &punctelev; for &yogh;e wuten wel þat an Asse
Nabbe heo neuere so luyte mete &punctelev; is trauail nis no þe lasse
For heo is i-harled here and þere &punctelev; and to file weorke i-do
I-priked and i-scourget eke &punctelev; and sackes heo berez al-so;
Of &yogh;eomere þingue heo is i-fed &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo alles comez þar-to
And selde heo is i-coureyd wel &punctelev; with-ovte nail an scho
¶ He seruede so is owene flesch &punctelev; and cleopede it "frere Asse"
Mete he &yogh;af him luyte i-nov &punctelev; and to cloþingue wel lasse;
he prikede also and scourgede ek &punctelev; and þoru&yogh;-out þe contrei&yogh;e
harlede it and deope wod &punctelev; bare-fot in deope weye
&YOGH;wane he i-sai&yogh; ani idel Man &punctelev; þat louede glotonie
And ne trauailede nou&yogh;t for is mete &punctelev; he cleopede him "frere flie"
For þe flie ne doth non oþur guod &punctelev; bote fleoth feor and neor
And a-waytez &yogh;wane men goth to mete &punctelev; oþur to heore soper;
A-non so þe Disch is i-set a-doun &punctelev; heo wole beo ope þe brerde
Of trauail ne wo ne kep[t]hþ heo nou&yogh;t &punctelev; bote þat heo wel ferde;
¶ &YOGH;wane a Man hath al dai i-swounke &punctelev; þei he it hadde i-swore
he ne schal to is Disch come so sone &punctelev; þat þe flie nele beo bi-fore
¶ Also farez manie idele Men &punctelev; þat non oþer guod nelleth do
Bote &yogh;wanne oþur Men beth to-ward þe mete &punctelev; &yogh;are huy beth þar-to;
Atþe Dische huy wollez al-so sone beo &punctelev; ase huy þat habbez i-swounke
And þanne is al heore weork i-do &punctelev; habben huy i-&yogh;ete and i-dronke;
Þanne gothþ huy ligge slepe &punctelev; oþur gothþ to some folie
Þare-fore seint Fraunceys cleopede &punctelev; swuche men "frere flie"
¶ Of noþing nas þis holie man &punctelev; so glad ase of edwij&yogh;t
For &yogh;wane ani Man opbraid is pouerte &punctelev; he was in gret deli&yogh;t;
&YOGH;wane Men cleopeden him hoxtare &punctelev; oþur cheorl oþur cheorles sone
For port-Men beoth ofte boistouse &punctelev; and hoxtares bi wone
"leue broþer," he seide &punctelev; "certes, þov seist sothþ
I-blessed beo þou for þat word &punctelev; and alle þat so dothþ
Preses[r. Perses (Ash. Peres)] sone Bernard &punctelev; it bi-comethþ bi ri&yogh;the lawe
To heore telle of is ri&yogh;hte &punctelev; ich auch&yogh;te beo glad and fawe."
And &yogh;wane men preiseden ou&yogh;t of is cuynde &punctelev; he nadde þare-of no deli&yogh;t
Þare-fore ho-so wolde him paye &punctelev; segge him sum edwi&yogh;t;
And bi-fore al folk a-brod &punctelev; in is prechingue he seide
his Miseise and is defaute &punctelev; ofte and is wrechhede.
¶ In poyle seint Fraunceis &yogh;eode &punctelev; some time ouer lond
So þat a porsful of panes &punctelev; bi þe weie he fond;
he ne tok non more &yogh;eme þare-to &punctelev; þane to so muche fen
his felawe bad him nimen heom up &punctelev; and dele pouere men
"I nelle nou&yogh;t," seide seint Fraunceis &punctelev; "of oþur mannes dele."
"Me þunchez," seide is felawe þo &punctelev; "þat þov nart nou&yogh;t fele
Þat þou ne louest nou&yogh;t pouere men &punctelev; &yogh;wane þou nelt heom don no guod."
Þis holie man i-heorde þis &punctelev; and one &yogh;wile in þou&yogh;te stod;
¶ "Þou schalt," he seide, "sone i-seo &punctelev; &yogh;[w]at þis panes beoth ech-on."
he wende and nam up þat pors &punctelev; and openede him a-non
Þo crep þare out a naddre &punctelev; þe fouleste þat mi&yogh;hte gon
And þe pors al amti was &punctelev; and peni bi-lefte non;
And þat was þe Deuel of helle &punctelev; þat in þe fourme of panes lay
For-to bi-traye þis holie man &punctelev; &yogh;wane he þe panes i-sai&yogh;
¶ Þis holie Man seint Fraunceis &punctelev; among ech manere best
Muche he louede &yogh;oungue lambre &punctelev; and a-nourede heom euere mest
For ore louerd euenede him-sulf to a lomb &punctelev; þoru&yogh; seint Iohan þe Baptist
And for it is with-oute felonie &punctelev; and milde ase ihesu crist;
And ofte &yogh;wane men wolden heom quelle &punctelev; fram deþe he heom brou&yogh;te
With biddingue and with is faire word &punctelev; and fale siþes heom bou&yogh;te
¶ In þe Abbeye of seint verecunde &punctelev; a &yogh;oung lomb he founde
A souwe a-strangli it a-non &punctelev; and fret it in a stounde
Seint Fraunceis stod and bi-heold &punctelev; "A-mong alle bestes," he seide
"A-corsed þou beo, luþere souwe &punctelev; þat dudest þis luþere dede;
Þat þi lijf beo schort and strong &punctelev; and þi dethþ beo strong al-so
And þat no þing ne ete of þi flesch &punctelev; &yogh;wane þou ert of liue i-do!"
Þo bi-gan þe souwe a-non &punctelev; ase he þis word seide
To beo ful of schabbe and of buyles &punctelev; and of oþur wrechhede
Þat heo orn out al of quiture &punctelev; and ase þat folk i-sai&yogh;
In wrechhede and in sorewe inov &punctelev; heo deide þane þridde day
And fur-rotede and stonk foule i-nov&yogh;. &punctelev; no best þat it i-sei&yogh;
Rauon ne pie no oþur foul &punctelev; nolde enes come þare-nei&yogh;
¶ For seint Fraunceis louede lambre[orig. lombre] &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;
On of is freond for godes loue &punctelev; a lomb him &yogh;ef a day&yogh;
Þis lomb wolde old and &yogh;oung &punctelev; al dai nei&yogh; him beo
And maken with him Ioye i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; &yogh;wanne it him mi&yogh;hte i-seo
Seint Fraunceis hiet þis schep a day &punctelev; &yogh;wanne it heorde freres singue
To churche gon at eche tide &punctelev; and ne lete for none þingue
Þat schep aftur þulke time &punctelev; selde wolde a-bide
&YOGH;wane hit i-heorde freres in þe queor &punctelev; þat hit nas at eche tide;
Blete it wolde a-&yogh;enes heom &punctelev; for it ne couþe nou&yogh;t elles do;
And &yogh;wane it sai&yogh; þe freres sitten a-kneo &punctelev; kneuli it wolde al-so
And &yogh;wane ani preost sacrede &punctelev; kneoli it wolde þar-to
And wel inwardliche bi-holde þudere &punctelev; ase it sai&yogh; oþur freres do
Wel au&yogh;te we onouri þe sacringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane a swuch best wolde
A wonder bede-man it was &punctelev; to come to godes[A later hand adds: seruice so] bolde
¶ Ase seint Fraunceis þis holie man &punctelev; ouer lond ofte him drou&yogh;
Wilde foules, smale and grete &punctelev; honoureden him i-nov&yogh;
For ase he wende in atyme &punctelev; to prechie ouer lond
An hep of foules grete i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; In a stude he fond;
huy songuen and maden noyse i-nov &punctelev; euerech in is wise;
Þe &yogh;uyt þe holie man a-mong heom cam &punctelev; huy nolden nou&yogh;t enes arise
¶ "Beu frere," quath þis holie Man &punctelev; "ore sustren þat beoth here
honourieth god þat heom made &punctelev; ech in his manere;
Ri&yogh;ht is þat we don also &punctelev; are we fram heom gon."
huy gonne to segge heore tidene &punctelev; among þis foules ech-on
Þo maden þis foules so gret noise &punctelev; þat huy ne mi&yogh;hten noþing i-here
"Sostrene," quath þis holie Man &punctelev; "chaungiez eouwer manere
Beothþ nouþe stille and latehþ me segge &punctelev; mine tidene with mi frere
And sethþe &yogh;e mouwen aftur us &punctelev; euer-ech with is fere."
¶ Þis foules a-non-ri&yogh;ht to is heste &punctelev; stille weren al-so
And seten and heorden heore tidene &punctelev; for-to huy hadden al ido
"Nou sustren," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "we habbuthþ i-seid ore tide
Bi-guynnez ouwer &yogh;wane &yogh;e wollez &punctelev; &yogh;e ne þoruen no leng abide."
Þis foules bi-gonne singue anon &punctelev; þe leste and eke þe meste
Swiþe gret pouwer he hadde of god &punctelev; þat foules weren at is heste
¶ Þis holie man wende him forth &punctelev; to prechi ouer lond
A gret hep eft-sone of foules &punctelev; in on oþur stude he fond
he wende forthþ a-mong heom. &punctelev; þis foules bi-gonne echon
Louten to him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and honouri him a-non
Þis holie Man at-stod ane &yogh;wile &punctelev; and þou&yogh;te heom sum guod teche
And ri&yogh;ht ase it weren men of witte &punctelev; þis foules he gan to preche
¶ "Leoue sostrene," he seide, "for godes loue &punctelev; honouriethþ ore creatur
For a-mong alle liues &punctelev; &yogh;e au&yogh;ten him don honour
For he &yogh;ifht eov nobleie i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; wynguene for-to fleo
And feþerene to beren eov up-on hei&yogh; &punctelev; wide for-to seo
And mete &yogh;ware &yogh;e wollez a-li&yogh;hte &punctelev; with-oute eche-manere suynche
he &yogh;ifth eov also muche pruyte and ayse &punctelev; ase &yogh;e mouwen onne þenche;
Delue ne diki ne þorue &yogh;e naþur &punctelev; ase manie Men moten do
And &yogh;eot &yogh;e mouwen habbe mete i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; &yogh;wane oþere nabbeth nou&yogh;t so."
¶ Þis foules heorkeneden him wel stille &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile is prechingue i-laste
And fram wodes and fram oþur studes &punctelev; þuder-word drowen faste
Þo þis holie man hadde i-do &punctelev; he wende forth a-non
And bi-tei&yogh;te heom ihesu crist &punctelev; and blessede heom ech-on;
he pleide with heom murie i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; ase he among heom gan gon,[These vv. are out of order.]
And strokede heom with is longue fleue. &punctelev; þere nolde a-rise nou&yogh;t on
Are he wolde bidden heom wende forth &punctelev; &yogh;ware huy hadden to done
Þis foules, þo huy heorden þis &punctelev; huy flouwen forth wel sone
¶ Seint Fraunceis a-mong al oþur þingue &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht at is heorte grounde
Ofte he þou&yogh;te deope i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; of ore louerdes wounden;
So studefast-liche in is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; non oþur þing he ne nam
hit bi-feol at þe holie rode-tid &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;ein Mi&yogh;hel-Masse cam
Opon þe hul of Auuerne &punctelev; ase it was ore louerdes wille
Al one in is oresones &punctelev; þere he lai wel stille
he þou&yogh;te on ore louerdes woundene &punctelev; so deope þat it nas non ende
An Aungel he i-sai&yogh; an hei&yogh; &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht fram heouene wiende
¶ Six wingene him þou&yogh;te he hadde &punctelev; þat schinden bri&yogh;hte and wide
Þe tweie stoden up a-bouen is heued &punctelev; and þe tweien bi is side
And þoru&yogh;-out ouer is wombe a-creoyz &punctelev; tweien þere weren al-so
Ase men seothþ ofte in churche depeint &punctelev; ho-so lokethþ þare-to;
Þe Armes weren a-long i-sprad &punctelev; ase huy weren on þe rode
And þe fet i-streitht a-long &punctelev; al vrninde a-blode
Þoru&yogh; þe ri&yogh;ht side he was i-smite &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; fet and honde
hit was in fourme of an Aungel &punctelev; ore louerd, ich onder-stonde
¶ So gret Ioye hadde þis holie Man &punctelev; of þis noble si&yogh;hte
Þat him þou&yogh;te he was in an oþur world &punctelev; and þonkede godes mi&yogh;hte;
he nuste &yogh;wat for Ioye do &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle he þis fourme i-sei&yogh;h
At þe laste he fleu&yogh; a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; in-to heouene an hei&yogh;h
Seint Fraunceis was in Ioye i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; for he hadde þat noble si&yogh;th
And nameliche of ore louerdes wounden &punctelev; þat he wilnede dai&yogh; and ny&yogh;ht
Þo bi-heold he is owene hondene &punctelev; and is fiet al-so
Þo weren huy þoru&yogh;-out i-smite &punctelev; and þe nailes þar-on i-do
And is ri&yogh;ht side i-wounded al-so— &punctelev; ake wel sore neren huy nou&yogh;t;
So þat he hadde þe woundene him-sulf &punctelev; þat so muche weren in is þou&yogh;t
¶ Þe nailes weren blake i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þe hauedene rounde and grete
Þe poyntes weren euelongue &punctelev; ase huy weren a-&yogh;ei[n]ward-i-bete;
Aboute þe nailes þat flesch stod up &punctelev; ase it were al-to-swolle
And ase it al a-boute were &punctelev; for Anguyse to-bolle
In þis manere we mouwen beo sikere &punctelev; þat ore louerdes woundene were
For bote ase a schewingue and Ansaumple &punctelev; in seint Fraunceyse huy nere
So þat þis holie man hadde &punctelev; ore louerdes woundene fiue;
And bi-lefden on him aftur-ward &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile he was a-liue
At þe holie rode-tid in Septembre &punctelev; he gan furst þis þing i-seo;
Ac ope þe hulle he hadde er &punctelev; nei&yogh; a monþe i-beo
And fourtene ni&yogh;t þare-aftur-ward &punctelev; he bi-lefte &yogh;uyt þere;
So þat euene vnder al &punctelev; fourti dawes þere were
¶ Ase Moyses opon synay &punctelev; was bi olde dawe
Fourti dai&yogh;es in priuete &punctelev; to seon þe olde lawe
Also was þis holie Man &punctelev; fourti dawes ri&yogh;ht
Opon þe hulle of Auuerne &punctelev; to seo þat holie si&yogh;ht
So þat Aboute Mi&yogh;helmasse &punctelev; furst he wende to grounde;
Ac he hudde is fet and hondene faste &punctelev; þat Men ne i-sei&yogh;en þe wounde
With þe woundene he liuede two &yogh;er &punctelev; and prechede a-boute wide
And þe woundene ornen ofte a-blode &punctelev; and nameliche of is side
And bi-bledde is cuyrtel ofte &punctelev; and is briech al-so;
he carede muche hou he mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; stilleliche it a-wei do.
¶ Sethþe þare cam in þe londe &punctelev; a swyþe strong qualm of orue
Þat schep and reoþeren and oþur bestes &punctelev; aldai lei&yogh;en a-storue
A guod Man þat hadde muchel orf &punctelev; bad ore louerd wel faste
Þat he ne bi-nome him nou&yogh;t al is guod &punctelev; ake þat som him moste i-laste
Slepinde in ametingue &punctelev; to him seide þoru&yogh;[om. þoru&yogh;?] godes sonde
Þat he scholde nime of þat watur &punctelev; þat seint Fraunceis wusch inne is honde
Oþur is fet and þere-with &punctelev; a-mong þe bestes sprenge
And, &yogh;if him þou&yogh;te þare were to luyte &punctelev; with oþur watur it Mienge
¶ Þis guode Man þare-afturward &punctelev; a-waitede is point ofte
And stal of þis watur stilleliche &punctelev; in huydeles wel softe
And spreinde a-mong is owene orf &punctelev; and a-mong oþure mani on
And oueral þare it was i-spreind &punctelev; huy weren hole ech-on.
¶ Seint Fraunceis was frere Menour &punctelev; in þe ordre twenti &yogh;er
And two &yogh;er and al-mest þreo wyke &punctelev; ore louerdes woundene he ber
So þat he drou&yogh; to-ward þe deþe &punctelev; and feblischede ful swiþe faste
On him nas nou&yogh;t bote fel and bon &punctelev; bi-leued atþe laste
In torment he was strong i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and &yogh;wane he was in worst stounde
his lene bones he wolde drawe &punctelev; a-&yogh;ein þe harde grounde
For-to make þe more is pine &punctelev; and þe eorþe he custe al-so
And þonkede god of alle guode &punctelev; þat he him hadde i-do
he lay sijk and deide sone &punctelev; seint Fraunceis þe holie man
In ore leuedi churche &punctelev; þare he furst þe ordre bi-gan
¶ Þo he was þe deþe nei&yogh; &punctelev; naked he liet him do
And to þe harde vrþe al bar &punctelev; al nakede he lay so
And het heom þat a-boute him were &punctelev; þat aftur þulke stounde
huy leten him ligge longue also &punctelev; nakede on þe grounde
Þat eorþe mi&yogh;hte on eorþe dei&yogh;e &punctelev; for þat were is ri&yogh;hte
he bi-gan to prechi is breþren &punctelev; ope is feble mi&yogh;hte
¶ Atþe laste, þo he þene dethþ i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; and i-felde hine ful strongue
"Voce mea" he bi-gan &punctelev; one saume of euesongue
And seide forthþ þe saume al out &punctelev; and heold up is hondene hei&yogh;e
And with þe laste word of þe saume &punctelev; he bi-gan to dei&yogh;e
he deide tweolf hundred &yogh;er &punctelev; and sixe and twenti ri&yogh;ht
Aftur ore louerdes burtime &punctelev; on a satur-day at ni&yogh;ht
Þe sonendai he was i-bured— &punctelev; he ne ferde nou&yogh;t ase þis riche
Þat for bobaunt of þe world &punctelev; liggethþ longue a-liche
¶ Þo þis holie man was ded— &punctelev; þei it were bi ni&yogh;hte
A gret hep of lauerkene &punctelev; opon þe churche a-li&yogh;hte
And murie sounguen al þe longue ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; a-boute þe bodie þere
Þo þe soule to heouene wende &punctelev; a&yogh;ein kuynde þei it were
For þe lauerke is a foul &punctelev; þat muche louez li&yogh;ht
And herethþ þane dai with hire song &punctelev; and restez hire a-ni&yogh;ht
A&yogh;ein kuynde huy sounguen þere &punctelev; ase þei huy hadden in muynde
hou muche he was anoured er &punctelev; of foules a-&yogh;ein hore kuynde
¶ Frere Austyn, þat was ministre &punctelev; under him i-do
Þo þis holie man was ded &punctelev; atþe deþe he lai al-so
In þe londe of labour[Terra di Lavoro] &punctelev; þat feor was þare-bi-side
Wel longue he lai speche-les &punctelev; þene dethþ forto a-bide
And ri&yogh;ht ase seint Fraunceis deide &punctelev; feor in an oþur londe
Þis frere Austin spac wel mildeliche &punctelev; and heold up is two honden
"Abijd, broþur," he seide, "ane &yogh;wyle &punctelev; ich come with þe a-non."
his freres axeden him &yogh;wat it were— &punctelev; for heom wondrede ech-on
¶ "Bote frere Fraunceis," he seide, "ore fader &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t hath is lif to ende
And is nouþe toward heouene &punctelev; and with him i-chulle wende."
With þis word he gan dei&yogh;e &punctelev; and is soule al in pes
To þe Ioye of heouene wende &punctelev; with is maister seint Fraunceis
And þare huy [beoth] boþe &punctelev; in Ioye with-outen ende
Nou god for þe loue of seint Fraunceis &punctelev; late us alle þudere wende. AmeN
SEint Albon þe holie Man &punctelev; was here of Enguelonde
I-martred he was for godes loue &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes sonde
Formest he was heþene man &punctelev; and of heþene men he cam
And sethþe, ase ore louerd it wolde &punctelev; he tornede to cristindom
¶ Þe luþere prince þat was þo &punctelev; dioclician
And an oþur þat was al so &punctelev; þat hei&yogh;te Maximian
Cristine men þat huy mi&yogh;hten i-wite &punctelev; huy brou&yogh;ten alle to grounde;
In eche londe huy lieten heom seche &punctelev; &yogh;ware huy mi&yogh;hten beon i|founde
And to strongue deþe heom duden &punctelev; swiþe manie and fale;
huy ne spareden none þat huy mi&yogh;hten finde &punctelev; noþur grete ne smale
¶ A luþur Iustise þat with heom was &punctelev; to enguelonde he cam
To Martri alle cristine men &punctelev; and destruyen cristindom
A clerk, a guod cristine man þat was &punctelev; heorde it telle wide
Of tormens þat huy duden oþur men &punctelev; he ne dorste no long a-bide
Ake he fleu&yogh; elles-&yogh;wodere &punctelev; þat he i-Martred nere;
To seint Albones house he cam &punctelev; and bad is In þere
¶ Seint Albon, þe &yogh;wile he with him was &punctelev; a-waitede and i-sai&yogh;
hov he was in is oresones &punctelev; boþe ni&yogh;ht and dai&yogh;
he þou&yogh;te þat he was a fol &punctelev; þat he was heþene so longue
he gan to leue on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and cristinedom ta-fongue
¶ Þe Iustise þane clerk liet seche &punctelev; so þat it was i-kud
hou at seint Albones house &punctelev; with him he was i-hud
Kni&yogh;htes he sende to fechchen him &punctelev; &yogh;if he i-founde were
To seint Albon huy comen &punctelev; and echsten after him þere.[This v. is written on the margin; v. 25-6 are spurious.]
huy comen and founden seint Albon &punctelev; and axeden him a-non
&YOGH;weþur ani swuch þere were. &punctelev; "for gode," quath þis holie man
"For gode," seide þis guode Man &punctelev; "I nelle it nou&yogh;t for-sake
A swuch Man ich am mi-seolf &punctelev; I nelle eou non oþur take."
¶ "A, þeof," seiden þis luþere men &punctelev; "artþou i-come þar-to
&YOGH;wane þou wolt for þat strongue þef &punctelev; to deþe beo i-do?"
Þis holie man huy bounden faste &punctelev; and to þe Iustise him brou&yogh;te
And tolden him þat he pulte him forth &punctelev; for þat oþur þef þat huy sou&yogh;ten
¶ "Bel ami," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "seie &yogh;wat is þi name
And of &yogh;wat kunne þou art i-come &punctelev; þat ore godes dost schuch[r. swuch] schame."
"To þis Axingue," quath seint Albon &punctelev; "ichulle answerie sone
Of &yogh;wat kunne ich am i-come &punctelev; luyte þou hast to-done;
Alban is mi name, i-wis &punctelev; and ich honori al-so
God þat schop alle þing &punctelev; and euere-more wolle do."
¶ "A, traitur," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "artþou i-come þar-to
I schal don tormenti þi bodi &punctelev; fram heued to þin ho
hastþou i-hud þane þef at-hom &punctelev; þat doth us so muche schame
And pulst forthþ þi-self, þo[r. þou] cheitif &punctelev; to deþe in his name
Anoure ore godes, ich rede, a-non &punctelev; and heom sacrefise
Oþur ichulle þe tormenti so &punctelev; þat men schullen of þe agrise."
"For nou&yogh;t þou spext," quath Albon &punctelev; "þar-aboute þou spillest þi brethþ
I-nelle neuere þene deuel honoure &punctelev; for drede of þe dethþ."
¶ Þo was þe Iustise swyþe wroth &punctelev; þane holie man he nam
Nakede, and[al. he] liet him faste binde &punctelev; and &yogh;af him sone is dom
With schourges he made is tormentours &punctelev; leggen on him i-nowe
On him huy leiden þat huy werie weren &punctelev; and al is bodi to-drowe
Þe harde scourgene in is tendre flechs &punctelev; deope gonne wade;
Þe more þat huy tormenteden him &punctelev; þe gladdore he him made;
[53-4 added in L.]he þonkede god þat he moste &punctelev; þare for is loue
To þe stat of cristindom &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is torment come
¶ þo þe luþere Iustise i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; þat it was al for nou&yogh;t
Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte fram Iesu crist &punctelev; for no-þing torne is þou&yogh;t
he hiet him lede with-oute toun &punctelev; and is heued smite of sone
I-redie weren þe tormentours &punctelev; for-to do is bone
huy harleden him wel filliche &punctelev; þat schame it was to se
For-to huy comen to þulke stude &punctelev; þare he scholde i-martred be
huy comen to an vrninde brok &punctelev; þere huy mosten ouer wade
[63-4 added in L.]Þe tormentores woden ouer al a-brod &punctelev; and no strencþe þar-of ne maden
¶ Ake ore louerd for seint Albones loue &punctelev; dude miracle þere
A-non so þe schrewe tormentores &punctelev; ouer i-wade were
For þo þis holie Man to watere cam &punctelev; þat watur him with-drou&yogh;
And ouer þe broke made ane wei &punctelev; druy&yogh;e and clene i-nou&yogh;
þat he wende ouer al-so druy&yogh;e &punctelev; ase it a-londe were;
And euere þat watur bi-hinden him &punctelev; smot to-gadere þere
And cam al a-&yogh;ein ase it was er &punctelev; þo he cam to londe
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; ho-so him wole onder-stonde
¶ þe maister of þe tormentores &punctelev; to &yogh;wam he was bi-take
Þo he i-sai&yogh; þe faire miracle &punctelev; þene deuel he gan fur-sake
[73-4 spurious.]And seide he wolde to Ihesu crist &punctelev; al is heorte wende
For þe Miracle þat he þare i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; þat so fair was and hende;
his sweord þat he on honde bar &punctelev; wel feor fram him he caste
And to seint Albones fet he feol a-doun &punctelev; and criede him merci faste
Þat he moste for him dei&yogh;e &punctelev; oþur, bote it oþur were
Þat he moste in þe place &punctelev; þene dethþ a-fongue þere
¶ Opon an hul huy wenden an hei&yogh; &punctelev; ase huy weren a-signet to
Þis holie Man seint Albon &punctelev; to þe deþe do
Seint Albon wilnede aftur watur &punctelev; þare ope þe hulle on hei&yogh;;
he bi-heold þat þare ne mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; no watur come þare nei&yogh;
Ore louerd he bad with guode heorte &punctelev; þat he sende is grace
Þat som water moste to him come &punctelev; in þat ilke place
[85-6 added in L.]Ore louerd heorde is bone &punctelev; þare anon-ri&yogh;hte
bi-fore alle þe tormentores &punctelev; in heore alre si&yogh;hte
¶ For þo he hadde i-seid is oresun &punctelev; and ore louerd i-bede
Þare sprong out of þat hei&yogh;e [hul] &punctelev; a fair welle in þulke stude
Of al-so guod water ase ani mi&yogh;hte beo— &punctelev; þat &yogh;uyt lastethþ, ich wene
Euere was þo and al-so nouþe &punctelev; ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte i-sene
Þis guode kni&yogh;ht þat bi-liefde on god &punctelev; for þat he sei&yogh; er
Wel more he criede þo on him &punctelev; for þulke miracle þer
And wilnede &yogh;eorne þat he moste &punctelev; for him dei&yogh;e þere
So þat in ore louerdes name &punctelev; Imartrede boþe huy were
¶ Ake þe tormentour þat smot of &punctelev; seint Albones heued
Luyte he þorte þar-of &yogh;elpe &punctelev; him were betere habbe bi-leued
For þo he smot of is heued &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht in þulke stounde
his owene ey&yogh;ene out of is heued &punctelev; þare ri&yogh;ht fullen to grounde
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; ho-so him wole onder-stonde
Ase men mouwe bi is wiþer-wine &punctelev; godes mi&yogh;hte fonde.[g. m. f. on the mar|gin; puyrliche onder-stonde ex|punged.]
Seint Albon i-martred was &punctelev; here in Enguelonde
Bi-side ane toune þat widincestre &punctelev; men cleopeden, ich onder-stonde
Þare is nouþe a churche a-rerd &punctelev; and a gret Abbeye al-so
Þat men cleopieth seint Albones &punctelev; ase he was to deþe i-do
Bidde we &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; and seint Albon wel faste
Þat we moten to þe Ioye come &punctelev; þat euere schal i-laste
SEint Wolston, bischop of wyrecestre &punctelev; was here of engelonde
Swiþe holi man he was al is lif &punctelev; ase ich me vnder-stonde
Þe &yogh;wile he was a &yogh;ong child &punctelev; clene lif he ladde i-nov&yogh;;
&YOGH;wane oþur children ornen to plei&yogh;e &punctelev; toward churche he drou&yogh;
Seint Edward was kyng þo &punctelev; þat nouþe in heouene is;
And þe bischop of wyricestre &punctelev; bri&yogh;ttey hei&yogh;te, i-wis
Of þis bischop Bri&yogh;tei &punctelev; seint wolston is ordre nam
Ech aftur oþur, ase it fel &punctelev; so þat he preost bi-cam
Þe bischop vnder-feng him sethþe &punctelev; and Monek him makede i-wis
In þe priorie of wiricestre &punctelev; þat noble hous and gret is
Swyþe wel is ordre he heold &punctelev; in þat priorie
And al is wille was for-to pay&yogh;e &punctelev; god and seinte Marie
In none bedde he nolde come &punctelev; ake, &yogh;wane oþere &yogh;eoden þar-to
bi-fore on auter he wolde go &punctelev; his oresones for-to do;
&YOGH;wane þe dede slep him ouer-eode &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng gon
his heued he wolde legge a-doun &punctelev; opon þe harde ston
Ope one grece bifore þe Auter &punctelev; oþur is bok þare-vnder do
And liggen ane stounde in dweole Miengyngue— &punctelev; al is slep scholde beon so
he nolde þreo dawes in þe wyke &punctelev; no-þing eten with-alle
Ne no word speken bote his beden &punctelev; for nou&yogh;t þat mi&yogh;te bi-falle;
þe oþur dawes wel luytel he spak &punctelev; and wel luytel he eat al-so
bote it were a luyte potage— &punctelev; holde he wolde him þer-to
So longue he leouede at wirecestre &punctelev; in þat holie lijf wel stille
Þat he was imaked prior of þat hous &punctelev; muche a-&yogh;ein is wille
his Couent he wuste swyþe wel &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse hem drou&yogh;;
Of god and alle guode men &punctelev; loue he hadde i-nou&yogh;
Þe prior[ie][MS. prior] of wyricestre &punctelev; seint oswold bi-gan er
Þat was bi-fore seint Wolston &punctelev; nei&yogh; ane hondred &yogh;er;
And þat he hadde er bi-gonne &punctelev; þe oþur fulfulde, i-wis
So þat þoru&yogh; heore beire dede &punctelev; strong weork and hei&yogh; þare is
Ase þis holie Man seint wolston &punctelev; in a tyme liet a-rere
A bel-hous of swiþe strong weork &punctelev; bellen to hanguy þere
And Machouns a-boue and bi-nethe &punctelev; þare a-boute were
Bi laddren cloumben up and doun &punctelev; and þat weork bi-twene al bere
A man þare clemb up bi one laddre &punctelev; an þo he was up on hei&yogh;
Fram eorþe mo þane fourti fet &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sei&yogh;
Dounward he ful, ase he mis-stap— &punctelev; Men weren sore a-gaste
Seint wolston stod and bi-heold &punctelev; hou he was a-dounward faste
he made þe signe of þe croyz &punctelev; ase he feol to-ward þe grounde
harmles he feol and hol man i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; his limes weren hole and sounde
And a-ros up and dude is weork &punctelev; ase him no-þing nere
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;te &punctelev; and þat þou cuddest wel þere
Þat [he] so harde fram so hei&yogh;e feol &punctelev; and of eche harme was sker;
Þou art a louerd þat wonderes dest &punctelev; ase seith þe sauter
¶ Hit bi-feol so þat bri&yogh;tey &punctelev; þe Bischop of wyricestre, was ded
A clerk was bischop after him &punctelev; þat Men cleopeden aldred
Þat seint wolston louede wel &punctelev; and he louede him al-so
For ech guod man wole louien oþur &punctelev; it were elles vuele i-do
Sethþe it bi-fel þat þe Erchebischop &punctelev; of Euerwicke was ded
Erchebischop huy maden þar &punctelev; þene bischop aldred
And þe bischopriche of wiricestre &punctelev; vacaunt was and lere
Seint wolston was sone i-chose &punctelev; and bischop i-maked þere
Bischop him made þe holie man &punctelev; seint Edward þe king
And a-feng him in his dignete &punctelev; and tok him is staf and ring
his bischopriche he wuste wel &punctelev; and also is priorie
And a-forcede him to serui wel &punctelev; god and seint Marie
Four &yogh;er he hadde bischop i-beo &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t fulliche fiue
þo seint Edward þe holie kyng &punctelev; wende out of þis liue
Gret reuþe it was to al engelond &punctelev; so weilawei þe stounde
For straunge men þere comen sethþe &punctelev; and brou&yogh;ten enguelond to grounde
¶ Harold was þo ri&yogh;htest eyr &punctelev; for non oþur þere nas;
Þe croune he bar of Enguelonde &punctelev; &yogh;wuche &yogh;wile so it was
For willame Bastard, þat was þo &punctelev; Eorl in Noremaundie
Þou&yogh;te to winne Enguelond &punctelev; þoru&yogh; strencþe and tricherie
[om.]he let him greiþi folk i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; and gret poer with [him]1 nam
And with gret strencþe in-to þe se he him dude &punctelev; and to Enguelonde he cam
he liet ordeinie is fierd wel &punctelev; and is banere up arer[d]e
And destruyde and nam al þat he fond &punctelev; and þat folk sore a-ferde
¶ Harold heorde herof telle &punctelev; þe king of Enguelonde
he liet greiþie faste is ost &punctelev; a-&yogh;ein him for-to stonde
Þe baronie of Enguelonde &punctelev; redi was wel sone
Þe king to helpe and heom-sulue &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;ht was for-to done
Þe weorre was þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; deolful and strong i-nov&yogh;
And eyþur of oþeres Men &punctelev; al-to grounde a-slou&yogh;
¶ No strencþe ne hadden þis straunge men &punctelev; þat were i-come so newe
A&yogh;einest heom of enguelonde &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle huy wolden beo trewe
Ake alas þe muchele tricherie &punctelev; þat þo was, and &yogh;eot is
þat brou&yogh;te þo Enguelond &punctelev; al-to grounde i-wis
For þe englische barones bi-comen some &punctelev; on-treowe and false also
To bi-trai&yogh;e heom-seolf and heore kyng &punctelev; þat so muche heom truste to
¶ Þis Noremauns and þis Englische men &punctelev; ane dai of bataile huy nome
Þare ase þe Abbeie of þe bataille is &punctelev; ate daye to-gadere huy come
To grounde huy smiten and slowen al-so. &punctelev; ake alas þulke stounde
Þat Enguelond was þoru&yogh; tresoun &punctelev; þare i-brou&yogh;t to grounde
For þulke þat þe king truste to &punctelev; failleden him wel faste;
So þat he was bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; and ouer-come atþe laste
And to grounde i-brou&yogh;t, and alle his &punctelev; and al Enguelond also
In-to vnecouþe mannes honde &punctelev; þat no ri&yogh;ht ne hadden þar-to;
And neuer-eft [it] ne cam a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; to ri&yogh;hte Eyres none
Vnkuynde Eyres &yogh;eot huy beothþ &punctelev; ore kingues echone
And nei&yogh;h-&yogh;wat alle þis hei&yogh;e Men &punctelev; and of þe lo&yogh;we al-so
For willam liet [him] crouni king &punctelev; þo þe bataile was al i-do
And bi-sette al enguelond &punctelev; with men of oþere londe
Neuereft to is cuynde heritage &punctelev; ne cam it, ich onder-stonde
¶ Þis willam bastard, þat was king &punctelev; sethþe him onder-stod
Þat he mid vnri&yogh;hte hadde i-sched &punctelev; mani ane mannes blod
And þare as þe bataille was &punctelev; ane Abbei&yogh;e he liet a-rere
Þat "þe Abbeie of þe bataille" is i-cleoped &punctelev; þat wel noble stand &yogh;eot þere;
for heore soulene he as liet a-rere &punctelev; þat he with vnri&yogh;hte þare a-slou&yogh;;
Ake euere he heold forth þe kynedom &punctelev; of enguelonde with wou&yogh;
¶ Ake sone so he was king i-mad &punctelev; and al enguelond bi-sette
Ase he wolde, with straunge men &punctelev; and no man ne mi&yogh;hte him lette
Þis holie Bischop seint wolston &punctelev; wel ofte him withseide
Þat he with on-ri&yogh;hte hadde i-do &punctelev; a swuch luþer dede
And spac a-&yogh;ein him baldeliche &punctelev; and ne sparede for no drede
For he was þo þe cuyndeste englische man &punctelev; þat was of enie manhede
And for alle oþure weren deseritede nei&yogh;h. &punctelev; þe king was with heom[r. him] wrothþ
Þat he was so luyte a-drad of him &punctelev; and swor a-non is othþ
To pulte him out of is bischopriche. &punctelev; he liet [him] somoune al-so
To westmunstre, to answerien him &punctelev; of þat he him hadde mis-do
¶ Nou nas nou&yogh;t seint wulston &punctelev; wel gret clerk in lore
For þo he scholde to scole gon &punctelev; to churche he &yogh;eode wel more
To westmunstre he cam to is day &punctelev; ase he was i-somoned er
Þe king was in grete wrathþe &punctelev; wel prest to kepe him þer
And þe bischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; lanfranc was is name
And þe bischop gondolf of Roucestre &punctelev; alle to don him schame
Seint wolston bi-fore heom cam &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;ein him weren so strongue
Ase a þeof bi-fore Iustise &punctelev; his dom to vnder-fongue
¶ Þe king and þe Erchebischop al-so &punctelev; speken to him wordes grete
Þat he scholde, ase he wuyrþe was &punctelev; is bischop-riche lete;
For-to holden swuch dignete &punctelev; to luyte he couþe of lore
And huy him hadden to longue i-þoled &punctelev; And þo nolden huy nonmore
And grete foles huy weren þat swuch a fol &punctelev; formest brou&yogh;te in swch mi&yogh;hte
And &yogh;if he was folliche onder-fongue &punctelev; huy wolden don him out with ri&yogh;hte
¶ Seint wolston stod wel mildeliche &punctelev; and herknede al þat huy sede
Nadde he noman bote god &punctelev; to his answere him rede
"Sires," he seide, "ri&yogh;ht it is &punctelev; þat ich eoure heste do
For, sire king, þou art mi souerein &punctelev; and þe[r. þu] erchebischop al-so
Þe Croce ich habbe &yogh;are i-bore &punctelev; þat &yogh;e i-seothþ here, lo
A-knowe ich am and wel ich wot &punctelev; þat i-nam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þer-to;
&YOGH;wane &yogh;e wollez þat ich as bi-leue &punctelev; ase man þat vnwurþe is
Wel fain i-chulle eouwer heste do &punctelev; ase mine souereines, i-wis
Vn-bou&yogh;hsome to holie churche &punctelev; i-wis i-nelle be nou&yogh;t
To &yogh;elden hire up ase &yogh;e me hotez &punctelev; ich habbe as here i-brou&yogh;t
¶ Ake, for &yogh;e ne token as me nou&yogh;t &punctelev; I nelle eou take non
Ake him þat as me bi-tok &punctelev; bi-fore eov euerech-on
Þe guode Man þat as me bi-tok &punctelev; &yogh;eonde he lijthþ wel stille
Ich as wulle him taken up &punctelev; and þanne ich do eoure wille."
¶ To seint Edwardes toumbe he wende &punctelev; þat was of Marbre-ston
A[r. and?] nam up is croiz wel mildeliche &punctelev; and smot þe point þar-on
Þe staf wende into þe marbreston &punctelev; ase it were in nesche sonde
And þo heo was inne deope i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þe guode Man hine liet stonde
"Nou," he seide, "ich him habbe bi-take &punctelev; him þat as tok me
And bi-fore eov here &punctelev; i-&yogh;ollden op þe dignete
Takez as nouþe &yogh;wam &yogh;e wollez &punctelev; som þat bet beo in lore
And habbez guod dai nouþe euerech-one—; &yogh;e ne mouwen esche me non-more."
¶ Þis holie Man wende forth &punctelev; a-mon[g] heom alle wel softe
Þat folk stod ase it were i-nome &punctelev; and bi-heolden þe croce wel ofte
hou heo stod in þe Marbre-ston &punctelev; so deope and so faste;
Of þe Miracle heom wondrede alle &punctelev; and some weren sore a-gaste
Some wenden þar-to sone &punctelev; þe croce up for-to drawe
Þare nas non so strong of heom &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;hte hire enes wawe
huy porueiden er sire Gondolf &punctelev; bischop of roucestre
Þat he scholde aftur seint wolston &punctelev; beon Bischop of wirecestre
¶ Þe Erchebischop aros him up &punctelev; to saisi þe croiz a-non
Þe Bischop of Roucestre wel baldeliche &punctelev; þudere-ward gan gon
Þe croiz he nam and faste he drou&yogh; &punctelev; in þe Marbre-ston
he ne mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t enes wawien. &punctelev; þat folk wondrede ech-on
And þare-a-boute wel þicke ornen &punctelev; þat wonder for-to seo
Þo þe king and þe Erchebischop i-sei&yogh;en &punctelev; þat non oþur it ne mi&yogh;hte beo
heom of-þou&yogh;te heore dede &punctelev; and after seint wolstan sende
And þat huy wolden in faire manere &punctelev; heore trespas a-mende
¶ Þe Messagers i-redie weren &punctelev; and aftur him sone wenden
&YOGH;eot þis holie Man for al þe gult &punctelev; is heorte to heom bende
And seide, "ich mot nede do &punctelev; mine souereines wille;"
To court he wende a-&yogh;ein to heom &punctelev; wel mildeliche and stille
Þo he was to court i-come &punctelev; huy a-risen a-&yogh;ein him þere
Þe king and þe Erchebischop al-so &punctelev; and oþere þat þare were;
With gret honur huy cleopeden him forthþ &punctelev; and for-&yogh;iuenesse him bede
And boden a-mendi a-&yogh;ein him &punctelev; al heore grete misdede
And beden him nime a-&yogh;ein is croce &punctelev; and don bi heore rede
For he was bet wuyrþe þare-to &punctelev; þane ani oþur, huy seide
¶ "Nai certes, sires," quath seint wolston &punctelev; "þat nere me nou&yogh;t to do
Ich wot wel þat &yogh;e seiden soth &punctelev; þat i-nam nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þare-to;
Ake nimeth &yogh;wam eower wille be &punctelev; an oþur þat conne more."
Þe kyng and þe Erchebischop also &punctelev; beden him milce and ore
And seiden þat þere nas non oþur &punctelev; þat so wuyrþe were þare-to
Longue it was are þis holie man &punctelev; wolde heore wille do[do added later.];
Ake, for-to obeien is souereins &punctelev; he wende forth atþe laste
And nam þe croce wel mildeliche &punctelev; þare he stikede hire er so faste
¶ Also li&yogh;htliche ase ani-þing &punctelev; þe croce he gan up drawe
Þat so mani men fondeden er &punctelev; and ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
Þicke orn þat folk a-bouten him &punctelev; and no wonder it nas
Þe miracle was sone wide i-kud &punctelev; þat so apert was
Men anoureden þis holie Man &punctelev; al-so muche ase huy mi&yogh;hte
his power þat him was er bi-nome &punctelev; he tok a&yogh;ein with ri&yogh;hte;
A-&yogh;ein to is bischopriche &punctelev; with gret honour he him drou&yogh;;
his Couent vnder-feng him faire &punctelev; with grete noblei&yogh;e i-nou&yogh;
¶ Þis holie Man ladde al is lif &punctelev; swyþe faire and clene
Sijknesses þare weren wel fewe &punctelev; þat man wolde him offe mene
Þat he ne brou&yogh;te to hele a-non &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace;
Sike men wel þicke comen &punctelev; to him in eche place
Deue and doumbe and blinde al-so &punctelev; he helde þoru&yogh; godes grace
&YOGH;wane huy comen to him &punctelev; ou&yogh;were in ani place
So longue he leouede on eorþe here &punctelev; þat he was of grete elde
His bodi bi-gan to heuegy swiþe &punctelev; grete feblesse he fielde
¶ A slou&yogh; feuere him cam on &punctelev; þat ne nam him nou&yogh;t ful strongue
Ac heo made is bodi to melte a-wei— &punctelev; þat laste swiþe longue
Seue ni&yogh;ht bi-fore þat he deide &punctelev; his breþren he liet fette alle
And liet him alle is ri&yogh;htes do &punctelev; and seide &yogh;wat heom scholde bi-falle
Out of þis world to heouene he wende &punctelev; þare he schal ay bi-leue
In þe Monþe of Ieneuer[19 Jan.] &punctelev; a-seint Fabianes eue
¶ A þousend &yogh;er and nie hundret &punctelev; and foure þare-bi-fore
It was þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; on vrþe was i-bore
In þe teoþe &yogh;ere also &punctelev; of þe kinedom
Of willam þe rede king &punctelev; þat aftur willam bastard cam[These two v. are written in one line.]
he hadde, are he heonne i-wende &punctelev; foure and þritti &yogh;er
And four Monþes and four dawes &punctelev; i-beo in worlde[r. wolde? the other MSS. bishop]
Four-score &yogh;er he was old &punctelev; and seuene al-so nei&yogh;h
Are he wende out of þis lijf &punctelev; to þe Ioye of heuene an hei&yogh;
¶ Þo þis holie man was ded &punctelev; þe Monekes comen sone
In þe priorie of wirecestre &punctelev; and duden þat was to done
Wuschen þat bodi, ase it was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; and to churche it bere;
Þe Monekes alle with gret honour &punctelev; þat is breþerne were
Þe seruise a-bouten him huy duden &punctelev; ase it was wel ri&yogh;ht
And to seggen heore sauteres al-so &punctelev; þare-bi huy woken a-ni&yogh;ht
¶ Þo it was wel with-inne ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; ase huy seiden in heore boke
heom luste slepe swiþe wel &punctelev; þat vnneþes huy mi&yogh;hten loke
And some ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t fur-bere &punctelev; ake lei&yogh;en and slepen faste
Some ase it were in dweolkningue &punctelev; heore ei&yogh;ene to-gadere huy caste
Þat holie bodi, þat lai þare ded &punctelev; a-mong heom in þe bere
A-ros up wel mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei it a-liue were
And a-wei&yogh;hte heom euer-ech-on &punctelev; and bi-gan atþon ende
And al along þe rewe &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe queor he gan i-wiende;
And euere ase he a-wei&yogh;hte heom &punctelev; sumdel he[superscr.] gan heom chide
Þat huy nolden with heore slep &punctelev; heore ri&yogh;hte tyme a-bide
¶ So muche [was] is holi heorte &punctelev; þe ordre for-to wite
Þat he nolde, þei he were ded &punctelev; his breþerne fur-&yogh;ite
Þis Miracle was sone i-kud &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;ht was þat it were
At wirecestre he was i-bured &punctelev; and &yogh;uyt he liht þere
Þare Man may for is holie bodi &punctelev; mani fair Miracle i-seo
Nou god graunti þat we mote with him &punctelev; in þe Ioye of heouene beo
SEint Matheu þe Ewangelist &punctelev; apostel he was and is,[al. i-wis]
Ewangelist and eke a-postle &punctelev; for-soþe he was and is
Ewangelist, for he godspelles made &punctelev; þat men doth ofte rede
Apostel, for ore louerd here on vrþe &punctelev; seint Matheu with him gan lede
For ase ore louerd eode ouer lond &punctelev; seint Matheu he sai&yogh; bi cas
his mester don of walkingue &punctelev; for a follare[al. tollare] he was
Fals and trichor of is werk &punctelev; and liuede bi falshede
Ore louerd him hiet bi-leue is weork &punctelev; "cum siwe me," he seide
And he bi-lefde þo is weork &punctelev; and wiz ore louerd eode
And is false mester liet &punctelev; for he nadde þer-to non neode
¶ Fair forebisne ore louerd &yogh;af &punctelev; alle sunfole men þo
&YOGH;wane he ane so sunfole Man &punctelev; het with him go
Seint Matheu is sunnes bette &punctelev; and tok to cristindom
And siwede ore louerd swiþe faste &punctelev; and is Apostel bi-com.
Sethþe þo ore louerd was into &punctelev; heouene i-wend
Þe Apostles weren þo wel wide in londe &punctelev; for-to prechie, i-send
In-to þe londe of Ethiope &punctelev; seint Matheu sone &yogh;ede
to prechie men to cristinedom &punctelev; ase it was wel gret neode
¶ He founde tweie luþere men &punctelev; and strongue wichchene þere
Zaroen and Arphaxat &punctelev; þat þe deueles limes were
Þat, ase huy wolden, in grete siknesse &punctelev; manie men hadden i-do
And manie men þoru&yogh; þe feonde &punctelev; i-helde huy hadden al-so
Alle þat þe luþere men &punctelev; in siknesse brou&yogh;te
Seint Matheu heom helde a-non &punctelev; and wel clene heom out sou&yogh;te
Sorie weren þis luþere Men &punctelev; huy nusten &yogh;wat was to done
Tweie dragones, þat feondes weren &punctelev; to heom huy cleopeden sone
Þat casten brumston and fuyr &punctelev; and [slowe][om.] &yogh;end al þe londe
Mannes[r. men and] bestes þere-with wel þicke— &punctelev; heom ne mi&yogh;hte no þing at|stonde
¶ Þis luþere men nomen þe dragones to heom &punctelev; for huy scholden to|drawe
Þane Apostel seint Matheu &punctelev; and bringue him of lijf-dawe
Þo seint Matheu þis i-heorde &punctelev; baldeliche he gan gon
Þe signe he made of þe croiz &punctelev; and to heom wende a-non
A-non so þe dragones him i-sei&yogh;en &punctelev; to is fet huy fullen a-doun
huy ne mi&yogh;hten heom wawien hider ne þuder &punctelev; ane fot for al þe toun
"lo, &yogh;e wrechches," quath þe apostle &punctelev; to þe luþere men tweie
"&YOGH;ware is nouþe al eouwere mi&yogh;hte? &punctelev; ouer-come &yogh;e beothþ beine
¶ &YOGH;if i-nadde nouþe mine louerdes grace &punctelev; for eou &yogh;eorne bi-sou&yogh;t
On eov-sulf it scholde nouþe bi-falle &punctelev; ase &yogh;e hadden bi me i-þou&yogh;t
Þis twei luþere dragones &punctelev; þat &yogh;e habbuth hidere i-brou&yogh;t
A-rereth heom &yogh;if &yogh;e mowen &punctelev; oþur eower art nis nou&yogh;t."
¶ Euere stoden þis wrechche men &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht ase huy weren i-nome
huy weren of seint Matheu a-ferde sore &punctelev; and heolden heom ouer-come
Seint Matheu þis tweie dragones &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes lore
Out of þe londe heom drof a-non &punctelev; þat huy ne comen þere non-more
he wende a-boute and prechede &punctelev; and þe tweie schrewene liet go
Ouer-comene wrechches ase hui weren &punctelev; nas heom neuer er so wo
¶ Hit bi-feol þat þe kingues sone &punctelev; of þe londe was ded
Sone þis twei&yogh;e deoueles limes &punctelev; to-gadere nomen hore red
And wenden þudere, &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;hten &punctelev; þoru&yogh; heore art him[orig. heom] a-rere;
And huy maden heore enchauntement &punctelev; ase þe deuel heom gan lere
Ake þat child lai euere ded— &punctelev; for heore mi&yogh;hte nas ri&yogh;th nou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; þe kingue huy weren i-nome &punctelev; and in strongue prisone i-brou&yogh;t
¶ Þe king sende aftur seint Matheu &punctelev; ase men of him tolde
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;hte is sone arere— &punctelev; for he was so wis i-holde
Þo seint Matheu þudere cam &punctelev; to ore louerd he[MS. heo] dude is bone
And a-rerde þat child &punctelev; fram deþe to liue wel sone;
Þat child a-ros and herede god &punctelev; i-bore of mayde marie
A-non so þe king þis i-sei&yogh; &punctelev; wel loude he gan to crie
"For-soþe," he seide, "ich i-seo &punctelev; þat Matheu a god is;
Þei he beo here in mannes fourme &punctelev; he is a god, i-wis
¶ Anoure we him ase it is ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; with seluer and with golde."
huy offreden to him tresor i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; more þane he a-fongue wolde
"Nai certes," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "god nam ich nou&yogh;t
Ake godes seriaunt þat here on eorþe &punctelev; to deþe was i-brou&yogh;t
ho-so wole on him bi-lieue &punctelev; to heouene he schal i-wiende
And ho-so nele nou&yogh;t, he worth i-wis &punctelev; in pine withþ-outen ende."
So þat þe king and alle his &punctelev; i-cristnede of him were
With þe tresor þat men him brou&yogh;te &punctelev; a fair churche he liet a-rere
¶ In þritti dawes heo was arerd— &punctelev; so gret hel[p] þare was to;
Þare þe king and is heore beden bede &punctelev; and alþe contrei&yogh;e al-so
Aftur þe tuei&yogh;e[MS. trei&yogh;e] enchauntours &punctelev; seint Matheu liet sende
Zaroes and Arphaxat &punctelev; and made heom þannes wiende
Into þe londe of perce &punctelev; huy wenden with schame i-nov;
Þere þat folk mis-bi-leued &punctelev; wel þicke a-boute heom drov
¶ Sethþe seint symon and seint Iude &punctelev; to perce þene wei nome
And þulke two enchauntours &punctelev; to grounde huy ouer-come
Þare huy neuereft cristine Men &punctelev; non a-nuy ne wrou&yogh;te
Ase Man mai in heore liue i-seo &punctelev; ho-so þare-after sou&yogh;te.
Seint Matheu in Ethiope &punctelev; þe kingues dou&yogh;ter nam
Þat of hire-seolf was a clene þing &punctelev; and &yogh;af hire cristinedom
A[r. and?] made hire a-uouwe chastete &punctelev; and clene lif to lede
þat maide was wel a-paid euere-aftur-ward &punctelev; of þat ilke dede
¶ A king of an oþur londe &punctelev; is loue on hire he caste
And wolde ire habbe to his spouse &punctelev; and wowede hire wel faste
Þo þis maide nolde is wille do &punctelev; to seint Matheu he &yogh;eode
Þat he scholde in his half beo &punctelev; and bed him grete mede
¶ "Cum," quath seint Matheu, "þilke dai &punctelev; and ich hire wolle rede
Þat heo heolde hire spoushod &punctelev; and þare-inne hire lijf lede."
Þe king was glad and wende wel &punctelev; Þat he bi him it seide
Þat he wolde hire to him rede— &punctelev; ake he nolde nou&yogh;t don so to quede
Þe king cam aday, and muche folk &punctelev; with him he gan bringue
And þis maide cam al-so &punctelev; to hure seint Matheus prechingue
Seint Matheu stod and prechede &punctelev; þat folk al a-brod
Mest he preisede of alle þingue &punctelev; in is sarmun spoushod
And þat þere nas no lijf so guod &punctelev; þare it was trewe and clene
Þe kyng was glad and hopede wel &punctelev; þat he it dude bi him mene
For þat Maide scholde &punctelev; to him i-wedded beo;
Seint Matheu he louede muche &punctelev; and hopede is wille i-seo
¶ So þat sethþe seint Matheu &punctelev; is prechingue forþere drou&yogh;
And seide, "&yogh;if þe king hadde a wif &punctelev; þat he louede i-nou&yogh;
And a fol come in spousbruche &punctelev; and lei&yogh;e bi is wiue
Þe king wolde beo wroth i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; and bringue him of liue
For he him hadde is wijf bi-nome &punctelev; and imad hire don amis
Of þe hei&yogh;e king of heouene &punctelev; also it fareth, i-wis
&YOGH;if he hathþ a guod spouse &punctelev; þat ledeth clene lijf
And þare come forthþ a fol &punctelev; and bi-nime him is wijf
To strongue deþe he wolde him bringue &punctelev; and to þe pine of helle al-so
Þare-fore ech man beo i-war &punctelev; þat he swuch þing ne do."
¶ Þo þe kin[g] i-heorde þis &punctelev; sone he onder-stod
Þat it was ri&yogh;ht bi him i-seid. &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod
And swor þat he nolde bliþe beo &punctelev; are he were[MS. he were a were] awreke
For[th][MS. for] he wende and bi-gan a-non &punctelev; seint Matheus dethþ bi-speke
Þis guode man nas no-þing aferd &punctelev; he prechede euere faste
And confortede þat clene maide &punctelev; þat ire heorte opon him al caste
¶ Þis Maide feol doun to is fet &punctelev; and on him &yogh;eorne gradde;
Euere þis guode man hire bi-sou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo clene lijf ladde
Sethþe he wende and greiþede him &punctelev; is masse forto singue
luþere Men i-redie weren &punctelev; i-sende þoru&yogh; þe kingue
Ri&yogh;ht ase he stod at is Masse &punctelev; on of heom forthþ wende
And smot him þoru-out with a swerd &punctelev; and alle his gottes to-rende
For he smot him In atþe Rugge &punctelev; and atþe wombe out
Þo þe guode Man a-slawe was &punctelev; þe schrewe was wel prout
¶ Þat folk þat cristine was &punctelev; wel þicke it cam a-non
Þe kingues paleis for-to brenne &punctelev; and to a-quelle is men ech-on
Ake seint Matheus desciples &punctelev; for-boden heom ech-one
Þat huy ne duden no such þing &punctelev; ake lieten god wurþe al-one
huy wenden and nomen þis holie bodi &punctelev; and swiþe faire on eorþe it brou&yogh;te.
Þe king &yogh;uyt bi al is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; after þat maide &yogh;eorne sou&yogh;te
Ake þo he ne mi&yogh;hte in none manere &punctelev; to is wille hire i-winne
he wende forth and sette a-fuyre &punctelev; þat hous þat heo was inne
Ake seint Matheu ne for-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þat Maide &punctelev; þei he ded were :[orig. were ded]
Fram heouene he a-li&yogh;hte a-doun to hire &punctelev; and is help ire cudde þere[added]
For þat fuyr he drof a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; to þe kingues paleis a-non
And fur-brende it al-to nou&yogh;t &punctelev; and is Men echon;
¶ Vnneþe he him-sulf and is sone &punctelev; a-scapeden with heore liue
he mi&yogh;hte segge, to wroþerhele &punctelev; he wilne[de] aftur wiue
For suyþe sone þare-aftur-ward &punctelev; Musel he bi-cam;
And þo he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t beo hol &punctelev; gret deol to him hee nam
With is swerd him-sulf he a-slou&yogh; &punctelev; and is bodi al-to-rende
Nou god it wot and seint Matheu &punctelev; &yogh;wodere is soule wende
Þat folk wende forth a-non &punctelev; and made ane newe king wel bliue
Þe clene maidenes broþur i-wis &punctelev; þat he wilnede so muche to wiue
Þat seint Matheu þe apostel hadde &punctelev; i-cristned with is honde;
&YOGH;ware-þoru cristinedom &punctelev; cam sethþe into al þe londe
Nou Iesu crist us &yogh;iue is grace &punctelev; þulke Ioy&yogh;e i-winne
For þe loue of seint Matheu &punctelev; þat he woneth inne
SEint leger a bischop was &punctelev; and holi man i-nou&yogh;;
Mani a man þoru&yogh; is prechingue &punctelev; to godes lawe he drou&yogh;
A luþur Iustise þare was nei&yogh;h &punctelev; Ebrom[r. Ebroin] was is name
Men tolden him, ase he wende a-boute &punctelev; of seint legeres fame
he liet him wel sone nime &punctelev; and bi-fore him bringue
And fondede for-to tuyrne is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; fram þe heuene kingue
þo he ne mi&yogh;hte þat don nou&yogh;t &punctelev; he was wroth inou&yogh;;
Ane luþere man he cleopede sone &punctelev; þat boþe is ei&yogh;ene ou&yogh;t drou&yogh;
¶ Þo is ei&yogh;ene in grete pine &punctelev; weren i-holede out boþe
he gan þe more prechi of god. &punctelev; þare-fore huy weren wroþe
A wei þer was of scharpe stones &punctelev; and opward stoden echon
Þare-oppe þis holie man &punctelev; barefot huy maden gon
huy driuen him barefot and a-blend &punctelev; ope þis scharpe stones þere
Þis guode man eode wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase þei him no-þing nere
And euere he prechede on Iesu crist— &punctelev; he ne bi-lefte for no fere
¶ For is longue prechingue þe luþere men &punctelev; wroþest with him were
huy coruen of is tongue a-non &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht bi is þrote a-boue
Þare schewede ore swete louerd &punctelev; fair Miracle for is loue
For þo is tongue was of i-corue &punctelev; &yogh;eot he prechede faste
And al-so wel as he dude er. &punctelev; þo weren þe schrewes a-gaste
huy bi-speken to don him more schame &punctelev; ake huy weren sumdel in doute
huy [sto]den[unreadable.] and bi-heolden is heued &punctelev; and þo[MS. þe?] i-sei&yogh;en huy þare|a-boute
A ro[un]d croune and swiþe cler— &punctelev; bri&yogh;htore ne mi&yogh;hte non beo
Þat vnneþe huy mi&yogh;hten is holie heued &punctelev; for þe leome i-seo
¶ Þis luþere Iustise het a-non &punctelev; þat men smiten of is heued
Four tormentores he was bi-take &punctelev; þat it nere nou&yogh;t bi-leued
huy ladden him with-oute toun &punctelev; for-[to] don þat dede
Ase huy comen a-midde þe wei &punctelev; þis holie man to heom seide
"&YOGH;wat neode is it for-to trauailli &punctelev; ferrore me to lede
Dothþ anon þat &yogh;e scholden do &punctelev; here ri&yogh;ht, ich eou rede."
Þe þreo quellares of þis word &punctelev; anon weren in grete drede
To is fet huy feollen a-kneo &punctelev; and for-&yogh;iuenesse him bede
Þare-fore was þe feorþe wroth &punctelev; forth he hupte sone
And smot of þe guode mannes heued &punctelev; ase he hadde heste to done
¶ Sone þare-aftur cam a fuir &punctelev; ase it of helle were
And al quik fur-barnde him &punctelev; and þe deuelene a-wei him bere
Seint leger was wel faire i-bured. &punctelev; is soule to heouene wende
And for þat bodi, ase it on eorþe lai &punctelev; fair miracle ore louerd sende
¶ Þe luþere Iustise þat him liet a-quelle &punctelev; þere-of heorde telle
two &yogh;er aftur þulke tyme &punctelev; þat he him liet a-quelle
To is toumbe ane kni&yogh;ht he sende &punctelev; þe soþe for-to fonde
Þo þe kni&yogh;ht to þe toumbe cam &punctelev; þare-bi he gan stonde
"In schendnesse," he seide, "mote he dei&yogh;e &punctelev; and in strongue deþe al-so
ho-so bi-lieuethþ þat dede men &punctelev; ani miracle mouwen do!"
Wel filliche also þe toumbe he smot. &punctelev; and a-non-ri&yogh;ht with þe dede
Oppon him feol is owene bone &punctelev; ase he bad and seide
For deuelene a-strangleden him a-non— &punctelev; for al redie þare huy were
And is soule, ase it was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; a-deuele wei huy bere
¶ Þe Iustise sone þare-aftur-ward &punctelev; to deþe was i-do
And a-slawe in grete schendnesse &punctelev; and a-deuele wei wende also
Þus was þe bischop seint leger &punctelev; a-wreke of is fon
And he him-sulf to þe Ioie of heouene &punctelev; after is deþe gan gon
Nou god for þe loue of seint leger &punctelev; is swete grace us siende
Þat we aftur þusse liue &punctelev; moten to þe Ioye of heouene wiende
SEinte Fey, þat holie Maide &punctelev; of swiþe hei&yogh;e men heo com
Swiþe &yogh;ong in hire childhod &punctelev; heo turnede to cristindom
And holi lijf i-nou heo ladde— &punctelev; þat word sprong wel wide
Of hire guodnesse and of hire holi lijf &punctelev; a-boute in eche side
¶ A luþer Aumperour þare was þo &punctelev; þat hiet Dioclician
And is felawe þat was al-so &punctelev; þe schrewe Maximian;
A luþur Iustise huy hadden with heom &punctelev; is name was dacian
To deþe huy brou&yogh;ten &yogh;ware huy founden &punctelev; ani cristine Man
¶ Þe Iustise Dacian &punctelev; wende in-tal[= in-to al] þe lond
And a-slou&yogh; alle þe cristine men &punctelev; þat he ou&yogh;were fond
So þat he heorde telle &punctelev; ase he wende bi þe wey
Of þis holie maide and clene &punctelev; and i-cristned, seinte Fey
¶ To þe toune þare heo was inne &punctelev; ase a wod man he wende
And burstinde in grete wrathþe &punctelev; is bedeles a-boute he sende
To crie a-boute in eche strete &punctelev; &yogh;if men mi&yogh;hte ani finde
Cristine man oþur womman &punctelev; þat huy heom scholden faste binde
And bi-fore him bringue haste-liche— &punctelev; þat huy ne sparede non!
And bote huy wolden heore [þou&yogh;t] tuyrne &punctelev; anoþur it scholde gon
¶ Þo þe banne was þus i-cried &punctelev; þare was Ioye I-nou&yogh;
Among þe paeyns euerechone &punctelev; þat Man cristine men so a-slou&yogh;;
Ake seoruwe and sor and deol i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; among cristine men þare was
Þo huy sei&yogh;en heore deth i-come &punctelev; and non oþur bote þare nas
¶ Seinte Fey was furst i-sou&yogh;t &punctelev; for men wusten of hire wel wide
Ioyful heo was and glad i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þo men þe banne criede;
Ake forth heo wende wel baldeliche &punctelev; nolde heo nou&yogh;t longue a-bide
Ake profrede hire to þe tormentores &punctelev; ase men sou&yogh;ten hire wide
With hardie heorte heo wende forth. &punctelev; þe tormentores hire nome
And harleden hire wel filliche &punctelev; forth toward hire dome
¶ Þe Iustise for wrathþe wende[r. vemde] þo &punctelev; heo bi-fore him come
heo made þe signe of þe croiz &punctelev; and blessede hire i-lome;
heo bad ore louerd wel mildeliche &punctelev; þat he ire &yogh;eue þere
Studefaste bi-leue and strencþe of heorte &punctelev; þat heo ouer-come nere
And in hire tormenz treowe heorte &punctelev; and þat he ire &yogh;eue is grace
To his onour answerie wel &punctelev; þe Iustise in þat place
¶ Þe Iustise bi-heold þat Maide &punctelev; with ful sori chere
he grennede and femde touward hire &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht ase he wod were
"Dameisele," he seide, "&yogh;wat art þou? &punctelev; &yogh;wat þencstþou for-to do
Tel me on &yogh;wam þou bi-lieuest &punctelev; and &yogh;wat is þi name, al-so."
"Sire," seide þis holie Maide &punctelev; "Fey ich hote nouþe
And cristine womman ich habbe i-beo &punctelev; sethþe ich ani guod couþe
Mi name nelle ich nou&yogh;t for-sake &punctelev; no mi cristindom noþur;
Þou mi&yogh;ht þretne al þat þou wolt &punctelev; of me ne worth þe non oþur."
¶ Þo bi-gan þis Dacian &punctelev; fair semblaunt to make
"Maide," he seide, "ich rede þe &punctelev; þat þou an oþur red take
Þench þat þou art fair and noble &punctelev; and þat þe bet bi-come
A noble lauedi to beon and hei&yogh;h &punctelev; þane beo i-brou&yogh;t here to dome
For &yogh;if þou wolt don aftur me &punctelev; in grete Ioie þou worst i-brou&yogh;t
And in grete nobleie, ase þe bi-cometh— &punctelev; þare-fore torne þi þou&yogh;t."
¶ "Certes, sire," þis maide seide &punctelev; "þou spext embe nou&yogh;t
For i-nelle neuere him for-sake &punctelev; þat so deore me hathþ a-bou&yogh;t;
For ich habbe to him mi vou i-maked &punctelev; þat i-nelle neuere breke
Þare[r. þare-fore] do elles &yogh;wat þou wolt &punctelev; bote þat þou þarof ne speke;
For I-nelle nou&yogh;t honouri þine false godes. &punctelev; for in þe sautere it is i-write
Þat alle swuche Deouele beoth &punctelev; and þat may ech Man i-wite."
¶ Þo fierde þe Iustise ase he were wod &punctelev; and made wel sori bere
And was neih&yogh; wod for þis Maide seide &punctelev; þat is godes deuelene were
he liet fette a bed of bras &punctelev; brod and hei&yogh;h also
And dude strepe þis Maide naked &punctelev; and in þis harde bedde ire do
¶ Þis Maide, þo heo naked was &punctelev; with glad semblaunt in wende;
huy strei&yogh;hten hire a-long and a-croiz &punctelev; and gret fuyr þare-onder tende
And casten on grece riue i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þat drof up so gret lei&yogh;e
Þat þis maide þou&yogh;te al a-fuyre &punctelev; ase huy þat stoden þare i-sei&yogh;e
Þe tormentores stoden þare-bi-side &punctelev; with kene oules and strongue
And tur[n]den þat Maide side and oþur &punctelev; ouer þe fuyre wel longue
Þat heo þoru&yogh; strencþe of þe grece &punctelev; ofte al a-fuyre stod
Euere lai þat holie Maide &punctelev; ase hire nere nou&yogh;t bote guod
hire heu heo nolde chaungi enes &punctelev; ne tuyrne hire þou&yogh;t;
Alle men þat þe wonder i-seien &punctelev; þe enchesun nusten nou&yogh;t
¶ Cristine men manie &punctelev; þo huy herden telle
Þat þe Iustise was þudere i-come &punctelev; with tormenz heom to quelle
huy ornen out of toune hem for-to huyde &punctelev; ech in is side, for doute
And lei&yogh;en in puttes and in olde diches &punctelev; &yogh;eont al þe contreie a|boute
An holi man þare hudde him so &punctelev; þat men cleopeden capras
Þat in þe north-side of þe toun &punctelev; in one olde roche he was
¶ He lai and darede out of is hole &punctelev; ase he dorste for doute
And i-sai&yogh; al þe torment of seinte Fey &punctelev; ase he [biheold aboute,[om. (so Ash.)]
hou men rosteden hire with fuyr and grece &punctelev; and to-drowen hire al-so
For it was a luyte þare-bi-side &punctelev; þat þis dede was i-do
Ase þis fuyr bi-gan to brenne &punctelev; þis holie man i-sei&yogh;
A coluere þare cam, so &yogh;wijt so milk &punctelev; fram heouene fleo on hei&yogh;
¶ A croune of guold heo bar a-doun &punctelev; þat schinde swiþe bri&yogh;hte
Bri&yogh;htore þane þe sonne leom. &punctelev; oppe þe maidenes heued[Ash. maide heo] ali&yogh;hte
And sette þe croune on hire heued &punctelev; with þe winguen heo bleu faste
A&yogh;ein þat fuyr, ase him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat it ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t i-laste
Fram-ward þat Maide heo bleu it euere &punctelev; þat it ne cam hire no-þing nei&yogh;h
And heo lai þare in alle Ioye &punctelev; ase þis holie man i-sei&yogh;h
Þare-fore oþure þat weren hire nei&yogh;h &punctelev; nusten nou&yogh;t hou it was
Þat þou&yogh;te þat heo was al a-fuyre &punctelev; and neuere þe worse hire nas
¶ Þis holie man seint capras &punctelev; þat i-sei&yogh;h al þis
to him-seolf he seide, "ich a-bide &punctelev; nou sone to longue, i-wis;"
he sturte out of þis deope Roche &punctelev; and þudere or[n] wel faste;
to þis tormentingue sone he cam &punctelev; no-þing him ne agaste
Loude he gradde with folle Mouth &punctelev; "Ich am cristine Man
I-nelle for-sake Ihesu crist &punctelev; for drede of Dacian
To longue ich habbe heonne i-beo— &punctelev; þat me for-þuncheth sore
here is Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;h &punctelev; þat schal bringue us to more."
¶ Tweie breþren þare comen þo al-so &punctelev; seint Felician
And seint prime &punctelev; þat seide also to þis Dacian
Wod-wrothþ was Dacian þo &punctelev; he dude heom nime ech-on
Seinte Fey and alle þe oþere &punctelev; and smiten of heore heuedes a-non
Þe tormentores i-redie weren &punctelev; and gonne þat maide take
And hire felawes forth with hire &punctelev; þat nolden ore louerd for-sake
And ladden heom forth to heore ende-day &punctelev; and heore heuedes smiten of sone
In gret wrathþe ech aftur oþur &punctelev; and duden heore maistres bone
¶ To þe Ioye of heouene a-non huy wenden &punctelev; and þare bi-leue with|outen ende;
Aungles þare weren to bere heom forthþ &punctelev; þat ore louerd þudere gan siende
Þe luþere men leten þe bodies ligge &punctelev; þo huy weren i-brou&yogh;t of dawe
In a foul stude al on-bured &punctelev; þare bestes heom scholden to-drawe
Ake cristine men þat þare weren nei&yogh;h &punctelev; þerto stelen bi ni&yogh;hte
And bureden heom in a derne stude &punctelev; ase nobleliche ase huy mi&yogh;hten
Nou seinte Fey and hire felawes &punctelev; ore erinde beode so
Þat we moten to þe Ioye come &punctelev; þare huy beoth inne i-do
Ondleuene þousend of virgines &punctelev; for ore louerd i-martrede were;
Telle i-chulle of heore martyrdom &punctelev; and ho heom þar-to gan lere
A kyng þare was in Brutayne &punctelev; sire Maur was is name;
Ane dou&yogh;ter he hadde þat hiet Ourse &punctelev; þat was of noble fame;
Cristine heo was and al hire kun &punctelev; swiþe hende and quoynte
So fair womman Men nusten non &punctelev; no so guod in euerech pointe
¶ Of hire fair-hede and of hire guodnesse &punctelev; men tolden in eche side
Þat þe word cam into Enguelond &punctelev; and elles-&yogh;woder wel wide
A kyng þare was þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; and Man of gret poer;
Gret nobleie he heorde telle &punctelev; of þis maide feor and ner
his wille was gret þat is sone &punctelev; þis Maide in spoushod hadde
Ake Men þe &yogh;uyt in Enguelond &punctelev; cristinedom non nadden
¶ Þe king of enguelond, þat was þo &punctelev; to þe kyng of Brutayne gan siende
For is dou&yogh;ter to is sone &punctelev; þat was is heyr so hende;
And seide, &yogh;if þat he þare-a&yogh;en were &punctelev; þat þe dede nere i-do
him and alle his he wolde destruy&yogh;e &punctelev; and al his lond al-so
Þo þis Messagers comen to þis kyng &punctelev; and heore erinde hadden i-seid
Sori and dreori was þis king &punctelev; he ne couþe þare-of no red
For þe king of Enguelond &punctelev; was heþene, and alle his
And for he wuste wel þat is dou&yogh;hter nolde &punctelev; i-wedded beo, i-wis
And also, for þe kyng of Enguelond &punctelev; was of so gret mi&yogh;hte
Þat he no strencþe ne mi&yogh;hte habbe &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him for-to fi&yogh;hte
And naþeles Triwes of is answere &punctelev; a&yogh;ein þe messagers he nam
Deol and sor and luyte gladnesse &punctelev; in is heorte þare cam
¶ He ne tolde no-þing is dou&yogh;ter fore &punctelev; of þis reuful cas;
&YOGH;eorne he bad god ni&yogh;ht and day &punctelev; for he redles was
And criede on him swiþe reufulliche &punctelev; þat he him scholde rede
A ni&yogh;ht an Aungel to is dou&yogh;ter cam &punctelev; and þeos wordes to hire sede
"Ne beo þou nou&yogh;ht a-&yogh;ein þis sonde &punctelev; Ake, þine fader forto paye
Graunte i-wedded for-to beo &punctelev; and bide þat he it delai&yogh;e
Ane þreo &yogh;er, þat þou mouwe þe &yogh;wile &punctelev; þi Maiden-hod anoure;
And þat huy þe purchace clene maidenes &punctelev; with þe to habbe in þi boure
¶ And þat þe king of Enguelonde and is sone &punctelev; and þi fader beon alle at one rede
Þe for-to cheose ten clene Maidenes &punctelev; with-oute eche wicke dede;
&YOGH;wane &yogh;e Endleue to-gadere beothþ &punctelev; þat huy eou finden &yogh;eot þer-to
Euer-ech of eov a þousend maidenes &punctelev; to serui eou al-so
Þat &yogh;wane &yogh;e alle to-gadere beoth &punctelev; þat ech mouwe in is side
honouri hire Maiden-hod and þin &punctelev; þat it beo couth wel wide
So þat Men ne mouwen Maide non &punctelev; alosed finde[finde overlined] a&yogh;ein þe;
And þat he wolle cristine bi-come &punctelev; þi louerd þat schal beo
In þis foreward graunte him &punctelev; aftur þe þridde &yogh;ere
I-spoused to beon in godes lawe— &punctelev; And ne haue þerof no fere!"
Þo þat maide i-heorde þis &punctelev; glad heo was of is lore
Þat heo wuste &yogh;ware-with heo mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; bringue hire fader of is sore
¶ Sone heo wende to hire fader &punctelev; and bad þat he ire telle scholde
&YOGH;wy þat he so mourninde &yogh;eode. &punctelev; he seide þat he nolde
"Ich wot wel þi þou&yogh;t," þat maide seide &punctelev; "þei þou it holde stille
Of þi sonde ne haue no doute &punctelev; ichulle don al þi wille."
Þo bi-gan heo tellen him in &yogh;wuche manere— &punctelev; ase þe Aungel hire hadde i-seid
heo wolde habbe þene hei&yogh;e Man &punctelev; &yogh;if þat it were is red
¶ Welle, glad was þe kyng &punctelev; þo þat he iheorde þis
Þe Messagers he &yogh;af Answere &punctelev; sone with gret blis
Þo huy [it] brou&yogh;ten þe kingues sone &punctelev; þe tiþingue wel him payde
