Sone he liet Baptizen him &punctelev; for loue of þat Maide;
And þoru&yogh; is fader and þoru&yogh; him &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; þe oþur kingue
Endleue þousend of clene maidenes &punctelev; to þis maide huy guonne bringue
heo was glad of þe compaygnie &punctelev; þat so fair to hire cam
Sone heo bigan in priueite &punctelev; telle heom of cristinedom;
Þat for hire loue and for hire prechingue &punctelev; alle cristine huy were
Louerd, &yogh;wuch a compaygnie &punctelev; of clene maidenes was þere
¶ So gret Ioye þe king of is dou&yogh;ter hadde &punctelev; and of ire faire ferrade
Þat huy scholden in þe se &punctelev; plei&yogh;e, &yogh;wane huy wolde
Þat ech man a-londe and in watere &punctelev; heore mayden-hod pre[i]sie scholde
huy sounguen ofte a-watere and eke a-lond &punctelev; and treches huy gonne lede
And oþur-manere faire pleies &punctelev; and al was of clene dedes
Mete and drinke stilleliche &punctelev; to þe schip huy lieten bringue
To þreo &yogh;eres sustinaunce &punctelev; with-oute leue of þe kingue
¶ A dai huy wenten into þe se &punctelev; and pleiden heom up and doun
For Ioye þere stoden, to bi-holden heom &punctelev; Men of mani a toun
Ase huy weren in mest Ioye of plei &punctelev; ore louerd ane wynd sende
Þat drof heom feor into þe se &punctelev; þat men nusten &yogh;wodere huy wende
Welle, glade were þis maydenes þo! &punctelev; þe wind heom drof wel bliue
To[al. ate] þe cite of coloyne &punctelev; formest huy gonne ariue
¶ To Damoysele ourse, þe kyngues dou&yogh;hter &punctelev; an Aungel cam þere
And bad hire lede wel hire compaygnye &punctelev; for-to huy i-martrede were;
And seide þat huy scholden forþere fare &punctelev; and alle a-&yogh;ein wende
And in þulke toune for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; imartrede beon atþenende
Glad was þat Mayde for þis word! &punctelev; forthþ huy wenden a-non
Atþe cite of Basilie &punctelev; huy a-riueden ech-on
¶ Fram þulke Cite euerechone &punctelev; a-fote huy wenden to Rome
Gret Ioye made þe pope with heom &punctelev; þo huy þudere come
For manie of heom weren nei&yogh;h him sibbe &punctelev; and for he was of bru|tayne;
Cyriac is name was. &punctelev; huy weren of him wel fayne
An Aungel cam to þe pope a ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; and seide þat he scholde
With þis Maydenes i-martred beo &punctelev; for ore louerd it so wolde
After þat tyme þis holie man &punctelev; honourede heom þe more
And prechede heom ofte of clannesse &punctelev; and of ore louerdes lore
Tweolf monþe and endleue wokes &punctelev; alle þis Maydenes were
At Rome with þis holie pope &punctelev; þat heom dude wel lere
¶ Ake þe pope seint Ciriac &punctelev; is conseil cleopie gan
His clerkes and is Cardinales &punctelev; and Mani on oþer Man
Bi-fore heom al is dignete &punctelev; he tok up atþen ende
And seide he wolde in-to an oþur lond &punctelev; with þis maydenes wende
¶ Þis Cardinales weren þare-a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; and seiden þat he gan reue
With fole wummen for-to go &punctelev; and is dignete bi-leue
Naþeles he wende forth with heom &punctelev; al a-&yogh;ein heore rede;
Þe Cardinales and is clerkes &punctelev; gret schame þare-fore him seide
Tweie luþere princes þare weren &punctelev; Maximin and Affrican
Þou&yogh;ten þat þis Maydenes wolden &punctelev; tuyrne mani a man
To heore Mey, þe prince of Coloyne &punctelev; huy senden for-þen-one
Þat he, &yogh;wane huy þudere comen &punctelev; A-slowe heom euerech-one
¶ Þat child þat scholde þis Mayde wedde &punctelev; ase heo hadde i-seid
Kyng was i-maud of Enguelonde &punctelev; þo is fader was ded;
Þat ladde swiþe chaste lijf &punctelev; and longuede swiþe sore
With þat clene Maide to speke and beo &punctelev; þoru&yogh; strencþe of godes lore
An Aungel cam to him and bad &punctelev; þat he on alle wise
his Moder and is &yogh;ungueste soster &punctelev; anon-ri&yogh;ht liete Baptize
And he with heom to Coloygne &punctelev; wiende with al his mayne
A-&yogh;ein is trewe spouse, þat was &punctelev; Mayde Ourse of brutayne;
Þat heo[r. he] him to hire leide faste &punctelev; in wille and eke in dede
And endede heore lijf in godes seruise &punctelev; ase heo heom wolde rede
¶ þis &yogh;ongue with gret ioye dude &punctelev; þat þe Aungel him gan lere
his moder and is soster he nam &punctelev; þo huy i-baptizede were
And þe Bischop Clement al-so &punctelev; þat i-baptized heom hadde
Toward coloyne forth with him &punctelev; a-&yogh;en þis Maydenes he ladde
Swiþe glad was þis &yogh;ongue king &punctelev; þo he to is lefMan cam
And also glad was þat Maide &punctelev; þo heo sai&yogh;h him in cristinedom
Mest Ioye heo made with is &yogh;ongue soster &punctelev; þat hiet Florentyne
Þat heo, clene Mayde, scholde &punctelev; soffrie deþes pine
¶ Ourse of Brutayne þene &yogh;oungue king &punctelev; in grete Ioye of loue gan lere
Þat he him heolde faste to hire &punctelev; and ne bi-lefde for no fere
Þat huy mi&yogh;hten in trewe loue &punctelev; to-gadere i-martred beo
And wonye in heuene with Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat bou&yogh;te heom on þe treo
Alþis grauntede þis &yogh;oungue king &punctelev; and is lefmane nou&yogh;t ne wernde;
his furste þou&yogh;t into treowe loue &punctelev; and into clannesse he turnde
¶ Þe heþene prince i-redi was &punctelev; þo huy to Coloyne come
With manie luþere heþene Men &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie huy nome
And huweden and crieden on heom a-schame &punctelev; and to grounde heom a-slowe
And ase so fale wolues a-mong lambren &punctelev; heore flechs huy to-drowe
Þo huy comen to þis clene þing &punctelev; Maide Ourse of Brutayne
Þat huy founden so fair a creature &punctelev; of hire huy weren wel fayne
Þe prince hire nam and hire bi-hiet &punctelev; to laten hire gon a-liue
And, for heo was so fair and noble &punctelev; habbe hire to wiue
¶ Þis Maide seide þat heo nolde to hire spouse &punctelev; him ne non oþur take
Þe prince nei&yogh;h for wrathþe wod &punctelev; þo he was so fur-sake
he liet hire to deþe scheote &punctelev; with Aruwene atþenende
And þus heo and al hire compaygnie &punctelev; to þe Ioye of heuene gan wiende;
And þe &yogh;ongue king of Enguelonde &punctelev; and is Moder also
And is &yogh;ongue soster Florentine &punctelev; to deþe weren i-do
And þe pope Ciriac &punctelev; and Bischopes mani on
Þat for trewe hope of Martyrdom &punctelev; with heom weren i-gon
Ore louerd hadde swiþe[al. Ou louerd þe] gret Ioye &punctelev; of þat swete ferrede
þat swuch martyrdom for is[al. þi] loue &punctelev; a-fenguen with-oute drede
In þe to hondrede &yogh;ere[al. om.] &punctelev; and ei&yogh;te and þrittiþe &yogh;ere
After ore louerdes buyrtyme &punctelev; þis maidenes i-martrede were
¶ Þis endleue þousend of clene maydenes &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie
I-burede weren in Coloyne &punctelev; in one Nonnerie.
An Abbot þere was bi-side &punctelev; þat heorde of þis cas
And ofte of þis clene Maydenes &punctelev; þat gret Miracle þere was
he bad þe Abbesse of Coloyne &punctelev; þat heo him graunti scholde
A bodi of þis clene Maydenes &punctelev; and he wolde it don in golde
Þo þis bodi was him i-take &punctelev; twelf Monþe he liet it beo
With-oute seluer oþur gold &punctelev; in one cheste of treo
¶ Þo þe twelf monþes weren a-go &punctelev; ase þe Monekes weren ech-one
A ny&yogh;t at Matines, þis[MS. þis þis] holie bodi &punctelev; a-ros hire up allone
heo beu&yogh; hire to þe hei&yogh;e weued &punctelev; and wende mildeliche
A-mong al þe Couent forthþ &punctelev; and out wel stilledliche.[r. stilleliche]
Þe Monekus, þo huy þis i-sei&yogh;en &punctelev; of-dradde and sorien[r. sorie] were
huy eoden to þe cheste þare heo [was] inne i-leid &punctelev; and ne founden ire nou&yogh;t þere
¶ "Þis," quath þe Abbod, "is ore wreche &punctelev; for we hire i-do nadde
In a schrine of gold, ase we bi-heten &punctelev; þo we ire hidere ladden."
To þe Abbesse of Coloyne &punctelev; þe Abbod wende a-non
And tolde þis cas al-hou it was &punctelev; of þat Maide i-gon
huy wenden forthþ to þulke stude &punctelev; þare heo was i-leid inne er
And heuen up þe þrouwes lid &punctelev; and founden hire ligge þer
Faire and euene ase heo dude er— &punctelev; so luyte lime þere nas
Þat ne lai ase heo was furst i-leid. &punctelev; a fair Miracle þere was
Þe Abbesse was þo swyþe glad &punctelev; and þe Nonnes euerechon
And þonkede god of þat faire Miracle &punctelev; and hei&yogh;e sounguen a-non
¶ Þe Abbot bad þat he moste habbe &punctelev; þis holie bodi eft-sone
And seide he wolde honouri it faire &punctelev; ase he au&yogh;te for-to done
Ake þe Abbesse nolde graunti it nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne þat couent noþur
Þat eft it scholde habbe a-wei &punctelev; þei he hadde i-beo heore broþur;
For buy i-sei&yogh;en þat it was godes wille &punctelev; þat it bi-lefde þere
Þis Abbod wende him hom a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; with wel dreorie chere
Nou God us graunti, &yogh;if is wille is &punctelev; þat we moten i-winne
Þe hei&yogh;e Ioye of heouene &punctelev; þare alle þis Maydenes beoth inne
Ne þat we neuere þarof ne missen &punctelev; for none[MS. nome] sorie sunne
SEinte Katerine of noble kunne: cam, bi olde dawe;
Hire fader was king, hire Moder Quyene &punctelev; boþe of þe olde lawe
Þe king . Coste. hire fader het. &punctelev; gret clerk þis Mayde was;
Þare nas non of þe seue .Ars &punctelev; þat heo maister of nas
Maxentius het þe Aumperour &punctelev; In eche londe he let crie
Þat ech kynerich under him &punctelev; come to Alisaundrie
Euerech Man for is stat &punctelev; to don to heore godes sacrefise;
ho-so it lete, men scholde of him don &punctelev; swyþe stronge Iustise
Þo ech lond was þudere i-come &punctelev; to don heore lawe
Seinte katerine wel harde-liche &punctelev; to-ward heom gan drawe;
bi-halues heo stod and bi-heold &punctelev; heore wrechche gydi-hede
heo sai&yogh; Anouri þe Maumates &punctelev; and manie cristine Men for drede
Þo hadde heo gret deol in hire heorte &punctelev; and blesse[de] hire a-non
And forth anon to þe Aumperour &punctelev; baldeliche heo gan gon
"Sire," heo seide, "riche Aumperour þou art &punctelev; swiþe noble and hende
Þov scholdest þi wisdom and þi wit &punctelev; to some guode wende
Þat i segge for þe folie &punctelev; þat ich i-seo eov do
So muche feorrene folk &punctelev; þov hast i-cleopet þar-to
Grete Ioie in ouwer heorte &punctelev; þis temple &yogh;e makiez i-fo
Þat is ymaud of lym and ston &punctelev; and of ouwer Maumates also;
&YOGH;wy ne bi-holde &yogh;e þe hei&yogh;e temple— &punctelev; for þer-of wondri ov mai
Of þe heie heuene þat geth a-boute &punctelev; a-bouen eov ni&yogh;t and dai
Of sonne and Mone and steorrene al-so &punctelev; fram þe este to þe weste
Þat trauaillieth and neuere werie ne beoth &punctelev; ne neuere ne habbeth reste
bi-þench þe wel and turne þi wit &punctelev; to some wisdome, ich rede
And &yogh;wane þin owene In-wit it seith &punctelev; þat nou&yogh;were nis swuch dede
Al-mi&yogh;ti god þou him hold &punctelev; þat swuch wonder can make;
bi-fore alle oþere Anoure him &punctelev; and þine Maumates for-sake."
With oþere resones of clergie &punctelev; þat mayde proffrede also
Þat heore godes nau&yogh;tes ne were &punctelev; þat heo Anoureden heom to
¶ Þe Aumperour stod and ne couþe þar-to &punctelev; Answerie In none wise;
Gret wonder him þou&yogh;te of hire fair-hede &punctelev; and of hire Quoyntise;
"Mayde," he seide, "a-bijd here-with &punctelev; for-to aftur ore sacrefise
And we schullen more with þe speke &punctelev; ich oþur mi Iustise."
Þo þe sacrefise was i-don &punctelev; þe Aumperour sat In is trone
And al is folk a-bouten him. &punctelev; men brouten þat Maide sone
"Maide," seide þe Aumperur &punctelev; "þou þinchest gent and freo;
Of &yogh;wat kunrade art þou i-come? &punctelev; gret wonder us þinchez of þe."
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "I-ne wilni bote luyte
to tellen þe of mine kunne &punctelev; for it were signe of pruyte;
For In is boke þe wise Man &punctelev; Catun seith al-so
Þat Man ne schal him-sulue preisi &punctelev; ne blamie no-þe-mo
For so doth foles þat wilniez muche &punctelev; of &yogh;elpingue and of sunne
Naþeles ichulle, ake for no pruyte &punctelev; tellen eov of mine kunne
Ich am þe kingus dou&yogh;ter coste &punctelev; þat þou wost &yogh;wuch is
hidere ich cam to speke mid eov &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e bi-leuez a-mis;
Mid vn-ri&yogh;te heo beozþ i-cleped godes &punctelev; þat o fot ne mouwen go[MS. gon]
Ne no man helpe in none neode &punctelev; ne heom-sulue no-þe-mo."
¶ "Maide," seide[MS. seide seide] þis Amperur &punctelev; "&yogh;if þat þis sothþ were
Al þis world were fals and guydi &punctelev; &yogh;if þou one heom[MS. heom heom] scholdest [lere];
And we schulle betere i-leue alle men &punctelev; and more it wole beo note
Þane ani fol womman ase þou art— &punctelev; for ouwer bolt is sone i-schote."
"Sire," seide þis Maide þo &punctelev; "þei þou luyte telle of me
Also guod mai beo mi reson &punctelev; ase þat comez of þe
For, sire Aumperur, þou[MS. ich þou] art &punctelev; ase ech man is al-so
Þat hote mai and hys men moten &punctelev; nede hys hestes do
Of bodi and of soule þou art y-maud &punctelev; ase þi-sulf mi&yogh;t i-seo;
Mid ri&yogh;te þi soule Maister is &punctelev; and þi bodi is hyne schal beo
&YOGH;if þi bodi maister is &punctelev; and þi soule[superscribed later.] is hyne
A&yogh;en kuynde it is &punctelev; and þou worst sikur &punctelev; þare-fore of helle pine."
Þoru&yogh; hire clergie þat holi Maide &punctelev; resones made so quoynte
Þat þe Aumperour ne non of his &punctelev; ne couþe hire ansuerie in none pointe
"Maide," he seide, "þou schalt a-bide &punctelev; In warde here mid me
And oþere ichulle bi tyme finde &punctelev; þat schullen Answerie þe."
Þis Aumperour sende anon &punctelev; wide a-boute is sonde
Þat þe gretteste maistres of clergie &punctelev; to him comen In eche londe
grete Mede of him to habbe &punctelev; to don a luytel Maystrie
And for-to susteinen op heore lawe &punctelev; þoru strencþe of clergie
So þat þare comen fifti Maistres &punctelev; þe gretteste þat man fond
Also wide ase men mi&yogh;ten seche &punctelev; ou&yogh;were In ani lond
Þe Aumperour heom seide a-non &punctelev; &yogh;ware-fore he after heom sende
For-to desputi a-&yogh;ein a &yogh;ong womman &punctelev; þat al heore lawe schende
"Nou is þis," þat .o. Maister seide &punctelev; "gret schame, ich onder-stonde
An Aumperur to sende a-boute &punctelev; so wide in eche londe
After þe gretteste Maistres, for-to despuyti &punctelev; a-&yogh;en a fol wenche
&YOGH;wane on of heore knaue mi&yogh;ten sone &punctelev; hire resones alle a-quenche!"
"Nai," seide þis Aumperour &punctelev; "heo is wisore þane &yogh;e wene;
&YOGH;if &yogh;e mouwen ou&yogh;t a&yogh;en hire don &punctelev; sone it worth i-sene
For ich habbe leouere þat &yogh;e hire ouer-come &punctelev; with resones In some wise
Þane we with strencþe hire maden &punctelev; to don þe sacrefise."
"Lat bringue hire[superscribed.] forth," seide þat on &punctelev; "and heo schal segge a-non
Þat heo ne spac neuere wit wisore men &punctelev; are heo fram us gon."
¶ An Aungel to þis maide cam &punctelev; and bad hire of no-þing drede
And seide heo scholde heom alle þoru hire reson &punctelev; to cristinedom lede
And heo alle scholden þoru hire reson &punctelev; a-fonge martyrdam
Þo þat Maide i-herde þis &punctelev; gret Ioie to hire heo nam
baldeliche heo eode forth &punctelev; þo men aftur hire come
"Sire," he[= heo] seide to þe Aumperur &punctelev; "&yogh;ifst þou a wis dom
Þat þus fale maistres of clergie &punctelev; bringest and sest a-benche
And me-self to desputy a-&yogh;eines heom &punctelev; þat nam bote a fol wenche
And &yogh;if þat heo me ouer-comez &punctelev; þou bi-hast heom gret mede
And makest me mid strencþe with heom speke &punctelev; and ne bi-hast me bote luyte
Þat þinchez me with on-ri&yogh;te it is &punctelev; &yogh;wane ich am one a-&yogh;ein heom alle
¶ Nov ichulle, for god is min help &punctelev; a-fonge þat me wole falle."
"Seie, dame conIoun, &yogh;wat artþou?" &punctelev; þis o legistre seide
"Þenchestþou speke a-&yogh;ein ore clergie? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
Þov seist þat god al-mi&yogh;ti &punctelev; dethz on eorþe þolede here
I-chulle proui þat he ne mi&yogh;te a-liue beo &punctelev; nouþe In none manere
For, ho-so deiez, he ne may &punctelev; neuerefft to liue come
&YOGH;wane þe vertue of al is bodi &punctelev; þoru deþe him is bi-nome;
And þi god al-mi&yogh;ti is ded &punctelev; þou ne mi&yogh;t libbe nou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if he þat scholde &yogh;iue þe lijf &punctelev; is to deþe i-brou&yogh;t."
¶ "Nai," seide þis holi mayde &punctelev; "þou faillest of þin art
An-oþur þou most segge, &yogh;if þou þencst &punctelev; of þine maistrie to habbe part
God hadde euere and euere he schal &punctelev; mid him is god-hede
And for loue of us In ore flesche &punctelev; he nam him man-hede
Of twei þingus he was þo imaked &punctelev; eiþur moste þo is kuynde a-fonge
For þe kunde of man-hede us to bugge &punctelev; he þolede deth wel stronge;
Ake for-to bi-leue ded, a-&yogh;en kuynde it was &punctelev; ase of is god-hede
Þare-fore he aros fram deþe to liue &punctelev; þo he hadde i-don al is dede
For þe stronge deþe þat þoru&yogh; Adam &punctelev; we weren to i-brou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; is godhede, i-meynd In ore kuynde &punctelev; nede moste beon i-bou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if þou with-seist þis reson &punctelev; an oþur i-chulle þe make
Þat grete clerkes seiden In heore lawe &punctelev; þat man ne may nou&yogh;t for-sake
¶ Platon, þe grete philosophe &punctelev; þat was heþene of ouwer lawe
he seide þat god wolde deie &punctelev; and him-selue to liue a&yogh;en drawe
Lokiez In is boke,[omit in is boke] hov it mi&yogh;te beo soth &punctelev; nouþe In ouwere[r. oþer] manere
bote þe muchele god of heuene &punctelev; bi-come a luyte Man here
Also Balaam, ouwer prophete &punctelev; þat heþene was al-so
In is bok he seide—&yogh;e wuten wel &yogh;ware &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e wollez loki þer-to
Þat þare scholde of Iacobes kuynde &punctelev; a steorre a-rise wel bri&yogh;t
Þat scholde kinges and princes &punctelev; al bi-nimen heom heore mi&yogh;t
Þat was þat ore louerd wolde &punctelev; of Iacobes kuynde beon i-bore
&[added.] ouer-comen alle þat euere weren &punctelev; sethþe oþer bi-fore
And &yogh;uyt þre kinges of ouwer lawe &punctelev; on þulke steorre þou&yogh;ten
For þe steorre þo god was i-bore &punctelev; and þare-fore lok him brou&yogh;ten."
Þo þeos Maistres heorden þis mayde speke &punctelev; of so grete clergie
heo ne couþen answerie hire of neuere a word &punctelev; and &yogh;euen hire þe maistrie
¶ Þo seide þe Aumperur In grete wrathþe &punctelev; "nis non of eov þat can
A-mong so manie grete Maistres— &punctelev; answerie a fol womman?"
"Certes, sire," þis Maistres seiden &punctelev; "so gret clerk nov nis
Þat scholde to hire reson &yogh;iue answere &punctelev; for heo seith so[al. soþ] i-wis
We seggeth, þe holie gost is with hire &punctelev; and In hire mouþe
Þat we ne conne hire answerie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne we ne dorren þei we couþe
Þare-fore, bote we betere of oure lawe &punctelev; þane we &yogh;eot i-seon
Alle we seggez with one mouþe &punctelev; cristine we wollez beon."
"Ey, trichours," seide þe Aumperur &punctelev; "is it icome þer-to
Certes, &yogh;e schullen euerech-one &punctelev; beo to stronge deþe i-do."
he het þat Men scholden a-midde toun &punctelev; fur-berne heom echone
And huy afenge þe deth for godes loue &punctelev; with-oute anie mone
And muche reuþe heo maden to katerine &punctelev; I-baptizede þat heo nere
Þat Maide heom confortede wel &punctelev; and cristine lawes gan heom lere
And seide þat heore stronge martyrdom &punctelev; þat heo þoleden þere
In stude of cristine-dom scholde beon &punctelev; &yogh;if heo stude-faste were
¶ Þis Maistres weren wel glade þo &punctelev; gladliche forth heo eode
And nomen þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; þat men heom wolde beode;
Heo maden þe signe of þe croiz &punctelev; þo men in þat fuyre hem caste
And þo heo hadden longe i-barnd &punctelev; and dede weren atþe laste
And þat fuyr was al a-queynt &punctelev; al-hole heo leien þere
&YOGH;wittore and wel fairore [of][om.] heu&yogh; &punctelev; þane heo euere er were;
Þare nas so luyte wem on heom &punctelev; þat þe leste of heore here
Oþur of heore cloþus a-peirede weren— &punctelev; heo leien with faire chere
Þis Aumperur let fette a-non &punctelev; þat Maide katerine
"haue reuþe of þi-sulf," he seide &punctelev; "and schild þe fram pine
haue reuþe of þi noble bodi &punctelev; þat is so fair and hende
For þou schalt beon in grete nobleye &punctelev; &yogh;if þou wolt þi þou&yogh;t wende
In mi paleis ich schal þe make &punctelev; hext after þe quene;
After þi fourme ichulle þe make &punctelev; An ymage, bri&yogh;t and schene
Ouer-guld and quoynte i-nov &punctelev; and sette as a-midde þe cite
Þat ech man hire honouri schal &punctelev; for honour of þe
Ase men schullen to one god do. &punctelev; þou ne schalt mid al þi lore
So muche nobleie bi-þenche þe &punctelev; þat I nelle don þe more."
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "let þi fole þou&yogh;t
For þov nast non more &yogh;wile to spille &punctelev; þane speken embe nou&yogh;t
god almi&yogh;ties spouse ich am &punctelev; and al þi blaundisinge
Ne alle þine tormenz ne schullen min heorte &punctelev; enes fram him bringe."
Þe Aumperur hire let strep[e] naked &punctelev; and to a piler faste hire bounden
With stronge schourges men beoten hire sore &punctelev; and maden hire harde wounden
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten þare-with-al &punctelev; turnen hire þou&yogh;t
In depe prisone and swiþe deorke &punctelev; sone heo was i-brou&yogh;t;
Þat no man hire mete ne &yogh;af ne drunch &punctelev; þei heo scholde for hungur deie
For heo scholde to heore lawe hire þou&yogh;[t] tuyrne &punctelev; and beon i-brou&yogh;t out of teie
In þat prison þat Maide lai &punctelev; twelf dawes and twelf ni&yogh;t
Þat heo noþer .et. ne dronk &punctelev; ne i-sai&yogh; non eorþelich li&yogh;t;
A &yogh;wit coluere þare cam fram heuene &punctelev; to hire euer-ech dai
And brou&yogh;te hire fram heuene mete &punctelev; In-to prisone ase heo lai
A day ase þe Aumperur was &punctelev; out of þe toune i-fare
Þe Aumperesse þou&yogh;te on katerine &punctelev; and hadde of hire gret care
Of hire bede wel priueliche &punctelev; heo a-ros at mid-Ni&yogh;t
And nam with hire sire porfirie &punctelev; þat was hire priue kny&yogh;t
Þo heo to þe prisone come &punctelev; heo i-sei&yogh;en þare gret li&yogh;t;
gret wounder heom þou&yogh;te &yogh;war-of were &punctelev; þe deorke stude so bri&yogh;t
Þo heo i-sei&yogh;en[al. sei&yogh;en heo] seinte katerine &punctelev; was In þe prisone grounde
And an Aungel of heuene with hire stonde &punctelev; and smerede hire wounde
¶ Þe Aumperesse cride a-non &punctelev; "Katerine," heo seide, "þin ore
Mine ri&yogh;te bi-leue þov tech me &punctelev; I nelle beo fol non more."
Þe kni&yogh;t al-so, sire porfirie &punctelev; loude cride al-so
Þat muche folk þat þare-a-boute was &punctelev; sone cam þer-to;
Sire porfirie ful a-doun to hire fet &punctelev; and merci he gan crie
With grete Ioye þis Maide prechede heom &punctelev; of god and seinte marie;
So þat Aumperesse and porfirie &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þis Maide þere
And twei hondred of oþur folk &punctelev; I-baptizede weren
¶ Ore louerd him-sulf cam sethþe a-doun &punctelev; to seinte katerine
"Lo," he seide, "here ich am &punctelev; for &yogh;wam þou hast þis pine
In þine tormenz beo studefast &punctelev; Ichulle beo mid þe;
Þi sege is in heue[ne] i-maud &punctelev; þare þov schalt wonien mid me."
An oþur dai þe Aumperour &punctelev; after þis Maide sende;
Þat heo were ded, oþur al fur-fare &punctelev; swiþe wel he wende
Þis Maide was bi-fore him y-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; swiþe fat and round
"&YOGH;wat," he seide, "hou geth þis? &punctelev; heo is hol and sound
&YOGH;ware beoth þis traitores," he seide &punctelev; "þat hire In prisone wuste
Stilleliche heo hire habbeth i-fed &punctelev; þat no man it nuste
bi þe treuþe þat i schal to Mahon &punctelev; heo ne schullen so non-more!"
he let nime alle þe gayholers &punctelev; and tormenti heom ful sore
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "is þis a guod Ivggement
gulte-lese Men for mine gulte &punctelev; to bringe in swuche torment
he þat hath me i-fed &punctelev; him ne drat of þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
For an Aungel it was of heuene &punctelev; þat mete me hath i-brou&yogh;t
Do me &yogh;wat torment þat þov wolt &punctelev; and lat heom quite gon
For-soþe, þat[al. of þat] þou on heom seist &punctelev; gult heo ne habbez non."
"Ey., hendie Maide Katerine" &punctelev; seide þis Aumperour
"Þench op-on þi noble stat &punctelev; of alle Maidenes þov art flour;
Torne þi þou&yogh;t and þou schalt beon &punctelev; þe Aumperesse per;
heo ne schal no-þing bi-fore þe habbe &punctelev; bote þat heo me mot beo ner."
"guode man," seide þis holie mayde &punctelev; "þov spext embe nou&yogh;t
For al þi pouwer þou ne schalt &punctelev; fram ihesu crist wende mi þou&yogh;t
Al þat torment þat þou mi&yogh;t þenche &punctelev; And of alle [day longe,[d. l. wr. by a later hand on an erasure.]
Þov mi&yogh;t don me &yogh;if þou wolt &punctelev; redi ich am to fonge;
For ich ne wilni no-þing so muche &punctelev; ase mi flechs and mi blod, i-wis
to &yogh;iue for mi louerdes loue &punctelev; þat for me he &yogh;af his."
Þo was þe Aumperur so wroth &punctelev; þat he was nei&yogh; i-swowe
Four &yogh;weles of Iren he let fullen &punctelev; with rasores, kene I-nowe
And with ginne heom makede tuyrne a-boute &punctelev; þe tweien on þat on half opward
Þe oþur tweine euene heom a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; In þat oþur half a-done-ward
Þat, ho-so bi-twene were &punctelev; In none half ne mi&yogh;te him wende
Þat þe rasores nolden al is flechs &punctelev; to-drawen and to-rende
Sone so þis Maide was i-don þar-on &punctelev; hire bodi for-to schende
Ore swete louerd fram heuene &punctelev; an Aungel to hire gan sende
Þis Aungel with a drawe swerd &punctelev; þe &yogh;weoles al-to-hev
Þat þe peces a-boute flowen &punctelev; ase corn &yogh;wane man it sev
And smot[al. smite] of þis luþere men &punctelev; wel harde to þe grounde;
Four þousend þ[er]e weren a-slawe &punctelev; In a lutel stounde
Þo nuste þe Aumperur &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;te don &punctelev; for deol ne for sore
Þe Aumperesse nolde hele hire stat &punctelev; lengore þo nam-more
¶ "Sire," heo seide, "hou gez þis? &punctelev; for godes loue, þin ore
Ich i-seo þat þis mayde is guod &punctelev; and of holi lore
Ower Maumates ichulle for-sake &punctelev; Inelle on hem bi-leue more."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for wrathþe &punctelev; loude &yogh;eolle and rore
he ne mi&yogh;te fram Ihesu crist &punctelev; hire þou&yogh;t no-þing wende
he het men þat[r. þat men] scholden hire lede &punctelev; to þe tounes ende
And hire bresten fram hire bodi &punctelev; with Irene crokes rende
And þare-after smiten of hire heued &punctelev; þe more forto[r. hire to] schende
Wit guode heorte þe Aumperesse &punctelev; þane deth gan a-fonge;
Þe quellares heo bad hi&yogh;en faste &punctelev; and ne a-biden nou&yogh;t to longe
Heo nomen þe kene crokes of Ire &punctelev; þat hire flechs depe gnowe
And, also man draweth with combes wolle &punctelev; hire tetes heo to-drowe
Fram hire bodi mossel mele &punctelev; and sethþe smiten of hire heued
Þat bodi, for houndes it scholden ete &punctelev; vn-bured it was bi-leued
Ake porfirie it burede a-ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þat holi bodi and guod
Þo þe Aumperur þat bodi miste &punctelev; he was wroth and wod;
he tormentede þare-fore manie Men &punctelev; þat ne mi&yogh;ten heom nou&yogh;t skere
Þo eode porfirie forth &punctelev; and seide, "sire, lo me here
Ich burede þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat was cristus make;
And to Ihesu crist ich habbe al-so &punctelev; al min heorte i-take;
For no pouwer þat þou mi&yogh;t don &punctelev; I-nelle him for-sake."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for deol and sor &punctelev; alle is lymes to schake
¶ "Mahun," he seide, "hou schal þis beo? &punctelev; &yogh;wat schal ich nou do
Nov Ich habbe mi wif for-lore &punctelev; and mi kni&yogh;t porfirie al-so
And porfirie al min heorte was! &punctelev; &yogh;wy neltþou me rede?"
Þo wenden þis oþure kny&yogh;tes forth &punctelev; and loude heo gonne grede
"We nellez þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; no leng bi-leue for drede."
Þo gan þe Aumperur to-drawe is her &punctelev; and sore siche and grone
"Mahun," he seide, "&yogh;wat schal ich do? &punctelev; hov schal ich bi-leue allone
&YOGH;wi neltþou raþer fette me &punctelev; and bringe me of þusse liue
Þane soffri alle mine men to leose &punctelev; after mine leoue wiue
Þei þou nelle, mahun, helpe me &punctelev; I-ne for-sake þe nou&yogh;t
Þis foles þat habbez þe for-sake &punctelev; to deþe heo schulle beo brou&yogh;t."
He let nime porfire þene guode kny&yogh;t &punctelev; and is felawes echone
And smiten of heore heuedes with-oute toun &punctelev; ase Mahones fon
Þo let he fette katerine &punctelev; "Dameysele," he seide
Þei þov me bi-nome mi wijf &punctelev; mid þine fole rede
I-chulle, &yogh;if þou wul torni þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; fur-&yogh;iue þine misdede
And with gret nobleie ase min Aumperesse &punctelev; ouer-al with me þe lede."
¶ "Certes, sire," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "þis wordes beoth alle for nau&yogh;t
Þov ne schalt me neuere bringue fram him &punctelev; þat hath min heorte i-cau&yogh;t
Do þat þov wolt, and haue i-don &punctelev; and bring þi wille to ende
For þou ne schalt neuere for no-þing &punctelev; min herte fram Ihesu wende."
"&YOGH;ware beo &yogh;e, mine quellares?" &punctelev; þe Aumperur þo seide
"Faste &yogh;e schulle þe wychche binde &punctelev; and with-oute toune lede
And smitez[r. smite] of hire heued a-non &punctelev; an don þe guode dede
Þat heo ne bringe us neuereft &punctelev; In soruwe ne In drede."
Þo þis Maide was i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; to slene with-oute þe toun
hire preiere heo maude to god &punctelev; a-knes heo sat a-doun
"Louerd," heo seide, "graunte þou me &punctelev; þat ech man þat hath in[om. in] mone
In ani neode oþur in ani anuy &punctelev; of mine passione
graunte þat he mote to is wille &punctelev; help a-fonge sone."
Þo cam ore louerd him-self to hire &punctelev; and grauntede hire bone
¶ "Cum forth," he seide, "mi suete leman &punctelev; mi leue spouse al-so
heuene-&yogh;at a-&yogh;ein þe I-opened is &punctelev; þare þou schalt comen to."
A quellare hire heued of smot. &punctelev; þat folk þat a-boute heom stode
&YOGH;wijt Milk heo i-sei&yogh;en eorne out of þe wounde &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t o drope of blode
Aungles comen and nomen þat bodi &punctelev; a-mong alle þe manne
And to þe hul of synay it beren &punctelev; tuenti Iorneies þanne
And bureden it þare In one faire place &punctelev; wit grete nobleye and riche;
Þare þoru&yogh; Ihesu cristes grace &punctelev; hire bones restez &yogh;uyte
Þare-of &yogh;eot to þis day &punctelev; þare eornez eoille wel riue
&YOGH;ware-with manie sike Men &punctelev; beoz to hele i-brou&yogh;t and to liue;
Wide In londe it is i-lad &punctelev; þat ho-so it habbe mote
Noble relike it is al-so &punctelev; sike Men to don bote
Þre hundred &yogh;er and twenti &punctelev; after þat god was i-bore
I-Martred was þis holie Maide &punctelev; of &yogh;wam we tolden bi-fore
Ihesu crist, for þe suete loue &punctelev; of seinte Katerine
graunti us þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; and schilde us fram helle pine
Amen amen, segge we alle &punctelev; for is holie tyme
SEinte lucie, þat holie Mayde &punctelev; In Cezile was i-bore;
&YOGH;ong heo bi-gan to serui god &punctelev; and bi-lefde sunne and hore;
Dame Evtice hire Moder het &punctelev; þat hire to wommane brou&yogh;te
Of hire childe wel glad heo was &punctelev; ase heo suyþe wel ou&yogh;te
So bi-feol þat on Dame Eutice cam a siknesse &punctelev; swiþe greuous and long
Four &yogh;er he[= heo] hadde gret pine— &punctelev; þe menison of blode wel strong
On leches heo hadde i-spendet[MS. i spendedet] &punctelev; Muche del of hire guod
Ake þare nas non þat hire hele mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo ne bledde euere blod
So þat wide In þe londe Men tolden &punctelev; of seinte Agace
Of Miracles þat comen at hire schrine &punctelev; þoru ore louerdes grace
In þe cite of Cathenes &punctelev; þere þis holi womman lay;
Folk wende þudere wel wide &punctelev; boþe Ni&yogh;t and day
bi manie scor to-gadere &punctelev; of eche londe a-boute
Þo seinte lucie þis i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; al dai so gret route
"Moder," heo seide, "þou hauest an vuel &punctelev; ful greuous with-alle
And we hereth of miracles al day &punctelev; þat of seinte Agace doth falle
go we þudere forth mid oþure &punctelev; to þe holie seint Agace
And þare þou schalt to hele come &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace."
¶ Nov was lucie stilleliche &punctelev; I-torned to cristine-dom
Ake hire Moder heþene was &punctelev; and al þat heo of com;
Lucie to ane heþene manne &punctelev; was i-weddet In hire &yogh;ong-hede
Ake Naþeles clene Mayde heo was &punctelev; with-oute eche fol dede
Hire Moder heo nam stilleliche &punctelev; and with oþere Men heo wende
To seinte Agace Toumbe &punctelev; hire Moder for-to amende
[vv. 25-6 are tr. in the other MS.]And i-heorde þe Masse a dai &punctelev; mid oþure þat þere were
Þo heo weren þudere i-come— &punctelev; so longue[al. a stounde] heo lefden þere
So þat þe godspel was þat day &punctelev; ase lucie onder-stod
Of a womman þat &yogh;wylene hadde &punctelev; þe menison of blod
And cam ant touchede þe lappe &punctelev; of ore louerdes cloþes ene
Ase he eode In grete prece &punctelev; and was hol a-non and clene
"Leoue Moder," seide lucie &punctelev; "&yogh;if þov bi-leuest on holi churche
And þe wordes of þis godspel &punctelev; and þer-after wolt wurche
Þoru&yogh; touchingue of seinte Agace toumbe &punctelev; þou&yogh; schalt beo hol a-non
Ase þeo womman &yogh;wylene was &punctelev; þat aftur ore louerd gan gon."
Þo þat folk was al i-went &punctelev; seinte lucie cam
To seinte Agace holie toumbe &punctelev; and ire Moder with hire nam;
Þare heo leien In heore beden &punctelev; heo nolden þannes gon
¶ So þat lucie, þat clene Maide &punctelev; werth a-slepe a-non
Seinte Agace, þat holie Maide &punctelev; to hire fram heuene a-li&yogh;te
With gret felau&yogh;-schipe of Aungles— &punctelev; hire croune schon wel bri&yogh;te;
"Lucie," heo seide, "leoue soster &punctelev; &yogh;wy trauaillestþou so
And &yogh;wy biddestþou me so &yogh;eorne þat þing &punctelev; þat þou mi&yogh;t þi-self do
For þine bi-leue, þat is so guod &punctelev; helpez þi Moder, i-wis
And nov þoru þe and þine guod-nesse &punctelev; þi Moder i-held is
And also ase þis cite is &punctelev; i-wuyrþet muche þoru&yogh; me
Also schal þi contreie &punctelev; Anoured beon for þe;
For þi clene Maiden-hod &punctelev; and for þi holie lif, i-wis
Þi woneingue is wel &yogh;are i-maket &punctelev; with us in heuene-blis."
Þo þis holie Maide a-wok &punctelev; heo bi-gan to quakien sore;
¶ "Moder," heo seide, "þov art hol &punctelev; ne þarfþe drede non-more
For þe loue of þat holie Maide &punctelev; þat þe hath to hele i-brou&yogh;t
Ne fonde þov neuere to bringue me &punctelev; of mi clene þou&yogh;t
And ne soffre þou nou&yogh;t mine spouse in folie &punctelev; mi Maiden-hod a-spille
Ne lat me nou&yogh;t leose þat longue lif &punctelev; for a luytel fol wille
Ake al þat þou i-grauntet hast &punctelev; for-to &yogh;iue him with me
Lat me it &yogh;iue þe pouere men &punctelev; Moder, ich bidde þe."
Þe Moder, þo heo hol was &punctelev; guod womman bi-cam
And þe dou&yogh;ter bi hire Moder wille &punctelev; þat guod to hire heo nam;
heo hit delte a-mong pouere Men &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle þare i-laste ou&yogh;t
to him þat hire spouse was &punctelev; þe teoþingue was i-brou&yogh;t
he wende to seinte lucies norice &punctelev; and axede hire wel stille
&YOGH;wat lucie were on bi-come &punctelev; heore guod for-to a-spille
¶ And &yogh;wi heo dude it so a-wei &punctelev; and &yogh;wodere heo dude it bere
Þis norice wel quoyntelich &punctelev; &yogh;af him a-non answere
"heo hath ifounde forto sulle &punctelev; swyþe derewurþe þing, i-wis
Þat is suych a þousent more wurth &punctelev; þanne al þat þing þat is;
Þe beste chaffare it is i-bou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat euere Man to drou&yogh;;
Woldestþou gon þare-Inne In part &punctelev; riche man þou were i-nou&yogh;"
Þat was þe chaffare þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; þat heo hadde i-bou&yogh;t
gret wonder he hadde of þulke Answere &punctelev; and stod in gret þou&yogh;t
So þat he onder-&yogh;at sone &punctelev; þat heo cristine was
In grete wrathþe he tolde fore &punctelev; þe Iustice, þat het pakas.[MS. þakas]
Lucie was sone i-fet &punctelev; and bi-fore þe Iustice i-brou&yogh;t
"Maide," seide þe Iustice &punctelev; "&yogh;wat hast þou i-þou&yogh;t
¶ Let þi folie," he seide &punctelev; "Ich rede, on alle wiffe
And to ore godes, ase ri&yogh;t is &punctelev; do þine sacrefise!"
"Ich habbe," quath þis holie Maide &punctelev; "al þis þre &yogh;er i-do
Mine sacrefise to Iesu crist &punctelev; and &yogh;uyt i-chulle al-so
Al þat ich hadde ich habbe ispended &punctelev; and bi-take In is lore;
And þer-to ichulle mi bodi take &punctelev; &yogh;wane me nis bi-leued nomore
Spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] i-chulle nou al mi bodi &punctelev; fram þe fot to þe heued
And euerech lime In is seruise &punctelev; nov me nis more bi-leued;
Ich &yogh;elde him op al mi bodi &punctelev; sire Iustise, here bi-fore þe
¶ "Nov ich wot," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;ware-to þou tornest þi mod
For In hore-dom and In lecherie &punctelev; þou hast i-spend al þi guod
Þar-on þou wolt þi bodi al spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; and þar-of þou dest preche;
&YOGH;wane þov nast non more to spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; for-soþe þou worst a wrechche
For þov spext ase an hore strong &punctelev; &yogh;wane þou wolt for-sake
Þi louerd þat þou art to i-weddet[corr. to i-wedded.] &punctelev; and to lechours þe take."
"I-wedded ich was to Ihesu crist" &punctelev; þis holie maide him tolde
"Þo ich was i-baptized &punctelev; and þulke weddingue ichulle holde
Ake to hore-dome þov woldest me bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov me woldest make
Mine spousede louerd Ihesu crist &punctelev; for ani oþur man for-sake."
"Þou schalt for-sake him," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "haddestþou it i-swore
For to þe commune bordel þov schalt beo &punctelev; i-lad oþur i-bore
[The following part of this legend is written as prose, in two columns on each page on f. 60b.]And þare schal mani a moder-child &punctelev; go to þi foule licame
And ligge bi þe, alle þat wollez &punctelev; in hore-dom and in schame."
¶ "Ne mai no wumman," quath þis maide &punctelev; "of hire maiden-hod beo ido
For þe more þat mi bodi a-&yogh;ein mi wille &punctelev; here defouled is
Þe clenore[MS. clenore] is mi mayden-hod &punctelev; and þe more mi mede, i-wis."
¶ Þe Iustise let wide a-boute &punctelev; into al þe contreie crie
Þat alle þat wolden &punctelev; bi a swuch fair wumman don anie folie
Comen to hire, alle þat wolden &punctelev; for alle heo scholde heom take,[a later hand adds consente.]
For in bordel heo scholde beo i-do &punctelev; þare heo ne scholde non fur-sake
he hiet is men nimen hire faste &punctelev; and to þe bordel hire lede anon
Alle þat mi&yogh;hten nei&yogh;h hire come &punctelev; faste huy hire drowen ech-on
huy schoue and drowe al þat huy mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire anne fote i-winne
Ne o fote uchchen of þe stude &punctelev; þare as heo stod inne
Þo nomen huy ropes strongue i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; ant to fet and hondene teide
And alle þat mi&yogh;hten þere nei&yogh;h come &punctelev; faste huy drowen and breide;
A þousend men with al heore main &punctelev; on hire gonne drawe
Ac euere heo lai stille a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "&YOGH;wat, hou goth þis?" quath þe iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;wat resun mai þis beo
Þat a þousend ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þis womman &punctelev; of þe stude enes teo?"
¶ "Sire iustise," þat Maide seide &punctelev; "þou hontest a-boute nou&yogh;t
For, þei þou haddest &yogh;eot to heom &punctelev; ten þousend mo i-brou&yogh;t
&YOGH;uit it scholde bi-foren eov alle &punctelev; bi folfuld bi me her
Þat holie vers þat seint Dauid &punctelev; seithþ in þe sauter:[Ps. 90]
Þat a þousend men scholden in mi side falle &punctelev; and to grounde beon i-brou&yogh;t
And ten þousend in mi ri&yogh;ht side &punctelev; and nei&yogh;h me ne comen nou&yogh;t
Þare-fore it is al for nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat þou hontest here-a-boute;
God is strengore þane þou be &punctelev; and þare-fore i-nabbe no doute."
¶ "Þou art strong wichche," quath þe iustise &punctelev; "and þar-of Man schal þe bringue
Mine clerkes and mine enchauntours &punctelev; bi-nime schullen þi wich|chingue."
His clerkes he let bringue forth &punctelev; and his enchauntours echone
And huy maden heore coniurisones &punctelev; a-boute þis Maide alone
And þo huy hadden al ido þat huy couþen &punctelev; þat folk gan eft-sones drawe
Ake euere heo lai i-liche stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ Þe Iustise, þo he þis i-sei&yogh; &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod
"Certes," he seide, "hire wichchingue &punctelev; ne schal do hire no guod."
Strongue temene he liet fette &punctelev; of Oxene mani on
And bringue þere þis Maide was &punctelev; and to hire tei&yogh;en ech-on;
He liet heom prikie and harli faste &punctelev; and huy guonne drawe and pluchche
And euere lai þis Maide stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "Certes," he seide, "ore fare nis nou&yogh;t &punctelev; oþur-&yogh;wat we moten do
With oþer þing we schullen hire to nau&yogh;te bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen so
Makieth ope þe hore, þare heo lijthþ &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen hire winne heonne
Also strong fuyr ase &yogh;e conne &punctelev; þat heo al-to douste brenne!"
A strong fuir and gret i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þis tormentores wrou&yogh;te
Aboute þis holie clene maide &punctelev; to brenne hire al-to nou&yogh;te
Þo þis fuyr was wel strongue i-maud &punctelev; heo sat a-midde ful stille;
Þat fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte don hire non harm &punctelev; þat were wurth a fille
Þo nomen huy pich and brumston &punctelev; and welden it wel faste
And ope hire nakede tendre bodi &punctelev; al-fuyri it casten
¶ Euere sat þis Maide stille &punctelev; it ne greuede hire no-þing
Ake euere heo prechede with glade heorte &punctelev; of Ihesu, heuene king
¶ Þo nuste þis luþere iustise &punctelev; &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;hte don more
&YOGH;wane he ne mi&yogh;hte þis clene þing &punctelev; ouer-come mid al is lore
A scharp swerd and a kene &punctelev; þoru&yogh; hire þrote he liet do
To bi-nimen hire speche &punctelev; and hire lijf also
Þo heo was þoru&yogh; þe þrote i-smite &punctelev; þe betere heo spac i-nou&yogh;
And prechede euere of Ihesu crist &punctelev; and wel smere lou&yogh;
¶ "&YOGH;e þat beoth cristine &punctelev; glade and bliþe &yogh;e beo
Of no-þing ne habbe &yogh;e drede &punctelev; for gret ioy ich i-seo
Ane Ioyeful þyþingue ich eou telle &punctelev; þat sothþ is and nou&yogh;t les
Þat ri&yogh;ht nouþe is holi churche &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t in guod pes
For hire tweie wiþerwines &punctelev; þat habbez i-beo so &yogh;are
Ri&yogh;ht nouþe beoth to nau&yogh;t i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;e þorue habbe of heom no kare
For þe luþere dioclician &punctelev; þat so muche harm hath i-do
he is i-pult out of his kynedom &punctelev; he ne cometh non-more þar-to;
And also Maximian &punctelev; þat so luþur hath i-beo
Ri&yogh;th nouþe he deide in luþur deth &punctelev; &yogh;e schulle him non-more i-seo;
So þat þe luþere wiþer-wines &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;ein holie churche were
Out of heore mi&yogh;hte beoth i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne habbe &yogh;e none fere
¶ Þus glade tyþingue ich eov bringue &punctelev; þei huy feor heonne beo
I-hered beo god, þat ich moste &punctelev; þis dai a-liue i-seo
I-chulle bi-teche ou ihesu crist &punctelev; for fram eov ich mot wende
Bringuth me ore louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; for þat schal beo mi[corr. to my] ende."
¶ Þe preostes wenden forth anon &punctelev; and folk þat þere stod
And fetten to þis holie maide &punctelev; godes fl[e]chs and is blod
Þo heo it hadde under-fongue &punctelev; and hire ri&yogh;htes al-so
And þe oresones weren alle i-seid &punctelev; þat bi-fullen þer-to
Mid þe laste [word][om.] heo &yogh;af þene gost &punctelev; ase huy amen seide
Aungles þare weren redie I-nowe &punctelev; hire soule to heuene lede
Þere heo is with ihesu crist &punctelev; in Ioye with-outen ende
Nou god for seinte lucie loue &punctelev; þudere us late i-wiende! Amen

div1.head: 27 ¶ Ici poez oyer coment seint Thomas de Kaunterbures nasqui. e de quev manere gent de pere e de Mere.

lg.l: WOlle &yogh;e nouþe i-heore þis englische tale &punctelev; þat is here i-write
Of seint Thomas of Caunterburi &punctelev; al-hou he was bi-&yogh;ite
Of londone is fader was &punctelev; A bordeys[r. borgeys] hende and fre
Gilbert Bekat was is name &punctelev; þe bok tellez me
Ake is Moder was of heþenesse. &punctelev; nov sone &yogh;e mouwen i-heore
Al-hou heo cam into engelonde &punctelev; are heo i-cristned were
Gilebert him bi-þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þe Croiz for-to fo
In-to þe holie lond &punctelev; his penaunce þe bet to do
So þat, þo he þudere cam &punctelev; he was sone i-nome
Ase A sclaue forth i-lad &punctelev; and i-don In prisone
And faste was i-gwiued &punctelev; he and manie mo
And i-wust wel sikerliche &punctelev; þat he ne scholde a-wei go
In þe Amirales prisone[orig. prisones] &punctelev; heo hadden i-beo so longue
To &yogh;eres and an half &punctelev; In bendes swiþe strongue
So þat god &yogh;af þe Amiral &punctelev; boþe heorte and wille
Þe more to louien Gilebert &punctelev; for he was meoke and stille
Eche daie &yogh;wane þe Amiral &punctelev; to is mete wolde go
he bad, Gilebert to is mete &punctelev; scholde come also
gret auantage, for-soþe, it was &punctelev; þat he mi&yogh;te so gon;
Ake euere he hadde ane peire feteres &punctelev; faste him up-on
And ofte-siþes þe Amiral &punctelev; dude for Gilebardes loue
Auantage to is felawes &punctelev; þat with him weren In prisone
hit bi-feol þat Amiral &punctelev; Ane faire dou&yogh;ter hadde
Childrene of is owene &punctelev; none mo for-soþe he nadde
priueliche heo dude for Gilebert &punctelev; Auantages manie and fele
And ofte-siþe heo wolde speke with him &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo mi&yogh;te to bi|stele
For heo ne dorste bi-fore hire fader &punctelev; laste he it onder-&yogh;ete
Þat it were for gyle &punctelev; þat heo with him speke
&YOGH;eot it bi-feol In a dai &punctelev; þat heo sai&yogh; þo heo mi&yogh;te
to Gillebert heo eode priueliche &punctelev; and echste him &yogh;wat he hi&yogh;te
And of &yogh;wat bi-leue he were &punctelev; and of &yogh;wyche londe
And &yogh;if he wolde for is louerdes loue &punctelev; þene deth a-fonge
Gilbert hire Ansuerede þo &punctelev; In swiþe fair manere
"Of engelonde ich am, and cristine Man &punctelev; þei ich beo nouþe here;
Mi name is Gilbert beket &punctelev; of Londene þe cite;
gladliche icholde þane deth a-fongue &punctelev; for is loue þat[MS. þad.] bou&yogh;te me
And for-to saui mi cristine-dom &punctelev; and mine trewe bi-leue al-so."
Þis womman to Gilbert wel sone &punctelev; þeos wordes heo seide to
"Cristine-dom ichulle onder-fonge &punctelev; for þe loue of þe
And þou a-non aftur-ward &punctelev; treweliche weddi me."
Gilbert was ful sore a-drad &punctelev; of þis wommane sawe
Laste heo wolde bi-Meldi him &punctelev; &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; he were a-slawe
To &yogh;eres and an half he was sclaue &punctelev; and þat him þou&yogh;te longe
So þat he and is felawes &punctelev; gonne heom onder-stonde
Þat heo wolden þet prison breke &punctelev; and A-weiward gon;
Sore heo weren alle a-ferd &punctelev; for traison of þat womman
Þat prison heo breken &punctelev; ri&yogh;t þulke daie at eue;
Forth heo wenden alle a-wei &punctelev; þare nolde non bi-leue
In þe morewe-tide heo weren i-sou&yogh;t &punctelev; bote þer nas non i-founde
Ak þo bi-þou&yogh;te þat Maiden hire &punctelev; In wel luyte stounde
hov heo mi&yogh;te best on take &punctelev; and &yogh;wat heo mi&yogh;te do;
So þat heo porueide hire &punctelev; and fort a-wei gan go
Al-bi ny&yogh;te heo wende a-wei &punctelev; men nusten &yogh;ware heo bi-cam
Ne heo ne couþe nanne wei &punctelev; bote god was hire lodes-man
Þoru&yogh; godes grace heo was i-lad &punctelev; with men þat onder-stoden hire langage
So þat heo cam to þe se &punctelev; and redi fond hire passage
Þane wei heo Axede In hire langage &punctelev; In-to engelonde;
So þat heo cam with pilegrimes &punctelev; ase ich me onder-stonde
Ouer þe se sauf and wel &punctelev; þoru&yogh; grace þat heo hadde
Of Iesu crist, and socur of men &punctelev; þat hire ouer ladden
heo ne couþe no-þing conteini hire &punctelev; ne speken no-þe-mo;
Ake euere heo axede In hire langage &punctelev; to londone for-to go
Mid pilegrimes and þoru grace of god &punctelev; to londone heo cam
And þo heo was þudere i-come &punctelev; þare ne knev heo no man
Ne heo ne couþe speke ne hire bi-seo &punctelev; bote ase a best þat a-strayed were
Þare-fore on hire gapede alday &punctelev; swyþe muche fol[c] þere
boþe Men and wommen &punctelev; and children suyþe fale
for hire continaunce was wonderful &punctelev; and hire speche no Man ne couþe þare
In Manie stretes heo hadde i-wandret— &punctelev; þat Man may wel i-wite
So þat bi-fore gilbertes house &punctelev; þe Noyse was onder-&yogh;ite
For þe knaue þat hadde with him &punctelev; In heþenesse i-beo
to þe dore he orn swyþe &punctelev; þe dune for-to i-seo
he i-sai&yogh; þat it was þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter &punctelev; þat al þe wondringue was on
hasteliche he tornede In a-&yogh;en &punctelev; to is louerd a-non
And seide, þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter was &punctelev; In þe strete þare-oute
And suyþe gret prece of gurles and Men &punctelev; comen hire al-a-boute;
he seide, "al þe gredinge is for hire &punctelev; þat &yogh;e doth nouþe i-heore."
"Louerd," seide gilbert, "&yogh;weþur heo beo &punctelev; al-one with-outen fere?"
he het is knaue loki sothþeliche &punctelev; &yogh;if þat heo it were;
And bad hire leden to ane guode wyues house &punctelev; and a-stunte with hire þere
And þat heo hire scholde finde i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; of al þat heo hadde neode
ri&yogh;t ase heo wolde is owene bodi &punctelev; and he hire þar-of bede
Al-so tyme ase þis knaue &punctelev; to þis Mayde cam
For Ioye heo ful a-doun i-swowe &punctelev; opon þe harde ston
Þo hire stat was a-&yogh;ein i-come &punctelev; þe knaue hire op nam
And heo wel gladliche with him eode &punctelev; to þulke guode womman
And heo hire onder-feng swiþe faire &punctelev; for gilberdes loue;
heo makede hire wel an-Ayse &punctelev; and was hire swyþe wel-come
Gilbert him bi-þou&yogh;te &punctelev; a-non so he hadde i-ete
To þe bischop for-to gon &punctelev; with him forto speke
Þare he was at seint poules &punctelev; of him to habbe red a-non
Al-&yogh;wat him were of þat Maide &punctelev; is beste forto don
Þane bischop of londone &punctelev; for-soþe he fond þere
And fyue oþur bischopes &punctelev; with him þare were;
So þat he fond þare six bischopes &punctelev; þe beste of Engelonde
And þo Gilbert i-sai&yogh; heom alle &punctelev; bi-fore heom he eode stonde;
he bi-gan to telle is tale &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is owene Mouth
And are he hadde al i-told &punctelev; heo was swyþe selcouth
he tolde hou he In þe Amirales prisone &punctelev; in heþenesse hadde i-be
And hov þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter to him seide &punctelev; þat was so fair and fre
Al-hov þat heo wolde cristine bi-come &punctelev; for enchaison of him
&YOGH;if he wolde weddi hire &punctelev; and for-saken al hire kun;
And hou he and is felawes &punctelev; bi-twene hem alle bi-speke
For drede of hire wordes &punctelev; þat prison for-to breke
&YOGH;If þat heo mi&yogh;ten grace habbe &punctelev; a-wei for-to gon
laste heo weren alle for hire &punctelev; to stronge deþe i-don;
And al-hou heo was to londone i-come &punctelev; and fram so fer i-gon
gret wonder þar-of he hadde &punctelev; for language ne couþe heo non
Þo þis bischopes hadden i-heord &punctelev; þat gilbert heom hadde i-told
Þe bischop of wynchestre it wel onder-stod &punctelev; for he was wis and bold
Þat hit was al þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; þat heo was so fer i-come
Out of hire owene londe so fer &punctelev; þat heo þoru miseise ne hadde i-be nome;[MS. nonome.]
For heo ne couþe language non &punctelev; with men for-to speke
With &yogh;wan heo mi&yogh;te i-winnen hire &punctelev; herboruwe and drinke and mete
he seide, "with-oute faille &punctelev; &yogh;if god hathþ i-porueid so
þat heo for gilberdes loue &punctelev; cristinedom wole onder-fo
And gilberd hire wolde weddi &punctelev; sum blede of hire schal come
Þat schal holie churche holde to ri&yogh;te &punctelev; and serui godes sone
For we it mowen wel i-wite &punctelev; and we wollen us onder-stonde
Þat heo is in-to þis londe i-come &punctelev; it is godes sonde
for þat þing þat god helpe wole &punctelev; ne schal nou&yogh;t beo for-fare."
Alle þeos oþure bischopes &punctelev; a-cordeden to þis tale
And seiden þat gilberd scholde weddi hire &punctelev; and holden hire to wiue
&YOGH;if heo wolde i-cristned be &punctelev; and tuyrne to clene liue
So þat a-non-ri&yogh;t þene moruwe &punctelev; i-porueid it was al-&yogh;are
At seint poules churche, þat heo scholde &punctelev; Icristned beo ri&yogh;t þare
Þo þe baptisterie was al-redi &punctelev; to hire baptizingue
Þe bischopes beden þat Men scholden &punctelev; þe womman bi-fore heom bringe
Þo heo cam bi-fore þe bischopes &punctelev; heo axeden hire wel sone
&YOGH;if heo wolde i-cristned beo &punctelev; ase lawe was for-to done
heo answerede In hire langage &punctelev; wel sone heom a-&yogh;en
&YOGH;if gilbert wolde hire weddi &punctelev; i-cristned heo wolde ben
And bote he hire weddi wolde &punctelev; heo nolde cristinedom a-fongue
heo seide heo wolde raþer tuyrne a&yogh;en &punctelev; In-to hire owene londe
Gilberd couþe hire language. &punctelev; þare he stod wel stille
to þe bischopus he seide &punctelev; he wolde don heore wille
So þat heo i-cristned was &punctelev; ase god hire &yogh;af þe grace
Of alle þe six bischopes &punctelev; and i-spouse in þe place
hire heþene name ne j nou&yogh;t telle &punctelev; for-soþe &yogh;wat heo hiet
Þe name þat heo of cristindom hadde &punctelev; i-wute &yogh;e schullen &yogh;et
heo was i-nemd Alisaundre &punctelev; as ich me onder-stonde;
Seint Thomas was on hire bi-&yogh;ite &punctelev; pris-martyr of engelonde
Þo Gilbert[orig. Gilberd] hire hadde i-weddet &punctelev; wel glad of him heo was
Þe furste Nij&yogh;t þat he knovlei&yogh;te hire &punctelev; he bi-&yogh;at seint thomas
Fram þe tyme þat he was bi-&yogh;ite &punctelev; for-to þat he was i-bore
he ne lai non more bi hire &punctelev; þane he dude bi-fore
Anon-ri&yogh;tes a-morewe &punctelev; so gret wille him nam
to þe holi londe for-to gon &punctelev; þat he cam erore fram
Þat him þoute dei&yogh;e he scholde &punctelev; bote he wende a-&yogh;enward sone
Ake he bi-þou&yogh;te him of is wiues stat &punctelev; &yogh;wat were of hire to done
laste heo wolde mourny swyþe &punctelev; &yogh;wane he were a-gon
And gret deol to hire nime— &punctelev; for langage ne couþe heo non
Þat ani Man couþe onder-stonde &punctelev; þat heo speke to
bote gilbert oþur [his] knaue. &punctelev; þare-fore him [was] ful wo
So þat gilbert was in grete þou&yogh;te &punctelev; and bi-gan to sike sore
laste is wif gret harm habbe scholde &punctelev; &yogh;wane he i-wend weore
Þare-fore gilbert mournede muche &punctelev; and si&yogh;te stille and softe
laste is wif fur-fare scholde &punctelev; he bi-þou&yogh;te him ofte
for þe mourningue þat he makede &punctelev; is wif it onder-stod
And for he si&yogh;te i-lomeliche &punctelev; þat i-chaunged was is mod
his wif him axede swiþe &yogh;eorne &punctelev; and a-raysonede him wel tou&yogh;te
&YOGH;if him mis-likede ani-þing &punctelev; þat grefde him in þou&yogh;te
So streitliche heo fraynede him &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng for-sake
he tolde hire hov gret wille he hadde &punctelev; þene wei a-&yogh;ein to take
For-to trauaili is bodi more &punctelev; ase euerech man wel ou&yogh;te
Al for-to honouri Iesu crist &punctelev; þat him so deore a-bou&yogh;te
Þo heo sai&yogh; gilbertus wille &punctelev; þat it was so guod
heo nolde no-þing a-&yogh;en him beo &punctelev; for-to chaungi is mod
Ake heo &yogh;af him conseil þane wei to gon &punctelev; þat he hadde In þou&yogh;te
And forto queme Iesu crist &punctelev; þat him deore bou&yogh;te
Þare was i-sene þat heo was treowe &punctelev; and of studefast mod
heo nolde letten hire louerd nou&yogh;t to done &punctelev; þat him þou&yogh;te god
Ake euere heo bad him þane wei gon &punctelev; þat he hadde In þou&yogh;t
For-to serui is creatour— &punctelev; þare-a-&yogh;ein heo nolde beo nou&yogh;t
And &yogh;eorne he[= heo] bad for enchaison of hire &punctelev; he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bi-leue
Saue[MS. sone] heo bi-sou&yogh;te gilbert &punctelev; þat he one bone hire &yogh;eue
Þat heo moste is knaue with hire habbe &punctelev; þat hire langage couþe
And for he scholde hire solas beo &punctelev; and speke to hire with mouþe
heo truste so muche to Iesu crist &punctelev; þat to cristinedom ire hadde i-brou&yogh;t
Þat heo ne scholde nou&yogh;t fur-fare— &punctelev; so treowe was hire þou&yogh;t
Gilebard lefde is knaue wit hire &punctelev; his name was Richard Mone
he greiþede him wel haste-liche &punctelev; and wende is wei wel sone
To þe holie londe he wende &punctelev; In penaunce ase he dude er
And þare he bi-lefde þo &punctelev; fulle furthþe-half &yogh;er
Þo he hadde þre &yogh;er þare i-be &punctelev; and an half &yogh;er more
Into is owene londe &punctelev; a-longued he was sore
&YOGH;if þat he was þare ou&yogh;t i-knowe &punctelev; I-ne can ou tellen non ende;
bote, ase þe bok us tellez &punctelev; hamward he gan þo wende
And þo he to londene[MS. londene] cam &punctelev; Ichot wel, þare he founde
his wif and thomas, is &yogh;onge sone &punctelev; boþe hole and sounde
Welle, muche was þe Ioie &punctelev; þat he makede with is sone
And also he dude with is wif &punctelev; þo he was hom I-come;
And is wif gret Ioie made &punctelev; with hire housebonde
For he was hire swiþe wel-come &punctelev; In-to engelonde
Þat child heo setten to lore &punctelev; are it were seue &yogh;er eld;
Ich wot, it leornede swiþe wel &punctelev; and wax swiþe quointe and beld
Þo þat he was wel i-woxe &punctelev; of bodi and of clergise
Þat þe bischop of londone &punctelev; wilnede is seruise
he nolde serui þe bischope nout &punctelev; ake he bi-lefde at-hom
And preide is fader wel &yogh;erne &punctelev; þat he moste to schole gon
Of is fader and of is moder &punctelev; &yogh;e habbez i-heord telle
Acke of seint thomas him-selue &punctelev; þat beste cometh nou to spelle

div1.p: ¶ Hic Isci Comence la vie seint Thomas Erceeueske de Kaunterbury.

lg.l: ENgelond, wel glad þov beo &punctelev; for þou mi&yogh;t wel eþe
And al-so holi churche &punctelev; for one Mannes deþe
Þe erchebischop seint Thomas &punctelev; þat[al. þat ou] wel deore bou&yogh;te
With is blod and with is brayn &punctelev; þat þe scharpe swerd sou&yogh;te
Seint Thomas, þis holi Man &punctelev; to Alle guodnesse he drov&yogh;
At londone he was i-bore &punctelev; of guode Men i-nou&yogh;
For of londone is fader was &punctelev; a wel guod emne Man
Þis child was &yogh;ong to schole i-set &punctelev; And swiþe wel he bi-gan
His Moder him wolde al day rede &punctelev; and wel ofte on him crie
Chaste lijf and clene for-to lede &punctelev; and for-sake lecherie
And louien bi-fore al oþur þing &punctelev; god and seinte Marie
And serui hem and holi churche &punctelev; and bi-leuen alle folie
Þis child, þei it were &yogh;ong &punctelev; swiþe wel þis under-stod
For seli child is sone i-lered &punctelev; þare he þenchez to beon guod
Þo þis child was bet in elde &punctelev; and of to and twenti &yogh;er
his moder wende out of þis liue &punctelev; þat so muchel him louede her
Þis child wolde lengore gon to scole &punctelev; ake is fader him nolde finde
For þat child þat is modur for-leost &punctelev; is help is muche bi-hinde
Þis child þoru&yogh; is fader heste &punctelev; ase man þat oþur red not
Seruede A borgeys of þe toun &punctelev; and his a-countes wrot
So longe þat he cam to court &punctelev; and was in guod offiz
With þe erchebischop of Kaunterburi &punctelev; sire tebaud, guod and wis
He seruede him so hendeliche &punctelev; þat In a luytel stounde
he makede him his conseiller &punctelev; so studefast he him founde;
his ercedekne he makede him sethþe &punctelev; and dude al bi is rede
Swyþe wel bi-gan þis Ercedekne &punctelev; holi churche bi-lede
And stifliche heold op hire ri&yogh;te— &punctelev; þat alle Men i-seie
An þar-of nolde he þolien no wrong &punctelev; þei he scholde þare-fore deie
Wel ofte he wende to rome &punctelev; for holi churche al-so
Swuche prelatus al-to fewe &punctelev; beoth nouþe In office i-do
¶ So þat henri king of Engelonde &punctelev; after sire steuene þe blays
Duyk of Normandie— &punctelev; y-maked was al In pays
Þis king henri þe &yogh;ongue &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
louede muche wel to do &punctelev; and guode Men to him nam
And fondede to habben guod conseil &punctelev; and wis bi al is mi&yogh;te
For-to holden riche and pouere &punctelev; euerech man to ri&yogh;te
Of þe Ercedekne Thomas &punctelev; Men tolden him sone i-nou&yogh;
hov he was stable Man and wis &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;
Þoru&yogh; þe Erchebischopes graunt &punctelev; he makede him chaunceler
For euere Man mot him a-bouwie &punctelev; þat hauez mest pouwer
Þo þis holi Man was i-torned &punctelev; fram þe office of holi churche
To a gret office of þe world &punctelev; þare-after he moste wurche
Al-to nobleie of þe worlde &punctelev; his continaunce he brou&yogh;te
Of swuche porture neuere Man i-holde nas— &punctelev; þei oþur were is þou&yogh;te
With more nobleie he rod i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þane he was i-wonet to do
his loreins weren al of seluer &punctelev; stirapes and spores al-so;
pley he siwede of hauekus &punctelev; and of houndes I-nou&yogh;;
And ase men þou&yogh;ten, In euereche point &punctelev; to alle pruyte he drou&yogh;
bote In is heorte it was an-oþur &punctelev; hov-so he him bere;
And euere he was chaste þoru&yogh; alle þing &punctelev; hov-so it euere were
Ake euere he was for holi churche &punctelev; and for pouere Men al-so
A-&yogh;en þe proute courteoures &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;en heom wolden ou&yogh;t do.[Both verses were orig. transposed in the MS.]
¶ To holden op holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; so muche wo he gan drie
A-&yogh;en þe luþere courteours &punctelev; þat a-nuyden him of is liue
Also he tolde þe Erchebischope &punctelev; wepinde swiþe sore
And oþere ofte In priueite &punctelev; þat loueden him þe more
he wilnede mest of alle þinge &punctelev; and on ore louerd he gan crie
Þat he moste with honour &punctelev; bi-leue þulke baillie
And ech oþur seruise of court &punctelev; with þe kingus gode wille
For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t is court paie &punctelev; bote he wolde is soulle spille
Ake þe king him fond so stable &punctelev; and so guod conseiller
Þat he nolde make for no-þing &punctelev; non oþur chaunceler;
he ne truste to no man so muche &punctelev; ne þare nas non so hei&yogh;
Þat he tolde is priueite so muche &punctelev; ne þat him were so nei&yogh;
So muche he caste is heorte on him &punctelev; þat In his warde he let do
his eldeste sone sire henri— &punctelev; he was is .Eyr. al-so
Þat he were is wardein &punctelev; and al is ordeinour
Aftur is wille to wissi him &punctelev; to þe kingus honur
Þe king wende In-to Normandie &punctelev; for-to soiorni þere
And lefde is sone with seint Thomas &punctelev; þat he is wardein were
¶ boþe þe fader and þe sone &punctelev; mest heore heorte heo caste
Ope seint thomas þe holi Man &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile it wolde i-laste;
Þare nas Man In engelond &punctelev; þat hadde so gret power
Of þe reaume ase seint thomas &punctelev; boþe fer and ner
Hit bi-fel þat sire Tebaut &punctelev; ase god þe grace sende
Þe Erchebischop of Kaunterburi &punctelev; out of þis liue wende
Þat word was sone wide couth &punctelev; a-mong þeuwe and freo
Þat seint Thomas after him &punctelev; scholde Erchebischop beo
Þe king al-so In Noremandie &punctelev; þo men tolden him þat cas
A-non bar is heorte him mest &punctelev; to don þare seint thomas;
Þat couent of Caunterburi &punctelev; desirede him also
So ase ech Man it wolde &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t he[al. it] was þar-to
At West-munstre he was i-chose &punctelev; to þat heie pouwer
Þe fifte &yogh;er þat he was i-mad &punctelev; þe kingus Chaunceler;
he was of elde þulke tyme &punctelev; of foure and fourti &yogh;er
his owene deth he onder-feng &punctelev; and is Martyr-dom þer
For þe king was In Normandie &punctelev; Ipresented he was
to henri, is sone, In Engelonde &punctelev; þo non oþur kyng þere nas
Ake þei it were a-&yogh;en is wille &punctelev; he nolde it nou&yogh;t for-sake
¶ Þo[MS. þo he Axede In &yogh;wuche Manere &punctelev; þo Axede he in &yogh;wuche m.] Axede he in &yogh;wuche manere &punctelev; þe croiz he scholde take
Men seiden him þat he scholde a-fongue &punctelev; holi churche so freo
Þat he[MS. heo] ne scholde onder noman &punctelev; bote onder þe pope beo
Ne no-þing þenche bote holden op wel &punctelev; holi churche lawe
"In þis manere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "ich hire a-fongue fawe."
Þis was ri&yogh;t at wit-sonentid &punctelev; þat þis dede cam to ende
Þis guode Man to Caunterburi &punctelev; a-non bi-gan to wende
Al þe contreie, to don him honour &punctelev; a-&yogh;en him cam and drov;
Þare was for him In Caunterburi &punctelev; Ioie and blisse I-nov
Þat dai of þe Trinite &punctelev; bischop i-sacret he was
And onder-feng þis dignete &punctelev; þe guode Man seint thomas
Sire henri, þe kingus sone &punctelev; was at his sacringue
And sixtene bischopus al-so &punctelev; þis dede to ende bringue
Þo þis dede was i-don &punctelev; heo gonne sende sone
Aftur is palliun to rome &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t was for-to done
Alisaundre, þat was pope þo &punctelev; he was at Mount-pellers
Þudere wenden þis wise men &punctelev; þat weren is Messagers
¶ Þe Abbod Adam of Euesham &punctelev; heore cheuenteyn huy nome
to þe pope Alisaundre &punctelev; to Mount-pellers heo come
heore erinde heo hadden sone of him &punctelev; for [he] hem no-þing ne wernde
And heo nomen heore leue of him &punctelev; and hamward a-&yogh;ein heo turnden
And þis pallion wel sone was &punctelev; to seint thomas i-brou&yogh;t
Þis holi Man it a-fonge &punctelev; with wel milde þou&yogh;t
¶ Þo he was in is dignete &punctelev; al clanliche i-do
he chaungede euerech-del is lif &punctelev; and is maneres al-so
Þe here he dude on next is liche &punctelev; is flesches maister to beo
Schuyrte and brech streit i-nov &punctelev; a-non doun to is kneo
For him þou&yogh;te þat he wel mi&yogh;te &punctelev; of oþure habbe þe maistrie
&YOGH;if he hadde of is owene flesche &punctelev; al-ovt þe seignorie;
&YOGH;if is soule Maister were &punctelev; and is flesch is hyne
him þou&yogh;te he mi&yogh;te is dignete &punctelev; bringue to guode fine
Sethþe on-ouewarde þe here &punctelev; þe Abite of Monek he nam
And a-boue al þan clerkene Robe &punctelev; ase to is stat bi-cam;
So þat he was clerk with-oute &punctelev; and with-Inne Monek al-so
Þoru&yogh; þe Abite þat he hadde on him &punctelev; priueliche i-do
In penaunce and In fastingue &punctelev; he was ni&yogh;t and dai
And In is oresones, bote som &yogh;wile &punctelev; þat he slepe lai;
And &yogh;wane he scholde eten is mete &punctelev; for þat he moste nede
Euere he preide ore swete louerd &punctelev; þat he moste wel spede;
And euere &yogh;wane he Masse song &punctelev; he wep and si&yogh;te sore;
he hastede euere þare-with faste &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te no man more
¶ Swiþe faire he fedde him at is bord &punctelev; with grete nobleie and pruyte
And of þe beste him-sulf he et &punctelev; ake ofte bote luyte
Of is ordres he was ful streit &punctelev; and he was in grete fere
For-to ordeinen ani Man &punctelev; bote he þe betere were
Idul nolde he neuere beo &punctelev; ake euere doinde he was;
In eche manere of betere liue &punctelev; neuere no bischop nas
Sire henri, þe kingus sone &punctelev; þat with him was er i-brou&yogh;t
bi-lefde euere In is warde &punctelev; fram him nolde he nou&yogh;t
Þe loue þat was hem bi-twene &punctelev; nas neuere more i-seie
Ne of no Man þis child nadde &punctelev; neuere more loue ei&yogh;e.[al. ne ei&yogh;e]
[Reditus regis.]HIt bi-fel þat þe king &punctelev; ovt of Noremandie cam
In-to Enguelonde, þe stat to loke &punctelev; and al-so is kynedom
Seint Thomas nam with him &punctelev; sire hanri, is sone
And wel faire with honour &punctelev; wende to south-hamptone
Þare was Ioie and blisse i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þo heo to-gadere come;
heo custen and heo clupten faste &punctelev; and hereden god i-lome
Þe king bi-lefde In Engelonde &punctelev; to wardi is kynedom
Seint thomas to is priueitez &punctelev; euere-more he nam
And heold him euere ase he dude er &punctelev; is hexte conseiller;
bi is wille he nolde habbe i-haued &punctelev; non oþur chaunceler
Euere &yogh;wane he ani-þing dude &punctelev; þat were a-&yogh;en þe ri&yogh;te
Seint thomas it with-seide &punctelev; euere with al is mi&yogh;te.
Hit bi-fel þat þe bischop of wirecestre &punctelev; sone þere-after ded was
And þe bischop of hereforde al-so &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
Þe bischopriches fullen boþe &punctelev; In-to þe kingus hond
For-to onder-fonge al þe prov þare-of &punctelev; ase lawe was in þe lond
¶ Þe king heom nolde nou&yogh;t &yogh;iue sone &punctelev; bote heold heom swiþe longe
In his hond, þat he mi&yogh;te þar-of &punctelev; þe more prov a-fonge
Hit ne likede nou&yogh;t seint Thomas &punctelev; þat holi churche so
Scholde for a luytel coueitise &punctelev; In þe kingus warde beon i-do;
he þou&yogh;te þat it was swiþe muche &punctelev; a-&yogh;en ore louerdes wille
And þat þe king mi&yogh;te In swuche manere &punctelev; holi churche a-spille
he bad þe kinge In faire manere &punctelev; þat he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bi-leue
Þat þulke tweie bischoperiches &punctelev; some guode Men he &yogh;eue
Þe king him grauntede mildeliche &punctelev; and nas nou&yogh;t a-&yogh;en is bone
Ake Þeos bischopriches boþe he &yogh;af &punctelev; twei guode Men wel sone
¶ Seint thomas þou&yogh;te wel &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paie
þe kingue ne his conseil &punctelev; bote he wolde holi churche bi-traie;
In gret care and in soruwe he was &punctelev; hov he mi&yogh;te best do
For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paien Ihesu crist &punctelev; and þene kingue also
Seint Thomas halewede þat ilke &yogh;er &punctelev; þe churche of Redinge
Þat i-founded was and a-rerd &punctelev; þoru&yogh; henri þe oþur kingue
Þat &yogh;eot lith þare wel faire i-bured— &punctelev; willames sone bastard
In þulke &yogh;ere seint thomas &punctelev; schrinede seint edward
At westmunstre, þare he lijth &punctelev; þat bi-fore king willame was;
bote king harald heom was bi-tueone &punctelev; for-to is power no leng nas
Þe loue was euere gret i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; bi-tweone seint thomas
And þe kinge, for-to þe feond &punctelev; destourbede hit, allas
luyte an luyte þat contek sprong &punctelev; for pouere Mannes ri&yogh;te
paie ore louerd and þe kinge &punctelev; þis holi man ne mi&yogh;te
Þe furste tyme þat seint thomas &punctelev; ovtliche him with-seide
hit was for þe king a-&yogh;en pouere Men &punctelev; dude onri&yogh;tful dede
¶ Þe king nam fro &yogh;er to &yogh;ere &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Engelond wel wide
After is wille ane summe of panes &punctelev; i-deld bi-eche side
And sethþe þoru an-queste &punctelev; he let þoru&yogh; þe contreies an-quere
hov muche ech Man scholde pai&yogh;e &punctelev; and hov muche is ri&yogh;te were
So longue he nam taillage &punctelev; þat he axede atþe laste
Eche &yogh;ere ane certeyne rente &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al engelond wel faste
&YOGH;wat for ei&yogh;e, &yogh;wat for loue &punctelev; no man him ne with-seide;
bote euere þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; þat hit was an onri&yogh;tful dede
he þou&yogh;te al on god and on is soule &punctelev; and bi-lefde al his manhede
And wende forth wel baldeliche &punctelev; to þe king with-outen drede
"Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if it is þi wille &punctelev; þou art riche and hende
And king of gret pouwer i-nov— &punctelev; ore louerd þe more sende
A taillage þov taxt fram &yogh;er to &yogh;er &punctelev; þoru&yogh;-out al þi londe
And axest it for a certeine rente &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te, ich onder-stonde;
For ri&yogh;te rente þov dest it take &punctelev; at a certein daie in þe &yogh;ere
A certeyn summe a-signed &punctelev; And so ne dude no king ere
&YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; þat þat certein rente, me þinchez &punctelev; þov ne mi&yogh;t it nou&yogh;t make
A taillage it is, and sumdel &punctelev; with vnri&yogh;te i-take."
¶ "Thomas, thomas," quad þe king &punctelev; "þou art mi chaunceler
Þou au&yogh;test more to holden op &punctelev; þane to with-seggen mi power."
¶ "Sire," quath þis holi Man &punctelev; "ich habbe i-beo with þe
And þou hast, ore louerd fur-&yogh;elde þe &punctelev; gret guod i-don me
An oþur baillie ich habbe a-fongue &punctelev; þei it were a-&yogh;en mi wille
And I ne mai nou&yogh;t loki boþe wel &punctelev; bote ich scholde min owene a-spille;
For ich am to luyte wuyrth &punctelev; þat on for-to loke
Þanne dude he gret folie &punctelev; þat boþe me bi-toke
Þare-fore ich þe &yogh;elde up here &punctelev; al-out þe chauncelerie
And take me al to holi churche &punctelev; to god and to seinte Marie."
Þo was þe king wel of I-nou&yogh; &punctelev; wroþere þane he was er;
Ake naþeles is heorte bar &punctelev; euere to Thomas þer
Þat þridde þing &yogh;eot mest of alle &punctelev; and sonest in wrathþe hem brou&yogh;te
A preost, þat[al. þer] was a luþer Man &punctelev; þat luyte of god rou&yogh;te;
Þat of Manslau&yogh;t was bi-cleoped &punctelev; and þare-fore i-nome also
And In þe bischopes prisone of Salesburi &punctelev; þare-fore he was i-do
Þe Mannes frend þat was a-slawe &punctelev; siweden ope him so faste
So þat þe preost to Iuggement &punctelev; Ibrou&yogh;t was atþe laste
Men acuseden him faste of þe dede. &punctelev; he ne answerede nou&yogh;t þer-to
Acke heold him faste to holi churche &punctelev; and ope none oþere he nolde him do
¶ I-loked him was to puyrgi him &punctelev; þoru&yogh; clergie, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te
And dai him was þar-to i-set &punctelev; þoru&yogh; holi churche ri&yogh;te
Þo þe dai was i-come &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te him puyrgi nou&yogh;t
he was sone i-lad a-&yogh;en &punctelev; and into prisone i-brou&yogh;t
Þo was þe bischop in grete care &punctelev; &yogh;wat þer-of were to done;
For-to habbe þe wisore red &punctelev; to seint thomas he sende sone
And he him sente word a-&yogh;en &punctelev; þat he scholde þene preost take
And on-ordeini him of euerech ordre &punctelev; and ase a lewede Man him make
And sethþe don him in strongue warde &punctelev; þat he neuer-eft þar-of ne wende
In penaunce and in pine i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; his sunnes for-to a-mende
Þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; dude seint thomas heste;
So þat þe preost was i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; In tormenz bi þe meste
Þe tiþinge her-of sone &punctelev; to þe kinge cam
Þat a luþer þef, a manquellare &punctelev; hadde a so li&yogh;t dom
him þou&yogh;te þat it nas nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t &punctelev; ne þat it ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t beo so
And phelipe de boys, a Chanoyne &punctelev; him hadde al-so mis-do
Þare-fore was ech oþur clerk &punctelev; þe more him a-&yogh;en wille;
him þou&yogh;te þat swuch lawe scholde &punctelev; þe pais of þe londe a-spille
To westmunstre he let somony &punctelev; alle þe bischopes of engelonde
And oþure, þe gretteste clerkes al-so &punctelev; and þe hexte, ich onder-stonde
[Ait Rex.]¶ "Beav seignours," þe king seide &punctelev; "I not &yogh;wat &yogh;e habbeth i-þou&yogh;t;
&YOGH;if &yogh;e goth forth with ower wille &punctelev; ore pais ne worth ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if a clerk hath ane Man a-slawe &punctelev; oþur strong þeffþe i-do
And he mouwe þanne desordeined beo &punctelev; and to liue comen so
heo wollez þanne mis-don al day &punctelev; and beon þare-oppe wel bolde
And so schal þe pays of þe londe &punctelev; wel vuele beon i-holde
Luyte heom wolde rechche &punctelev; to leosen heore ordre so
&YOGH;wane heo for heore ordre ne spariez nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þefþe for-to do
And euere þe herre heore ordre is &punctelev; me þinchez bi puyr lawe
þe strengore scholde heore dom beo &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo wolden to þefþe drawe."
[Ait Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quad seint Thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;if it is þi wille
Lothz vs were any-þing to don &punctelev; þi pays for-to a-spille
Þe clerkus þat beoth I-ordeynede &punctelev; þov wost wel heo berez a signe
Þat heo beoth lymes of holi churche &punctelev; þat so noble is and digne;
&YOGH;if heo weren with þulke signe &punctelev; to vile deþe i-do
A-viled were al-holi churche &punctelev; and foule i-schend al-so
And &yogh;if heo beoth formest onordeined &punctelev; and for þulke sulue dede
Sethþe þoru&yogh; dom to deþe i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; it nere nou&yogh;t wel to rede
For it nas neuere lawe ne ri&yogh;t &punctelev; double dom to take
For o trespas, ase &yogh;e wel wuteth &punctelev; and sunne it were to make;
And vnwuyrþere þane a lewed Man &punctelev; holi churche were so
A lewed Man for o trespas &punctelev; bote o Iuggement nis i-do
Þare-fore þine grace we biddeth þe &punctelev; &yogh;if it is þi wille
Þat þov ne a-rere none newe lawe &punctelev; holi churche to spille
For we biddez ni&yogh;t ant day &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is for-to do
Þat god holde þe þine ri&yogh;te &punctelev; and þine reavme al-so."
[Rex.]¶ "beav sire," quath þe king þo &punctelev; "þov seist wel i-nov&yogh;
Ich hadde lothz bi mi concience &punctelev; don holi churche wov&yogh;;
For lawes þere beoth and costomes &punctelev; þat habbethz euere beon i-holde
Of bischopus þoru&yogh; al Engelond &punctelev; ase ovre Aunceteres us tolde
And bi þe kingus daye henries &punctelev; þat ovre graunt-sire was
I-confermede weren and i-holde &punctelev; And no man þare-a&yogh;en nas
Woltþu þulke lawes holde? &punctelev; do me to witene sone!"
"We schullen do," seint Thomas seide &punctelev; "al þat is to done—[Thomas.]
Alle þe lawes and þe costomes &punctelev; we schullen holde bi ore mi&yogh;te
Þat beothz to holde and habbeth i-beo &punctelev; sire,—sauue oure ri&yogh;te."
[Rex.]"Sauue ouwer ri&yogh;te?" quath þe king &punctelev; "bev sire, &yogh;wi seistþou so
bi þulke worde Ine scholde no-þing &punctelev; a&yogh;en þine wille do
Þat þov noldest segge þat it were &punctelev; a-&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te
And so þou mi&yogh;test bringe al þat lond &punctelev; In contek and In fi&yogh;te
&YOGH;e moten holde þe lawes &punctelev; for-soþe ich onder-stonde
Þat word me þinchez venimous &punctelev; to þe pays of þe londe."
[Thomas.]"Sire," quath þis holi man &punctelev; "ne meue &yogh;e ov ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
Wel þov wost þat ech of us &punctelev; are we weren here-to i-brou&yogh;t
Trewenesse we þe sworen ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; and eorþelich honour al-so
Sauue ore ordre and ore ri&yogh;te— &punctelev; bote þat was out i-do
hou scholde we, sire, nouþe oþur do? &punctelev; &yogh;e ne Au&yogh;ten it us nou&yogh;t beode
For godes loue hold us to ri&yogh;te &punctelev; for nouþe we habbez neode."
[Rex.]¶ "Ich i-seo nouþe, thomas," quath þe king &punctelev; "&yogh;ware-to þou wult drawe;
Þov art I-come to late &punctelev; to bi-nimen us ovre lawe
