Þov woldest makien me more wrechche &punctelev; þane euere ani kyng was
Þare-to þov art i-come to late &punctelev; þou cast aumbes as."
þe king [aros] in wrathþe a-non &punctelev; and let heom sitte ech-one;
In-to is chaumbre he wende &punctelev; and ne grette heom neuer one
Fram londone he wende sone &punctelev; In wrathþe ase þei it were
he ne seide no man of is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; ake bi-lefde heom alle þere
Þe bischopus þou&yogh;ten þo ech-one &punctelev; þat he was wroth i-nou&yogh;
Þare weren fewe bote seint thomas &punctelev; þat toward him ne drou&yogh;
¶ On seint Thomas heo criden faste &punctelev; is þou&yogh;t forte wende
Oþuer he wolde al þat lond &punctelev; for þulke one worde schende
kni&yogh;tes and oþure ofte comen &punctelev; þat with þe kinge were
And beden seint Thomas ententifliche &punctelev; þat he þat word for-bere
And þat it were him gret folie &punctelev; þe kinge In wrathþe bringe
And also destourbi al þat lond &punctelev; for so luytel þingue
Seint thomas stod longe in þou&yogh;te. &punctelev; "leoue breþren," he seide
"A-&yogh;en þe kyngus honur I-ne schal &punctelev; neuere don no dede
Ake euerech word ichulle bi-leue &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;en is honur is."
Þo weren þis oþure glade i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þo heo i-heorden þis
And radden him wende to þe kinge &punctelev; is wrathþe for-to stille
"Lef me were," quath seint Thomas &punctelev; "with ri&yogh;te to don is wille."
He wende to þe kinge to Oxenford &punctelev; and with him þare he fond
grete Eorles and barones also &punctelev; þe hexte of al þe lond
Þe king welcomede seint Thomas &punctelev; ake he ne made him nou&yogh;t fair chere;
bischopes and Eorles he let cleopien &punctelev; alle þat þere were
[Rex.]¶ "Bev sire," he seide, "ich am king &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te of þis londe;
Customes here weren bi-fore &punctelev; I-vsed, ich onder-stonde
And so muche wrechche nam ich nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat ich nelle þe lawes holde
Þat ovre Auncestres heolden &yogh;wyle &punctelev; ase ore conseil us tolde
Þare-fore ichulle þat þulke lawes &punctelev; i-confermede beoth ech-on
Of mine eorles and mine barones al-so &punctelev; heo ne with-seggez non
Þare-fore ich hote ov euerechone &punctelev; þat &yogh;e beon þat ilke dai
At mi maner at Clarindone &punctelev; with-outen ani de-lai
For-to confermi þis lawes. &punctelev; ope peyne þat i schal ou sette
Ich hote þat &yogh;e beon þare ech-one— &punctelev; þat non oþur ne lette."
So departede þe court þo &punctelev; and euerech to is In drou&yogh;;
And euere was seint thomas &punctelev; In care and soruwe i-nou&yogh;
[Clarendon.]¶ þis bischopes and þe baronie &punctelev; alle comen to þe dai&yogh;e
to clarindone In wilte-schire &punctelev; þe kingue for-to paye
Þo heo comen to þe parlement &punctelev; þe king axede heom a-non
&YOGH;weþur heo wolden holde þe lawes &punctelev; ase heore Auncestres heolden ech-on
[Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;if it þi wille is
Ech man mot speke for him-selue &punctelev; and ich for me, i-wis
For mi stat and for holi churche &punctelev; Ich answerie þar-to
Þat alle þe olde guode lawes &punctelev; And þat &yogh;eot beoth al-so
graunti ichulle for holi churche &punctelev; for-to habben þin ore
Sauue ore ri&yogh;tes and ore ordre. &punctelev; þou ne mi&yogh;t axi nonmore."
¶ Þe king was wod-wroth for þat word &punctelev; þat him gan þo mislike
Seint Thomas wep In is heorte &punctelev; and sore bi-gan to sike
Al-to blodi was þat word i-seid &punctelev; and deore it was a-bou&yogh;t
Þare-fore was seint Thomas &punctelev; to stronge deþe i-brou&yogh;t
Þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; and of Northwiche al-so
Wepinde knevleden to seint thomas &punctelev; þat he scholde anoþur do
And habbe revþe of al-holi churche &punctelev; and of heom echone
"Þat we ne beon alle to grounde i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; for þulke worde one."
hei&yogh;e Men þat with þe kingue weren &punctelev; mani on al-s[o] wende
And knevleden to seint Thomas &punctelev; þat word for-to a-mende
¶ "Louerdyngues," quath seint Thomas &punctelev; "ich am &yogh;et a &yogh;ong man
And luyte &yogh;wule habbe bischop i-beo &punctelev; and þar-on luytel ich can
Þare-fore of ower olde lawes &punctelev; transcrit &yogh;e me take
And þare-oppe ichchulle conseillen me &punctelev; &yogh;wuche beon to for-sake."
þe king him let a traunscrit take &punctelev; of þis customes echon
Seint Thomas grauntede some of heom &punctelev; and with-seide mani on
[Prima lex.]¶ Þe lawes þat ichulle nouþe telle &punctelev; he grauntede wel fawe
'&YOGH;if a bonde-man hath ane sone &punctelev; þat to clergie beo i-drawe
He[MS. Ne] schal nou&yogh;t with-oute is louerdes leue &punctelev; no&yogh;were i-crouned beo
For þev-Man ne mai nou&yogh;t beon i-maket &punctelev; a-&yogh;en is louerdes wille freo.'
[Alia lex.]¶ An oþur lawe he grauntede al-so &punctelev; þat &yogh;e mowen nouþe i-seo
'&YOGH;if ani man of holi churche &punctelev; halt ani-þing of lay-fe
person, preost, oþur &yogh;wat-so he beo &punctelev; he schal don þere-fore
Þe seruise þat to þe kinge bi-fallez &punctelev; þat is ri&yogh;te nere for-lore;
And In plaidingue stonde in eche place &punctelev; and In iuggement al-so
bote &yogh;ware ani Man schal beon bi-leomed &punctelev; oþur to deþe i-do.'
[Tertia lex.]¶ He grauntede also, '&yogh;if ani Man &punctelev; þe kingues traytur were
And ani man is chateus &punctelev; to holi churche bere
Þat holi churche ne scholde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe chateus with strencþe lette
Ake þe king hem scholde wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase is howene fette
For al þat þe kingus feloun hath &punctelev; þe kingus catel it is
And ech man in holi churche &punctelev; is owene take i-wis.'
Seint Thomas grauntede bluþeliche &punctelev; þeos and oþure mo
Ake þeos oþere he with-seide— &punctelev; þat dude him muche wo
[Ia contradicta.]¶ '&YOGH;if bi-twene tweie lewede men &punctelev; were ani striuingue
Oþur bi-tuene a lewed man and a clerk &punctelev; for holi churche þingue
Ase for Avouweson of churche &punctelev; &yogh;weþur scholde þe churche &yogh;iue
Þe king wolde þat In his court &punctelev; þat plai scholde beon i-driue
¶ for ase muche ase a lewed Man &punctelev; þe o partye, was
clanliche onder þe kingue &punctelev; and onder no bischop nas.'
[ija.]¶ An oþur lawe was 'þat no bischop &punctelev; ne clerk noþe-mo
Scholde out of engelonde &punctelev; with-oute þe kingus leue go
And þanne heo scholden swerien heore oth &punctelev; opon þe boke, i-wis
Þat heo ne scholden purchaci non vuel &punctelev; þe kingue ne none of his.'
[iija.]¶ Þe þridde was, '&yogh;if ani man &punctelev; In mansingue were i-brou&yogh;t
And sethþe come to amendement &punctelev; and a-&yogh;en ri&yogh;te nere nou&yogh;t
Þat he ne scholde nou&yogh;t swerie op-on þe boke &punctelev; ake borewes finde he scholde
to stonde to al þat holi churche &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te him lokie wolde.'
[iiija.]¶ Þe ferþe was 'þat no man &punctelev; þat of þe kinge heolde ou&yogh;t
In chief oþur In seruise &punctelev; in mansingue nere i-brou&yogh;t
Þat[al. þe kyng s.] seiden, oþur is baillifs &punctelev; &yogh;wat he hadde mis-do
And lokede formest &yogh;weþer heo wolden &punctelev; to amendement it bringe
And bote huy wolden, bi heore leue &punctelev; þanne don þe mansingue.'
[va.]¶ Þe fifte was 'þat no bischopriche &punctelev; ne non Abbeie also,[al. þat bischopriches: & abbayes also]
Þat were voyde with-oute prelat &punctelev; In þe kingus hond were I-do
And þe king scholde al þat lond &punctelev; ase is owene take
For-to atþe laste þat him luste &punctelev; ani prelat make;
And þanne scholde þilke prelat &punctelev; of is chapele i-chose beo
Of is clerkus &yogh;wuch þat he wolde &punctelev; þat benefiz to bi-seo;
And þanne &yogh;wane he were i-chose &punctelev; In is chapele þere
homage he scholde don to him &punctelev; are he j-confermed were.'
[vja.]¶ Þe sixte was, '&yogh;if ani plait &punctelev; to chapitle were i-drawe
And ani man made ani apel &punctelev; &yogh;if men duden him a-&yogh;en lawe
Þat to þe bischop fram þe Ercedekne &punctelev; his apel [he][om.] scholde make
And fram þe bischop to þe Erchebischop &punctelev; and sethþe non herre take;
bote þe Erchebischopes court &punctelev; to ri&yogh;te him wolle[r. wolde] bringe
Þat he scholde fram þulke court &punctelev; bi-cleopien to þe kinge
And fram þe kinge non herre'— &punctelev; so þat atþenende
Þe playdingue fram holi churche &punctelev; to þe kingue scholde i-wende
And þe king a-mendi scholde &punctelev; þe Erchebischopes dede
And beon chief of holi churche— &punctelev; ake seint thomas it with-seide
[vija.]¶ Þe seueþe was 'þat playdingue &punctelev; þat of dette were
for-to &yogh;elde þoru&yogh; treuþe i-pli&yogh;t &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t i-holde nere
Al-þei it þoru&yogh; treuþe were &punctelev; þe playdinge scholde beon i-brou&yogh;t
bi-fore þe kinge and is baillifs &punctelev; and to holi churche nou&yogh;t.'
[viija.]¶ Þe ei&yogh;teþe was 'þat In þe londe &punctelev; citation non nere
Þoru&yogh; bulle of þe pope of rome &punctelev; Ake clanliche bi-leued were.'
[ixa.]¶ Þe Ninþe was 'þat peteres panes &punctelev; þat men gaderiez mani on
Þe pope nere nou&yogh;t on i-send &punctelev; ake þe kingue euerech-on.'
[xa.]¶ Þe teoþe was, '&yogh;if ani clerk &punctelev; ase felun were i-take
And for kingus felon j-proued were &punctelev; and he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t for-sake
Þat men scholden furst desordeini him &punctelev; and sethþe þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;te lawe
And þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;t Iuggement of þe londe &punctelev; bringe him of lijf-dawe.'
Þeos customes, and manie oþere &punctelev; þe king pulte forth a-non
And het þoru&yogh;-out al þis lond &punctelev; þat Men heom heolden echon
Þene feorþe dai bi-fore candelemasse &punctelev; þo þis was ido
Þe king het seint thomas a-non &punctelev; and þe oþere bischopus al-so
On þis chartre heore seles sette &punctelev; þat non aftur-tale nere
Þat þulke costomes weren i-holde &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al þe londe þere
"Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "for godes loue þin ore
to conseili us betere &yogh;if us furst &punctelev; are we speken her-of more!"
So þat respit was þar-of I-nome &punctelev; and ech wende In his side
¶ Seint thomas nam þat transcrit &punctelev; and nolde no lengore a-bide
to winchestre he wende þanne &punctelev; with soruwe and care i-nov&yogh;
hov he mi&yogh;te holi churche schilde &punctelev; fram þis muchele wov&yogh;
&yogh;wane oþur Men weren faste a-slepe &punctelev; he wep and si&yogh;te sore
"And Iesus[al. & bad god] helpe holi churche" &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
he i-sai þat þer nas bote o wei &punctelev; oþur he moste stif beo
Oþur holi churche was al bi-neþe &punctelev; þat with ri&yogh;te was so freo
Sori and careful he was I-nov &punctelev; þat he tok on so
For-to entri into Answere &punctelev; þare he ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t to do
Þat he a-feng þat transcrit &punctelev; and respit hadde i-bede
For him þou&yogh;te þat al-holi churche &punctelev; In þat he misdude;
For holi churche ne scholde &punctelev; In none stude stonde to dome
Ne Ansuerie kinge ne prince noþur &punctelev; bote þe pope of rome
¶ Þe deol þat thomas makede &punctelev; no tounge telle ne may
"Louerd," he seide, "alas, alas &punctelev; þat ich euere i-sai&yogh; þis day
Þat ich þe warde of holi churche &punctelev; so folliche scholde take
And so freo ase heo was er &punctelev; þus þeu sethþe hire make
heo þat was er so hei&yogh; and freo &punctelev; bi mine Auncestres daye
Þat ich hire scholde bi-neoþe bringe &punctelev; Allas! and so bi-traie
for þis Martyrs þat &yogh;wylene weren &punctelev; for hire to stronge deþe i-do
heo is nouþe þev þoru&yogh; me i-maked! &punctelev; Allas, &yogh;wi dude ich so
luytel wuyrth ich am of holi churche &punctelev; wardein for-to beo
And al-so vnwurthþeliche þar-to i-nome— &punctelev; þat ech man may i-seo
For ich nam nou&yogh;t, ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; fram none ordre i-nome
Ake fram hei&yogh;e kingus court to holi churche &punctelev; and þat wolde vuele bi-come
Of houndes ich was wardeyn &punctelev; and of hauekes with þe king
And nov am wardein of soulene i-maked &punctelev; and þat ne Ioyneth no-þing;
Ich þat for-sok min owene &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle ich was chaunceler
So manie soulene habbe to loke &punctelev; allas! &yogh;wat schal ich her
Ich drede þat god habbe me fur-sake &punctelev; hov tok ich on, alas!"
Þe deol þat þis holi man makede &punctelev; with-outen ende it was
he wep and si&yogh;te ny&yogh;t and dai &punctelev; and heold him al for-lore
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te a-soilled beo &punctelev; to þe pope he wolde þer-fore
And wende toward Caunterburi. &punctelev; sone þe kinge men tolde
Þat þe Erchebischop nolde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe newe statuz holde
Þe king het his baillifs sone &punctelev; and sende a-boute is sonde
Þat heo scholden greui seint thomas &punctelev; ouer-al on is londes
¶ Þis baillifs weren preste i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and ope is maneres wel faste
Nomen is bodene and greueden him— &punctelev; heo wenden þare-with him a-gaste
Seint thomas let heom al i-worþe &punctelev; and op-on ore louerd is heorte caste
And wende him wel priueliche &punctelev; bi ny&yogh;te atþe laste
to þe se, toward rome &punctelev; þat none of is men it nuste
bote twey Men þat he tok with him &punctelev; þat is priuete mest wusten
Sethþe þo is men him misten &punctelev; and nusten &yogh;ware he bi-cam
And seien þat heo with-oute louerd weren &punctelev; euer-ech is red nam
for-to don euerech is beste &punctelev; ech wende In is side
Ase men þat weren louerdlese— &punctelev; heo nusten &yogh;wat a-bide
Þis holi Man wende him forth &punctelev; and dude him In schipe sone
And wende forþeward in þe se &punctelev; ase he þou&yogh;te for-to done
¶ Þe wind cam ase ore louerd it wolde &punctelev; and drof him a-&yogh;en to londe
Sethþe he wende eft in-to þe se &punctelev; þe passage for-to fonde
Þe wind cam and drof him a-&yogh;ein. &punctelev; and ofte[al. eft] In he wende
And euere he was a-&yogh;en i-driue &punctelev; ase ore louerd þe grace him sende
Þo i-sai&yogh; þis holi man wel &punctelev; þat it nas nou&yogh;t godes wille
Þat he þe &yogh;eot of londe wende &punctelev; he turnde a&yogh;en wel stille
On of is seriaunz sat a ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile þat men woke
In his chaumbre at caunterburi[MS. caum|terburl] &punctelev; þe chaumbre for-to loke;
In þe Eueninge he bad is knaue &punctelev; to steken þe dore faste
Þis knaue eode toward þe dore &punctelev; is ei&yogh;ene a-boute he caste
Þo i-sai&yogh; he þis holi man &punctelev; In one huyrne stonde
he orn and tolde his maister fore &punctelev; and þonkede godes sonde
Þe seriaunt ne lefde þat nou&yogh;t &punctelev; naþeles op he a-ros
And fond seint Thomas In þe huyrne &punctelev; and sum-del him a-gros
Þare was sone Ioye i-nov&yogh;! &punctelev; þat folk sone to him drov&yogh;
And welcomeden him and maden him guod semblaunt &punctelev; with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;
¶ Heo setten bord and spradden cloth &punctelev; and bi-gonne to soupe faste
Seint thomas tolde hem þo &punctelev; wel Mildeliche atþe laste
&YOGH;wodere he þou&yogh;te to habbe i-went &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch cas god him sende
And hou it nas nou&yogh;t godes wille &punctelev; þat he þe &yogh;wyt forth wende
Þe tiþinge to þe kinge cam &punctelev; þat þe guode Man sein thomas
A&yogh;en þe status of clarindone &punctelev; of londe i-went he was
For þat o statuit was þat no bischop &punctelev; ne scholde bi none ende
With-oute leue of þe kinge &punctelev; oute of londe wende
Ake þe king sende is men sone &punctelev; to saisi al is lond
And al-so al is bischopriche &punctelev; ase is traitores, In-to is hond
Þis baillifs comen to caunterburi &punctelev; ase heo i-hote were
¶ Þo heo wenden to habben al heore wille &punctelev; heo founden seint thomas þere
No-þing ne mi&yogh;ten heo saisi þo &punctelev; heore wei heo hadden for-lore;
Also huy comen heo wenden a-&yogh;en &punctelev; and tolde þe kinge fore.
&YOGH;uyt seint thomas him bi-þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat he wolde fondi more
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te of þe kinge habbe &punctelev; betere grace and ore
he &yogh;arknede him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and to him þane wei he nam
At is manere at wodestoke &punctelev; to þe kinge he cam
Ase is erþeliche louerd &punctelev; he grette him, faire i-nov&yogh;
Þe king bi-heold him ful hokerliche &punctelev; and a-scorn som-del lou&yogh;
"thomas," he seide, "hou is þis? &punctelev; beo we so grete fon
Þat we ne mowen in one londe wonie? &punctelev; thomas, hov schal þis gon?"
"Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "god ne late hit neuere so beo
Ake god us sende, and holi churche &punctelev; betere grace to þe
And sende þe wille to louien hire bet &punctelev; And Iesus for is mi&yogh;te
Ne late me neuere a-&yogh;ein þi wille &punctelev; don þing with on-ri&yogh;te."
¶ Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; fondede for-to bringe
A-cord and loue bi is pouwer &punctelev; bi-twene thomas and þe king
Þe king swor a-non is othþ &punctelev; þat non oþur a-cord he nolde
bote þat þe status of clarindone &punctelev; ech bischop holde scholde;
And nameliche þeos bi-fore alle oþure &punctelev; '&yogh;if a clerk hath mis-do
And he þe kingus felun i-preoued were &punctelev; and for þeofþe also
Þat Men him[MS. him him] scholden desordeini &punctelev; and sethþe a-non þoru&yogh; lawe
to þe kingus baillifs deliueri him &punctelev; to an-hangi oþur to-drawe.'
Seint thomas i-sai&yogh; wel þo &punctelev; þat þare nas wei bote on
Oþur he moste stif with-stonde &punctelev; oþur is ri&yogh;tes for-gon
¶ he þou&yogh;te þat he nolde neuere &punctelev; holi churche bi-traye
Ne þat heo ne scholde beo in suyche seruage &punctelev; neuere bi is daye;
Raþur he wolde, ase oþere weren &punctelev; to Martyrdom beon i-do
Þane holi churche were so bi-neoþe— &punctelev; I-redi he was þar-to
Neuere ne mi&yogh;ten þe king ne he &punctelev; no-þing a-cordi þer
Ake departeden al with wrathþe &punctelev; ase heo hadden i-don ofte er
Þe king makede him wroth i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; þat so ofte in barate was
For o man þat him with-seide &punctelev; and non oþur a-&yogh;ein him nas
In grete wrathþe he swor is oth &punctelev; þat he wolde of him beon a-wreke
And þat þe holi Man scholde &punctelev; anoþur with him speke
he let somony seint thomas &punctelev; þat þe nexte þoresdaie he were
At Norehamptoune bi-fore seint lucus dai &punctelev; to &yogh;iuen him Answere;
And alle þe bischopus of þe lond &punctelev; And þe baronie al-so
he het beon þare at þulke daie &punctelev; is hestes for-to do
Alle seint thomas londes &punctelev; in-to is hond his men nome
Ase it were for-to destreynen[MS. destruyen] him &punctelev; þat he to his court come
¶ Ore louerd helpe nouþe seint thomas &punctelev; for oþur frend nath he non
A-mong so manie tyraunz for-to come &punctelev; þat weren alle is fon
bodi and soule he bi-tok &punctelev; Iesu, godus sone
And to is daie ase he Isomoned was &punctelev; wende to Norehamptone
In þe castel sat þe motinge &punctelev; of þis tyraunz ech-on
Þis holi man a-godes name &punctelev; a-mong[MS. a mond] heom wende a-non
¶ "Sire king," he seide, "god þe loke &punctelev; and saui þi dignite
Somounz ich hadde at þis daie &punctelev; here to Ansuerien þe
Ake non Erchebischop of caunturburi &punctelev; nas neuere i-somoned so
Ne so destreyned of no king. &punctelev; I not &yogh;wat þov me þencst to do
I not &yogh;wat is þe newe statuit &punctelev; þat þou þencst forth to drawe
bote hit beo on of clarindone &punctelev; þat þou woldest bringe to lawe
On me nastþu power non &punctelev; swych destresse for-to do
Heued of holi churche ich am i-maked &punctelev; þei ich onwuyrth beo þer-to
It nas neuere ri&yogh;t ordre þat þe sone &punctelev; is fader scholde bete
Ne þat desciple beote is maister. &punctelev; al þis were a-&yogh;en lawe
Al þis, ho-so ri&yogh;t bi-halt &punctelev; þov bi-ginnest forth to drawe
And þis bischopes al-so guod &punctelev; þat wardeins beoth mid me
to holde op þe honur of holi churche &punctelev; and þe þi dignite
heo beoth nouþe a-boute hire forto schende &punctelev; and bringe In-to vilte
gret reuþe it is þat Man schal so &punctelev; hire bringe bi-neþe for me;
&YOGH;if þov wolt ou&yogh;t to me &punctelev; þov wost wel i-ne may nou&yogh;t fi&yogh;te
Ich am &yogh;are deth for-to a-fonge &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te."
[Rex.]¶ "I-nelle no man," quad þe king &punctelev; "for holi churche quelle
beau sire, þov spext ase a fol &punctelev; a-noþur þov schalt me telle
Acke com to-morewe bi speche-tyme— &punctelev; þat þov þinne dai ne breke!
And Ansuere me of oþur þinge &punctelev; þat ichulle to þe speke."
Þus departede þe court þo. &punctelev; a-morewe, þene friday
Seint thomas wende þudere a-&yogh;en &punctelev; þo he þe time i-sai
Þe king [sat] an hei in is sce &punctelev; and a-coupede him wel faste
"Þov were," he seide, "mi chaunceler— &punctelev; ake al-to longe it laste
Ich þe lende þo fif hondred pound &punctelev; and þov ne &yogh;olde me nou&yogh;t on
Sete me þar-of ane schorte day &punctelev; for þov schalt heom &yogh;elde ech-on."
[Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "god sende us bet þin ore
I-ne wende neuere of þulke panes &punctelev; i-heore a-countes more
For ich hadde þulke tyme &punctelev; betere grace to ov&yogh;
Þane ich habbe nouþe &punctelev; and þat me þingchez wou&yogh;;
guode grace ich hadde to þe &punctelev; þou me louedest i-nou&yogh; þo
Þulke panes þo þov me &yogh;eue &punctelev; and woldest &yogh;et wel mo
Sire, þar-of ich am suyþe wel a-knowe &punctelev; þat ich heom a-feng of þe
Of þine &yogh;ifte with guode heorte &punctelev; for-soþe þov &yogh;eue hem me
And so hei&yogh; man ase þov art &punctelev; it mi&yogh;te wel beo stille
to Axi þing þat þov &yogh;eue er &punctelev; with þine so guode wille."
Þe king him axede &yogh;if ani man &punctelev; þulke &yogh;ifte i-sai&yogh;
And &yogh;weþur he mi&yogh;te prouen þe &yogh;ifte. &punctelev; Seint thomas seide nay&yogh;
[Rex.]¶ "Nov, louerdingus," quath þe king &punctelev; "alle &yogh;e i-heorez þis
Þat of þat tresor þat he is a-knowe &punctelev; þat ich him tok i-wis
Þe &yogh;ifte ne mai he proui nou&yogh;t &punctelev; Ase alle &yogh;e mowen i-seo
Iugement ich axi of þis court &punctelev; hou it þare-of schal beo."
Þe court him lokede &punctelev; ase he was &punctelev; a-knowe of þat þing
And ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t þe &yogh;ifte preoui &punctelev; to &yogh;elden ech ferþing
Þe king him het þe panewes &yogh;elde &punctelev; oþur sikernesse him make
Oþur is Marschales scholden swiþe anon &punctelev; is bodi to prisone take
Þis holi man of is bischopriche &punctelev; hadde wel luytel guod
Ake al helples a-mong is fon &punctelev; with-oute conseille he stod
Þe Marchales i-redie weren &punctelev; to prisone him lede a-non;
heo heten him don heom sikernesse &punctelev; oþur he scholde with hem gon
Þis holi man nuste non oþur red &punctelev; bote soffri al heore wou&yogh;
¶ Some guode men þat þare weren &punctelev; hadden of him reuþe i-nou&yogh;
Fif kni&yogh;tes nomen hem to rede &punctelev; and wenden to þe kingue
And token an hond for seint thomas &punctelev; of alle þulke þinge
euerech of an hondret pound &punctelev; for þis seli man to paie
Þo was þis guode Man quit I-nov &punctelev; ase at þulke daie
¶ A-Moruwe, þene saturdai &punctelev; to court eft-sone he wende
For-to heore þe kingus wille &punctelev; &yogh;if is heorte wolde ou&yogh;t a-mende
Þe kyng sat a-doun In is sce &punctelev; thomas bi-fore him stod
"bel ami, þou hast," quad þe king &punctelev; "i-stole me muchel guod
Mi chaunceler þov were, al-to longe &punctelev; and haddest In þin hond
Abbeies and bischopriches &punctelev; and muche del of þat lond
And þov ne &yogh;olde me þar-of none a-countes. &punctelev; þat rewez me wel sore;
Þar-of þritti þousent pound &punctelev; þov me schalt, and wel more
Þare-fore make þe &yogh;are i-nov &punctelev; þine a-countes to &yogh;elde
Sikur þov beo þov schalt it do &punctelev; &yogh;if ich þe may a-welde."
Alle þat heorden þeos demaunde &punctelev; In grete wonder stoden þere
And to[al. ech to o.] oþur seide þo &punctelev; þat heo ne heorden þer-of neuer er
And þat seint thomas was al bi-neþe &punctelev; and ope þe pointe he was
to beon i-cast In prisone &punctelev; for non oþur wei þare nas
Seint thomas stod In þou&yogh;te longue &punctelev; and with ri&yogh;te þe kinge bed
Þat he moste is conseil nime &punctelev; of þat he hadde to him i-seid
Þe bischopes he nam to is conseil &punctelev; þe king ne wernde him nou&yogh;t
In one Chaumbre, faste i-loke &punctelev; alle heo weren i-brou&yogh;t
Þat he ne scholden a-scapien &punctelev; are heo hore answere seide
"Nov, louerdinges," quad þis guode man &punctelev; "her-of &yogh;e moten me rede
For, al-so god me bringe of care &punctelev; Ine habbe þar-of gult non
Ake me for-to schende he axeth þis &punctelev; with on-ri&yogh;te ech-on
For ich was with him er wel i-nov &punctelev; and þat bringeth me nouþe in teone
Þare ne tok ich no witnesse &punctelev; of þat us was bi-tweone."
[Consilium. episcopus Wincestrie.]¶ Þe bischop henri of winchestre &punctelev; furst bi-gan him rede
"S[i]re," he seide, "þus me þinchez &punctelev; þov mi&yogh;t don of þis dede
For-soþe me þinchez with gret wrong &punctelev; þe calangez þe king;
Þo þov wendest of his seruise &punctelev; he ne Axede þe no-þing
And þo þov þe bischopriche a-fenge &punctelev; so clene and so freo
Þat þov of none oþur þinge &punctelev; ne scholdest i-charget beo;
And he quath þe quit al clanliche &punctelev; of ech oþur wike þer
An ne axede þe no-þing &punctelev; of þat þov haddest i-don er
&YOGH;ware-þoru me þinchez of none þinge &punctelev; þou ne schalt ansuerien nou&yogh;t
bote to god and holi churche— &punctelev; of alle oþere þov art i-brou&yogh;t."
[episcopus london'.]¶ Þe bischop gilbard of londone &punctelev; seide þo his a-vis
"Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if þov þe bi-þenchest &punctelev; ase a guod Man schal and wis
&YOGH;wat power þe king þe hath bi-take &punctelev; and to &yogh;wuche guode i-br[o]u&yogh;t
Al is wille þov most soffri &punctelev; and a-&yogh;en him ne beo þov nou&yogh;t
In muche wo þov bringst us alle &punctelev; and holi churche also
And þin owene bodi In perile &punctelev; bote þov is wille do
&YOGH;if þov þis wel onder-stode &punctelev; me þinchez for-soþe, i-wis
Þov woldest fondi him to paye &punctelev; and elles þov dudest a-mis."
[episcopus Wincestrie.]¶ Þo seide þe bischop of wynchestre &punctelev; "sire gilbert, beo stille
We sospendiez swuch conseil &punctelev; for it nis nou&yogh;t wurth a fille
&YOGH;if þe Erchebischop scholde beo &punctelev; al to þe kynges wille
Þe honour of holi churche he lore &punctelev; and is soule he mi&yogh;te so spille."
[episcopus Cicestrie.]¶ Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre &punctelev; bi-gan to speke þo
"Sire," he seide, "mi conseil is &punctelev; hou-so it euere go
Forto fondi In faire manere &punctelev; to paie þe kingues wille
With faire bi-heste, for-to eft-sone &punctelev; þat it were sumdel stille;
Þanne we mi&yogh;ten, &yogh;wane we weren &punctelev; of þusse destresse i-brou&yogh;t
Þe betere a-cheui In ore conseille— &punctelev; for nouþe ne do we ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
[episcopus lincoln'.]¶ Þe bischop Robert of lincolne &punctelev; radde wel þare-to
"Sire Erchebischop," he seide &punctelev; "for-soþe þov most it do;
Oþur þov schalt leose þine bischopriche &punctelev; and per-Auenture þi lif;
Þanne bi-&yogh;ete þov wel luyte &punctelev; me þinchez, of þis strif."
[episcopus Exon'.]¶ Þe bischop bartholmev of Eccetre &punctelev; bi-gan to segge is þou&yogh;t
"In al þe soruwe of þe world &punctelev; and care we beoth i-brou&yogh;t
betere it were þat on heued &punctelev; In peril him brou&yogh;te
Þane al-holie churche were bi-neþe &punctelev; and i-do to nou&yogh;te."
[episcopus Wigorn'.]¶ Þe bischop Roger of wyrecestre &punctelev; longe in þou&yogh;te stod;
"I-nelle ov segge on ne oþur &punctelev; for i-not &yogh;wat is guod
&YOGH;if ich radde him for-ta-bouwien &punctelev; al-to þe kingus wille
Min owene Mouth him-sulf demez &punctelev; al-holi churche to spille;
And &yogh;if ich rede a&yogh;en him to beo &punctelev; In þis place sum is
Þat wolde telle þe kinge fore &punctelev; and maken him mi fo, i-wis—"
bi þe bischope of londone &punctelev; þat ilke word he sede;
for he was euere a-&yogh;ein seint thomas &punctelev; with wordes and with dedes
"Þare-fore," he seide, "on ne oþur &punctelev; I-nelle segge i-wis
guod conseil god us &yogh;iue— &punctelev; for muche neod it is."
Þare nas non þat couþe is conseil &punctelev; with menske bringe to ende
Ne þat wuste hov heo mi&yogh;ten best &punctelev; ovt of þe chaumbre wende
[Thomas.]¶ Atþe laste ope seint thomas &punctelev; þis conseil moste al gon
Tweie eorles of þe kingus hous &punctelev; he let cleopie a-non
"Louerdingus," he seide, "we habbez i-speke &punctelev; faste of þusse þinge
And al-so fer forth ase we mowen &punctelev; we wollez paye þe kinge
Ake for we nabbeth nou&yogh;t i-redi here &punctelev; ore conseil al-clene
For-to þe nexte daie we biddez furst &punctelev; þat &yogh;e it graunti nouþe ene."
So þat heom was respit i-graunted &punctelev; and ech wende in is wei&yogh;e
Manie of seint thomas men &punctelev; bi-lefden him for ei&yogh;e;
And kni&yogh;tes þat with him weren &punctelev; alle fram him heo drowe
Seint thomas nam pouere men &punctelev; bi þe weie i-nowe
And ladde hem to is Inne &punctelev; and to þe mete heom sette;
he seruede heom is owene bodi &punctelev; And i-nov&yogh; mete and drinke heom fette
"Þis beoth," he seide, "godes kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; þis oþur men me habbeth for|sake
Þeos kni&yogh;tes ich loue more &punctelev; to heom ichulle me take."
Þene sonenday þare nas no court i-holde &punctelev; for it was an hei&yogh;-day
And þe Monenday sore syk &punctelev; þe bischop thomas lay
In þe syknesse of maldeflanke &punctelev; þat to him ofte cam
And for þe care þat he was Inne &punctelev; wel þe worse him nam
Men seiden þat he makede him sik &punctelev; for he ne dorste to court wende
Þe king in grete wrathþe i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; after him gan sende
"Wel &yogh;e i-seoth," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þat I-ne may come nou&yogh;t
For-soþe to-moruwe ichulle &punctelev; hov-so ich beo þudere i-brou&yogh;t
Þei ich schulle beo þudere i-bore &punctelev; In baruwe oþur In bere
Þudere ichulle, þoru&yogh; godes grace— &punctelev; crist me helpe þere."
A-morewe, þane tywesday &punctelev; ore louerd him gan a-rere
Þe furste dai after seint lucus dai &punctelev; ase it fallez In þe &yogh;ere
Þat dai he au&yogh;te onder-stonde &punctelev; and mani an oþur al-so
For bi custome alle is grete a-nuy &punctelev; bi twyesdai cam him to
Alle þe bischopes þane tywesday &punctelev; erliche to him wende
And seiden, "sire, þov art in feble point— &punctelev; god it þe a-mende
We habbez ore red þarof i-nome &punctelev; and mid one mouþe ech-on
to queme þe kinge we redez þe &punctelev; hov-so it euere gon;
Oþur he þe wole bere on hond &punctelev; þat þov art is traitur
And fur-swore &yogh;wore[al. &yogh;wane þu swore] him to don &punctelev; eorþelich honovr
And ne dost him non ake tricherie— &punctelev; he þe wole bere on honde
And bi-nime þe þi stat &punctelev; and perantur bringue þe out of londe."
¶ "Mine leoue breþren," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;e i-seoz wel echon
Þat al þe world grat on me one &punctelev; and alle [beoz] mine fon;
And þat [is] &yogh;uyt mest reuþe of alle &punctelev; þat &yogh;e þat mine breþren beoz
And me, þei ich sunful beo &punctelev; ouwer fader In torment i-seoz
&YOGH;e beoz mine meste fon of alle &punctelev; and also &yogh;e bez al-&yogh;are
In seculer court to demen me &punctelev; and þat nolde nou&yogh;t wel fare
For &yogh;e habbez þis a-mong ov to-day &punctelev; bi-speke swyþe i-lome
Nov god helpe al-holi churche &punctelev; and take þar-to gome
Ake In obedience ich ov hote &punctelev; þat &yogh;e þare-nei&yogh; ne beon
&YOGH;if ich am i-brou&yogh;t to Iuggement &punctelev; ake þat &yogh;e raþur fleon
And &yogh;if ani man hond on ov[al. me] set &punctelev; ich ov hote al-so
Þat &yogh;e þe sentence of holi churche &punctelev; for swuche violence &yogh;e[om. &yogh;e] do;
And holdez vp holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; þat ov is bi-take
Man ne schal for none drede of deþe &punctelev; hire ri&yogh;tes for-sake."
Þe bischopes weren þo wroþe i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; ant wenden to court ech-one
Nou god helpe þis holi man &punctelev; for he was þare al one
bote þe bischop of wynchestre &punctelev; þere ne lefde with him nou&yogh;t on
And Iocelin, þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; þat ne weren alle fram him i-gon
¶ Þis holi man truste muche to god &punctelev; and greiþed him a-non
And song ane Masse of seinte steuene &punctelev; are he come a-mong is fon
he song þulke masse i-lome &punctelev; for al-so heo bi-ginnez
Þe furste offiz is propre inov &punctelev; to þe stat þat he was Inne
Þe bi-ginninge of þulke masse &punctelev; In englischs so is þis
And luþere men pursiweden me &punctelev; louerd, min help þov beo!"[Ps. 119.]
Manie seiden þat þis i-heorden &punctelev; "novþe we mouwen wel i-seo
Þat he singuth þis Masse for þen-ones &punctelev; for þe kinge and for alle his
And þat he halt heom alle luþere &punctelev; þat a&yogh;en him spekez, i-wis."
Þis word cam to court wel sone— &punctelev; &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; heo weren ech-on
In þe more wrathþe a-&yogh;ein him &punctelev; and wel þe more is fon
¶ Þo seint thomas hadde is masse i-songue &punctelev; his chesible he gan of weue;
Alle is oþur uestimenz &punctelev; on him he let bi-leue
Oþur Armure nadde he non &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te;
A-boue he caste is cope &punctelev; þat bi-feol to is ri&yogh;te
he tok godes flechs and is blod &punctelev; with him swiþe stilleliche
Ane Creoyz he nam in is hond &punctelev; and wende forth baldeliche
Þe uestimenz was is Armure &punctelev; ase bi-feol to swuche ane kni&yogh;te;
Þe fourme of þe creoiz was is baner &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te
Forth wende þis guode kni&yogh;t &punctelev; a-mong alle is fon
Swete Iesus beo is help &punctelev; oþur frend nadde he non
Þe creoiz in is hond he bar forth &punctelev; and a-rerde op is baner
Þe bischop Robert of hereford &punctelev; bi-gan to gon him ner
"Sire," he seide, "ich crie þin ore &punctelev; þi chapeleyn ich mote beo
bi-fore þe lat me bere þe croiz &punctelev; for it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to þe."
"Þe &yogh;wyle ich hire bere," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "and þe fourme i-seo
Ich ne drede me of no man &punctelev; þe hardiore ich may beo."
Þanne seide þe bischop of londone &punctelev; þat euere was is fo
"I-ne rede nou&yogh;t þat þou bi-fore þe kingue &punctelev; In swyche manere go;
For wrathi he wole him a-non &punctelev; and a-wreken him In þe place."
¶ "Ich bi-take me," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "al to godus grace."
"Þov hast euere al þi lif," þis oþur seide &punctelev; "a muche fol i-beo
And þi folie nelt neuere bi-leue &punctelev; ase men mai nouþe i-seo."
[Curia.]Þis holi Man wiz is creoiz &punctelev; In-to þis court gan gon
[Rex.]And þo þe king i-sai&yogh; him so come &punctelev; he wrathþede him a-non
¶ "Louerdinges," he seide, "here &yogh;e i-seoz &punctelev; hov þis man me schent
In &yogh;wuche manere is he In-to þis court &punctelev; among us hidere i-went
Ase þei we ne lefden nou&yogh;t on cristindom &punctelev; ne In godes name
Ne mot ich nedes awreke me? &punctelev; ne doth he me gret schame?"
Þo seide al þe court a-non &punctelev; "sire, wel &yogh;e mouwen i-seo
Þat [he] is prou&yogh;t and conteckor &punctelev; and euere hath i-beo;
In despijt of þe and alle þine &punctelev; þis dede he hath i-do
For &yogh;if þou wolt, þou mi&yogh;t beon i-war &punctelev; eft-sone to take on so
to bringe men In so gret povwer &punctelev; swiche ase he is
to beon þe hexte of þine londe &punctelev; ase þou madest him, i-wis
Þare-fore we ne bi-menez þe nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þou noldest beo i-war bi-fore
We seggez bi him echone &punctelev; þat he is puyrliche for-swore
And ase bi a swuch Man þou do bi him &punctelev; and ase bi þine fon
For he þe swor eorthþelich honur &punctelev; and nele don þe non."
Þe budeles and þe oþur schrewes &punctelev; grenneden on him faste
And euere a-biden þe kinges heste &punctelev; In prisone him to caste
¶ Þe king let crie a-non a-boute &punctelev; &yogh;if ani so wod were
Þat stode In conseile wit seint thomas &punctelev; oþur felau&yogh;schipe him bere
Ase þe kingus traitour &punctelev; Men scholden him nime a-non
And laten him al one stonde &punctelev; and fondi &yogh;wodere he wolde gon (!)
Þe bischop of Eccestre to seint thomas &punctelev; he feol a-doun a-kne
"For godes loue þin ore! &punctelev; for soruwes þat þov mi&yogh;t i-se
haue reuþe of þe and of us &punctelev; oþur þou wolt us alle schende;
Alle we worþez i-brou&yogh;t to nou&yogh;te &punctelev; bote þov þi þou&yogh;t wende."
"Sire bischop," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "ase wel þou mi&yogh;t be stille
go henne fram me &yogh;if þov wolt &punctelev; and lat ech man don is wille."
Þe bischopes wenden to-gadere ech-one &punctelev; and heore conseil nome
And þo heo hadden heore fourme i-set &punctelev; to þe kinge a-&yogh;en heo come
¶ "Sire," heo seiden, "&yogh;e beoth a-nuyd &punctelev; and þat us for-þinchez sore;
For-&yogh;if us þat &yogh;e on us berez &punctelev; we nellez þe mis-don non-more
Wel we wutez þat þis wrechche &punctelev; þat scholde ore chief beo
he is fals and for-sworen &punctelev; and [þat][om.] mai ech man wel i-seo
For he suor to holde þe eorþelich honur &punctelev; and hath i-broke is oth;
And þat man mai wel proui on him &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e nellez nou&yogh;t beo wroth
Fur-&yogh;if us þine wrathþe, we biddez þe &punctelev; ant to rome we wollez wende
to bi-nimen him is Erchebischopriche &punctelev; and ase a wrechche him schende
Puyrliche for-suore we schullen him preoui &punctelev; sire king, bi eovwer rede."
Þe king bi-het heom gret honur &punctelev; to don þat ilke dede
to seint thomas, þare he was &punctelev; heo wenden alle a-non
Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre &punctelev; tolde for heom ech-on
"Sire," he seide, "ore gostliche fader &punctelev; þov were here-bi-fore
For fader we fur-saketh [þe] &punctelev; þov art fals and for-swore
For þou suore þe kynge eorþelich honour &punctelev; and nelt don him non
Þare-fore to þe court of rome &punctelev; we bi-cleopiez þe echon
to ansuerien us bi-fore þe pope &punctelev; of þat þov hast ido a-mis."
"Louerdingus," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "ich i-heore wel al þis."
¶ Nov suete Ihesu beo is freond &punctelev; &yogh;wane alle oþure were is fon
Þe king him let cleopien faste &punctelev; þat he come forth a-non
Þe Eorl Robert of lecestre &punctelev; and oþur men mani on
Comen after him and heten him sone &punctelev; bi-fore þe kingue gon
"Louerdingues," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;e wuyten wel ech-on
hou wel ich was with þe king &punctelev; þei ich habbe nouþe manie fon
Erchebischop he made me— &punctelev; for-soþe a-&yogh;ein mi wille
For euere ich dradde for oncunninge &punctelev; mi soule forto spille
¶ Þo axede ich bifore al þat folk &punctelev; In &yogh;wuche manere he me toke
Þe Maistrie of holi churche &punctelev; to wardi and to loke
holi churche me was bi-take &punctelev; In eche manere so freo
Þat ich were quit of alle oþure courtes— &punctelev; and &yogh;eot with ri&yogh;te it scholde so beo
And &yogh;wane holi churche is so freo &punctelev; I-nelle ansuerien þe kingue
Ne non oþur in his court &punctelev; of none eorþeliche þinge
For gold ne passez nou&yogh;t so muche &punctelev; In bounte led, i-wis
Al-so dignete of þe preost &punctelev; herre þane þe kingus is
And is gostliche fader ich am &punctelev; &yogh;if he wolde nime &yogh;eme
And it nere no lawe þat þe sone &punctelev; þe fader scholde deme
Þare-fore i segge at o word &punctelev; þat I-nelle me no-þing take
to Iuggement of kingus court &punctelev; ake clanliche it wolle for-sake
And take me to holi churche &punctelev; and to none erþeliche dome
And Ich bi-cleopie ov here ech-one &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Al þe stat of holi churche &punctelev; and al mi dignite
¶ Þoru&yogh; Ihesu crist it beo i-wardet &punctelev; &yogh;wan it ne mai oþur beo
And ou bischopus ich bi-cleopie &punctelev; to þe court of rome also
for &yogh;e Anourieth more ane erþeliche king &punctelev; þane &yogh;e god al-mi&yogh;ti do
And so þoru&yogh; þe ri&yogh;te of holi churche &punctelev; fram þis court ich wende
to bringe þeos cause of holi churche &punctelev; bi-fore þe pope to ende."
Þis holi Man wel mildeliche &punctelev; out of þis court gan gon
Þe king, and þat mid him was &punctelev; wrathþeden heom a-non;
heo criden on þis holi man &punctelev; and beleweden ech-on
Wit Also[MS. Ahso] grete noyse &punctelev; ase anie Men mi&yogh;ten don;
heo ne mi&yogh;ten makie non more cri &punctelev; þei al þe toun were a-fuyre
Ase[al. þane] heo duden opon þis holi man &punctelev; þat wide men it mi&yogh;ten i-huyre
Þis guode man eode softe forth &punctelev; ase him no-þing ne rou&yogh;te
for &yogh;uyt more men schenden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þo men him to deþe brou&yogh;te
he werth opon is palefrai &punctelev; and to is Inne he wende also
Vnneþe he mi&yogh;te with is hondene &punctelev; þeos þre þingus do
blessi þat folk and bere þe croiz &punctelev; and is bridel wisse
Þat simple folk orn a-bouten him &punctelev; with Ioye i-nov&yogh; and blisse;
for heo wenden þat he hadde i-beo &punctelev; atþe court faste i-nome
heo þonkeden muche Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he moste a-mong heom come
¶ to is In, at seint Andreues &punctelev; heo siweden him faste i-nov&yogh;;
Seint thomas alle þe pouere men &punctelev; with him to þe mete he drov&yogh;
And seide, "comiez here forth with me &punctelev; for mine freond &yogh;e beoth;
Ine habbe none freond bote eov &punctelev; ase alle men nouþe i-seoth."
he let heom Alle fede wel &punctelev; a gret hous-ful nei&yogh;;
Þe guode man wel þe gladdore was &punctelev; þat he heom alle i-sei&yogh;
Ase þis holi man sat at is mete &punctelev; þei he grete wille þer-to nadde
Þis word þat ore louerd het &punctelev; is redare bi-fore him radde
"&YOGH;if Men ov pursiwiet In one toune &punctelev; In-to anoþur toun &yogh;e fleo."
Þis holi man þou&yogh;te þat bi him-self &punctelev; þat word mi&yogh;te wel soth beo
And þat it godes wille was &punctelev; In-to An oþur londe gon
As þe holi godspel seith &punctelev; a man for-to fleo is fon
Þis holi man was þo wel þe hardiore &punctelev; of londe for-to wende
&YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;te a-schapie wel &punctelev; and god wolde þe time sende
¶ Þo it was to-war[d] eue &punctelev; twei seriaunz þare come
Sore weopinde, and warneden him &punctelev; þat he sum red him nome
For þe kyngus Men hadden i-swore &punctelev; þoru&yogh; heste of þe kinge
&YOGH;ware-so heo him mi&yogh;ten finde &punctelev; to stronge deþe him bringe
Seint thomas þou&yogh;te an-oþur. &punctelev; he let maken is bed a&yogh;en ni&yogh;t
Op Inþe heie churche &punctelev; bi-twene twei weuedes ri&yogh;t
Þo alle oþur men weren a-slepe &punctelev; and no man nas him nei&yogh;
he aros up and bi-heold &punctelev; on þe ymage an hei&yogh;;
bi-fore þe auter he feol don a-kne &punctelev; and on ore louerd bi-gan to crie
And formest he seide þe seuen salmes &punctelev; and sethþe þe letanie;
Al wepind ech haluwe he bad &punctelev; is help for-to beo;
bi-fore ech ymage he op aros &punctelev; and eft he sat a-doun a-kne
Þo he hadde iseid is beden &punctelev; stilleliche he gan gon
A luyte bi-fore þe cockes crowe &punctelev; out of þe churche a-non
And wende him out-ward of engelonde &punctelev; þat no man with him nas
bote a frere of Semplingham &punctelev; þat wel priue to him was
Þis guode Man flev al Engelond &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te;
Of al is wo ne &yogh;af he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;if he it a-mendi mi&yogh;te
¶ Þe tiþingue cam of þis cas &punctelev; to þe kingue ful sone
Þe hei&yogh;e men nomen heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wat were þar-of to done
Þe king and al is baronie &punctelev; and þe bischopes echon
Þat au&yogh;ten with seint thomas habbe i-be &punctelev; and weren mest is fon
to þis conseil euer-ech-one &punctelev; heo concenteden at þen ende
Þat þe king scholde of is hexte Men &punctelev; to þe court of rome sende
A-&yogh;en him &yogh;wane [he] þudere come &punctelev; and þe pope don onder-stonde
Þat he was fals and for-swore &punctelev; and destourbour of þe londe
For-to don þis grete neode &punctelev; þe wiseste Men heo nome
And þat is þing were al in pais &punctelev; for-to heo a&yogh;en come
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwike &punctelev; and þe bischop of Eccestre
to rome[MS. rome rome] heo wenden for þis neodes &punctelev; and þe bischop of Cicestre
And þe bischop of londone &punctelev; and of winchestre al-so
And also eorles and barouns &punctelev; and manie clerkes þer-to
to beren witnesse of þe fals-hede &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo to court come
Noble &yogh;iftes and oþur Iueles &punctelev; with hem al-so heo nome
Þare-with man mai ofte at court &punctelev; þe ri&yogh;te bringe to wou&yogh;
Nou&yogh; crist helpe þis holi man &punctelev; for he is &yogh;uyt pouere i-nou&yogh;
he nadde none &yogh;iftes forto &yogh;iue &punctelev; to holden up is ri&yogh;te;
Fram Norehamptone bar he eode &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te
¶ Fram seint Andreues þis holi man &punctelev; of Norehamptone he wende
With a frere of Semplingham &punctelev; are god þane dai heom sende
Fiue and twenti mile he wende &punctelev; to þe toune of graham
Are he stunte in anie stude &punctelev; with þe frere of Sempringham
Al North-ward he drou&yogh; him furst &punctelev; a-wei al fram þe se
Þat þe kinges Men ne scholden him finde &punctelev; to nimen ne for-to sle
Sethþe he wende fram graham &punctelev; fiue and tuenti Mile al-so
to þe toun[added later.] of lincolne &punctelev; are he wolde reste i-fo
Þene moruwe ope seint lucus day— &punctelev; tiwes-dai it was þo
he departede fram þe kingus court &punctelev; with much seoruwe and wo[MS. we];
his wei þane wodnes-ni&yogh;t &punctelev; out of þe toune he nam;
Sone morewe þene þores-dai &punctelev; to lincolne he cam
At one follares house &punctelev; his In he nam ri&yogh;t þare.[þare corr. to þere]
And bi ni&yogh;te euere he eode is wei &punctelev; þat he a-waited ne ware
At lincolne he dude him into watere &punctelev; are god þane dai sende
And þane fridai fourti mile &punctelev; al bi watere he wende
to þe Ermitage of Sempling-ham &punctelev; þat a-midde þe watere is;
And þare he bi-lefde al hardiliche &punctelev; þre dawes, i-wis
And sethþe he wende to seint botulf &punctelev; þat was heonnes ouer ten mile
Þare he dude him eft In-to watere &punctelev; and cam in a luytel &yogh;wile
to þe hous of hauer-holt &punctelev; þat of Simpling-ham is
Þe frere him ladde bi þulke house &punctelev; þe sikerore to beon, i-wis
Fram þannes he wende to eistreþe[r. estreye] &punctelev; his o maner with ri&yogh;te
Þe Erchebischopes of kaunterburi &punctelev; &yogh;if he hadde ani mi&yogh;te;
Þare he was nei&yogh; þe se i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; he a-bod wel þere
And a-waitede is point to passi ouer &punctelev; &yogh;wane hit best tyme were
¶ Seue-ni&yogh;t he bi-lefde þare &punctelev; for-to alle soulene dai;
In A Chaumbre ri&yogh;t bi þe churche &punctelev; dai&yogh; and ni&yogh;t he lai
Þat no man no scholde him onder-&yogh;ite &punctelev; ne i-war of him beo;
Þoru&yogh; þe churche he made an hol &punctelev; þe sacringe for-to seo
And for-to heren þare is masse— &punctelev; and Men þat to churche come
Nusten nou&yogh;t þat he was so nei&yogh; &punctelev; ne þer-of heo ne token none gome
An alle soulene dai, þene tywesdai&yogh; &punctelev; are god þene dai sende
he bi-tok god al holi churche &punctelev; and In-to þe se he wende
heo roweden forth al þane dai &punctelev; and a-&yogh;en þe eueninge
bi-sides ane hauene heo a-riueden &punctelev; þat men cleopez graueninge
In Flaundres, ase god it wolde. &punctelev; bote hors ne hadde he non
Þis holi man al a-fote &punctelev; forth is wei gan gon
Þat no man ne scholde him knowe &punctelev; þe Abite of frere he nam
And al-so a frere forth he eode &punctelev; þo he to Flaundres cam
blac was is cope a-boue &punctelev; is Cuyrtel &yogh;wijt blaunket;
Opon is rugge is cope he bar &punctelev; &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te go þe bet
Þe reyn was gret and suyþe st[r]ong &punctelev; and þe wei ful deop
Swiþe weri was þe holi man &punctelev; onneþe he bar up is fet
he was so trauailled In þe weie &punctelev; and in þe se bi-fore
Þat he sat a-doun and ne mi&yogh;te no fer &punctelev; bote he were i-bore
Þo wende forth a man, þat with him eode &punctelev; and huyrde him a mere
For an Englichs peni, with an haltre &punctelev; þis holi man to bere
Þe holi Man is cloþes tok &punctelev; and op-on þe Mere heom caste
And werth op a-boue alle is cloþes &punctelev; and rod him forth wel faste
¶ Allas þat suych a noble man &punctelev; vuele was it is ri&yogh;te
So febleliche ouer lond to wende— &punctelev; wel muche is godes mi&yogh;te;
Vuele was it is ri&yogh;te to gon a-fote &punctelev; oþur ope swuch a best to ride
holi churche he a-bou&yogh;te deore &punctelev; þat men tellez of wel wide
With one haltre ope þe mere &punctelev; forth rod þis holi man
As þei it were a frere, and let him cleopie &punctelev; frere cristian;
For he nolde nou&yogh;t lie &punctelev; þat cristian he was
And he was a-drad to beon i-knowe &punctelev; &yogh;if man cleopede him thomas
At one gode mannes house &punctelev; his In a-ni&yogh;t he nam;
At þe bordes ende he sat &punctelev; Ase vuele it him bi-cam
And al with-Inne seten is men &punctelev; as þei he lowest were
his oste nam wel gode &yogh;eme &punctelev; hov heo heom alle bere
he tok kepe of þe holi man &punctelev; þat sat atþe bordes ende
hou milde he was a-mong alle &punctelev; and mest corteis and hende
And hou hendeliche he delde is mete &punctelev; heom þat bi-fore him stode
And hov luytel he .et. him-selue &punctelev; with wel simple mode;
his limes al-so he bi-heold &punctelev; hou faire heo weren and freo
Þe hondene faire and longe fingres &punctelev; fairore ne mi&yogh;ten none beo;
his face was brod and long al-so &punctelev; his fore-heued large i-nov&yogh;
And euere mest bi-fore alle oþere &punctelev; is heorte to him drou&yogh;
¶ Of þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi &punctelev; he gan him vnderstonde
Þat it was couth ouer-al aboute &punctelev; þat he was i-wend out of londe
his heorte him bar þat it was he. &punctelev; In gret studie he was i-brou&yogh;t;
he rounede in is wiues ere &punctelev; and tolde hire al is þou&yogh;t
his wijf after þulke tyme &punctelev; þat soþe al-so þou&yogh;te
heo bi-gan to serui þis holi man &punctelev; and deinteþes to him brou&yogh;te
Applene. & peoren. and notes also &punctelev; and fondede in alle manere
A-mong alle þis oþur men &punctelev; to gladien wel þene frere;
heo bi-lefde to serui alle þe oþere &punctelev; and opon him was al hire þou&yogh;t
Seint thomas it vnder-&yogh;at &punctelev; and þare-with ne paide him nou&yogh;t
So þat he bi-heold a-boute &punctelev; a-non after soper
Wel mildeliche he bad is oste &punctelev; for-to comen him ner
And to sitte bi him a-doun &punctelev; for solaz, one stounde
"A, sire, merci," quad þis oste &punctelev; "Ichulle sitte on þe grounde
And sat him a-doun at is fet. &punctelev; seint thomas him bad arise
"Certes, sire," quad þis oste &punctelev; "I-nelle In none wise
¶ Nolde god þat ich bi þe sete! &punctelev; mi louerd, i-hered þou beo
Þat In mine house þov scholdest come &punctelev; and þat ich þane dai mi&yogh;te i-seo."
"Luyte deinte," quat seint thomas &punctelev; "of a swuch pouere man
Of swuch a frere ase ich am &punctelev; i-cleoped frere cristian."
"Sire, þin ore," quath þis oste &punctelev; "wel ich onderstonde
Þov art Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; i-wend out of engelonde."
"&YOGH;wy seistþov so?" quad seint thomas &punctelev; "þov hauest selde i-sei&yogh;e
Þene Erchebischop of caunterburi &punctelev; wende in swuche manere bi weie!"
"Sire," quad þe oste, "þov it art &punctelev; al-so me seith mi þou&yogh;t
And ich bidde þe for þe loue of god &punctelev; ne with-sak it a-&yogh;ein me nou&yogh;t."
Þis holi man him bi-þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat oþur he moste lie
Oþur beo bi-knowe þat he[MS. heo] it was &punctelev; so heo gonnen on heom[al. so þe oþer gan on him] crie
Ate laste he was a-knowe &punctelev; ake with him a-morewe he nam
his oste, þat he ne scholde him wrei&yogh;e &punctelev; forto he aftur[r. a fer] weie cam
to [þe] Abbeie of seint Bertin &punctelev; þis holi man i-wende
And þare he bi-lefde &punctelev; forto ore louerd oþur grace him sende.
Þe bischopus of engelonde &punctelev; and þe barones al-so
toward þe court of rome heo wenden &punctelev; heore erinde forto do
to þe kinge of Fraunce heo comen &punctelev; and lettres with heom bere
fram þe king of engelond &punctelev; þat þus muche an Englisch were
"to is louerd þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; sire lowis þe kinge
henri king of engelonde &punctelev; sende loue and gretinge
¶ Thomas, þat Erchebischop was &punctelev; of caunterburi bi-fore
Out of mine londe he is i-wend &punctelev; ase mi traitore and for-suore
Þare-fore ase min erþeliche louerd &punctelev; ich bidde þe bi mine sonde
Þat þov ne suffri nou&yogh;t þat he beo &punctelev; Irecetted In þine londe."
Þo þis king þis bone i-heorde &punctelev; ane &yogh;wile in þou&yogh;te he stod
"Certes," he seide, "ase me þinchez &punctelev; þis bone nis no-þing god
So strong þeof nis non in engelonde &punctelev; &yogh;if he in Fraunce come
Þat he ne mi&yogh;te In Fraunce duelle &punctelev; ase heo doth i-lome;
And wel raþur scholde a suych hei&yogh; man &punctelev; ne come he no so sone
Ake noþur ich ne þe king of engelonde &punctelev; with ore bischopes nabbez to done;
For mine bischopes with holi churche &punctelev; heore wille ich late heom do
And fairore were þe kinge anouri him &punctelev; and late him i-worþe also."
¶ Ne mi&yogh;ten þis hei&yogh;e men of him &punctelev; non oþur word a fonge;
So þat heo wenden forth heore wei &punctelev; þo heo hadden a-bide longe
Maister herebard of Boseham &punctelev; and oþure sethþe i-wende
to þe kinge lowis of Fraunce &punctelev; ase seint thomas him sende
And tolden þe kinge of al þe wo &punctelev; þat seint thomas hadde with wou&yogh;
Þe king weop, þo he i-heorde þis &punctelev; and made deol inou&yogh;
And tolde heom hov þe kingus men &punctelev; at him weren bi-fore
And &yogh;wuch ansuere he heom &yogh;af &punctelev; þat heore [wei][om.] was for-lore
Þis gode men with ioie inov &punctelev; heore leue of him heo nome
And þannes heo wenden sone i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Þare neren heo nou&yogh;t faire onder-fonge &punctelev; for þe bischopes comen bi-fore
And desclaundreden seint thomas &punctelev; þat he was fals and for-suore
Ake naþeles þe grace heo hadden &punctelev; þat to þe pope heo mi&yogh;ten go
him-sulue heo tolden in priuete &punctelev; al seint thomases wo
Of þe status of clarindone &punctelev; hou heo furst forth come
And hou he was i-brou&yogh;t at norehamptone &punctelev; bi-fore þe kinge to dome
And hov he wende out of engelonde &punctelev; In muchele miseise and wo
And al-hov he chaungede is name &punctelev; þe sikerloker forto go
Þe teres fullen out of is ei&yogh;ene &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te with-holden heom nou&yogh;t
he þonkede god þat swuch a prelat &punctelev; under him moste beo
So studefast to holi churche &punctelev; and þat he mi&yogh;te þane dai i-seo.
A-morewe comen þis bischopes &punctelev; and þe eorles also
To procuri seint thomas al þat vuel &punctelev; þat heo mi&yogh;ten do;
bi-fore þe pope, ase [he] sat &punctelev; ful nobleliche heo come
And bi-fore þe cardinales &punctelev; and al þe court of rome
[episcopus london'.]¶ Þe bischop of londone &punctelev; þat euere luþur was
bi-gan formest to telle is tale &punctelev; a-&yogh;ein seint thomas
he stod up bi-fore al þe court &punctelev; "beu pere," a-non he seide
"To þe we comieth to make ore mone &punctelev; of strong lif þat we ledez
Ower ri&yogh;te it is up to holde &punctelev; alle þat guode beoth
And foles to bringuen of heore folie &punctelev; &yogh;wane &yogh;e heom i-seoth
A destaunce þare is i-sproungue &punctelev; li&yogh;tliche in Engelonde
Þat destourbez al þat lond &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te, ich onder-stonde
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is al a&yogh;ein ore wille
Folliche he bi-gan In engelonde &punctelev; holi churche for-to spille
And to bi-nime þe kynge is fraunchise &punctelev; and is ri&yogh;tes also
Ake he ne mi&yogh;te us make for no-þing &punctelev; concenti þer-to.[This verse on the margin.]
And for wrathþe þat we nolden &punctelev; alle is wille do
Op-on us he caste is owene gult &punctelev; and opon þe kinge also
And atþe laste, ase þei it were &punctelev; þut lond forto blende
Þo noman ne dude him strencþe &punctelev; of londe he gan i-wende
for men nusten nou&yogh;t þe soþe &punctelev; þat heo scholden onder-stonde
Þat þe king him dude onri&yogh;th &punctelev; and driue him out of londe."
Þo he hadde al is tale i-told &punctelev; and i-maked is grete wise
[episcopus Chichestrie.]he sat a-doun; an þe bischop of chichestre &punctelev; sone gan op a-rise
¶ "bev pere," he seide to þe pope &punctelev; "me þinchez it fallez to þe
To on-don ech þing þat fallez to harme &punctelev; In þe communaute
Þat o Man ne beo i-soffred &punctelev; to gon forth mid is wille
to bring al þat lond to schame &punctelev; and holi churche to spille
Þat hath þe Erchebischop i-þou&yogh;t &punctelev; and þat is i-sene, i-wis
&YOGH;wane ech man of al þat lond &punctelev; faste a-&yogh;ein him is."
[Archiepiscopus Eboracensis.]¶ Þe Erchebischop of Euerwike &punctelev; þo he is tyme i-sei&yogh;
Aros op and bi-gan to telle &punctelev; is tale al on hei&yogh;
"Sire," he seide, "no man ne knoweth &punctelev; so wel ase ich do
Þene Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; ne þe bischopriche al-so
Þe Erchebischop is willesful &punctelev; and &yogh;wane he is alles i-brou&yogh;t
In ani wille þat is luytel wuyrth &punctelev; he nele bi-leue it nou&yogh;t;
Þat man ne may for no-þing &punctelev; bringe him of is þou&yogh;t
he is nouþe In swuyche folie— &punctelev; þat we habbeth deore a-bou&yogh;t;
li&yogh;tliche he is þare-Inne i-come &punctelev; ake he it nele lete neuere mo
bot &yogh;e þoru&yogh; ower pouwer &punctelev; bringe us out of wo."
[episcopus Exon'.]¶ "Sire," quath þe bischop of eccetre &punctelev; baldeliche he spac þo
"Þis cas &yogh;e moten a-mendi sone &punctelev; hov-so it euere go
And &yogh;e ne leuen nou&yogh;t þe soþe &punctelev; þat men doth ov to onder-stonde
Send with us fot with fot &punctelev; ane legat in-to Engelonde
And lat him of-gropi þe soþe þere &punctelev; and þare-after þu lat him wurche
for-soþe, bote &yogh;e þaron[al. oþer] þenche &punctelev; &yogh;e schendez holi churche."
[Comes Arondelie]¶ Þe Eorl of Arundel aros op þo &punctelev; a man of gret dignete
"Sires," he seide, "for godes[MS. guodes] loue &punctelev; ane stounde herkneth me
Þe lewede Men þat here beoth &punctelev; þat ne connen latin non
We ne onder-stondez nou&yogh;t &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e habbez i-told ech-on;
Ake In langage þat we conne &punctelev; swuche men ase we beoth
hei&yogh;e barouns and noble kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; ase &yogh;e nouþe i-seoth
¶ Tellen ichulle for us alle &punctelev; &yogh;wy we beoth hidere i-wend
For ore louerd þe king of Engelonde &punctelev; Þat hauez us hidere i-send
to schewi furst þe reuerence &punctelev; and grete loue also
Þat he hath to eov i-bore &punctelev; and euere he þenchez to do;
And þare-of he sent þe word bi us &punctelev; ase we bi-fore þe stondez
Eorles, barones, and bischopes &punctelev; þe hexte of þe londe
&YOGH;if he hadde ani herre i-haued &punctelev; hidere he hadden i-wend
Ake to one so hei&yogh;e court ase þeos is &punctelev; he hath us hidere i-sent
to schewi eov furst in his name &punctelev; þat, also wid ase þe world is
So trewe prince nis onder god &punctelev; ne þat so muche ov loueth, i-wis
Ne þat so muche Anoureth holi churche &punctelev; and euere hath i-do
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is a noble man also
Þat, &yogh;if omanere of him nere &punctelev; ase ich me onder-stonde
Þare nere no lond In cristinedom &punctelev; a-&yogh;einest engelonde,[MS. engelonge]
Ne holi churche so wel i-wust &punctelev; and i-schild fram ech wou&yogh;
Onder noble prince and prelat &punctelev; boþe guode men i-nou&yogh;
Ake þes thomas, þis guode Erchebischop &punctelev; so hath a luyte wille
Þat muchel a-peirez his guodnesse &punctelev; and bi-guynneth þat lond to spille
his wille is suych þat, &yogh;wane he is &punctelev; icomen in fole þou&yogh;t,[This verse on the margin.]
he nele þoru&yogh; conseil ne þoru&yogh; no rerd &punctelev; þarof beo i-brou&yogh;t
In swuche folie he is nouþe i-come— &punctelev; ore louerd is þou&yogh;t wende
bote men mouwen is þou&yogh;t wenden &punctelev; þat lond he wole al schende
Þare-for mi louerd þe king ov bit &punctelev; þat &yogh;e with us sende
Ane legat into engelonde &punctelev; to ofgropi al þen ende
Oþur certus he is ope þe poynte &punctelev; al þat lond to spille;
And þat &yogh;e him chasti þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;te lawe &punctelev; & bi-nime him is fole wille."
Of alle þe clerkes þat þare seten &punctelev; non of heom þar nas
Þat ne preisede muche þis hei&yogh;e man &punctelev; for he so renable was
[papa.]¶ "Louerdingues," quath þe pope &punctelev; "wel we onder-stondez i-nou&yogh;
Þat [&yogh;e] to-ward þe Erchebischop tellez &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te oþur with wou&yogh;
Ake we ne mouwen þar-of non dom &yogh;iue &punctelev; bote him-sulue here were
For we ne mowen bi-hinden him no Iuggement &yogh;yue &punctelev; ne no ri&yogh;t i-wis it nere."
[comes.]¶ "Sire," quath þe Eorl of Arundel &punctelev; "&yogh;e moten bet onder-stonde
A certein dai us is i-set &punctelev; to come in-to engelonde
And þane dai ne dorre we nou&yogh;t breke &punctelev; for ore louerd þe kingue
Þare-fore &yogh;e moten us grace don &punctelev; sumdel of þis þinge
&YOGH;e moten, &yogh;if it is ower wille &punctelev; ane legat wis[r. wiz] us sende
And þene Erchebischope hoten also &punctelev; to Engelonde i-wende;
And ase þe legat þare enquereth &punctelev; þar-aftur he mai do."
¶ "Certes, beu frere," quat þe pope &punctelev; "I-nelle nou&yogh;t take on so
&YOGH;wane þe erchebischop hidere comez &punctelev; I-not &yogh;wat he wole telle;
Þare-fore are ich i-heore him speke &punctelev; no-þing don þar-of i-nelle."
"Certes, sire," seide þis oþur &punctelev; "we ne dorren a-bide nou&yogh;t."
"Nov de pardeus," quath þe pope &punctelev; "doth ase &yogh;e habbeth i-þou&yogh;t!"
Þis oþure weren wroþe i-nou&yogh;. &punctelev; wel faire heore leue heo nome
And wenden heom forth in grete wrathþe &punctelev; And to londone heo come.
Seint Thomas was þo In Flaundres &punctelev; In huydinge ase þei it were
In þe Abbeie of seint Bertyn &punctelev; and longe he hadde i-beo þere
Atþe laste he aros bi ni&yogh;te &punctelev; and out of Flaundres wende
Al priueliche In-to Fraunce &punctelev; ase ore louerd him grace sende
Þe king of Fraunce þat was þo &punctelev; louwis guod and hende
heorde telle of þis holi Man &punctelev; he let sone after him sende
Þo þis holi Man to him cam &punctelev; gret Ioye he gan him make
And het him in eche stude opon is lond &punctelev; j-nov&yogh; of his take
¶ to spene to him and alle his &punctelev; &yogh;ware-so heo euere come
Nolde seint thomas nou&yogh;t a-bide &punctelev; are he come to rome
Þe king him fond spence i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; to him and alle his
And sende with him guod conduyt &punctelev; to bringe him þare, i-wis
¶ þo seint thomas to Rome cam &punctelev; faire he was onder-fonge;
And sumdel þe pope was anuyd &punctelev; þat he hadde i-beo so longe
Men a-coupeden him of þulke trespas &punctelev; þat þe bischopes tolden er
And beden him ansuerie for is stat &punctelev; and aleggi þare-fore þer
Seint thomas wolde op arise &punctelev; Men beden him sitte a-doun
And he bigan a-godes name &punctelev; and schewede þis reson
"Sire," he seide, "ich am I-maked &punctelev; þei ich onwuyrth beo
to wardi þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; ase &yogh;e mowen iseo
Þulke churche was i-woned to beo &punctelev; Ase lauedi, and schynde wide
bri&yogh;te ase þe sonne a-mong alle oþure &punctelev; of al þe west-side
Þe sonne þat was erore so cler &punctelev; deork heo is bi-come
brode cloude and strongue i-nou&yogh;: þat[om. þat?] hire li&yogh;t habbeth bi-nome;
Ouer-cast heo is with þis cloudene: þat heo ne &yogh;ifth lij&yogh;t non
And alle þe churchene of Engelonde: deorke beoth ech-on
Þe kyng, þat hire scholde up-holde: he bi-nimez al hire ri&yogh;te
And ase þe cloudene hire ouer-cast: þat heo ne mai no leng li&yogh;te
Ich þat scholde hire wardein beo: þare-a&yogh;ein ich mot fi&yogh;te
And stonde a&yogh;en and with-segge: þe luþere costomes bi al mi mi&yogh;te
For þei ich hadde a þovsend liues: ase ich nabbe bote on
raþur þane ich it þolie wolde: &yogh;yue ich wolde ech-on
Þe costomes a&yogh;en holi churche: þat þe king hath forth i-brou&yogh;t
here &yogh;e mouwen heom i-heore: &yogh;if heo buth to graunti ou&yogh;t."
¶ Þis holi man bi-gan to rede þe luþere lawene: ase he heom hadde i-write;
he wep þat þe teres ornen a-doun: þat deol it was to wite
Þe pope and alle is cardinales: þat sei&yogh;en him wepe so sore
And heordene alle þe luþere lawene: heo ne mi&yogh;ten for-bere non|more
Ake bi-gonnen to wepe faste ech-one: and hereden god al-so
Þat heo mi&yogh;ten finde a swuch prelat: ouer holi churche i-do
Þat holi churche so heold to ri&yogh;te: and ne soffrede no wov&yogh;;
heo þonkeden god of swuch a Man: and honoureden him inov&yogh;
Þe pope het is clerkes alle: þat[om. þat?] þoru&yogh; al cristindome
Þat heo wit-seiden suyche luþere lawes: &yogh;ware-so huy euere come
And[om. And] þat heo neren i-soffrede nou&yogh;ware: hov-so heo comen to ende
And þat heo &yogh;euen heore lijf þare-fore: raþur þane holi churche schende
[Thomas]¶ Þo spac eftsone seint thomas: wepinde swyþe sore
"I-nabbe nou&yogh;t," he seide, "so muche wo: þat i-nere wurþe wel more
For þoru&yogh; strencþe of eorþeliche manne: In þis pouwer ich am i-do
Ake ich me drede a-&yogh;en godes wille it be: for onwuyrth ich am þar-to;
Þare-fore ore louerd for ri&yogh;te wreche: vuel biginninge me deth sende
And ich drede for mine wrechche gultes: þat worse worth þe ende
Þare-fore, þat holi churche: ne beo to grounde i-brou&yogh;t
For mine sunnes and for mine onmi&yogh;te: þat I-ne may hire wardi nou&yogh;t
Ich &yogh;elde ov op here þe bischopriche—: an oþer &yogh;e moten þare do
Þat mowe bet loki holi churche: for onwuyrth ich am þarto."
¶ his Ryng he nam and bi-tok þe pope: and op &yogh;eld þe bischopriche
Þe pope swiþe deolfulliche: and wel Inliche bigan to siche
Þerof conseillede al þe court: &yogh;wat þe beste red were
to laten him witien holi churche: oþur to don a-noþur þere
"Me þinchez," quath a cardinal: "In swuch cas ase nouþe is
best it were to don an oþur: In his stude, i-wis
Forto paien bet þe kinge: and swuc[h] cas mi&yogh;te bi-falle
Þat þe kyng wolde a-swagi and bi-leue: is luþere lawene alle
For betere it were In faire manere: ho-so it mi&yogh;te to ende bringue
Þane contec arere In swuche londe: and nameliche a&yogh;en þe kingue
And man mi&yogh;te purveien þis gode manne: an al-so guod ase þat is
I-ne wot &yogh;wat conseil &yogh;e wollez rede: for i-chulle reden þis."
Þo seide an oþur cardinal: "Ine rede nou&yogh;t so, i-wis
For þat wolde &yogh;iuen men an-saumple: al dai to don a-mis;
For &yogh;wane þe king were wroth with ani bischop: for anie cunnes þinge
to don þane bischop a-non a-doun: þe mo vuele lawene he wolde bringe
And þanne were holi churche i-schend: þat lauedi scholde be
For þis red me þinchez feble: a betere &yogh;e moten bi-seo."
[papa.]¶ Þe pope nam þo seint thomas: and tok him a-&yogh;ein is ring
to bi-leue erchebischop forth: and stable þoru&yogh; alle þing
studefastliche to holden up: al-holi churche ri&yogh;te
And he him wolde a&yogh;en ech man: helpen bi is mi&yogh;te;
Ake he ne scholde nou&yogh;t þe &yogh;eot: to engelonde wend[e]
Ake a-bide betere grace of þe king: &yogh;if god it wolde sende
To þe grete Abbeie to pountenie: forto soriourni þere
he sende þis holi Man: for-to it betere were
With luytel folk and luytel aise: þare he dude bi-leue
For he nadde him-sulf nou&yogh;t to spene: bote ase heo him &yogh;eue
his men he bro&yogh;te In seruise: heore mete to wynne þere
And him-sulf he was al one nei&yogh;: þei he hei&yogh; Man were
hard lijf he ladde i-nov&yogh;!: And he hadde of harde here
Schuyrte and brech streit i-nov&yogh;: hardore neuere nere;
Þe strapeles weren swiþe streite: with mani a knotte al-so;
A-non to is þies þe schuyrte tilde: þe brech ri&yogh;t to is to;
Þe knottes gnowen al is flechs: a-boute bi eche side
Swiþe on-aisi was is brech: a-boute for-to ride;
harde mi&yogh;te he sitte a-doun: and harde ligge al-so
Louerd, deore a-bou&yogh;te he heuene: wel au&yogh;te he come þer-to!
¶ Þe bischopes of Engelonde: þat a-&yogh;ein him weren at rome
Þe Eorles and þe oþere hei&yogh;e Men: þo heo to Engelond come
heo tolden þe kinge al heore cas: hov heo hadde i-sped
Þo was þe king boþe sori and wroth: þat he was nei&yogh; a-wed
¶ "A," he seide, "þilke traitour: þat ich habbe forth i-brou&yogh;t
Þat he me schal swuch schame don nouþe!: Ine may it þolie nou&yogh;t
And he fleu&yogh;th[r. fleu&yogh;ch?] out of londe: þat Ine may to him come
I-chulle me of is cunne a-wreke: heo schullen a-bugge some."
he let seche out clene al is kun: and is oþur frend ech-on
Ovt of Engelonde he let heom driue: þat þare ne moste leue non
Sike ne feble, . &yogh;ung ne old: ne womman þat was with childe
Ne þe children þat soukinde weren: —muche was he on-milde
In hire Armes þe moder bar þat child: and In heore wombene some
Þare hadde þe king, ase me þinchez: a feble wreche i-nome
I-harlede heo weren in grete Miseise: out of londe, alas
Ech guod man hadde revþe of heom: þat heorden of þat cas
And seiden stilleliche bi-twene heom: þat he a luþur king was
Mo luþere dedene þe king bi-þou&yogh;te: &yogh;eot ope seint thomas
Þeos Men þat he of londe drof: were heom lef oþur loth
Ech aftur oþur he made heom swerie: opon a boke gret oth
Þat heo ne scholden in none stude: bi-leue none stounde
Are heo to þe Erchebischope comen: &yogh;ware-so heo him founden
And tellen him fore hov heo weren: out of londe i-brou&yogh;t
to bringue him jn þe more sor: &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;ten tuyrne is þou&yogh;t
¶ &YOGH;eot þe king bi-þou&yogh;te a luþer dede: more ope seint thomas
he for-bed þoru&yogh; al Engelond: ase fer ase his pouwer was
Þat no man ne scholde for him bidde: In churche ne elles &yogh;ware
Ase men doth nouþe for Erchebischopes: and habbez i-don wel &yogh;are
Louerd, muche was þe schame þo: þat holi churche bi-tidde
&YOGH;wane heo ne moste a-mong oþur men: for so holi a man bidde!
Þat folk of seint thomas kunne: wel þicke a-bouten him drou&yogh;
Aldai heo weren i-flemde for him—: In miseise and soruwe i-nou&yogh;;
Heo weopen and criden deolfulliche &punctelev; and tolden him al heore cas
hov heo weren for him defoulede &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch hore soruwe was
Seint thomas bi-heold heom deolfolliche &punctelev; and bi-gan to siche sore;
And euere he makede fair semblaunt &punctelev; to conforti heom þe more
And seide þis word to gladie hem &punctelev; þat men onder-stoden wel longe
"Ech lond," he seide, "is owene contreie &punctelev; to þulke þat beoth stronge"
Ase Man þat seith, þei &yogh;e beon here &punctelev; In vnkouþe londe i-brou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if &yogh;e beoth stronge in godes lawe &punctelev; it ne schal ov greui nou&yogh;t
Alle þe hei&yogh;e men of þe londe &punctelev; þat heorden of þat cas
Corseden þe kinge, and seiden al-so &punctelev; þat he a luþur man was
Þis selie men a-boute men nomen &punctelev; for loue of seint thomas
And founden heom liflode i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þat in miseise neuer on nas.
Þo þeos tiþinges to þe kingue &punctelev; of Engelonde cam
þat þis folk was wel onder-fonge &punctelev; gret deol to him he nam
"Certes," he seide, "&yogh;wane I-ne may &punctelev; in þis manere is heorte buye
In more miseise ichulle him bringe &punctelev; þat is lijf him schal a-nuye."
¶ Greye Monekes of Cistevs &punctelev; fram &yogh;ere to &yogh;ere
A Chapitre makeden generale &punctelev; of Abbodes þat þere were;
For euerech Abbod of greie Monekes &punctelev; to þulke chapitle cam
With-Inne þre &yogh;er,[al. a terme] ase [huy] &yogh;uyt doth &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al cristindom
Þo þe chapitle plenere was &punctelev; þudere þe king sende
to þe Abbotus alle plenereliche &punctelev; þat to þulke chapitle wende
And sende heom word þat him þou&yogh;te wunder &punctelev; more þane i-nou&yogh;
Þat heo wolden him so muche do &punctelev; on-kuynde dedes and wou&yogh;
for-to susteiny is wiþerwyne &punctelev; a-mong heom and is fo
In þe house of pounteneye &punctelev; þat brou&yogh;te him in swuch wo;
And bote heo wolden him bi-leue &punctelev; and ne susteyni him non-more
Alle þe greye Monekes of Engelonde &punctelev; a-bugge it scholden sore;
For heo susteineden is fo &punctelev; ne[r. no] wonder he seide it nere
Þei he awreke him of þat hous &punctelev; þat ine his londe were
Þo þeos lettres to Cisteus &punctelev; a-mong þis Abbotes come
Of þe þretningue heo dradden heom sore &punctelev; and conseil þarof heo nome
So þat heo beden seint thomas &punctelev; his heste forto do
For heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t a&yogh;en þe kingus wille &punctelev; non-more holden him so
Þo seint thomas þis i-heorde &punctelev; he gan forto siche sore
And bad Ihesu crist him helpe þo &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
¶ "Louerdingus, &yogh;e þat habbez me &punctelev; I-susteyned mani a day[Thomas.]
In mine grete neode, Ihesu crist it ov &yogh;elde &punctelev; þare ich mi-sulf ne mai
&YOGH;if crist wole, &yogh;e ne schullen neuere &punctelev; for me harm a-fongue;
&YOGH;ware-so ich euere mai on eorþe beo &punctelev; fram eov ichulle wende
Þat &yogh;e ne beon for me a-peirede— &punctelev; ore louerd is grace me sende
Þat &yogh;e habbeth on me i-spend &punctelev; after me cometh on
Þat swyþe wel it wole[MS. it wole it wole] a-quiten &punctelev; hou-so it euere gon.[v. 1523-4 al. om.]
For ich mai &yogh;uyt mine mete bidde &punctelev; I-nam nou&yogh;t to guod þer-to
Ore louerd þat fedeth þe wilde bestes and foules &punctelev; he mai me fede al-so
Ake hov-so it euere of me bi-come &punctelev; god, &yogh;if it is his wille
holde up þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; þat heo fulliche naspille."
Ase þis holi man in þou&yogh;te stod &punctelev; &yogh;wodere he mi&yogh;te wende
Þe king of Fraunce, þat was so guod &punctelev; sone he gan him word sende
Þat he wolde bi-leue op-on is londe— &punctelev; &yogh;ware is heort best drou&yogh;
Cheose he him-sulf, and he wolde &punctelev; finden him spense i-nou&yogh;
For it is soth i-seid, &yogh;wane a man is &punctelev; In mest soruwe and teone
Þanne is ore louerdes grace next— &punctelev; ase it was þare i-sene
¶ Þis holi man nam is leue þare &punctelev; mildeliche and softe
And sore wepinde he wende forth &punctelev; he &yogh;oxede and si&yogh;te wel ofte
[Abbas ponten'.]Þe Abbot of pounteneye &punctelev; sumdel forth-ward him brou&yogh;te
And Axede him &yogh;wi he were &punctelev; In so deolfule þou&yogh;te
"Ichulle þe telle," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;wi ich carie so
bot þat þov ne telle no man fore &punctelev; are mine ende-day beo i-do
Ich am siker þat i schal &yogh;eot &punctelev; deie in Martyrdom
[Sompnium.]For to-ni&yogh;t ase ich was a-slepe &punctelev; a wonder[MS. &yogh;onder] metinge me com
¶ In þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; me þou&yogh;te i stod, i-wis
And striuede for holi churche &punctelev; a&yogh;en þe kinge and his
Þo comen þere four kni&yogh;tes gon &punctelev; and smiten me opon þe croune
Ech after oþur, þat mi brayn &punctelev; schedde al a-brod þare doune
For [me] nouþe[al. me] ich þonki Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat i schal dei&yogh;en so
Ake for mine Men i siche sore &punctelev; I-not &yogh;wat heo schullen do."
Þis holi man wende forth &punctelev; In care and deol bi wei&yogh;e
Forto he cam to senouns &punctelev; twelf mile fram pounteneie
[ad Senon'.]¶ Þare he bi-lefde In soiourninge &punctelev; alþe &yogh;wile þat he wolde
And þe king him fond to spene i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
Þis guode Man bi-lefde þere &punctelev; In pais and reste i-nov&yogh;;
An euere he carede for holi churche &punctelev; þat þe king dude hire wou&yogh;
he sende to þe kinge of Engelonde &punctelev; þat he scholde late beo stille
And ne weorri non more op-on holi churche &punctelev; &yogh;if it were is wille
Sone þas[al. seþþe] þe king of Engelonde &punctelev; ase is wille him nam
Ouer se wende, ase god it wolde &punctelev; and in-to Fraunce he cam
¶ Þe king of Fraunce was a-boute &punctelev; &yogh;if god wolde him grace sende
A-cordi him and seint thomas &punctelev; &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te it bringe to ende
So þat heo weren to-gadere i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; at one dai&yogh;e I-set
Seint thomas cam bi-fore þe king &punctelev; and ase is louerd him gret
And to is fet fel a-kne &punctelev; he wep and cride is ore
"haue reuþe of holi churche &punctelev; and ne weorre þov hire non-more
And þine wille i-chulle do &punctelev; ase ich seide er, bi mine mi&yogh;te
Saue mine louerdes honur &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te."
¶ Þe king makede him wroth i-nov&yogh; for þat word &punctelev; ase he hadde ofte i-beo
"Novþe &yogh;e movwen," he seide, "ech-one &punctelev; his falshede i-seo
For man[al. i-ne] ne mi&yogh;te don ope is[al. þis] worde &punctelev; noþing a&yogh;en is wille
Þat he ne wolde segge þat icholde &punctelev; al-holi churche spille
And þat it[al. ic] were a&yogh;en godes lawe— &punctelev; and In swyche manere he mi&yogh;te
Þat lond destourbi and me bi-nime &punctelev; mi fraunchise and mi ri&yogh;te
And gode bischopes þare habbez i-beo &punctelev; bi-fore him ase [&yogh;e] wyten, i-wis;
Ake, þat &yogh;e i-seon alle mine treowenesse &punctelev; and þat al þe wronge is his
And[al. as þe] wiseste and þe beste bischopes &punctelev; þat bi-fore him were
A-&yogh;en þe meste fole kinge þat bi-fore me was &punctelev; faire heo heom bere
Do he al-so a&yogh;en me nouþe &punctelev; and ich me pai&yogh;e wel i-nov&yogh;;
And &yogh;if he is a&yogh;en þis fourme &punctelev; me þinchez he hauez wou&yogh;
Oþur him þinchez þat neuere bischop &punctelev; so wis ase he non nas
Oþur he me halt þe meste wrechche king &punctelev; þat euere i-bore was."
[rex francie.]¶ Þo seide þe king of Fraunce &punctelev; and alle þat heorden þis
"Certes, þov bedest him loue i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; al þat wrong is his."
[thomas.]¶ Seint thomas stod and bi-þou&yogh;te him &punctelev; and gan to siche sore
"Þei ichabbe i-haued a-nuy &punctelev; to come me is wel more
"&YOGH;if þe bischopus," he seide, "bi-fore me &punctelev; hadden i-do heore mi&yogh;te
hit ne hadde i-beo non[r. nou?] neod þare-fore &punctelev; to contecki ne to fi&yogh;te
For are þis it were stable i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; þoru&yogh; gode mannes si&yogh;te
Nouþe god for is grace &punctelev; sende holi churche hire ri&yogh;te
For þat þe bischopus bifore me weren to nesche &punctelev; ase ich nouþe i-finde
Þe studefastore i mot beo &punctelev; oþur it worth al bi-hinde
Ich wot wel þat heo habbeth here-bi-fore &punctelev; þe customes in engelonde
.I.-vsed heom al-to muche &punctelev; holi churche to schonde;
And þei heo habben i-beon suffred longe &punctelev; and to custome i-drawe
Þare ne may no man for-soþe segge &punctelev; þat heo beoth ri&yogh;t ne lawe
For ore louerd louez ri&yogh;t and sothnesse &punctelev; and none vuele costomes, i-wis
And þat he schewez wel bi o word &punctelev; þat In þe godspel is
For ore louerd euenez him-self &punctelev; to sothnesse þere
