Ake he ne eueneth him in none stude &punctelev; to costome þat a&yogh;ein þe ri&yogh;te were
Þare-[fore] me þinchez ri&yogh;t it is &punctelev; þat we to sothþnesse drawe
And destourbi þe vuele costomes &punctelev; þat beth a-&yogh;ein þe lawe;
Þare-fore i-nelle none costomes &punctelev; soffri bi mine mi&yogh;te
Þat a&yogh;ein sothnesse beoth &punctelev; and a-&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te."
here man mai i-se þat vuele lawes &punctelev; no guod Man nele a-fonge
Ake destourbi heom mid al is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þei heo habben i-beo i-holde longe;
For he þat sosteinez vuele lawes &punctelev; ase wel he haueth sunne
bote he heom a-legge &yogh;if he may &punctelev; ase he þat heom deth bi-gynne.
Þo þe king of Fraunce i-heorde &punctelev; and oþure þat þare were
Þat seint thomas ne dude þe kinges wille &punctelev; no-þing apayd heo nere
[rex francie.]¶ "Sire bischop," quath þe king of Fraunce &punctelev; "Ich i-seo wel novþe þi wrong
Þe king þe beot loue i-nov &punctelev; þet strif is nov on þe i-long
Wolt[r. wost] þov nouþe is lawes him bi-nime &punctelev; þat neuere him nere bi-nome
Þe kingus heo[m] habbeth alle i-holde &punctelev; þat bi-fore him habbeth i-come
gret Maister þov woldest a-londe beo &punctelev; to muche were þi power
to muche ich habbe honouret þe &punctelev; In mine londe her;
bote þov suffri him is ri&yogh;te lawes &punctelev; Ichulle bi-come þi fo
And &yogh;if we beoth þine fon boþe &punctelev; I-not &yogh;wodere þov mi&yogh;t go."
¶ Seint thomas heold him euere In on. &punctelev; þe kingues heom makeden wroþe
And departede fram him[MS. heom] so &punctelev; In grete wrathþe boþe;
huy þretneden and maden noyse i-nov &punctelev; seint thomas heold him stille
Raþur he wolde deth a-fonge &punctelev; þane þolie heore luþere wille
Nov help crist seint thomas &punctelev; for neode he hath þere-to
Nov boþe þe kingus beoth is fon &punctelev; &yogh;ware may he nov go
I-flemd he was out of Engelonde &punctelev; and out of Fraunce also
Alle is men maden deol i-nov &punctelev; heo nusten &yogh;wat forto do
And nameliche is cunnes-Men &punctelev; þat for him i-flemd were
"Louerd," heo seiden, "allas, allas &punctelev; þat we lifles nere
For i-driue we beoth out of Engelonde &punctelev; and nei&yogh; of Fraunce al-so;
Louerd, &yogh;wat scholde more sorewe &punctelev; þane us is i-come nouþe to?"
¶ Seint thomas made him glad i-nov &punctelev; and confortede is men a-non;
"beth stille," he seide, "&yogh;e makiez deol &punctelev; neodeles nouþe ech-on;"
And seide "&yogh;e mouwen of-swinke ouwer mete &punctelev; ase guode men doth mani on;
For beo &yogh;e fram me, huy wollez beo ouwer freond &punctelev; þat nouþe beot ower fon
&YOGH;e ne habbez hate of no man &punctelev; bote for me, with wou&yogh;
And beo &yogh;e fram me i-wend &punctelev; men wollez louien ov i-nou&yogh;."
"A, sire, merci," þis oþure seiden &punctelev; "we wuten wel al þis
For us-sulf nis us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; bote for þe, i-wis;
We schullen wel nouþe ore mete i-winne &punctelev; ake we nuten &yogh;wat þov schalt do
bote þov schulle for honger dei&yogh;e. &punctelev; louerd, &yogh;weþer þov schulle so?"
"Ich mai bidde mine mete," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "for i-nam nou&yogh;t to guod þer-to;
Ore louerd it &yogh;elde heom alle þat ani guod &punctelev; for his loue me habbez[r. wollez] i-do
bi-twene borgoyne and prouence &punctelev; ase men doth me onder-stonde
gvode men beoth and al-mes-fole &punctelev; þoru&yogh; kuynde of þe londe
&YOGH;if I-ne mot In Fraunce beo &punctelev; þudere ichulle i-wende
And bidde mine mete for godes loue &punctelev; &yogh;if he me wole it sende
&YOGH;eot sum[MS. sun] guod man me may i-seo &punctelev; and it beo godes wille
And habbe revþe of me and beon min help &punctelev; þat miseise me ne spille."
His men for him and for hem[MS. him] sulf &punctelev; makeden deol i-nov&yogh;;
Þe guode man among al is wo &punctelev; confortede heom and lou&yogh;
Allas þe deol þat þare was &punctelev; þat swuch an hei&yogh; man bi-tidde
Þat þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is mete scholde bidde
Deore a-bou&yogh;te he holi churche &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te
Wel au&yogh;te ech man here-after drede &punctelev; a-&yogh;en holi churche to fi&yogh;te.
Ase ech man at oþur is leue nam &punctelev; a-boute for-to wende
And þe holi man In his side &punctelev; &yogh;wodere god him wolde sende
Þare ase god wolde to bidde is mete &punctelev; fort god him sende betere won
god sende is grace a-mong heom alle &punctelev; þat sorie weren ech-on
¶ Þe kingus Messager of Fraunce &punctelev; to seint thomas cam gon
And seide þat is louerd him bad &punctelev; come to him a-non
¶ Forth wende þis holi man &punctelev; ake he nuste for &yogh;wuche þinge;
he tok him al-to godes wille &punctelev; and cam bi-fore þe kinge
¶ A-non so þe king him sai&yogh; come &punctelev; a-&yogh;en him he gan gon
And ful a-doun to is fote a-kne &punctelev; and cride him merci a-non;
"blind," he seide, "ich habbe i-be &punctelev; and þat novþe ich onder-stonde
Al mi lond to þine wille &punctelev; ich take þe an honde;
Þe &yogh;wule ich am in Fraunce king &punctelev; ichulle finde þe i-nov&yogh;
For ich onder-stonde þe soþe nouþe &punctelev; þat þe king hath al þe wou&yogh;."
¶ Þe king sende þis holi man a-&yogh;en &punctelev; to Senouns, i-wis
And fond him þere spense i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; him and alle his
More he dude is mi&yogh;te &yogh;eot &punctelev; and bi-tuene he sende is sonde
For-to bringue a-cord bi-twene him &punctelev; and þe kinge of enguelonde
At Momartre In Fraunce &punctelev; þis dai was i-nome
Þudere weren þis kingues boþe &punctelev; and seint thomas i-come
Þe king of Fraunce dude is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo weren to a-cord i-brou&yogh;t;
Ake þo heo hadden to-gadere i-speke &punctelev; al it was undo for nou&yogh;t
For þe king swor euere grete oþus &punctelev; þat a-cord he nolde non
bote þe status of Clarindone &punctelev; i-holde weren euerech-on;
And seint thomas swor þat bi is dai&yogh;e &punctelev; he nolde þarof holde non
Raþur he wolde deth a-fonge &punctelev; bote þare were oþur i-won
So þat heo departeden with wrathþe &punctelev; þo heo nolden non oþur do
Seint thomas bi-gan to siche sore &punctelev; and Inliche wep al-so
"Louerd," he seide, "help me nouþe &punctelev; for þine swete fif wounde
Oþur holi churche is ope þe pointe &punctelev; to beon i-brou&yogh;t to grounde."
Maister bernard of bosham &punctelev; þat[MS. þaf] is .o. clerk was
In priueite bi-twene heom to &punctelev; seide to seint thomas
"Sire," he seide, "þe mount-martre &punctelev; þis hul i-cleoped is
Þare ase &yogh;e[MS. ase &yogh;e ase &yogh;e] habbez pais bi-speke &punctelev; of holi churche i-wis
And ase þe name seith of þis hulle &punctelev; ase ich douti in mi þou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; þi martyrdom holi churche &punctelev; worth formest to pais i-brou&yogh;t."
¶ Sore sichinde seint thomas seide &punctelev; "god wolde þat it were so
And þoru&yogh; mine deþe holi churche &punctelev; Into ri&yogh;t pais were i-do
And þat ich hadde with mine blode &punctelev; and with mine liue i-bou&yogh;t
Þat heo were in ri&yogh;te lawe &punctelev; and Into guod pais i-brou&yogh;t!"
A-&yogh;ein Midsomer it bi-ful &punctelev; þat þe king him gan onderstonde
And In wrathþe of seint thomas &punctelev; wende In-to engelonde
For-to saisi sire henri is sone &punctelev; mid al is kinedom
And for-to crouny him—longe him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; are he þare-to com
And is conseil seide þat it was &punctelev; mest of alle þinge
Holi churche and seint thomas &punctelev; In vnri&yogh;te for-to bringe;
For þe Erchebischopes ri&yogh;te it were &punctelev; þat of Caunterburie is
To crouny þene kyng of Engelonde &punctelev; and non oþur bischop, i-wis
Þe king in preIudice of him &punctelev; and to bi-nimen him is ri&yogh;te
Let oþur bischopes crouni is sone &punctelev; and [cud]de a luyte mi&yogh;te
¶ Four bischopus him crouneden &punctelev; a-&yogh;en ri&yogh;te and a-&yogh;ein þe wone
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; and þe bischop of londone
And þe bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of roucestre al-so;
In seint peteres churche at west-Munstre &punctelev; þeos dede was ido
Þe fader seruede þe sone &punctelev; at þe mete a-dai
And with [þe] reaume saisede him &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai
Þe tyþingus of þusse þingue &punctelev; to seint thomas huy come
Of þulke on-ri&yogh;te he sende sone &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Þe pope him sende lettres a&yogh;en &punctelev; and bulle þat he scholde
A-mansi þe king and is conseil &punctelev; &yogh;wuch tyme þat he wolde
And suspendi þe bischopes &punctelev; þat swuch on-ri&yogh;t duden þere
And entre-diten al engelond &punctelev; for-to it a-mendet were
¶ Seint thomas heold þe lettres to him &punctelev; for-to god him grace sende
Þat he mi&yogh;te him-sulf þe neodes[al. dede] do &punctelev; &yogh;wane he to engelond wende.
&YOGH;uyt cam king henri þe olde &punctelev; eft-sone into Fraunce
Þe king of Fraunce was euere a-nuyd &punctelev; of þulke desturbaunce
And wende a-boute to makien a-cord &punctelev; and bi-tweone he sende faste;
So þat heo weren, ase god it wolde &punctelev; a-cordut at-þe laste
A-seinte Marie dai Maudeleyne &punctelev; Idon was þis dede
In ane Mede þat men cleopiez &yogh;uyte &punctelev; "þe traitores mede"
Al-so ferde þulke a-cord &punctelev; ase þe Mede i-cleoped was
For þer-aftur a luyte stounde &punctelev; no-þing i-sene it nas
Muche heo speken In priueite &punctelev; and in grete loue heo wenden a-two
And seint thomas wende þat þe king &punctelev; al is wille wolde do
Maister herebard of boseham &punctelev; to þe kinge he sone wende
For þe foreward þat heo hadde bi-speke &punctelev; ase seint thomas him sende
And bad him hote &yogh;elde a-&yogh;en &punctelev; ase forth ase he mi&yogh;te
Þat is baillifs in is bischopriche &punctelev; nomen with onri&yogh;te
"&YOGH;e," quath þe king, "wolde he so? &punctelev; &yogh;eot he schal a-bide
Ichulle i-wite hov he wole him bere &punctelev; formest In oþur side;
par-auntur so faire he may &punctelev; bere him a-&yogh;en me
Þat ichulle &yogh;elden him ech feorþing. &punctelev; þare-fore cheose he."
¶ Maister herebard wende a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; ant tolde seint thomas fore
"&YOGH;e," þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; "þis pais is al-for-lore."
Sethþe seint thomas him-sulue &punctelev; to þe kinge he wende
to speken more of þe a-cord &punctelev; &yogh;if he it mi&yogh;te a-mende
Þe king him welcomede al li&yogh;tliche &punctelev; ase he ne heolde nou&yogh;t þer-to
And wende him forth to heren is masse &punctelev; and seint thomas al-so
he was i-woned to habbe is masse &punctelev; ase it ful to þe dai&yogh;,[MS. dai&yogh;e]
And þo he let singen him þe soule-masse &punctelev; þat no-þing þare-to ne lai&yogh;
For he nolde nou&yogh;t atþe peis &punctelev; cussen seint thomas
Þe holi Man þou&yogh;te wel &punctelev; &yogh;wat þe Anchaisoun was
Wel narewe þe king him gan bi-þenche &punctelev; to derne is luþere þou&yogh;t
Ake to him þat wot ech derne þing &punctelev; þing[om. þing] it nas [to] hele nou&yogh;t
Þo þe Masse was i-do &punctelev; In conseil longue heo stode;
Wel ofte þe king him opbraid &punctelev; þat he dude him er of guode
And &yogh;wuch a lov&yogh; man he cam to him &punctelev; and In &yogh;wuche pouwer he him brou&yogh;te
And þat he au&yogh;te vuele a-&yogh;ein him beo &punctelev; &yogh;if he him wel bi-þou&yogh;te
So þat heo weren to-gadere longe &punctelev; and þo heo hadden al i-do
Þei it luytel &yogh;wile i-laste &punctelev; with loue heo departeden ato.
¶ Seint thomas bi-gan to sike sore &punctelev; þo he gan him onder-stonde
[reprimacio thome.]Þat he hadde longe i-beo &punctelev; oute of engelonde;
Þei it were a-&yogh;ein is wille &punctelev; it þou&yogh;te him luþer dede
Þat is bischopriche so longe was &punctelev; with-oute conseille and rede
to þe king of Fraunce he wende furst &punctelev; and to oþere guode and hende
And faire he tok is leue at heom &punctelev; to engelond for-to wende;
he þonkede heom of alle honur &punctelev; þat heo him hadden i-do;
With fair conduyt and gret loue &punctelev; fram heom he wende so
Fram Fraunce he wende with gret honour &punctelev; toward engelonde;
At one hauene he gan a-bide &punctelev; þat Men cleopiez &yogh;wit-sonde.[near Calais]
Þe lettres þat he hadde of rome &punctelev; to Engelond he sende
to don þe sentence al a-brod &punctelev; bi-fore him ase he wende
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; In sentence he let do
And þene bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of londone al-so;
for heo hadden i-crouned þene &yogh;onge king &punctelev; a-&yogh;en þe dignete
With onri&yogh;te In is bischopriche &punctelev; he a-mansede hem alle þre
¶ Þo þe tiþinge to heom cam &punctelev; heo maden heom wroþe i-nov&yogh;
And þretneden þis holi man &punctelev; þei it were with wou&yogh;
Seint thomas eode toward þe schipe &punctelev; In-to engelonde for-to wende
A man þare cam fram engelonde &punctelev; a&yogh;en heom,[r. him] guod and hende
"A, sire," he seide, "for godesloue &punctelev; ne passe nou&yogh;t þe se
For þare beoth kni&yogh;tes in Engelonde &punctelev; Iporueide þe for-to sle;
At eche hauene Men a-waytiez &punctelev; to kepe þe, mani on;
&YOGH;if þou comest a-mong heom ov&yogh;t &punctelev; þov worst a-slawe a-non."
"Certes," quath þis holi Man &punctelev; "Inelle no leng a-bide
to Engelonde Ichulle me drawe &punctelev; tide &yogh;wat bi-tide;
Þei ich beo drawe lime mele &punctelev; I-nelle bi-leue non-more
to longe ich habbe þaunes i-beo &punctelev; þat rewez me wel sore
Þe soulene þat ich habbe þare for-to loke &punctelev; six &yogh;er and more, i-wis
With-oute wardein habbez i-beo &punctelev; allas! to longe it is
A-slawe ich worþe, wel ich wot &punctelev; þare, are come ou&yogh;t longe
Ichulle for holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; gladliche þene deth a-fonge
Ake biddez for me Ihesu crist &punctelev; i bidde eov par charite
bi-fore alle oþere nameliche &punctelev; o þing biddeth for me
Þat god for is holi grace &punctelev; to Caunterburi me sende
Þat ich mote a-liue oþur ded &punctelev; In-to mine owene churche [wende];
&YOGH;if i-ne mai þudere a-liue come &punctelev; are ich i-martred beo
Þat mi bodi mote &yogh;wan ich am ded— &punctelev; god it graunti me."
his leue he nam wel deolfolliche &punctelev; and to schipe he wende so;
he þonkede heom al honour &punctelev; þat Men him hadden i-do
And bi-tei&yogh;te al Fraunce Ihesu crist &punctelev; and blessede it wel faste;
Þat folk wep and makede sorewe gret &punctelev; heore deol longe i-laste.
¶ At douere were kni&yogh;tes &yogh;are &punctelev; þat heorden of him telle
Sone ase he come op þere &punctelev; al aredi him to quelle
Sire Reinaud of wareygne &punctelev; and sire Randolf þe brok;
And also Gerueis þe schyrreue &punctelev; gret folk with him tok
to kepe þis holi Man at douere &punctelev; ase he come op of þe se
And bote he wolde heore wille do &punctelev; al-&yogh;are him for-to sle
to þe hauene of sandwiche &punctelev; þat schip wel euene drou&yogh;
Þe oþere a-biden him alle at douere &punctelev; with þretninge and bost i-nou&yogh;
In þe schipes seile an hei&yogh; &punctelev; þis holi man let do
Ane Croiz, þat Man fer isai&yogh; &punctelev; Iseuwed faste þer-to
Þat was signe of is baner &punctelev; oþur ne kepte he non
Men stoden at sandwich and bi-heolden &punctelev; þe Croiz wel manion
And seiden, "we i-seoth nouþe hider-ward come &punctelev; oure bischop thomas;"
Þe &yogh;uyt he was fer in þe se &punctelev; heo wusten &yogh;wat he was
Þat cri was sone wide couth &punctelev; þat folk orn faste i-nov&yogh;
And are he were to londe i-come &punctelev; muche folk a-&yogh;ein him drou&yogh;
heo criden and þonkeden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat heo mosten him a-liue i-seo
And welcomeden him with Ioye i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; non more ne mi&yogh;te beo
Þene þridde day of þe Aduent &punctelev; bi-fore cristemasse it was
Þat he to Engelonde cam &punctelev; þe guode man seint thomas;
Þe seuenþe &yogh;er þat he wende furst &punctelev; out of engelonde
Six &yogh;er and a Monthþe he was fleme &punctelev; ase ich me onder-stonde
Þis was endleue hondret &yogh;er &punctelev; and sixti &yogh;er and tene
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; In is moder a-li&yogh;te, ich wene.
[Accusatio militum.]¶ Þat word to þe kni&yogh;tes cam &punctelev; to douere of þis cas
hov seint thomas þe holi man &punctelev; at sandwych a-riued was
to sandwich heo wenden faste. &punctelev; seint thomas heo founden a-non;
With[MS. withith] luþer semblaunt and fals heorte &punctelev; heo welcomeden him ech-on
And seiden, "hou hauestþov þene wei &punctelev; to engelonde i-nome
Þat destourbest al þat lond &punctelev; sone so þov art i-come
And al-so al-holi churche &punctelev; ase we alle i-seoth
Þat þov a-mansest þus þeos bischopes &punctelev; þat þine felawes beoth
Þov au&yogh;test mid alle lawe &punctelev; loue and pais a-rere
And þare nas neuere a-londe pais &punctelev; sethþe þov bischop were
&YOGH;if þov wenest wel for-to do &punctelev; with-drau&yogh; þine dede sone;
Oþur Man schal bi þe do &punctelev; ase with swuch a man is to done."
[Responsio thome.]¶ "Mine leue freond," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "sothþ it is i-nov&yogh;
þe mansinge þat ich let do &punctelev; it was with ri&yogh;te and nou&yogh;t with wou&yogh;
And bi mine louerdes leue þe king &punctelev; þat ech man in ri&yogh;te were
Þat so gret trespas ne wende forth &punctelev; þat it a-mendet nere
And were eft-sone after-ward &punctelev; with on-ri&yogh;te and a-&yogh;ein lawe
In desertison of mine churche &punctelev; to costome i[MS. it]-drawe."
Þo þe kni&yogh;tes heorden þat þe king &punctelev; consentede þer-to
heo bi-leueden al heore grete mod &punctelev; and heore þretningue al-so
And in faire Manere beden him &punctelev; ondon is Mansingue
to norisi loue with is felawes &punctelev; and bi-twene him and þe kinge
So þat respit bi-tuene heom &punctelev; of þis Ansuere heo nome
For-to seint thomas a-moruwe &punctelev; to Caunterburie come
[Aduentus Cantuar.]¶ Seint thomas a-moruwe &punctelev; to Caunterburi him drou&yogh;
Al þe contreie a-&yogh;ein him cam &punctelev; with Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;
Ech preost somonede is paroche &punctelev; clanliche in euerech ende
to beon alle &yogh;are a-&yogh;ein him &punctelev; with procession for-to wende
So þat with processiones &punctelev; manie and faire i-nov&yogh;
With croyz and with taperes &punctelev; þe contreie a-&yogh;ein him drou&yogh;
Þare was Ioie and blisse i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; more ne mi&yogh;te non beo;
heo þonkeden &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat a-liue him mosten i-seo
Of bellene and of tabours &punctelev; so gret was þe soun
Of eche manere gleo and of song &punctelev; þo he cam into toun
Þat man ne mi&yogh;te i-heore non oþur þing &punctelev; bote þe noise þat was so gret;
Non more ioie ne mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; þane þare was In euereche stret
¶ Ase ore louerd a-palme-sonenday &punctelev; honovred was i-nov&yogh;
Þo he rod into Ierusalem &punctelev; and toward is deþe drov&yogh;
Al-so was þis holi man &punctelev; ase men mi&yogh;ten i-seo þere;
For ore louerd wolde þat is deth &punctelev; semblable to his were
Are seint thomas þe holi man &punctelev; to is churche come
Þe Monekus with procession &punctelev; a-&yogh;ein him þene wei heo nome
Of is palefrai he li&yogh;te a-don &punctelev; and custe þe Monekes ech-on;
to þe weuede wel mildeliche &punctelev; heo ladden him a-non
Þo he hadde at churche i-do &punctelev; al þat him was to done
With is men wel mildeliche &punctelev; to is In he wende sone.
[Milites retro veniunt.]¶ Seint thomas ne hadde i-beo &punctelev; at is paleis nou&yogh;t longe
Þat þe kni&yogh;tes ne comen &punctelev; heore answere forto afonge
heo beden him ase heo beden er &punctelev; on-don is mansinge
And a-soilli þe bischopes[MS. bischepes] &punctelev; þat he let þare-Inne bringe
"bev freres," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þat ne mai i do nou&yogh;t
For heo beoth In mansinge &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe pope i-brou&yogh;t
And .I.-ne mai nou&yogh;t on-do is dede &punctelev; &yogh;e wuten wel, in none place
Ake nou&yogh;t-for-þan ich truste wel &punctelev; so muche In his grace
Þat ichulle a-soilli heom &punctelev; In þusse fourme fawe
Þat heo don sikernesse for-to stonde &punctelev; at holi churche lawe
And to þe lokinge of holi churche— &punctelev; ake in oþur fourme non."
Þe kny&yogh;tes, þo heo herden þis &punctelev; chidden faste ech-on
And þo heo nadden non oþur word &punctelev; in wrathþe forth heo wende
And tolden þe bischopes heore ansuere &punctelev; þat heom þudere sende
Þe bischopes maden heom wroþe i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; ant þretneden him wel faste
Ake naþeles þe tweyne of heom &punctelev; with-drowen heom atþe laste
¶ Þe bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of londone al-so;
to holi churche heo wolden stonde &punctelev; and to is lokinge al-so
¶ Ake þe Erchebischop of Euerwik &punctelev; a-non-ri&yogh;t heom with-sede
"Daþeheit habbe þat so atstonde &punctelev; so folliche at ower rede
For-to don us in is grace &punctelev; þat euere hath i-beon ore fo
And hath i-don us mani a schame &punctelev; and þanne he wolde wel mo
Þei he habbe ouer ov power &punctelev; ouer me ne hauez he non
For erchebischop ich am, wel &yogh;e wutez &punctelev; ase wel ase he is on
Ich habbe a luytel Coffre &punctelev; þat stant hol and sount
Atþe leste þare beoth Inne &yogh;eot &punctelev; Ei&yogh;te hundret pound
&YOGH;are ich am to spene þat &punctelev; and &yogh;eot me þinchez to luyte
For-to a-wreken us wel of him &punctelev; and for-to a-legge is pruyte
Wende we to þe kinge a-non &punctelev; and telle him of is dede
Þat him ne tit neuere pais &punctelev; bote he þarof him rede."
[hic ueniunt ad regem.]¶ Þeos þreo bischopus hasteliche &punctelev; ouer se þene wei nome
A luyte bi-fore cristemasse &punctelev; to þe kinge heo come
And founden him in Normandie. &punctelev; a-doun heo fullen a-kne
heo beden him holden op his honour &punctelev; stifliche hore help to beo
And tolden him hov þis holi Man &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
Destourbede al-holi churche &punctelev; and is kynedam
And hov he hadde with gret pruyte &punctelev; In mansinge i-do
Al þat maden is sone king &punctelev; and consenteden þare-to
And hov in despit of him &punctelev; he dude swuch luþer dede
And þat he ne scholde neuere in pais beo &punctelev; bote he nome an-oþur to rede
[Rex iratus.]¶ Þe king, þo he heorde þis &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh; wod
he eode op and doun ase witles &punctelev; and ofte in þou&yogh;te stod
"&YOGH;if he a-mansez alle þat maden &punctelev; mine sone king," he seide
"Mid þe furste he a-mansez me &punctelev; for it was min owene dede
Þe traitur a-spillez al þat lond &punctelev; and bringez us in wrechhede
ho mi&yogh;te In swuch soruwe &punctelev; longe eni lif lede?"
Ofte he corsede alle þeo &punctelev; þat he hadde forth i-brou&yogh;t
Of þe false preost and is fo &punctelev; þat heo ne a-wreke him nou&yogh;t
Þat destourbede al þat lond &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te in wrechhede;
Ase he eode op and doun[MS. don doun] &punctelev; ofte þat word he seide
¶ Þe kni&yogh;tes þo [heo] heorden þis &punctelev; stoden some stille
And bi-þou&yogh;ten heom wel priueliche &punctelev; to paie þe kinges wille
Þe foure þat mest schrewes weren &punctelev; bi-þou&yogh;ten hem of guyle
Sire reynaud le fiz ovrs &punctelev; and sire huwe de moruile
And sire willam traci &punctelev; and sire Richard de bruiz
heore names for heore schrewehede &punctelev; ne beoth nout for-&yogh;ite &yogh;uyt
huy nomen heom to rede stilleliche &punctelev; to passi þe se
to paie þe kingus wille &punctelev; seint thomas for-to sle
Stilleliche heo wenden forth &punctelev; þat no man it nuste;
heo weren nei&yogh;wat atþe se &punctelev; are þe king it wuste
Þo þe king it onder-&yogh;at &punctelev; After heom he sende
Þat heo bi-lefde heore folie &punctelev; and a&yogh;enward to him wende
Ake þis messager ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ouer-take heom for none ginne
For are he cam to þe se &punctelev; heo weren fer with-Inne
Þo made þe king deol i-nov &punctelev; þat heo weren forth i-wend
And þat is messager ne ouer-tok heom nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he after heom hadde i-send.
[Predicatio thome.]¶ Seint thomas at Caunterburi &punctelev; a-midewynteres dai
Stod and prechede al þat folk &punctelev; þat mani a man i-sai
In is prechingue he bi-gan &punctelev; to siche swiþe sore
And deol and sorewe made i-nov &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te no man more;
Swiþe sore he gan to wepe &punctelev; þe teres ornen a-doun
Þare was mani wepinde Ei&yogh;e &punctelev; wel sone &yogh;eont al þe toun
"Mine leue freond," quath þis holi man &punctelev; weopinde suyþe sore
"Ouwer preost ich habbe ane &yogh;wyle i-beo &punctelev; ake i-ne mai no lengore more,[This v. added on the bottom.]
For min ende-dai is nei&yogh; i-come &punctelev; I-ne worþe here nou&yogh;t longe;
Ich am redi for holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; deth for-to afonge
biddez for me for godes loue &punctelev; and for holi churche al-so
Þat geth al-mest nouþe to grounde &punctelev; bote god nime &yogh;eme þar-to
Deth ichulle wel fain take &punctelev; &yogh;wan it is godus wille
For þe ri&yogh;te of holi churche &punctelev; raþur þane heo spille."
bok and candele he nam a-non &punctelev; and a-mansede ri&yogh;t þere
Alle þat werreden[MS. weṛrṇeden] holi churche &punctelev; and a-&yogh;ein hire ri&yogh;tes were
And nameliche sire randolf þe brok &punctelev; and sire robert de bruyz[r. Brok] also
Þat þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi &punctelev; gret on-ri&yogh;t habbez i-do
For þe &yogh;wuyle þat he was out of londe &punctelev; þe king henri bi-tok
Þe bischopriche al for-to loke &punctelev; sire Randolf þe brok
And he mad Robert de brok &punctelev; is clerk þat was þo
Of al þis wardein onder him. &punctelev; þat dude is londe wel wo;
For he destruyde al þe bischopriche &punctelev; and to him-sulf nam i-nov&yogh;
And dude him fair bold a-rere &punctelev; of þat he nam with wou&yogh;
Þer-inne a-criste-masse dai &punctelev; þo þe mansinge was i-do
he sat and .et. wel nobleliche &punctelev; and manie with him al-so
Seint thomas (!)[r. he (so the other MSS.)] caste houndes of is bred &punctelev; þat bi-fore him lai
And euerech hound it for-sok &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;
Þo handlede he oþur bred &punctelev; and let menge hit at þe laste
Wit oþur bred þat lai bi-side &punctelev; and to þe houndes let it caste
Al þat he i-handlet hadde &punctelev; þe houndes al for-lete
And chosen out þat oþur þare-a-mong &punctelev; and wel clanliche it ete
Þe guodnesse[al. mansinge] was on him i-sene &punctelev; a-non-ri&yogh;t þat ilke dai
&YOGH;wane þe houndes þat bred for-soken &punctelev; þat bi-fore him lai
¶ bi a fridai þulke &yogh;eres &punctelev; was cristemasse-dai
[Milites.]Þare was gret miracle of god &punctelev; þat al þat folk i-sai.
¶ Þis four luþere kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; of &yogh;wuche we gunne telle
to engelonde wel sone comen &punctelev; seint thomas to quelle
to þe castel of salt-wode &punctelev; a-seint Iohanes dai heo come
Six milene fram caunterburi &punctelev; and þare heore In heo nome;
And sire Randolf þe brok &punctelev; to hem cam wel sone
heore conseil heo nomen þulke ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þe luþere dede to done
Þene morewe, a-childre-masse dai &punctelev; þo god þene dai sende
Sire Randulf þe brok wel stilleliche &punctelev; to Caunterburi he wende
For-to enqueri of seint thomas &punctelev; &yogh;ware heo mi&yogh;ten him finde
Þat he ne drowe him nou&yogh;t a-wei &punctelev; ne hudde him no&yogh;were bi-hinde
[Milites.]¶ Þis kni&yogh;tes þene Tywesdai &punctelev; no lengore nolden bi-leue
Ake wenden heom to Caunterburi &punctelev; wel are it were eue
A luyte bi-fore compelin &punctelev; to seint thomas heo come;
Þene ri&yogh;te wei ful baldeliche &punctelev; In-to is chaumbre heo nome
heo comen and founden him stilleliche &punctelev; In is chaumbre stonde
With priue clerkes &punctelev; and gret conseil hadden on honde
Sire Reynaud le fiz ours &punctelev; grimliche forth i-wende
"Sire," he seide, "ore louerd þe king &punctelev; in message us hidere sende
Fram him out of Normandie &punctelev; Ane heste we habbez i-brou&yogh;t
Þat þov do is heste— &punctelev; ne bi-lef þov it nou&yogh;t
And þat þou wende sone to is sone &punctelev; þat &yogh;ong king i-maked is
For-to a-mendi a&yogh;einest him &punctelev; þat þov hast is fader i-don a-mis
And swer þene othþ to beon him trewe &punctelev; and of þe baronie al-so
Þat þou halst of him in chef &punctelev; do þat þo[u] au&yogh;test him for-to do
Þe clerkes þat þov bringest with þe &punctelev; &yogh;if here-ate heo wollez at-stonde
Schullen suerie þe kinge trewe to beo &punctelev; oþur heo schullen out of londe."
[Thomas.]¶ "Bev frere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "I-nelle þe no-þing lie
Þe kinge ichulle don ri&yogh;t and lawe &punctelev; of þe baronie
Ake nolde it god þat holi churche &punctelev; onder fote were so
Þat ich oþur mine clerkus &punctelev; scholden ani othþ þe kinge do
For þov wost wel alle þe lewede Men &punctelev; þat beoth In his londe
Ne sweriez him nou&yogh;t þene oth &punctelev; as ich me onder-stonde
Nov wolde &yogh;e holi churche &punctelev; In grete seruage do
In more þane ani lewede man beo? &punctelev; nai, it ne worth nou&yogh;t so."
[Miles.]¶ "Me þinchez wel," quath sire Reynaud &punctelev; "þat þov nelt do no-þing
Of þe heste þat we bringez &punctelev; fram ore louerd þe king
Al-so in is half we hotez þe &punctelev; þat þov a-soili al-so
his bischopes þat þov hast &punctelev; In mansinge i-do."
[thomas.]¶ "bev frere," quathþ[MS. quathy] seint thomas &punctelev; "it nis mi dede nou&yogh;t
Ake þoru&yogh; þe popes owene mouthþ &punctelev; in sentence heo beoth i-brou&yogh;t
¶ And þou wost wel it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to me &punctelev; þe popus dede on-do."
[Miles.]"Þei þe pope it hete do," quat sire Reynaud &punctelev; "þoru&yogh; þe it is i-do."
¶ "&yogh;if þe pope hath," quath thomas &punctelev; "In sentence i-brou&yogh;t[thomas.]
heom þat habbez me mis-don &punctelev; he ne mis-paiez me nou&yogh;t."
[Miles.]¶ "In eche manere þov schewest wel" &punctelev; sire Reinaud seide þo
"For-to a-nuye ore louerd þe king &punctelev; and þat þov art is fo
&YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; we i-seoth wel &punctelev; þat þov wilnest to don him wo
And woldest beo king in is stude— &punctelev; ake þou ne worst neuere so
And &yogh;if þou mi&yogh;test, bi-nime him is crovne— &punctelev; ake so ne schal it nou&yogh;t go."[both lines transposed in other MSS.]
¶ "Certes, bev frere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "I-ne þenche no-þing þer-to
Ake raþur ichulle him þer-to helpe &punctelev; so muche so ich mai
And for him and for his honour &punctelev; ich bidde ni&yogh;t and dai
For þare nis nouþe man on eorþe &punctelev; þat ich louie, i-wis
So muche ase him, sauue is fader &punctelev; þat &yogh;eot mi louerd is
A-seinte Marie dai Maugdeleyne &punctelev; for-soþe i segge þe
Þo þe a-cord was formest i-maked &punctelev; bi-twene mi louerd and me
he seide me þat ich lete a-mansi &punctelev; alle þat hadden mis-do
Mine churche þat is his owene Moder— &punctelev; and ich habbe idon so."
¶ "A-voy, sire preost," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "to muche þov spext nei&yogh;
Þov desclaundrest þin owene louerd &punctelev; þov ne art noþer guod ne slei&yogh;
[Miles.]Seistþov þat mi louerd þe king &punctelev; In mansinge let do
Alle þat maden is sone king? &punctelev; ne consentede he þer-to
Nas it al is owene dede &punctelev; and bi none oþur mannes lore
A-voy, sire preost, bi-þench þe bet &punctelev; ne seie þov so namore."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þou wost wel it was so,[thomas.]
For þou were þare þi-self þo &punctelev; and manie oþere þer-to
bischopus and Erchebischopus ek &punctelev; and oþere grete and hei&yogh;e
&YOGH;e fif hundred men and mo &punctelev; al-so þov wel i-sei&yogh;e."
[Miles.]¶ "beo stille," quath þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "hold þinne mouthþ, ich rede
Þov mis-seist mi louerd þe king &punctelev; daþeit alle þat it seide
ho mi&yogh;te soffri swuch sclaundre &punctelev; bote he nome þar-of wreche
bi þe fei þat schal to god &punctelev; man schal þe an-oþur teche!"
his felawes euerechone &punctelev; heore Armes a-brod caste
And ferden ase Men þat weren wode &punctelev; and þretneden him wel faste
to þe Monekus heo wenden a-non &punctelev; "comieth here forth," he seide
"&YOGH;e holdeth here þe kingus fo &punctelev; witiez him wel, ich rede;
Þat &yogh;e to þe kingus wille &punctelev; is bodi &yogh;e[om. &yogh;e] habben al-&yogh;are
Oþur he schal ouwer londes aboute &punctelev; and ower maneres maken wel bare!"
[thomas.]¶ "Sire Reynaud," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "wenstþou þat ichulle fleo
Nai par deu, nou&yogh;t a fote &punctelev; for þe king ne for þe."
[Miles.]¶ "bi god, sire bischop," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "bi þat þou wost þen ende
Þi fleoinge schal beo luyte wurth &punctelev; þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t wel fer wende."
Þis kni&yogh;tes in grete wrathþe þo &punctelev; wenden heom forth ech-on
And leten heom army swyþe wel &punctelev; and comen a-&yogh;en a-non
W[i]th suerdes and with axes &punctelev; and with oþere armes mo;
Robert de brok, þe luþere clerk &punctelev; he was with heom þo
Into þe cloistre of Caunterburi &punctelev; with grete noyse heo comen weue
Þe Monekus songen Euesong &punctelev; for it was wel-nei&yogh; eue
Some for þe grete noyse &punctelev; fullen a-doun for fere
And some bi-gonne to fleon a-boute &punctelev; ase men þat witlese were
Seint thomas nam ane Croyz &punctelev; ake oþure armes non
And þare-with wel baldeliche &punctelev; he eode a-&yogh;ein is fon
Þis Monekus ornen[MS. ornem] to him some &punctelev; "sire, merci," heo seiden
"For godes loue a-bid &yogh;ut here &punctelev; ore louerd þe mai &yogh;uyt rede;
Soffre þat we helpen þe &punctelev; oþur þat we with þe dei&yogh;e."
Some wolden makien þe doren &punctelev; þo heo þat folk i-sei&yogh;e
"bi-leuez," quath þe holie Man &punctelev; "&yogh;e ne doth nou&yogh;t as þe wise
Singuth forth ower auesong &punctelev; and doth ore louerd is seruise
Man ne schal of holi churche &punctelev; castel maken non
latez foles ane stounde a-wede &punctelev; and in heore folie gon!"
Þe kni&yogh;tes comen reken In &punctelev; heore folie for-to do
And seiden, "&yogh;ware is nouþe þis traitour &punctelev; and þis false bischop also?"
[thomas.]¶ Seint thomas bar þe Croiz on honde &punctelev; and answerede is fon
"Ich am here, godus preost &punctelev; ake traitour nam ich non
Sechez him þat wole ov fleo &punctelev; oþur þat drede ovwer þretninge
Non rediore ne beoth ower swerdes &punctelev; me to deþe bringue
Þat min heorte prestore nis &punctelev; þene deþ for-to take;
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; I-nelle nou&yogh;t det for-sake."
Þare wende forth on of heom &punctelev; and is huyre of him drou&yogh;
And is mantel a-non after-ward &punctelev; with gret uilte i-nou&yogh;
Sire Reynaud le fiz ours &punctelev; pursiwede him anon
¶ "Sire Reynaud," quat seint thomas þo &punctelev; "hov schal þis nouþe gon
Ofte ich habbe þe guod i-do &punctelev; and manie oþure mo."
"Þov schalt sone," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "i-wite hou it go
Traitour, þou art ded a-non &punctelev; non oþur nelle ich do."
"For-soþe," quath þis holi man &punctelev; "wel prest ich am þer-to
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; dei&yogh;e ichulle wel fawe
&YOGH;if heo mi&yogh;te þere-after-ward &punctelev; in pais beo and in lawe
Ak ich ov bidde &yogh;if &yogh;e sechez me &punctelev; in ovre louerdes name
Þat &yogh;e ne comen nei&yogh; non oþur man &punctelev; harm ne do ne schame;
For non oþur gulti nis &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e witez me
heo buth alle gultlese bote ich one &punctelev; þar-of sikere &yogh;e beo;
And al-so ase heo gultlese beoth &punctelev; harmles latez heom wende."
Þe guode man sat a-doun a-kneo &punctelev; þo he sai al þe ende;
Forto a-fonge þene stronge deth &punctelev; is heued he buyde a-doun
And softe, ase some i-herden &punctelev; he seide þis oresoun
[Oratio thome.]¶ "Ore louerd and seinte Marie &punctelev; and seint Denis al-so
And alle þe avouwes of þis churche &punctelev; In &yogh;was ore ich am i-do
Ich bi-take mine soule here &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te."
&YOGH;eot he bad for holi churche &punctelev; þo he nadde non oþur mi&yogh;te
Sire Reynaud le fiz ovrs &punctelev; mest schrewe of ech-on
For-to smite þis holi man &punctelev; is swerd he drou&yogh; a-non
¶ Ake Edward grim, þat was is clerk &punctelev; in g[ra]unte-brugge i-bore
his louerd to helpe &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te &punctelev; his Arm he pulte bi-fore
he woundede is Arm swyþe sore &punctelev; þat blod orn faste a-doun
W[i]th þulke dunte he smot al-so &punctelev; seint thomas ope þe croun
Þat blod orn bi[MS. bi corr. to to] is face a-doun &punctelev; In is ri&yogh;t half of þe wounde
Lovde gradde þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "smitez alle to grounde!"
Edward grim and[MS. and and] alle is men &punctelev; þat þo a-boute him were
At-ornen a-boute ech in is side &punctelev; ope þe weuedes for fere
Ase it bi ore louerd ferde &punctelev; þo þe giwes him nome
his desciples flovwen anon &punctelev; men nusten &yogh;ware heo bi-come;
For in þe godspel it is i-writen &punctelev; þat ore louerd him-self seide
"&YOGH;wane a man smit þene schepherde &punctelev; þe schep wollez to-sprede";
And ore louered bad for is desciples &punctelev; þat men ne scholden hem[MS. him] non harm do
Þaron þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; he bad for is men al-so
An oþur kni&yogh;t smot seint thomas &punctelev; in þulke sulue wounde
And made him bouwie is face a-doun &punctelev; and loke toward þe grounde
Þe þridde in þulke sulue stude &punctelev; þare-after him smot a-non
And makede him loute a-doun &punctelev; is face to þe ston
In þulke stude þe feorþe smot &punctelev; þare þe oþere hadden er i-do
Þat þe point of is swerd brak &punctelev; In þe Marbre ato.
¶ &YOGH;eot þat ilke point at Caunterburi &punctelev; þe Monekus doth wite
For honour of þe holi man &punctelev; þat þare-with was i-smite.
With þulke stroke he smot al of &punctelev; þe scholle and þe croune
Þat þut brain ful on þe pauement &punctelev; al a-brod þare doune
þat &yogh;wite brayn[MS. braym] was i-meind &punctelev; with þe rede blod þere
Þat colur was wel fair to seo &punctelev; þei ich[al. hit] reulich were
Al round it orn a-boute is heued &punctelev; ase it were a dyademe
And al-round þare-a-bouten it lay &punctelev; &yogh;ware-of men token grete &yogh;eme
For &yogh;wane men peyntiez an Anletnesse[al. halewe] &punctelev; &yogh;e ne seoth it nou&yogh;t bi-leued
Þat þere nis depeint a Roundel &punctelev; al-a-boute þe heued
bi þe diademe of is brayne &punctelev; þat he holi was
Þo þis holi man i-martret was &punctelev; þis kni&yogh;tes graden ech-on
"Þis traitour is to deþe i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; wende we henne a-non
Siwieth us &yogh;e kingus men alle &punctelev; and alle þat with him beoth
Of þis traytur &yogh;e beoth a-wreke &punctelev; ase &yogh;e nouþe i-seoth
he þou&yogh;te beo herre þane þe king &punctelev; and bi-nimen him is croune
And bringe to nou&yogh;t al engelond &punctelev; ake nouþe he lijth þare doune."
Ase þe giwes bi ore louerd seiden &punctelev; þo heo wolden him to deþe do
Þat he made him kin[g] and non nas &punctelev; and godes sone al-so
Þo þis luþere kni&yogh;tes weren &punctelev; fram þis holi man igon
Robert de brok him bi-þou&yogh;te &punctelev; and turnede him a-&yogh;en a-non
And þoru&yogh; þe scolle smot is swerd &punctelev; deope with-Inne is heued
Þo þe scolle al amti was &punctelev; and no brayn Inne bi-leued
Ase þe giwes leten smite ore louerd &punctelev; to þe heorte grounde
After þe deþe with a spere &punctelev; and maden þe fifte wounde
¶ Þis luþere men alle in one stude &punctelev; smiten seint thomas
In þe scolle ri&yogh;t euene a-brod &punctelev; þare is croune was
he nas nou&yogh;t þe man þat he wolde &punctelev; is heued enes with-drawe
Ne fondi for-to fleo heore strokes &punctelev; ne enes a-weiward wawe
Ne nou&yogh;t enes groni ne makien cri &punctelev; bote mildeliche and softe
Euere he heold is heued forth &punctelev; al-þei heo smiten him ofte.
Þis luþere kni&yogh;tes wenden a-non &punctelev; to is tresorie
breken is doren and is coffres &punctelev; and duden gret robberie;
heo nomen is cloþes and is hors &punctelev; and is tresor al-so
Chartres and oþur priue writes &punctelev; þat in is coffres weren i-do
heo it bi-token sire Randolf de brok &punctelev; þat he þare-with wende
to þe kinge in-to Noremandie &punctelev; and segge þat heo him sende
And þat he dude þare-with &yogh;wat he wolde &punctelev; and &yogh;if þare ani were
A&yogh;en is wille oþur is fraunchise &punctelev; þat he[MS. heo] sone to-tere
A-mong is tresor heo founden al-so &punctelev; tweie wel stronge heren
Wel filliche heo casten heom a-wei &punctelev; ase þei heo nou&yogh;t wurth nere
Ake naþeles heo bi-þou&yogh;ten heom þo &punctelev; and weren somdel in fere
And seiden bi-twene heom stilleliche &punctelev; "guod man we wenez he were."
Sire willam traci tolde sethþe &punctelev; of þis guode man seint thomas
Þe bischope of Eccetre in is schrifte &punctelev; ase he of him i-schriue was
Þat þo þe guode man was a-slawe &punctelev; and heo ovtward were
So sore heom a-gros þat heo weren &punctelev; nei&yogh; witlese for fere;
For heom þou&yogh;te euere ase heo eoden outward &punctelev; ne wenden heo no so bliue
Þat þe eorþe openede onder heom &punctelev; for-to swolewen hem a-liue.
¶ Þo þis guod man i-martred was &punctelev; and þe kni&yogh;tes weren out i-gon
In-to al þe toun of Caunterburi &punctelev; couth it was anon
Þat folc cride deolfulliche &punctelev; and to churche heo drowe
And onovreden þat holi bodi &punctelev; and custen it ofte i-nowe
Þe Monekus comen sone þer-to &punctelev; and þis holi bodi toke
And leiden faire In one bere &punctelev; and bi-fore þe Autere it bi-woke
Þat face was &yogh;wy&yogh;t and cler i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; and no blod nas þar-inne
bote fram þe ri&yogh;t half of is frount &punctelev; toward þe left chinne
A smal rewe þere was of blode &punctelev; þat ouer is nose drou&yogh;;
More blod þar nas in al is face &punctelev; ase folk i-sai&yogh; i-nou&yogh;
Þe woundene bledden al þe ni&yogh;t &punctelev; and men henten þare-of, i-wis
And In þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; of þulke blode &yogh;eot is
Ake he nas neuere of þe worse hewe &punctelev; for al þat he bledde þere
bote in guode heowe and cler inov &punctelev; ri&yogh;t ase he liues were
And somdel ley&yogh;inde with þe mouþe— &punctelev; he lai ase þei he slepe
Muche folk was a-boute him &punctelev; þat blod for-to kepe
And forto gaderi of þe blode &punctelev; þat i-sched was on þe grounde
And of þat eorþe þat was bi-bled &punctelev; and glade weren &yogh;wan heo it founden
¶ For þat nolde heom noman werne— &punctelev; þicke a-wei men it drou&yogh;;
And ho-so mi&yogh;te enes þat bodi cusse &punctelev; he was glad i-nou&yogh;
A-morewe þe luþere kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; Armeden heom eft-sone
And with-oute toun nome heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wat heom was to done;
heo bi-radden for-to nime þat holi bodi &punctelev; and with wilde hors to-drawe
And sethþe hangen it on a waritreo— &punctelev; heo seiden þat it was lawe
For he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe to beon i-bured &punctelev; In churche ne In churche|&yogh;erd
Þe Monekus þou&yogh;ten þis swiþe wel &punctelev; and weren ful sore a-ferd
heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; hasteliche þere-bi-side
With luyte solempnete i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; for heo ne dorsten no leng a-bide
Þis holi bodi was i-bured &punctelev; In þe munstre of ihesu crist
bi-fore seint Austines weuede &punctelev; and seint Iohanes þe baptist
heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t so longue &punctelev; for-to þat bodi i-wasche were
Al ongreiþet to leggen it In &punctelev; [heo] hei&yogh;eden bliue for fere
Ase heo strepten of is cloþes &punctelev; al a-boue heo founde
Clerkene cloþes ase him to bi-feol &punctelev; and oþere bi þe grounde
Monekene Abite with-Inne &punctelev; ase heo founden þere
boþe Covele and stamin &punctelev; he founden next is here
So þat he was Monek with-Inne &punctelev; and seculer with-oute
Nuste no man is priueite &punctelev; of þa[t] him was a-boute
And next is flesche þe here was &punctelev; with knottes mani on
Þat deope in is flesche seten &punctelev; some ri&yogh;t to þe bon;
Þar-of he hadde schurte and brech &punctelev; luytel aise he mi&yogh;te i-fele
So þat he was þare-inne i-bounde &punctelev; fram þe scholdre to þe hele;
With luytel aise he mi&yogh;te sitte &punctelev; and ful on-aisi-liche ride
And on-aisiliche ligge also &punctelev; opon eþur side.[This v. on the margin.]
Ful of wormes was is flesch &punctelev; to al oþur wo
In none creature, ich onderstonde &punctelev; neuere ne weren i-seie mo;
For in euereche stude of is flesche &punctelev; so þicke heo weren i-sete
Þat þe grete ne mi&yogh;ten for þe smale &punctelev; comen to heore mete;
Faste heo schouen and cropen al-so &punctelev; ase ametene[formice overwr.] al a-boute
Ake þe smale cleoueden faste to &punctelev; þe grete bi-lefden with-oute
¶ he deide endleue houndret &yogh;er &punctelev; and seuenti and on
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; of is moder nam flesch and bon
Of þreo and fifti &yogh;eres elde &punctelev; him-sulf he was þo
Mani a fair dai he hadde i-leoued &punctelev; in care and in wo.
Þe king was in normandie &punctelev; and her-of nuste nou&yogh;t
he made deol and sorewe i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þo þe tiþinge him was i-brou&yogh;t
In þe Castel of Argenteyn &punctelev; he soiornede þo;
With-oute þe &yogh;ates ne cam he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; fourti dai&yogh;es ne mo
Ake euere he heold him in priuete &punctelev; In wepinge and oþur wo;
For none neode þat Man mi&yogh;te habbe &punctelev; with-oute he nolde go;
Ne rou&yogh;te he no-þing of þe world &punctelev; wel luyte he eat al-so;
Þe sorewe and þe deol þat he made &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te neuere beo i-do
he sende a-non to Caunterburi &punctelev; for þis deolful dede
And bad þe Monekus pitousliche &punctelev; þat heo for him bede;
And sende heom þat it nas &punctelev; no-þing bi is rede
Ake þat þe kni&yogh;tes wenden forth &punctelev; and no-þing him fore ne seide
And þat he sende after heom &punctelev; for-to comen a-&yogh;e
¶ And are þe messeger were to heom i-come &punctelev; huy weren fer in þe se
to þe pope al-so god &punctelev; þe king sende sone
And bad is conseil pitousliche &punctelev; &yogh;wat him were to done
he bad him for þe loue of god &punctelev; In swyche anguise him rede
Þat he were i-schriue and a-soilled &punctelev; of so luþer a dede
Þe pope hadde ful gret pite &punctelev; þat he swuch word him sende
¶ And gret Ioye for he hadde wille &punctelev; is lif for-to amende
twei cardinales he sende him &punctelev; wise men boþe to
to schriuen him of þulke sunne &punctelev; and a-soilli him al-so
And þe bischopus for-to a-soilli al-so &punctelev; þat weren in mansinge
Welle, þat þe Cardinales &punctelev; welcome weren þe kinge
Þe king bad heom deolfulliche &punctelev; to schriuen him of þe dede
And bi-het heom studefastliche &punctelev; to stonden al-to heore rede
he swor on þe halidom &punctelev; þat þoru&yogh; him nas it nou&yogh;t
Ne bi is wille, ne bi his heste &punctelev; þat he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t;
And &yogh;et he seide þat for is fader deþe &punctelev; so sori man he nas
Ne for is moderes no-þe-mo &punctelev; Ase he for is deþe was;
And he seide he wolde with guode heorte &punctelev; alle þe penaunces a-fonge
Þat heo wolden on him legge &punctelev; ne weren heo no so stronge
For he was enchaison of is deþe &punctelev; and of is anuy al-so
Þe kni&yogh;tes, for-to paien him &punctelev; brou&yogh;ten him þer-to
¶ Þo þe Cardinales i-sei&yogh;en þis &punctelev; þat he to repentaunce drou&yogh;
heo a-soileden him and setten on him &punctelev; stronge penaunce i-nou&yogh;
In priuete ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; þat no man þar-of nuste
And þis al-so þat ichulle novþe telle &punctelev; þat alle Men of wusten
his priue penaunces some weren &punctelev; fastinge for-to make
[vv. 2261-2 om. in the other MSS.]And In fale tymes linne cloth and schurte of selk &punctelev; for is sunnes for-sake
In-to þe holie londe he scholde finde &punctelev; to hundret kny&yogh;tes, to fi&yogh;te
Al ane &yogh;er with þe templers &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te;
¶ And þat he scholde þe status of Clarindone &punctelev; al clanliche with|drawe
Þoru &yogh;wuche statuz þis holi man &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t was of lijf-dawe;
And þat he clanliche &yogh;olde a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; al þat bi-nome was
Þe bischopriche of Caunterburi &punctelev; for wrathe of seint thomas;
And þat he scholde is vuele wille &punctelev; also clanliche for-&yogh;iue
Alle þat he hadde out of londe &punctelev; for wrathe of him i-driue
Þe king grauntede al heore wille &punctelev; weopinde swiþe sore
And seide þat it was to luyte &punctelev; and bad on him legge more
And &yogh;eot, "al to ouwer wille here &punctelev; mi bodi ich bi-take
&YOGH;iueth me penaunces i-nowe &punctelev; I-nelle neuer on for-sake."
he wende out atþe Churche dore &punctelev; a-soiled forto beo
And seide þat he nas nou&yogh;t wurthe &punctelev; þat men scholde him with-inne i-seo;
And with-oute churche pitousliche &punctelev; he sat a-doun a-kne
Ake þe Cardinales nolden nou&yogh;t &punctelev; is bodi al on-wreo
And somdel a-boue is cloþes &punctelev; heo a-soileden him ri&yogh;t þere;
For deol heo weopen pitousliche &punctelev; and manie þat þare were
his sone al-so made one bi-heste &punctelev; with wel dreorie chere
Þe faderes penaunce to folfulle &punctelev; &yogh;if he of power nere
Oþur &yogh;if he felle in-to feble stat &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te it nou&yogh;t ful-ende
Opon him-self þe charge he nam &punctelev; and dude ase guod and hende
Þus was þe holi man &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t to martyrdom;
Mani was þe fair miracle &punctelev; þat for him sone com.[Both verses are written in one line.]
[Jerusalem.]¶ For In Ierusalemes londe men wusten &punctelev; of is martyrdom
With-Inne þe furste fourtene-Ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he þe det nam
For a Monek in þulke londe &punctelev; In is deþe vuele lai
And is Abbod cam to him &punctelev; bi-fore is ende-dai[Both verses are written in one line.]
And conIurede him[MS. him þat him] þat he scholde &punctelev; after is deþe þere
to him comen and tellen him fore &punctelev; in &yogh;wuch stat he were
So þat þis Monek deide sone &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
to is Abbod sethþe he cam &punctelev; ase he I-conioured was
And seide þat he i-saued was &punctelev; In þe Ioie of heuene an hei&yogh;;
he tolde him muche of þe Ioye &punctelev; þat he þare i-sei&yogh;
he tolde him þat þulke tyme &punctelev; þat he to heuene cam
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; þolede martyrdom
And þat is soule þulke tyme &punctelev; to heuene wende a-non;
"Fair was þat processioun &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;en him cam gon
Of Aungles and of patriarks &punctelev; and of apostles al-so
Of Martirs and of confessours &punctelev; and of virgines þer-to
heo nome alle þeos holi soule &punctelev; And bi-fore ore louerd sone
brou&yogh;ten hire with Ioye and blisse &punctelev; ase he sat in is throne
his croune was al of i-smite &punctelev; and blodi was is heued
And is brayn was al i-sched &punctelev; þare nas nou&yogh;t bi-leued
¶ 'Thomas, thomas,' quath ore louerd &punctelev; 'þus it fallez to þe
To þine louerdus court to come &punctelev; In swuche manere to me
For þi seruise ich þe &yogh;yue &punctelev; ase muchel Ioie and blis
Ase ich &yogh;af seint peter &punctelev; þat min Apostel is.'
he sette ane Croune op-on is heued &punctelev; of golde cler and guod
Swyþe wel bi-cam þat bri&yogh;te gold &punctelev; op-on þe rede blod
More Ioie ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; þane In heuene for him was
For þe Erchebischope of caunterburi &punctelev; is name was seint thomas
Þe Tywesdai after Cristemasse &punctelev; þe furste þat þere cam
Þis holi man in Engelonde &punctelev; þolede martyrdom;
And &yogh;wan þov i-heorst of is deþe telle &punctelev; of Men of Engelonde
Þov i-leue me of þis tale &punctelev; and þe soþe onder-stonde."
Þe Abbod sone a-morewe &punctelev; ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t seint thomas
Ake þe patria[r]cke of Ierusalem &punctelev; he tolde al hov it was
So þat forþere in þe &yogh;ere &punctelev; it was wel onder-stonde
Þo pilegrimes þudere comen &punctelev; out of Engelonde
In &yogh;wat manere he was a-slawe &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch tyme he was ded
Þe pilegrimes tolden al þe soþe &punctelev; ase þe Monek hadde er i-seid
Þus was i-kud In Ierusalem &punctelev; þe deth of seint thomas
With-Inne þe furste fourtene ny&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he i-martred was.
[Guerra regum.]¶ þe fifte &yogh;er, ich onder-stonde &punctelev; after is martyr-dom
bi-twene kyng henri and is sone &punctelev; gret contek þare bi-com
Þe sone bi-cam prout a-non &punctelev; for is kynedom
And of is fader tolde luyte &punctelev; and werre ope him nam
Þe meste del was with is sone &punctelev; of al Engelonde
And þe kyng of Fraunce al-so &punctelev; and þe king of scotlonde
So þat þis seli oldeman &punctelev; In sorewe was I-nov&yogh;
Al he it wuste þe luþere dede &punctelev; þat man seint thomas a-slou&yogh;
he wende him out of Normundie &punctelev; to-ward Engelonde
Are he come to Caunterbiri &punctelev; he nolde nou&yogh;were at-stonde;
And þo he cam fer w[i]th-oute þe toun &punctelev; he gan to li&yogh;te a-doun
Al a-fote and bare-fot &punctelev; he wende into þe toun
In is Curtel one and on-gurd &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;
Ri&yogh;t so he wende to þe stude &punctelev; þere seint thomas lai
At is toumbe he feol a-doun a-kneo &punctelev; wepinde wel sore
he heold op is hondene deolfolliche &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
¶ Wepinde in is oresones &punctelev; al fastinde he lai
At þis holi mannes toumbe &punctelev; a ny&yogh;t and al a dai;
Of euerech Monek of þe hous &punctelev; he tok is discipline
With a smart &yogh;eorde, and &yogh;eot him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þere was to luyte pine
he bad heom alle deolfulliche &punctelev; bidden for him one
And swor he wolde legge a-doun &punctelev; þe luþere lawene ech-one
¶ So þat he let singe ane masse &punctelev; are he þannes wende
In þe honour of seint thomas &punctelev; þat he is grace him sende
Þe &yogh;wyle men þe masse songe &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
Þe kyng of Scotlond was i-nome &punctelev; þat mest is fo was;
And manie oþere also with him &punctelev; þat weren is stron[ge] fon;
So þat heo þat weren vn-nome &punctelev; to him nadden power non
his folk dude þe bataille &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle þe masse i-laste[MS. staste];
Þar-to heo hadden luyte help &punctelev; and weren wel sore agaste
Ake ore louerd for seint thomas loue &punctelev; his grace wel sone him caste
So þat heore fon weren some[m MS. sone] i-nome &punctelev; and some flouwen wel faste
So þat þis seli olde king &punctelev; þat al bi-neþe er was
Al a-boue was sone i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; þoru&yogh; bone of seint thomas;
And is sone was al bi-neþe &punctelev; and so he bi-&yogh;at wel luyte
For-to weorri a&yogh;ein is fader &punctelev; for is sori pruyte
bi him men mowen nime ensaumple &punctelev; to beon to hastiue
to &yogh;iuen heore sones op heore lond &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle heo hem-sulue beoth a-liue
Þe kingus sone þare-after-ward &punctelev; prouede vuele i-nov&yogh;
And wel longe bi-fore þe fadere &punctelev; toward þe deþe he drou&yogh;
And fur-pinede in þe menisone &punctelev; þat is lif him þou&yogh;te long;
he deide sethþe deol-folliche &punctelev; in gret pine and strong
his broþer also, sire Geffrei &punctelev; þat Erl of brutayne was
Deide al-so in þe menison &punctelev; In þulke sulue cas
So þat after is fader deþe &punctelev; þare ne lefde eir non
bote heore &yogh;ongue broþer king Richard &punctelev; and sethþe þe king Iohan
Ake sire Geffreies child &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te lawe of londe
Þe heritage scholde habbe i-bore &punctelev; ase ich me onder-stonde.
[Mors Militum.]¶ Þeos luþere kni&yogh;tes alle foure &punctelev; þat slowen seint thomas
Deiden in stronge deþe i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; ase wel ri&yogh;t it[MS. it it] was
heo weren echone repentaunt &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;ten none men more
euere heo criden on seint thomas &punctelev; to &yogh;iuen heom milce and ore
Sone after-ward þat he was a-slawe &punctelev; al heore guod huy lete
And wenden to þe holi lond &punctelev; heore sunnes for-to bete
Ake sire Willame traci ne wende nou&yogh;t &punctelev; forth with þe oþere þreo
he hopede here In Engelonde &punctelev; Inou&yogh; repentaunt to beo
[These two verses are tr. in the MS.]Þare-after-ward he bi-cam &punctelev; in grete meseise and strong
his flesch bi-gan to breken out &punctelev; and rotede an fovle stonk
So longue þat he stonk so foule &punctelev; þat deul it was to se
Þat onneþe ani man mi&yogh;te &punctelev; for stunche nei&yogh; him beo
his flesch rotede on him al-so &punctelev; and al dai ful awei
Þat is bones weren al bare— &punctelev; þo ne likede him no plei
Wit is hondene he to-drou&yogh; al-so &punctelev; his flesch atþe laste
pece and oþur al a-brod &punctelev; a-wei fram him he caste;
hondene and Armes he to-drov&yogh; &punctelev; mest of ech-on
Þat þere nas no flesch bi-leued &punctelev; bote senue and bare bon
Manie men it þou&yogh;ten wel &punctelev; þat bi is wille it were
Al for-to biete[MS. biete] is sunnes here &punctelev; þat is soule in helle nere
Wrechchedore gost ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; þane þis prisun was;
And euere he cride deolfulliche &punctelev; "merci, seint thomas."
Atþe laste he let is lijf &punctelev; In wel stronge pine
And &yogh;if ore louerdes wille was &punctelev; he cam to guode fine
Þis kni&yogh;tes aftur heore luþere dedene[al. dede] &punctelev; deiden sone ech-on
So þat with-Inne þe þridde &yogh;ere &punctelev; a-liue ne lefde þer non
For þe sauter seith þat swuche men &punctelev; þat of tricherie beoth
Ne schullen nou&yogh;t halue heore dawes libbe &punctelev; ase &yogh;e alda[i] i-seoth;
Þei heo beon swyþe repentaunt &punctelev; ase þis kni&yogh;tes weren, ich wene
&YOGH;uyt ne libbeth heo nou&yogh;t half heore lif &punctelev; ant þat was bi heom i-sene.
¶ Seint thomas þis holi man &punctelev; onder eorþe he lay
Are þat he I-schrined were &punctelev; wel mani a long day;
he lai þere nine[al. inne] and fourti &yogh;er &punctelev; and half a &yogh;er þer-to
And a-boute ane Ei&yogh;te dawes &punctelev; are he were of eorþe i-do
god wolde a-bide ane guode tyme &punctelev; to don so noble þing
Þat þare weren boþe guode &punctelev; Erchebischop and king
For þe king Iohan þat longue was &punctelev; euere of luþere rede
luyte þou&yogh;te bi is daie &punctelev; to don so guode dede
¶ Ake þe king henri, is &yogh;onge sone &punctelev; nolde nou&yogh;t longe a-fine
After þat he was king i-mad &punctelev; are seint thomas were in schrine
he nas nou&yogh;t þrettene &yogh;eres old &punctelev; þo he dude þis noble þing
And it was in þe feorþe &yogh;ere &punctelev; þat he was i-mad &yogh;ong king
Þe guode Erchebischop steuene &punctelev; radde faste þer-to
So þat bi hore boþe redes &punctelev; þis dede was i-do
Þe pope honorie, þat was þo &punctelev; hidere he gan sende
Ane legat fram Rome, þat het pandulf &punctelev; to bringe þis dede to ende
Þe pope &yogh;af alle pardon &punctelev; þat þudere wolden gon
Þat men nusten in Engelonde &punctelev; suuych pardon non
Þare-fore, for-to honouri þis holi man &punctelev; þere cam folk i-nov&yogh;;
Of bischopes and of Abbodes &punctelev; mani on þudere drou&yogh;
Of priores and of persones &punctelev; and manie oþur clerkes al-so;
Of Eorles and of barones &punctelev; and manie kni&yogh;tes heom to;
Of seriaunz and of squiers &punctelev; and oþere house-bondes i-nowe;
And þe simple men of þe londe &punctelev; so þicke þudere drowe
Þat al þe contreie þare-a-boute &punctelev; þe tounes wide and longe[MS. londe]
Vnneþe mi&yogh;ten al þat folk &punctelev; þat þudere cam a-fonge
¶ So þat þis hei&yogh;e men &punctelev; þat scholden þis dede do
Weren in care hov heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; for prece comen þer-to;
So þat Erchebischop steuene &punctelev; of &yogh;wam ich er ov seide
And þe bischop Richard of Salesburi &punctelev; þar-of heom nomen to rede
And prior water of þe house &punctelev; and þe couent al-so
Wenden heom in priuete &punctelev; þis dede for-to do
bi ni&yogh;te, þo men weren a-slepe &punctelev; and luyte þar-on þou&yogh;te
heo nomes[r. nomen] op þe holi bones &punctelev; and in one cheste brou&yogh;te
And setten heom in a priue stude &punctelev; for-to þe time was i-come
þat[MS. hit] was i-crid into al þat lond &punctelev; þat heo scholden beo up i-nome
It was in þe monþe of Iulie &punctelev; euene þene seuenthe dai
bi a tiwesdai it was þo &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;
Þo þe dai was i-come &punctelev; to þe munstre heo wenden a-non
Kyng henri þat &yogh;onge child &punctelev; an þe hei&yogh;e men ech-on;
A-boute onderne of þe daie &punctelev; to þis holi bones heo come
PAndulf wende furst þer-to &punctelev; þat legat was of rome
And þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; and þe Erchebischop of reins al-so
Þat for þulke þinge cam &punctelev; fram bi-&yogh;eonde se þer-to
And sire hubert de boru&yogh; &punctelev; þat þo was hei&yogh; Iustise
Þeos foure grete louerdes &punctelev; þat noble men weren and wise
On heore scholdres huy nomen up &punctelev; þis holi bodi a-non;
¶ Bischopus and Abbodes al-so &punctelev; it beren ful mani on
to þe hei&yogh;e weuede of þe trinite &punctelev; þe holie bones heo bere
And leiden þe Cheste al þare-with &punctelev; In a noble schrine þere
Þis king henri was so &yogh;ong &punctelev; þat he ne dorste nou&yogh;t
With þe oþere bere þat holi bodi &punctelev; laste men him hurten ou&yogh;t
It was bi a tiwesdai &punctelev; þat heo þe bones op nome;
Alle is chaunces þat he hadde &punctelev; bi tiwesdawes him come
In a tiwesdai he was i-bore &punctelev; and of is moder wombe he cam;
And also ase men bringuth ane þeof &punctelev; for-to a-fonge is dom
bi-fore þe kynge at Norehaumptone &punctelev; op-on a tiwes-dai&yogh;
Wit gret schame he was i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; ase al þat folk i-sai&yogh;
Filloker þane ani þef &punctelev; folk him þare schende;
bi tiwesday he was i-flemd al-so &punctelev; and out of londe he wende;
And bi a tiwesdai&yogh; at pounteneie &punctelev; ore louerd to him com
And seide to him þat swete word &punctelev; of is martyrdom
¶ "Thomas," seide ore swete louerd &punctelev; "&yogh;eot schal of þine blode
Al mi churche honoured beo—" &punctelev; þis wordes weren wel guode;
bi a tiwesdai also gud &punctelev; to engelonde he cam
After þat he was i-flemd &punctelev; to a-fonge is martirdom;
bi a tiwesdai at Caunterburi &punctelev; to deþe he was i-do;
And sethþe bi a tiwes-dai &punctelev; Ischrined he was al-so
Þeos seuen Auntres bi tiwesday &punctelev; him comen atþe leste
Þare-fore we i-seoth manie men &punctelev; makien one bi-heste
to bi-leue flesch þene tiwesdai &punctelev; oþur to o mel faste
For-to heo comen to Caunterburi &punctelev; oþur þe &yogh;wyle heore lif i-lastez
Nov Iesu crist for þulke loue &punctelev; þat seint thomas on þou&yogh;te
&YOGH;yue us part of þulke Ioie &punctelev; þat he so deore a-bou&yogh;te
AL þis bok is i-maked of holi dawes &punctelev; and of holie mannes liues
Þat soffreden for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; pinene manie and riue
Þat ne spareden for none ei&yogh;e &punctelev; godes weorkes to wurche;
Of &yogh;was liues &yogh;wane heore feste fallez &punctelev; men redez in holi churche
Þei ich of alle ne mouwe nou&yogh;t telle &punctelev; ichulle telle of some
Ase euerech feste after oþur &punctelev; In þe &yogh;ere doth come.
Þe furste feste þat in þe &yogh;ere comez &punctelev; we cleopiez &yogh;eres-dai
Ase ore louerd was circumciset &punctelev; In þe giwene lay
For to fulfullen heore lawe &punctelev; and for cristinedom non nas
Are longe þare-afturward &punctelev; þat he I-cristned was
¶ He was Nyne and twenti &yogh;er &punctelev; and þrettene dawes old
Are he i-baptized were &punctelev; ase þe bok us hath i-told
Al-so it fel a twelfte-dai &punctelev; seint Iohan þe baptist
Baptizede in þe flum Iordan &punctelev; ore louerd Ihesu crist
In þat dai a twelf-monþe &punctelev; ore louerd was at one feste
Þare he turnde water to win &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is moder heste
We holdez al-so þat dai feste &punctelev; of þe þridde þinge
Ase þe þre kingues to ore louerd &punctelev; presaunt dude bringe;
to him heo comen ase is moder &punctelev; a-child-bedde lay
After þat he i-bore was &punctelev; þane þretteþe day
Ase it fallez a-twelfte-dai— &punctelev; longe heo erore him sou&yogh;ten
gold. and. mirre. and An-sens &punctelev; In presaunt heo him brou&yogh;ten.
Seint Fabian þrettene &yogh;er &punctelev; pope was[MS. was was] In rome;
he turnede mani men þat luþere weren &punctelev; in-to cristine-dome
Decius, þat prince was &punctelev; of heþenesse þo
he let him martri þere-fore &punctelev; and oþere with him mo
Telle ichulle of þe holi man &punctelev; seint Sebastian
he seruede ane heþe amperour &punctelev; þat het dyoclician;
hext maister he was onder him &punctelev; to don al is wille
Cristine Man he was bi-come &punctelev; bote þar-of he heold him stille
for no doute of Martyrdom &punctelev; ake for þat he wolde longe
Serui god almi&yogh;ti, are he wolde &punctelev; deth onder-fonge
Alle þe men þat cristine weren &punctelev; þat þe Aumperor ou&yogh;wer founde
Sone he let to deþe bringe &punctelev; with fuyre oþur mid wounde
&YOGH;wane ani man for cristindom &punctelev; to deþe scholde beon brou&yogh;t
Seint Sebastian heom confortede &punctelev; þat heo ne dradden heom nou&yogh;t
Deth a-fonge for godes loues &punctelev; Ake þat heo studefaste were;
Mani he heold in þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue &punctelev; þat flechchi wolden for fere
¶ Marcus and Marcellian &punctelev; breþren weren tweie
Þe Aumperour for cristinedom &punctelev; I-nome hadde heom bei&yogh;e
he let heom binde to-gadere faste &punctelev; boþe to o piler
And to þe Eorþe naylli heore fet &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten fer ne ner
So heo stoden al ane day and a ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þat non ne mi&yogh;ten fram oþer;
Eiþur of heom ofte to oþere seide &punctelev; "here is ioye, leue broþer!"
guod it is and murie &punctelev; breþren to wonie i-fere
Euere heo precheden cristindom &punctelev; mid wel glade chere
Þe Aumperor let nimen ane spere &punctelev; ase heo stoden to-gadere i-bounde
Þoru&yogh; heore heortene he let heom smite &punctelev; þat heo deiden in a luyte stounde
Sebastian was þo i-wreid &punctelev; þat he heom &yogh;af þane red
to holden op faste heore cristindom &punctelev; þei heo scholden beo ded
Þe Aumperor let him cleopie &punctelev; "Sebastian," he sede
"to þe al mi truste was &punctelev; mi lond to wissi and rede
Of alle þing þat min is &punctelev; Ich &yogh;af þe mest power
to holden op min honour &punctelev; and to saui it fer and ner
Ich habbe to þe suspecion &punctelev; Ake for-soþe i-ne segge it nou&yogh;t
Þat þov a-&yogh;en me and a-&yogh;en min honour &punctelev; Itorned hast þi þou&yogh;[t]."
Sebastian seide, "sire Aumperour &punctelev; A&yogh;en þe neuere I nas
Ake mid þe and al þine þinge &punctelev; to þin honour ich was
And ofte ich habbe ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh; &punctelev; godes sone bi-sou&yogh;t
Al-so wisliche ase he with is heorte blode &punctelev; deore us hauez i-bou&yogh;t
Þat he þe &yogh;yue power gret &punctelev; and wille and eke þou&yogh;t
to leten þine false godes— &punctelev; for heo ne helpeth þe nou&yogh;t."
¶ Wod-wroth was þis Aumperor. &punctelev; "Sebastian," he seide
"habbe ich þus i-holde þe? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
bote þov honouri ore godus &punctelev; to swuche pine i schal þe take
Þat, are þov beo to deþe i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; ech lime þe schal ake."
"Sire," seide Sebastian &punctelev; "þine þretningue ne drede i nou&yogh;t
More me greuez þat þou nelt &punctelev; habbe reuþe in þi þou&yogh;t
And honouri him þat made þe man &punctelev; ant þine maumates bi-leue
Þat ne mouwe helpe nou&yogh;t &punctelev; for heo beoth doumbe and deue."
Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe was &punctelev; þesne holi man he let take
And dude him leden into þe feld &punctelev; and binde him to a stake
he let archers to him scheote &punctelev; ase it were to one marke;
With quareles and with Arewene &punctelev; heo maden him woundes starke
Mani on wende þoru&yogh;-out him &punctelev; in a luytel &yogh;wyle
heo stikeden al-so þicke on him &punctelev; so yrichon deth of piles
Þo heom þou&yogh;te þat he was ded &punctelev; hom heo gonne i-wende;
On-bured heo bi-lefden him þare &punctelev; his bodi for-to schenden
A cristine womman, þat hei&yogh;te Yreine &punctelev; wende þudere bi ni&yogh;te
Forto burien þat holi bodi &punctelev; &yogh;if heo it finde mi&yogh;te
heo cam and fond him hol and sound &punctelev; he nadde nou&yogh;t one wounde;
With gret Ioye heo ladde him to hire hous &punctelev; and glad was þat heo him founde
¶ Þene feorþe dai Sebastian &punctelev; wende to þe Aumperour
"Sire," he seide, "ichulle þe telle &punctelev; þat fallez to þin honour
&YOGH;e mis-bi-leuez, and men doth eov &punctelev; a-mis to onderstonde
Þat cristine men scholden harm do &punctelev; to þe and to al þine londe
For i-sosteyned and i-saued &punctelev; it is þoru&yogh; heore bone
More þane þoru&yogh; ouwer Maumates &punctelev; þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t wurhþ a spone
For we biddez ny&yogh;t and day &punctelev; god, þat me hidere sende
Þat he eov &yogh;iue long lijf &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e eov wollez a-mende."
"hou is þis?" quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þov a-liue beo
Nartþou nou&yogh;t Sebastian &punctelev; þat ich a-felde let sle?"
"&YOGH;e," he seide, þis holi man &punctelev; "a-liue ich am nouþe her
hol and sound, with-oute wounde &punctelev; to schewen þe godus pouwer
And to schewen þat &yogh;e onri&yogh;t doth &punctelev; cristine Men to sle
For heore bi-leue is ri&yogh;tful and guod &punctelev; and ouwere nis wuyrth a stre
Þare-fore on þine soule þench! &punctelev; ne bi-lef þou nou&yogh;t on a stone
Ake on him þat us deore a-bou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat is godes sone al one."
¶ "Ov&yogh;," seide þe Aumperovr þo &punctelev; "&yogh;ware is ovre mi&yogh;te
Schal þis þeof þoru&yogh; is wichchinge &punctelev; a-&yogh;en us with wordes fi&yogh;te?"
he let nimen sebastian &punctelev; and hom to is paleis lede
For no miracle þat he dude &punctelev; to wide scholde sprede
Laste Men torneden to cristindom &punctelev; In-to a priue stude he him ladde
With staues he let him to deþe beten. &punctelev; and þo heo a-slawe him hadde
In one Chaumbre foreine &punctelev; a-midde þe fuylthþ-hede
he let him honge with a rop— &punctelev; and þat was a vil dede
Þat bodi forto schende &punctelev; for he hadde drede
Þat cristine Men him wolden stele &punctelev; and is bodi a-wei lede
bi ni&yogh;te cam þis holi Man &punctelev; to a womman, þat het lucine
And tolde hire hou he ymartred was &punctelev; and in &yogh;wuche pine
An hou filliche is bodi heng &punctelev; and þat heo ase sone ase heo mi&yogh;te
his bodi fette, and burien it &punctelev; a-mong cristine men bi ni&yogh;te
Þis guode womman at Midni&yogh;t &punctelev; dude ase he hadde i-bede
Fette þat bodi and burede hit &punctelev; In a wel fair stude
Þus seint sebastian þe holi man &punctelev; is lif brou&yogh;te to ende
And fram þe pine of is liue &punctelev; to þe blisse of heuene he gan iwende
SEint Anneis, þat holi Maide &punctelev; wel &yogh;ong heo bi-gan
to serui god al-mi&yogh;ti &punctelev; to beon cristine womman
heo nas bote of þrettene &yogh;er &punctelev; þo heo was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t
For þe loue of Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat deore us hath i-bou&yogh;t
In rome, þare he wonede &punctelev; so fair creature nas non
Ase was þis maide forthward &punctelev; of felle noþer of bon
Ase þis Maide-child cam a dai &punctelev; goinde fram schole
Þe constables sone hire i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; and heold hire for fole;
he gan to louien hire in folie &punctelev; and for hire was in mourninge
And carede hov he mi&yogh;te best &punctelev; to ende his fole þou&yogh;t bringe
For stille mourninge þat he hadde &punctelev; he i-werth swuyþe lene
Þar-of wondrede muche is frend &punctelev; and &yogh;erne him duden bi-men[e]
heo axeden him a dai in priuete &punctelev; hov he dude fare
he gan to telle fram on to oþur &punctelev; &yogh;ware-of was is care
And hou he wolde him-self a-sle &punctelev; bote he þat maide hadde
Þe consta[b]le non oþur ne sai&yogh; &punctelev; is sone forth he ladde;
heo comen to Anneyse, þat Maide hende &punctelev; and nomen hire bi þe honde
Þe fader seide &punctelev; "lo here mi sone &punctelev; þat wurth riche heyr of londe
¶ A fair grace þe is i-come &punctelev; he hath is heorte to þe i-take;
Riche womman þou worst i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; he schal habbe þe to make;
hext þov worst of al þi kun &punctelev; of londe and oþur þinges
gold and seluer þe worth i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; broches and eke ringus."
Þat maide seide &punctelev; "go fram me &punctelev; þov luþe[r] deþes fode
Woldestþov defouli mi bodi? &punctelev; þov ne bringest me neuere in þat mode
Ich habbe me one spouse i-nome &punctelev; þou ne wost nou&yogh;wer swuch non
bri&yogh;tore þane þe sonne oþur ani li&yogh;t &punctelev; þat euere on eorþe schon
Of &yogh;was kuynde wondri may ech þing &punctelev; for is moder is clene mayde
his fader of womman neuere ne wuste &punctelev; so þe prophetus us saide;
Al þene world he made of nou&yogh;t &punctelev; and &yogh;af us ovre fode;
Wel deore with is swete blod &punctelev; he bou&yogh;te us on þe rode
Ane marke he hathz on me i-do &punctelev; þat I-ne scholde non oþur take
Deorewurþe þing he hath me bi-hote &punctelev; I-nelle him neuere fur-sake."
¶ Þe Constable het Symproni. &punctelev; "hov geth þis," he seide
"&YOGH;weþur þov bi-leue on þe false gode? &punctelev; torne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
And nim þis child to þi spouse &punctelev; and þenk on þine owene guod
Oþur ischal do þe so tormenti &punctelev; þat þov schalt nei&yogh; beo wod."
"beo stille," seide þis maide þo &punctelev; "be stille, þou deueles lime
Þov ne schalt to-dai for no þretning &punctelev; mi guode þou&yogh;[t] me bi-nime
Ich am redi for is loue &punctelev; þat deore me hath i-bou&yogh;t
tormenz a-fonge, and þe deth al-so &punctelev; for Ine drede me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
þe Constable let somony al þe cite &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te þis mayde heom bi-fore;
hire for-to schiende, he dude hire strepe &punctelev; so naked so heo was i-bore
Þat ech man scholde i-seon hire derne limes &punctelev; þe more hire to schende
"Onwreste man," þis mayde seide &punctelev; "schame þe worth atþenende
¶ Ne schameth þe no-þing in þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; bi womman þus to do
&YOGH;wan þou of womman art i-come &punctelev; and ech man is al-so?"
Þat[al. þat maide] was not[ags. hnot] for hire &yogh;ong-hede &punctelev; are hire smok were of i-nome
Þare was[MS. was was] on hire swete heued &punctelev; so muche fair her i-come
Þat hudde al hire swete bodi &punctelev; þat it tilde bi-neothe hire kne[MS. kneo];
Þo ne mi&yogh;ten men for here &punctelev; of hire bodi nou&yogh;t i-se
An hous þat seruede of bordel &punctelev; þare was bi-side
Þare-Inne þe constable hire let do &punctelev; and sethþe het crie wide
Þat alle þat wolden folie don &punctelev; þudere scholden wende
And finde þare a fol womman &punctelev; of bodie fair and hende
Þo þat Maide was þare-Inne i-do. &punctelev; so ful was þat hous of li&yogh;te
Þat no man for brij&yogh;t-hede &punctelev; þat Mayde i-seo ne mi&yogh;te
Þat Maide sat a-doun a-kneo &punctelev; and seide hire oresun þere
"Louerd," heo seide, "&yogh;ong ich am &punctelev; a-mong mine fon i-brou&yogh;t here
Euerech fondeth to don me schame &punctelev; þat he[r]-a-boute wendez
Louerd, ne &yogh;if neuere no luþer man power &punctelev; mi bodi for-to schende!"
Þis Maide sat euere in hire beden &punctelev; to ore louerd heo gan crie
hire ne mi&yogh;te no man for li&yogh;te i-seo &punctelev; þat come þere-In for folie
Ake euere &yogh;wane heo comen In &punctelev; to don heore fole þou&yogh;t
heo heorden hire crie on ore louerd so &yogh;erne &punctelev; and hire ne sei&yogh;en nou&yogh;t.[Vv. 63, 64 are tr. in the MS.]
¶ Þo bi-gan ech after oþur &punctelev; ase euer-ech with-Inne cam
For Miracle þat heo sei&yogh;en þere &punctelev; tuyrne to cristindom
And bi-gonne forth with hire &punctelev; to ore louerd &yogh;eorne crie
Þo was þat an hous of beden &punctelev; þat raþer was of folie
Ase þat maide sat and bad hire beden &punctelev; an Aungel þare cam gon
A Roket he brou&yogh;te on is hond to hire &punctelev; &yogh;wittore nas neuere non
Þat [maide][om.] dude on þis Roket. &punctelev; al naket heo was er
Naþeles heo ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t hire bodi seo &punctelev; for li&yogh;te ne for her;
Þo heo hadde ido þis Roket on &punctelev; non-more i-hud heo nas;
Fairore lijf nas neuere i-seie &punctelev; þane þis &yogh;onge maide þo was
Þe constables sone cam for-to don with hire &punctelev; ase he hadde er i-seid
And are he mi&yogh;te þat Maiden handli &punctelev; he fel a-doun stan-ded
his felawes þat with him comen &punctelev; with-oute heo weren wel stille
And hopeden, for he so longe was &punctelev; þat he dude is wille
¶ Naþeles, þo he to longe was &punctelev; is o felawe gan in gon
And fond þat child ligge ded &punctelev; so cold ase a ston
he leop him out in-to þe strete &punctelev; loude he gan to grede
"Comiez hidere, men, and sleth þis wichche &punctelev; for heo hath i-do a luþer dede
Þe Constables sone heo hath a-slawe &punctelev; here &yogh;e mouwen i-seo
Comiez nouþe bliue and nimeth hire &punctelev; þat heo a-wei ne fleo!"
Þat folk cam reke a-boute þis hous &punctelev; and founden þat it was ded
Alle þe baillifs þudere comen &punctelev; to nimen þar-of red
Some seiden þat heo wichche was &punctelev; some þat heo was guod
And alle for þe childes deþe &punctelev; wroþe weren in heore mod;
heo stoden and Iuggeden hire a-mong heom alle &punctelev; þat quelle heo wolden hire sone
Þat maide sat a-doun on hire knes &punctelev; and made to god hire bone
Þov kuythþ þine mi&yogh;te[þ. m. al. om.] and send þis child &punctelev; lijf here In þis place
Þat þis folk þat here is luyþur &punctelev; þine mi&yogh;te mouwen i-seo;
Ne lat none mo men deth a-fonge &punctelev; for enchesun of me."
¶ A-doun þar cam an Aungel &punctelev; "mayde Anneis," he seide
"Ore louerd hath i-heord þine bone &punctelev; þat þou to him bede."
heo blessede þat child, and hit aros &punctelev; fram deþe to liue
And þonkede god, and orn him out &punctelev; at þe dore wel bliue;
he cam out a-mong al þat fo[l]k &punctelev; loude he gan to crie
"On god þat[om. þat] is In heuene &punctelev; þat was i-bore of þe Maidene Marie
Þat is fader and sone and holi gost &punctelev; louerd of alle þinge
Þat wille hadde þoru&yogh; is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; fram deþe to-day me bringe
Fur-sakez eovwer false godes &punctelev; for heo nabbeth mi&yogh;te non
Forto meoui heom enes of þe stude &punctelev; non more þene a ston."
Þe childes fader and mani oþure &punctelev; swiþe glade bi-come
Þo heo i-sei&yogh;en þe Miracle &punctelev; and cristindom hem nome
Wod-wroþe weren þe luþere men &punctelev; heo gonne bi-twene heom telle
In &yogh;wuche martyrdome heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; þis holi maide a-quelle
heo leten makien a gret fuyr &punctelev; þare a-midde þe place
For-to brenne seinte Anneis. &punctelev; and þar[MS. þat] ore louerd cudde is grace
¶ For þo þat Mayde was þudere i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; In þe fuyr men hire þrev&yogh;
Þat fuyr clef a-middes a-to &punctelev; and þe luyþere men it wel i-knev&yogh;
For þo it smot in eiþur side &punctelev; and barnde heom al-clene
Þat Maide nas i-wemned nou&yogh;t &punctelev; for it ne touchede hire nou&yogh;t ene;
bote heo sat hire a-doun a-kne &punctelev; and in eiþur half was þe lei&yogh;e
