"Louerd," heo seide, "&yogh;if þi wille it beo &punctelev; þat ich here schulle dei&yogh;e
I-redi ich am for-to a-fonge þat fuyr &punctelev; þat is me In eyþur side
&YOGH;if ich schal here I-martred beo &punctelev; oþur lengore a-bide."
Þo heo hadde þis word i-seid &punctelev; þat fuyr a-queinte a-non
Non more hete nas in þe place &punctelev; þane in þe colde ston
&YOGH;eot þulke þat bi-lefden a-liue &punctelev; on god þat ne[om. þat] bi-lefden nou&yogh;t
And Iuggeden hov heo mi&yogh;ten don &punctelev; þat heo were to deþe i-brou&yogh;[t]
heo leten nime a kene suerd &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; hire þrote it smite;
Þat rede blod orn a-doun &punctelev; on hire limes so &yogh;wite
Fairore ne mi&yogh;te no-þing [be] &punctelev; þane was þat ilke blod
On hire limes þat weren so &yogh;wite &punctelev; þo hit þaron stod
Þus þis Mayde seinte Annes &punctelev; brou&yogh;te hire lijf to fine
And wende to þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; after hire muchele pine
SEint Vincent In spayne &punctelev; to a cristine bischop cam
Þat men cleopeden valentin &punctelev; and cristindom of him nam
Þe king[al. iustice] of þe londe— &punctelev; Dacian was is name
For þe bischop cristine was &punctelev; he þou&yogh;te to don him schame
he let him nime and binde &punctelev; and don him in grete pine
Þe bischop cride &yogh;erne on god &punctelev; he nolde oþur fine
With heom þat him tormenteden &punctelev; he spac with milde speche
Seint Vincent was þare-fore wrath &punctelev; and seide: "ich mot þe teche;
&YOGH;wy spext þov so mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei þov a-drad were
Wenstþou þat heo þine Maistres beon? &punctelev; &yogh;war-of hauest þov fere
Spec hardiliche, and conforte wel &punctelev; oþure þat cristine beoth
Þat heo mowe to þe deþe hardie beon &punctelev; ase heo þe i-seoth!"
"hov is þis?" seide þe king &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þes þef wene fi&yogh;te
And with-segge us al a-brod? &punctelev; Ich him schal euene di&yogh;te
Lateth þene bischop a-wei gon &punctelev; for is milde speche
Nimez vincent and bindez a-non &punctelev; we schullen him oþur tech[e]
With scourges and with staues &punctelev; faste &yogh;e him bete
Þat he ne mouw i-wielde neuere a lime &punctelev; are þat &yogh;e him lete!"
"&YOGH;e," seide vincent, "þov pai&yogh;est me wel &punctelev; þi word ne þinchez me nou&yogh;t ille
I-ne fond neuere Man þat so wel &punctelev; a-cordede to mi wille
¶ Nov ich hopie to habbe game &punctelev; for erore me þou&yogh;te longe;
hit schal me tuyrne to Ioye and gleo &punctelev; and þe to[MS. to þe] pines stronge."
Þe tormentores nomen þane holie Man &punctelev; and to a piler him bounde
With staues and scourges heo leiden on him[al. him on] &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Þo heo &yogh;euen him sorest duntes &punctelev; lei&yogh;en he gan wel smere;
Þe tormentores seten a-doun and cleopeden help &punctelev; þo heo werie were
And seiden &punctelev; "we beoth nouþe ouer-come &punctelev; ore Armes aketh sore;
he[l]pez us and betez þesne[MS. þesne þesne] þeof &punctelev; for we ne mowen non[MS. nou] more."
Þo was þe king wroth with heom &punctelev; he let heom a-nou take
Some he let tormenti sore &punctelev; þat ech bon heom gan Ake
And some he let to deþe bringue &punctelev; and some in oþur turment
Euere he let ferschi and nevny[r. nevuy?] &punctelev; tormentores to seint Vincent
&YOGH;wane heo weren werie of bete &punctelev; þe holi man bi-gan to speke
"Louerd, i-wuyrþed beo þi name &punctelev; nouþe ich am swiþe wel a-wreke
Þe more þat heo betez me &punctelev; þe betere me is, i-wis;
to heom i[t] torneþ to pine and sor &punctelev; and me to Ioie and blis."
¶ "Ne mowe we nov&yogh;t," seide þe king &punctelev; "with no-þing þar-to it bringe
Þat þov nelt nemme þine false god &punctelev; for no luþur betinge?"
"Þov luþere Man," seide Vincent &punctelev; "&yogh;eot þou most tormenti more
I-ne habbe nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot tormenz i-nouwe &punctelev; þar-after me longez sore."
Þo he was i-scourget so &punctelev; þat men mi&yogh;ten i-seo ech bon
And euerech Ioynt and senue &punctelev; þe king gan ner him gon
"Vincent," he seide, "haue of þi-self &punctelev; revþe and merci
Ne lat þov non-more þi fa[i]re bodi &punctelev; þus defouli
bi-lief on ovre godes and torne anon &punctelev; þi þou&yogh;t and þi mod
And i-schal þe &yogh;iue ope al mi lond &punctelev; pouwer gret and guod."
"beo stille," seide seint vincent &punctelev; "al Atter is þi lore
beo stille a-non, þou deueles tonge &punctelev; þou makest me drede sore
hit me greueth þat þov feinest þe &punctelev; more þane al þe pine
And alle þe tormens þat þov me dest &punctelev; þov and alle þine;
Þat þov bi-leuest þine tormenz so sone &punctelev; and art bi-neoþe i-brou&yogh;t
&YOGH;eot þou most more Ioye &punctelev; bringen in mi þou&yogh;t."
"Þov schalt &yogh;eot," seide þe king &punctelev; mo tormenz a-fonge."
he let him lede with-oute þe toun &punctelev; and on a gibet him honge
Vincent for Ioie bi-gan to eorne &punctelev; þo he i-heorde þis dom
Þare nas non þat him mi&yogh;te ouer-take &punctelev; are he to þe gibat com
Þo þat he an-hengut was &punctelev; gret Ioye he made and blisse
Euere he prechede ase he heng &punctelev; godes wordes to wisse;
Þe lengore þat he þare heng &punctelev; þe more Ioie he made
Þo gradden þe tormentores &punctelev; "we ne schullen neuere ouer-come þis tade."
¶ Atþe laste he nomen him a-doun &punctelev; and ladden bi-fore þe kinge
And seiden þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten him &punctelev; for noþing to deþe bringe
"Alas," seide þe king þo &punctelev; "is ore mi&yogh;te us bi-nome
&YOGH;ware-of seruieth ovre godes &punctelev; þat þes þeof us schal ouer-come
Ledez him with-oute þe toun &punctelev; a gret fuyr &yogh;e þare make;
And þat he beo a-midde i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; and i-bounde to one stake;
For-brenne he schal euerech lime &punctelev; ne schal he þus him wer[e]
And &yogh;wane he is to douste I-barnd &punctelev; we beoth i-brou&yogh;t of care."
Þe tormentores nomen seint Vincent &punctelev; and duden þe kingus heste
Þe holi man wende in-to þe fuyr &punctelev; ase gladliche ase to one feste
Þo heo wenden þat seint vincent &punctelev; to douste i-brend were
heo ornen hom and tolden þe kinge fore &punctelev; gladdore neuere heo nere
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone hom come &punctelev; þat seint vincent nas er
At home and stod bi-fore þe kinge— &punctelev; mani sori man was þer
¶ Þe tormentores tolden þe kingue &punctelev; hov he i-barnd was
"Alas! alas!" þe king seide &punctelev; "neuerer i-schend i-nas
Schal þeos þef us ouer-come? &punctelev; Mahun, nou þin ore
Þei he grete tormenz habbe i-haued &punctelev; &yogh;eot ich can bi-þenche more."
he let nime platus of Ire &punctelev; sum-del þunne and brode
And let heom legge amidde þe place &punctelev; wel nei&yogh; ane cartes lode;
gret fuyr he let þar-on make &punctelev; and þo heo glowinde were
Þat wode-fuyr heo duden al a-wei &punctelev; þane guode man þudere heo bere
And on þe berninde plates him casten &punctelev; and some þarof heo toke
And leiden an-ouewarde is holi bodi &punctelev; mid one Irene croke
Al he was þar-on ihud— &punctelev; þe &yogh;ut nadde he none fere
Þat grece of him orn a-brod &punctelev; ase þei it frijnge were
Þe swyþere þat he barnde &punctelev; þe gladdore he him made;
he lou&yogh; smere, &yogh;wane þe plates &punctelev; In is flesch gonne wade;
Atþe bi-ginningue he was glad &punctelev; and gladdore atþenende
"Alas! alas," þe king seide þo &punctelev; "þes þef us wole schende
Þis torment ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; an-oþur we moten bi-þenche."
he let maken a swyþe gret fuyr &punctelev; þat no-þing ne mi&yogh;te a-quenche
¶ Seint Vincent huy lei[den] a-mide-warde &punctelev; and sethþe salt heo nome
And Mid ladeles on is wondene it casten &punctelev; in[al. & in] þe fuyr i-lome
So þat þe salt scholde is woundene frete &punctelev; with þe brenninde fuyre;
Þe spranglinge of þe blode i-selt &punctelev; wide men mi&yogh;ten i-huyre
"&YOGH;e," seide þis guode man &punctelev; "þis is a swete feste
Mani Ioye ichabbe i-haued &punctelev; ake þis is on þe meste."
&YOGH;wane is blod spreinde In þe rof an hei&yogh; &punctelev; he gan to lei&yogh;en smere
Þanne was þe king and alle is men &punctelev; In swyþe grete fere
And seiden &punctelev; "þes þef us wole ouer-come. &punctelev; Mahun, &yogh;ware is þi mi&yogh;te
Schal þes þef with is wichchinge &punctelev; a&yogh;en þi power fi&yogh;te?"
"&YOGH;eot Ich þenche," seide þe king &punctelev; "of one pine stronge;
beo þes þef þar-on i-do &punctelev; he ne schal nou&yogh;t libbe longe."
heo setten him in a swyþe deork put &punctelev; þat in þe gayhole was
So ful of sweordes pointes i-pi&yogh;te &punctelev; ase Mede is ful of gras
Þare-oppe þanne holi man &punctelev; heo casten, faste i-bounde
Þat þe pointes of þe swerdes scholden &punctelev; &yogh;iuen him deþes woundes
Faste heo loken alle þe dore &punctelev; and leten him longe þere beo
Ope þe swerdes pointes in deorkhede &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te noþing i-seo
Þare cam an Aungel with a taper &punctelev; brenninde in is hond
Of his pine he bar him op— &punctelev; and þare was godes sonde
¶ Þe Aungel was þar with him &punctelev; ase longe ase he þare was
Mid a brenninde taper, and Ioie gret &punctelev; þat neuere more nas
Þo it was longe þare-afturward &punctelev; þis men comen þerbi-side
And wende þat he were ded &punctelev; ane stounde heo gonne a-bide
Þo i-heorden heo þis holi man &punctelev; loude and murie singe
And herede god in heuene. &punctelev; heo tolden þat þe kinge
Þo was þe þing nei&yogh; i-swowe &punctelev; and seide, sichinde wel sore
"Alas, we beoth nouþe ouer-come &punctelev; I-ne can[MS. cam] þenche non more;
Ovre godes ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat alle þing habbeth to wolde
I-nelle neuere-eft a-&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;te &punctelev; creaunt ichulle me holde
¶ &YOGH;wane no pine ne mai him sle &punctelev; oþur þing ichulle fonde
"goth," he seide, "and maketh a bed &punctelev; þat softeste in anie londe
Of quoiltene and of materasz &punctelev; of cheisel and of palle
And þanne leggez him þar-on &punctelev; swiþe softe with-alle."
Þo þat bed was i-maket &punctelev; to þe gayhole heo wende
And founden þare þat lij&yogh;t of heuene &punctelev; þat ore louerd þudere sende
Wel softe heo nomen þis holi man &punctelev; and custen is sore wounden
to Relikes heo gadereden stilleliche &punctelev; þat heo of is blode founden;
heo leiden him in þat nesche bed. &punctelev; and þo he was þaron
his preiere he dude to ore louerd crist &punctelev; and deide þo a-non
Þo þe king isai&yogh; þis þat he deide &punctelev; so mildeliche in is bedde
"tormenz," he seide, "we him habbeth i-do &punctelev; vuele þarof us spedde
Ded we wolleth him ouer-come &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mi&yogh;ten a-liue
Into þe wilde felde &punctelev; þat bodi &yogh;e beren wel bliue
Wilde bestes and foules &punctelev; to-drawe heo schullen it sone."
Þis men brou&yogh;ten þat bodi þare &punctelev; and duden þe kingus bone
Þare cam fleo a Rauon &punctelev; and a-doun þare-bi he a-li&yogh;te
Kene and suyþe dredful &punctelev; i-redi he was to fi&yogh;te;
&yogh;if þare come ani foul to &punctelev; þat þis bodi i-sei&yogh;e
Þe Rauon smot to grounde &punctelev; ne mosten þare come non nei&yogh;e
¶ Ake Euere he drof heom a-wei &punctelev; þudere &yogh;wane heo come;
Ne mi&yogh;te þare come none so kene &punctelev; þat o mossel þarof nome
A wolf cam also þuder-ward &punctelev; is mete for-to fette
And wolde of þat bodi nime. &punctelev; þe Rauon a-&yogh;ein him sette
he flev and smot with bile and fot &punctelev; þat þe wolf atþen ende
blodi was and ouercome &punctelev; a&yogh;en hamward he gan wende
Þe Rauon wuste þis bodi longe &punctelev; Iwemmed nou&yogh;t it nas
Þo þe king it onder-&yogh;at &punctelev; þat þe bodi i-hol was
hom he let it fette a&yogh;en &punctelev; and seide, "&yogh;wat may beo ovre red
þat we ne mouwen him ouer-come &punctelev; noþer quik ne ded
&YOGH;if we ne mouwen quik ne ded &punctelev; ouer-come him a-londe
For no[MS. ne] quoyntise þat we mouwen do &punctelev; a-watere we wollez fonde."
he let it lede fer into þe se &punctelev; and bonde þarto mani a ston
And casten it out of a schip. &punctelev; it bi-gan to sinke a-non
þo þe Mariners i-seien þis &punctelev; glade heo weren and bliþe;
For-to telle þe kinge fore &punctelev; heo hi&yogh;eden hom wel bliue
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone to londe come &punctelev; þat heo ne founden a-londe
Þis holi Man wel faire ligge &punctelev; a-bouen þe se-sonde
Sore a-gremed and a-schamed &punctelev; hom huy gonne wende;
Þe kinge heo tolden al heore cas &punctelev; fram þe furste to þe ende
"Alas, alas," þe king seide &punctelev; "þe schame and þe schonde
We ne mowe him neuere ouer-come &punctelev; quik ne ded, a-watere ne a-londe
¶ Do we him out of ovre þou&yogh;t &punctelev; we ne mouwen us neuere a-wreke;
Ich drede þat he mi bane worþe &punctelev; I-here ich more of him speke."
A-ni&yogh;t In slepe seint Vincent cam &punctelev; to A womman þare-bi-side
And tolde hire &yogh;ware is bodi lai &punctelev; and bad hire nou&yogh;t to longe a-bide
Ake þat heo it scholde burie sone &punctelev; for him longuede after reste
Þis guode womman it onderstod &punctelev; þo heo a-wok, with þe beste
heo wende and sou&yogh;te þis holi bodi &punctelev; and fond it swiþe sone;
heo dude it burie with gret honour &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t was for-to done
Þus seint vincent þe holie man &punctelev; in Spayne endede is lif
And wende to þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; after þis pines and strif
Men nusten neuere martyr non &punctelev; þat hadde more torment
Ne þat with som pine ouer-come nas &punctelev; bote þe gode man seint vincent
SEint powel was a luþer Man &punctelev; are he i-couerted were
Alle þe cristine Men of þe lond &punctelev; hadden of him gret fere
For he was muche and strong and feol. &punctelev; &yogh;ware-so he eni founde
In chaumbre ne in bedde he ne sparede nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he ne slov&yogh; heom alle to grounde
Þo he hadde a-boute Ierusalem &punctelev; In eche stude i-sou&yogh;t
And alle þe cristine men þat he fond &punctelev; to stronge deþe i-brou&yogh;t
he cam to þe souereyns of þe lawe &punctelev; and seide, "ich habbe i-mad al clene
Al þis lond of cristine Men &punctelev; [&yogh;e][om.] ne dorre of heom more mene
Wende ichulle to Dam[a]sche &punctelev; and clansi þat lond al-so;
Alle þat ich a-liue finde mai &punctelev; to deþe ichulle heom do
Oþur ichulle heom faste binde &punctelev; and hidere to eov sende;
Alle þat ich a-liue finde may &punctelev; ichulle a-sle oþur schende."
¶ Saul was þo is ri&yogh;te name. &punctelev; he gan forth i-wende
I-Armed, and mani a man with him &punctelev; to bringe is þou&yogh;t to ende
Ase he cam a-midri&yogh;t þe wei &punctelev; a li&yogh;t him cam a-boute
Þat he ne mi&yogh;te for li&yogh;te i-seon. &punctelev; þo gan him sore a-doute;
he stod ase þei he a-stoned were. &punctelev; þo cam þare in a stounde
A drem ase þei it a þondre were. &punctelev; þare-with he ful to grounde
And lai, þat he ne mi&yogh;te him wawie nou&yogh;t. &punctelev; þo herde he a uoiz telle
"Saul, &yogh;wi werrestþov opon me &punctelev; mine Men for-to quelle?"
"ho art þov?" seide saul &punctelev; "louerd, artþov þare?"
A voiz seide, "&yogh;e, ich am þi god &punctelev; þat þov hast i-weorred so &yogh;are
to wynci a&yogh;ein þe pricke &punctelev; swiþe strong it is þe."
"Louerd," seide Saul þo &punctelev; "&yogh;wat woltþov do mid me?"
"Þov schalt," seide ore louerd þo &punctelev; "In-to þe toune wende;
Þine ri&yogh;te bi-leue þe schal teche &punctelev; a man, to &yogh;wam i-schal þe sende."
Þis was þene fourteoþe &yogh;er &punctelev; aftur þulke stounde
Þat Ihesu crist soffrede on þe rode &punctelev; for us deþes wounde.
Þo Saul hadde longe i-leie &punctelev; wel softe he op a-ros
And stod op—he ne mi&yogh;te i-seo neuere a del &punctelev; ful sore him a-gros
he let him lede to þe toun. &punctelev; it was þane þridde dai
Are he .et. oþur dronk &punctelev; oþur ani si&yogh;t i-sai&yogh;
¶ Ore louerd cam to a guod preost &punctelev; is name was ananye
"go," he seide, "in-to þe toun &punctelev; and to Iudases hous þov hi&yogh;e
Saul þov schalt þare finde &punctelev; þat i-weorred me hauez longue;
&YOGH;if him cristindom in mine name &punctelev; and he it wole onder-fonge
sei&yogh;e þat god þe þudere sende &punctelev; þat In þe weie a-&yogh;ein him cam
Þo he wolde a&yogh;ein him weorri &punctelev; and is power him bi[bi overlined]-nam."
'Louerd," seide Ananie &punctelev; "ich habbe muche i-heord telle
Þat Saul was a luþer man &punctelev; and cristine men dude quelle."
"Ne dred þe nou&yogh;t," ore louerd seide &punctelev; "lomb he is bi-come
him þinchez longe are he habbe &punctelev; cristinedom i-nome
to beo prechour of mi word &punctelev; i-chose ich him habbe;
he schal beo wis and studefast &punctelev; nanne betere i-nabbe."
Þo Ananie i-heorde þis &punctelev; hardiliche forth he wende
he cam to Saule and seide him so &punctelev; þat ore louerd him þudere sende
Þat he scholde cristine beo. &punctelev; saul was þo wel bliþe
And er þane he i-baptized was &punctelev; ech &yogh;wyle him þou&yogh;te fiue
Þo he i-baptized was &punctelev; powel was is name
Wel au&yogh;ten men herien þane god &punctelev; þat of þe wilde makez þe tame
A-non so he I-baptized was &punctelev; þare feol out of eiþer ei&yogh;e
Fuylþe ase þei it were slym &punctelev; þat alle þe men it sei&yogh;e
þo mi&yogh;te he swiþe wel i-seo. &punctelev; he heold op is honde
¶ A-knevwes he sat in his bedes &punctelev; and þonkede godes sonde
tendre metes men greiþede him &punctelev; and &yogh;af him þar-of wel ofte
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te is strencþe coueri &punctelev; heo beddeden him wel softe
Þo seint powel i-couered was &punctelev; and hadde strencþe of Manne
he purueide him of prechingue &punctelev; and wende a-non ri&yogh;t þanne
Into þe giwene synagogue &punctelev; and prechede cristindom
Ech man wondrede þat him i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; þo he prechour bi-cam
And seiden &punctelev; "nis þis þilke man &punctelev; þat weorrede alle þeo
In þe londe of Ierusalem &punctelev; þat he mi&yogh;te o&yogh;were cristine men I-seo?"
Manie Men he tornede to cristinedom &punctelev; and manie him þou&yogh;ten quelle
And bi-speken hov heo mi&yogh;ten do &punctelev; for he bi-gan a-&yogh;ein heom telle
he ne let for no drede &punctelev; þat he ne prechede wel bliue
For euere þoru ore louerdes grace &punctelev; he ascapede with þe liue
he sou&yogh;te &yogh;ware þe Apostles weren &punctelev; to heom he cam wel sone
to prechi mid heom godes word &punctelev; ase hore ri&yogh;te was to done
Þe apostles weren formest a-ferd of him &punctelev; and leueden him wel vnneþe
For he so muche cristine folk &punctelev; hadde i-brou&yogh;t to deþe;
Ake þo heo wusten hou it was &punctelev; to felawe [heo] him toke
For þare ne i-werth non so wis &punctelev; holi churche to loke
Seint powel to cristinedom &punctelev; cam In þusse manere
god us graunti for is loue &punctelev; In heuene to ben is fere
Seinte Bride of hei&yogh;e men &punctelev; In scotlond heo cam
Of riche men and of gret power &punctelev; In lawe of cristindom
Þis Maide bi-gan wel &yogh;ong &punctelev; to beo of porture hende;
Þare ne scholde vil dede ne word &punctelev; neuere fram hire wende
heo bigan ore louerd crist to serui &punctelev; in worde and in dede;
&YOGH;wane hire &yogh;ongue felawes weren atþe plei&yogh; &punctelev; hire oresones heo seide
¶ hire moder louede hire swiþe wel &punctelev; þat, þo heo was of elde
Al hire chese and al hire milk &punctelev; heo bi-tok hire to welde
And al þet &yogh;wijt þat In þe court was &punctelev; heo scholde ope hire helde
At a certeyn dai þarof &punctelev; trewe a-countes &yogh;elde
Þat Maide let gaderi swiþe clene &punctelev; þe Milk ant þe chese
botere and al þat þarof cam &punctelev; nolde heo nowi&yogh;t leose
&YOGH;wane heo sei&yogh;e anie pouere Men &punctelev; heo delde it heom wel clene
hire deierie was euere of chese and botere &punctelev; bar and swiþe lene
&YOGH;wan hire dai&yogh; was nei&yogh; i-come &punctelev; a-countes forto &yogh;elde
Of hire moder heo was a-ferd &punctelev; glad heo was ful selde
&YOGH;eorne heo bad ore louerd crist &punctelev; þat he scholde beo hire red
he nadde &yogh;warof a-countes &yogh;elde &punctelev; ase hire moder hadde i-seid
Þo þe day was i-come &punctelev; heo nuste &yogh;ware-with hire a-quite
For þare nas in þe deierie &punctelev; nou&yogh;t adel of none &yogh;wite
Naþeles þe moder eode þudere &punctelev; to loke hou it ferde
heo fond ech lome i-heped ful &punctelev; al a-boue þe brerde
Of chese and of botere &punctelev; and of oþur &yogh;wijte also
he ne may neuere is &yogh;wyle leose &punctelev; þat for þe guode wole ou&yogh;t do
hit bi-feol þat þis Maydenes frend &punctelev; nomen heom to rede
Þat heo i-weddet scholde beo. &punctelev; and heo anon-ri&yogh;t heom with-seide
to þe bischope heo wende a-non &punctelev; and a-vouwede chastete
And seide heo nolde neuere man habbe &punctelev; þe sikerore for-to beo
For Ioye þat þe bischop hadde of hire &punctelev; he seide þa[t] he wolde ete
And alle is Men, a dai with hire &punctelev; he bad hire maken heore mete
Þarof was þis Maide glad &punctelev; and naþeles sore heo hire dradde
For bote bred and Ale and one kou &punctelev; non more mete heo nadde
heo bi-gan to milken þis cov &punctelev; and muche milk of hire heo nam[MS. mam];
Þe lengore þat heo hire Milkede &punctelev; þe more milk þare cam
Þis kov &yogh;af so muche Milk &punctelev; þat þare-mide heo fedde
Þene bischop and alle is Men þat dai &punctelev; and muche þonk þarof hadde
¶ hit bi-feol þare-after-ward &punctelev; þat Maide a-feld wende
Forto loki to hire schep. &punctelev; so gret rein ore louerd to eorþe sende
Þat hire cloþes al wete weren. &punctelev; and a-&yogh;en hom[MS. heom] heo gan gon
heo wolde hangi hire cloþus forto druye &punctelev; and heo ne sai&yogh; nou&yogh;t &yogh;waron
Þe sonne schon In at one hole &punctelev; and ope þe bem of þe sonne
hire wete cloþes heo heng forto druy&yogh;e &punctelev; þat þe stremes a-doun ronne
Museles comen to hire adai &punctelev; of-hongrede and of-cale
heo beden hire mete and drinke for godes loue. &punctelev; he nadde nou&yogh;t a spone-ful ale
A fat þare stod fol of baþe-water &punctelev; heo &yogh;af it hire blessinge
Þe beste Ale a-liue it bi-cam &punctelev; he &yogh;af it þe Museles drinke
A womman cam and bad hire salt &punctelev; and heo ne hadde non
With hire blessingue heo turnede to salte &punctelev; ane wel grete ston
Þre sike men beden hire guod &punctelev; ase heo to hire come
A seluerne coppe heo [heom] &yogh;af &punctelev; and gladliche heo hire nome;
And bi-gunne for-to striui &punctelev; hov heo hire dele mi&yogh;te
"Abidez," seide þis Maide &punctelev; "and ichulle it euene di&yogh;te."
Þis Coppe heo smot a&yogh;en a ston &punctelev; þat heo to-brak aþre;
Euerech heo &yogh;af iliche muche &punctelev; ase euene ase it mi&yogh;te beo
Þeos miracles, and manie oþure &punctelev; seinte Bride wrou&yogh;te;
Þe blinde and þe doumbe &punctelev; to guode hele heom brou&yogh;te
Þe furste dai of feuerer &punctelev; hire lijf heo brou&yogh;te to ende
god us graunti alle forth with hire &punctelev; te[r. to þe] blisse of heuene wende
SEinte Agace, þat guode Maide &punctelev; In cisile was i-bore;
Wel &yogh;ong heo bi-gan cristine to beon &punctelev; þat hire soule nere fur|lore
Of faire porture þis Mayde was &punctelev; and stable in godes lore
Þe Duyk of þe londe it onder-&yogh;at &punctelev; it him of-þou&yogh;te sore
he ne mi&yogh;te for revþe don hire in pine &punctelev; Al for hire &yogh;onghede;
And for heo so fair was &punctelev; he hopede hire out of þulke bi-leue lede
An old quene þare was bi-side &punctelev; strong hore and baudestrote;
heo hadde Ni&yogh;e dou&yogh;tren li&yogh;t wummen. &punctelev; þe Duyk bi-gan hire gret mede bi-hote
Þat heo scholde þat maide wite &punctelev; and mis-techen hire and rede
And fondi &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;te hire bringe &punctelev; in fol þou&yogh;t oþur in fol dede
Þis clene þing was to þis hore i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat hei&yogh;te Affrodose
heo, and hire dou&yogh;tren al-so &punctelev; maden hire þe glose
And bi-hete hire quoynte þingus fale &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
Richesse and oþur Ioye i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þat heo hire þou&yogh;t chaungi scholde;
heo seiden &punctelev; "hov mi&yogh;te a swuche creature &punctelev; þus gent and þus freo
hende and milde and swete i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; with-oute Iolifte [beo]
Þi &yogh;ongue blod nolde it þolie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; scholde þi Ioie beon þe bi-nome;
In þis lond nis prince so hei&yogh; &punctelev; þat þov ne mi&yogh;test him wel bi-come."
¶ Þis Maide, þei heo were &yogh;ong &punctelev; bi-gan to Answerie a-non
And seide, "beo stille, þou deueles bouk! &punctelev; þe ne worth here non i-won
Þe hexte prince þat is ani &punctelev; In loue ich habbe i-take
In mine &yogh;onghede and euere-more &punctelev; to holde him for mi make
Swete and hende and milde he is &punctelev; on him is al mi þou&yogh;t
Ich am so faste to him i-bounde &punctelev; þar-of ne bringuest þou me nou&yogh;t."
Þis luþere wummen weren ech-one &punctelev; studefastliche Ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh;
A-boute to bringue luþer þou&yogh;t &punctelev; In-to þis swete &yogh;ounge may&yogh;;
Þritti dawes heo was with heom &punctelev; þat heo fondeden euere
to bringue hire into þe deueles lore &punctelev; Ake heo ne spedden neuere
Þis wychche wende to þe Duyk þo &punctelev; þat het quincian
And seide, "sire, i-ne mai chaungi nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe þou&yogh;t of þis womman;
Li&yogh;tloker man may þane hardeste ston &punctelev; make nesche ase wolle
Þane þat Maide þoru&yogh; any gin &punctelev; of hire þou&yogh;t bringe schulle."
Þe Duyk let a-non þis mayde fette &punctelev; and Axede &yogh;wat heo were
"godes schulchone," heo seide, "ich am" &punctelev; heo nadde none fere
he Axede of &yogh;wat kunne heo were. &punctelev; heo seide, "of gent and freo."
Þe Duyk seide, "hov mi&yogh;t þov gentil womman &punctelev; and eke a schulchone beo?"
"&YOGH;us," seide þat maide þo &punctelev; "hit is more fraunchise
to beon gode[s]schulchene oþer is þral &punctelev; þane king oþur Iustise."
"Anovre ovre godes!" seide þe Duyk &punctelev; "ne spec of þi god non-more
Oþur ichulle þe swuch pine do &punctelev; þat it schal þe rewe sore."
"I-ne schal so sone," þat maide seide &punctelev; "In pine beo i-brou&yogh;t
Þat it nele a-swagi &yogh;if ich habbe &punctelev; on ihesu crist mi þou&yogh;t;
&YOGH;if þou bringest me in ani fuyre &punctelev; and ich me bi-þenche
On þe pine þat he þolede for me &punctelev; a-non it wole a-quenche."
Þe Duyk let nime þat maide a-non &punctelev; and In-to þe gayhole lede;
Þat maide was þo also glad &punctelev; ase þei men hire to feste bede
In stronge prisone heo was i-do &punctelev; þar-inne longe heo lay
Þe Duyk let þare-after-warde &punctelev; at-fore him þat mayde bringe a day
¶ "Agace," he seide, "bi-þench þe wel &punctelev; bi-lef þi fole þou&yogh;t
Anovre ore[MS. ore ore] godes þat mowen þe helpe &punctelev; are þou beo in pine i-brou&yogh;t."
Þat maide seide, "þou spillest þi breth &punctelev; and þou tellest embe nou&yogh;t
Ake ich rede þat þou Anouri him &punctelev; þat deore us hath i-bou&yogh;t
And bi-lef þine false godes &punctelev; þat power nabbez non
Þat beoth i-mad of an old stoc &punctelev; oþur of þe harde ston."
"Neltþou [nou]&yogh;t[MS. Neltþou&yogh;t]," seide þe duyk &punctelev; "þine folie &yogh;uyt bi-leue
In stronge pine þov schalt beo i-don &punctelev; to-day are it beo eue."
hokes and witthene he let nime &punctelev; and faste to hire breoste binde
And let is tormentores with þe withþene &punctelev; hire breostene of wynde
"Þov onwreste bouk," þis Maide seide &punctelev; to þe duyk quincian
"Ne hastþov no schame in þine heorte &punctelev; defouli þus ani man
Þat lyme þat þov þi moder of soke &punctelev; and þe hath forth i-brou&yogh;t
Do þov þin owene confusion &punctelev; and ne dred þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
¶ gret pine þolede þis clene [may] &punctelev; are heo weren of i-drawe;
So muche was hire þou&yogh;t on gode &punctelev; þat it ne greuede hire nou&yogh;t an hawe
Þo heo weren of i-drawe &punctelev; In-to prisone heo was eft i-do
Þe Duyk let witie þat prison faste &punctelev; þat no man ne come hire to
hire woundene to hele with ani-þing &punctelev; oþur hire pines forto lisse
Ake ore louerd ne for-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t hire &punctelev; þo ne þorte he misse
Ase heo in prisone al one was &punctelev; an old man þare cam gon
boxes fulle of Oygneme[n]z &punctelev; he brou&yogh;te mani on
And seide þat he hire hele wolde. &punctelev; "þov ne schalt," heo seide;
"I-ne kepe no man bote god &punctelev; þat me hele and rede."
"Ich am," seide þe olde man &punctelev; "In his name hidere i-wend
For ich am his apostle— &punctelev; to þe he me hath i-send
Þine woundene forto hele &punctelev; þat þov hast for him stronge
In þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; þine mede þou schalt afonge."
Þe woundes he gan smeorie &punctelev; heo weren hole in one stounde
Þat Maide nuste &yogh;ware he[MS. heo] bi-cam &punctelev; þo he hadde i-held hire wounde
Þe Duyk let þat maide bi-fore him bringe &punctelev; þene feorþe day
he seide, "hastþov &yogh;eot i-chaunget þi þou&yogh;t?" &punctelev; þat mayde seide "nay
Þi word," heo seide, "ne doth non oþur &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov spext þus to me
bote fuylez swiþe foule þe eyr &punctelev; þat it deth inne fleo
he is wod þat stok oþur ston &punctelev; wole to helpe calle
And nou&yogh;t to god of heuene &punctelev; þat hath i-heled mine wounden alle."
"Darstþou &yogh;eot," seide þe Duyk &punctelev; "of þine false gode more telle
Beo þov so wod to nemmen him more &punctelev; in stronge deþe Man schal þe quelle."
"Onwreste bouk," þat Maide seide &punctelev; "I-nelle it lete nou&yogh;t
Þe &yogh;wyle þat ich libbe may &punctelev; to nemen him with worde oþur with þou&yogh;t."
Þe Duyk het men hire for-brenne &punctelev; a gret fuyr he let make
Þo heo [hire] wolden þar-inne do &punctelev; þe eorþe bi-gan to quake
¶ Ase wide ase þe cite was &punctelev; and felde a-doun þe dom-halle;
Twei men þat hire Iuggeden to deþe &punctelev; a-slawe weren with þe walle
Þat folk of þe cite was a-drad. &punctelev; to þe duyke heo seiden
"Þis Mayde is guod, and we beth for hire &punctelev; In grete perile and in drede
gret pine þov hast [hire] i-don &punctelev; þou ne schal so non-more."
Þo þe Duyk i-herde þis &punctelev; a-drad he was wel sore;
Þat Mayde he let to prisone lede &punctelev; and he him-seolf a-scapede a-wey
bi one posterne stilleliche &punctelev; þat no man him ne sey&yogh;
Þo þat mayde into prisone cam &punctelev; a-doun heo sat a-kneo
"Louerd," he seide, "fram mani pine &punctelev; þou hast i-saued me
fram fuyr and fram woundes stronge &punctelev; þou me hast i-brou&yogh;t
And fram mi child-hod þou me hast i-wust &punctelev; þat ine mis-bi-lefde nou&yogh;t
Lat me, louerd, to reste wende &punctelev; for here me þinchez long
Tyme it is to endi mi lijf &punctelev; mine soule þov onder-fong."
Mid þusse worde bi-fore al þat folk &punctelev; heo bi-gan to dei&yogh;e
Þare was mani a sori man &punctelev; and mani a wepinde ei&yogh;e
Þat folk þat hire louede &punctelev; siwede hire wel faste
hire bodi heo nomen with gret honour &punctelev; and bureden it atþe laste
Þo heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; a felawe-schipe þare cam go
Of þe faireste children þat mi&yogh;ten beo &punctelev; þre hondret and wel mo
&YOGH;onge þingus of on age &punctelev; in &yogh;wite cloþus of palle;
Ane table of Marbre In is hond &punctelev; þe on bar at-fore heom alle
¶ heo Ioyneden it to seinte Agace toumbe &punctelev; þo heo comen þer-to
Wel sweteliche heo wenden a&yogh;en &punctelev; þo heo hadden so i-do
Angles it weren þat þare a-li&yogh;ten &punctelev; for seinte Agace to grounde
Clerkes bi-heolden þe table &yogh;eorne &punctelev; þare-Inne i-write huy founde
"Þis Maide hadde holi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; god heo dude honour
A-serued heo hath to alle þe contreie &punctelev; deliueraunce of langour."
For-soþe heo mi&yogh;ten þis laste word &punctelev; þar-after onder-stonde
þulke time a twelf-Monþe &punctelev; of an hul in þe londe
Strong fuyr þare cam eornen out &punctelev; ase water doth of welle
And barnde al þat þare was a-boute &punctelev; quic þing it gan a-quelle;
hit spradde wide into al þat lond &punctelev; þat folk hadde grete fere
And barnde þe hard roche of ston &punctelev; ase þei it Col were
heo ne dorsten bi-leue at no toun &punctelev; ake ornen ase men þat were wode
At seinte Agace Toumbe &punctelev; þare heo formest at-stode
Al-so it bi-feol in hire daye &punctelev; ase sone ase heo weren þere
Þat fuyr queinte a-non in-to al þat lond &punctelev; ase þei it neuere nere;
And bi-fore it hadde six dawes i-last &punctelev; and six Nij&yogh;t al-so
And orn ase þei it water were &punctelev; for-barnde al þat him cam to
Þo schewede ore louerd þat it was soth &punctelev; þat þe maide seinte Agas
A-seruede deliueraunce to al þe Contree— &punctelev; þare wel i-sene it was
Al-so w[i]sliche we schullen hire bidde &punctelev; ase heo þe contreie &yogh;af bote
Þat we to þe Ioye þare heo is Inne &punctelev; with hire come we mote
SEinte scholace, þat holie mayde &punctelev; heo was of clene liue
Leouere heo hadde to beon Nonne &punctelev; þane beon i-widdet to wiue
Seint Beneit hire broþer was &punctelev; and þe Ordre furst bi-fond
Of Nonnes and of blake Monekus &punctelev; þat is &yogh;uyt into al þat lond;
Of blake Monekus at Duyn &punctelev; An Abbeye he let a-rere
him-sulf þe Abite furst he nam &punctelev; þe &yogh;ongore for-to lere
Seinte Scholace, his soster &punctelev; blac Nonne he let hire make
And tei&yogh;te hire penaunce forto don &punctelev; to faste and to wake
Þeos twei&yogh;e holie creatures &punctelev; eche &yogh;ere hadden ane wone
to comen to-gadere some Tyme &punctelev; and tellen of godes sone;
Ake heore noþer in oþeres Abbeye &punctelev; bi-leue come ne mi&yogh;te
Ne duelle for none þinge &punctelev; oute of heore celle bi Ni&yogh;te
¶ Þo þis guode holi mayde &punctelev; i-brou&yogh;t was in grete Elde
hire longuede with hire broþer to speke &punctelev; feble heo hire felde
Þo heo hadde to him i-sent &punctelev; and to-gadere heo weren i-come
Al dai heo tolden of godes priuetez &punctelev; seinte Marie sone
Of þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; hou holi men heore [lif] ladden;
Þare-of al heore Ioye was &punctelev; þat heo to-gadere hadden
Sorie weren þis holie þingus boþe &punctelev; for it was sumdel nei&yogh; Eue
Seint Beneit to is soster seide &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng bi-leue
Seinte scholace sori was. &punctelev; "broþur," heo seide, "þin ore
Þis holie wordus so murie beoth &punctelev; &yogh;eot we moten telle more;
&YOGH;wane we In godes seruise beoth &punctelev; we ne doz nou&yogh;t ore ordre breke
Ich am so feble þat ich ne wene &punctelev; neuer-eft more with þe speke;
bi-leue we þis one Ni&yogh;t to-gadere &punctelev; for his loue þat deore us bou&yogh;te
Ich wot þat he it wole us for-&yogh;iue &punctelev; &yogh;wane we it doth in guode þou&yogh;te."
"beo stille," seide seint beneit &punctelev; "loke &yogh;wat þou dest telle
Wel þov wost þat ine mai beo &punctelev; bi ni&yogh;te fram mine celle."
Þo scholace i-sai&yogh; þat it ne heold &punctelev; to bidde hire broþur more
hire heued he hangede a-doun &punctelev; and bi-gan to wepe sore
"Louerd," heo seide, "þat þov art &punctelev; ful of milce and ore
Lat me, louerd, &yogh;if þi wille it beo &punctelev; i-heore more of þi lore;
¶ Ne lat nou&yogh;t mi broþur to-Ni&yogh;t &punctelev; fram me, louerd, wende
Ake soffre us with tales of þe &punctelev; bringe þis ni&yogh;t to ende."
Ase þis Maide loke[r. lokede] opward &punctelev; þo heo hadde i-don hire bone
Þat weder þat was so cler and fair &punctelev; bi-gan to chaungie sone;
hit bi-gan to þondri and hauli &punctelev; lei&yogh;ten and eke rine
Þat feor with-Inne Ni&yogh;te it was &punctelev; er þat weder wolde a-fine
¶ Þo ne mi&yogh;te seint beneit &punctelev; for þe wedere þannes i-wende
"Soster," he seide, "&yogh;wat hastþov i-don? &punctelev; þou fondest me to schende;
&YOGH;if it nere ore louerdes wille &punctelev; wel ne dost þov nou&yogh;t
Þat i-schal mine ordre breke &punctelev; so nadde ich neuere i-þou&yogh;t."
"Leue broþer," þat maide seide &punctelev; "ich bad þe swiþe &yogh;erne
Þat þou þis ni&yogh;t bi-lefdest here &punctelev; and euere þov dudest me werne
Ich bad mi louerd of heuene &punctelev; and he me i-herde a-non
Cheos nouþe &yogh;waþer þov bi-leue wolt &punctelev; oþur heonnes for-to gon
bi-lef me alone &yogh;if þov mi&yogh;t &punctelev; for no þonk ne can ich þe
Ake ich þonki god of heuene &punctelev; þat so sone i-heorde me."
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten departi nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to-gadere al ni&yogh;t heo woke
And tolden of godes suettnesse &punctelev; and of is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; In tale and eke in boke
Þe Ni&yogh;t heom þov[&yogh;te] suyþe schort &punctelev; and sorie at þene ende
heo weren þo heo þane dai&yogh; i-sei&yogh;en &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo scholden a-to i-wende
heo ne dorsten no lengore to-gadere beo &punctelev; ac wenden to heore celle
heo weren boþe swiþe sorie &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng to-gadere duelle
Þo þat Maide was hom i-come &punctelev; sore sik heo lay&yogh;
And ase it godes wille was &punctelev; heo deide þane þridde dai&yogh;
Seint Beneit in is celle eode &punctelev; his soster soule he i-sei&yogh;
In fourme of a &yogh;wi&yogh;t Coluere &punctelev; fleon op into heuene an hei&yogh;;
heouene openede a-&yogh;eines hire &punctelev; þe Coluere gan in fleo
glad was þis holi man &punctelev; þat he it mi&yogh;te i-seo
A-moruwe he and is couent &punctelev; þudere wenden sone
And bureden þat holi maide &punctelev; ase it was ri&yogh;t to done
bidde we suete Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat is so fair and hende
Þat we moten þudere comen &punctelev; ase scholace dude i-wende

div1.head: 35 Purgatorium sancti Patrici abb[at]is.[I have published this legend before in Altengl. Legenden, Paderborn, 1875, p. 177 ff, together with two other versious.]

lg.l: SEint paterik þoru godes grace &punctelev; makede ane put in Irlonde
Þat seint patrike purgatorie is icleoped &punctelev; &yogh;eot, ase ich onderstonde
Ore louerd him bi-tok ane staf &punctelev; mid is owene honde
Þat he fond þulke purgatorie with &punctelev; i-hered beo godes sonde
In Irlonde is &yogh;eot þilke staf i-wust &punctelev; dereworþeliche i-nov&yogh;
For gret relike he is i-holde &punctelev; and elles it were wou&yogh;
Seint paterik in þulke stude &punctelev; þat his purgatorie is
Of religion bi-gan an hous &punctelev; þat &yogh;eot stant, i-wis
Ant Chanoynes þare-inne he makede &punctelev; ase &yogh;eot þare beoth al-so
Þane put he let faste closi a-boute &punctelev; þat noman ne come þar-to
¶ In þe churche-&yogh;erd is þat ilke putt &punctelev; ri&yogh;t toward þe Est-side
ri&yogh;t est fram þe hei&yogh;e Au&yogh;ter &punctelev; þat manie men &yogh;wylene sou&yogh;ten wide
he is bi-walled faste a-boute[MS. abooute] &punctelev; and faste i-loke þe &yogh;ate
And þe prior haueth þe kei&yogh;e in warde &punctelev; þat no man ne mot In þar-ate
Al bi seint paterikes dai&yogh;e &punctelev; men wenden þudere i-lome
And sethþe also mani on &punctelev; and fewe a&yogh;en þare come;
Ake þulke þat þare comen a&yogh;en &punctelev; of þat heo i-sei&yogh;en, heo tolde
Ase it is in þe house i-write &punctelev; and in priue conseile i-holde.
¶ Þe manere is of euerech man &punctelev; þat for-soþe þudere i-went
Þat it beo to bete is sunnes &punctelev; &yogh;if ore louerd him grace [sent]
to þe bischope of þe lond &punctelev; furst he schal him schriue
And bidde him leue þene wey to go &punctelev; in amendement of is liue
Ake þe bischop schal rede heom[r. him] þare-a-&yogh;ein &punctelev; and manie resones schewe
And segge þat manie þudere wendeth &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein þare comieth fewe
Ake &yogh;if he is stable in is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; for al þat men him habbez i-bede
Þe bischop him wole is lettre make &punctelev; to þe prior of þe stude
¶ Þe prior him wole al-so rede i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; for-to chaungi is þou&yogh;t;
And, &yogh;wane he si&yogh;kz him studefast &punctelev; þat he nele bi-leue it nou&yogh;t
In-to churche he wole him lede &punctelev; and sette him a-doun a-kne;
Fiftene dawes he schal þare &punctelev; in is oresones beo
And &yogh;if heo ne mouwen for no-þing &punctelev; maken chaungi is þou&yogh;t
With gret procession[MS. precession] of preostes &punctelev; to þe putte he worth i-brou&yogh;t;
With þe croiz and with þe haliwatur &punctelev; heo schullen blessi him ech-on
him-sulf he schal him blessi al-so &punctelev; and þanne into þe putte gon;
And þat procession schal tuyrne a&yogh;en &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is for-to done
A-moruwe In þulke tyme &punctelev; heo schullen come þudere eft-sone
And, bote heo finden him þanne a&yogh;en i-come &punctelev; with gret deol and sor
heo schullen tuyrne a-&yogh;ein, and sikere beoth &punctelev; þat he ne comez a&yogh;en non-more.
¶ hit bi-fel bi þe kingus dai&yogh;e steuene &punctelev; þat novþe late was
Of a kni&yogh;t, þat hei&yogh;te sire Ovwayn &punctelev; a swiþe wonder cas
to þe bischop þis kni&yogh;t eode &punctelev; and to schrifte to him he cam
In grete repentaunce of is sunnes &punctelev; deol and sorewe to him he nam
Þe bischop bi-gan to chide faste &punctelev; for þat he hadde mis-do
And seide þat he was manne worst &punctelev; for-to sunegun so
And seide þat he ne mi&yogh;te so muche schame a-fonge &punctelev; þat he nere wuyrþe more
Þe kni&yogh;t sat with careful heorte &punctelev; he si&yogh;te and weop ful sore
¶ "Sire," seide þe kni&yogh;t, "&yogh;wan ich habbe &punctelev; manne worst i-do
to þe sunne þat grettest is &punctelev; mest penaunce mot þar-to;
And &yogh;if ich a-mong alle men &punctelev; mest sunful am, alas
Þe gretteste penaunce ichulle take &punctelev; þat euere bi-founde was
Ichulle me take to godes grace &punctelev; and in is name i-wende
Into seint paterikes purgatorie &punctelev; and take þat god me wole sende."
"Ov, beu frere," quath þe bischop &punctelev; "be stille, &yogh;wi seistþov so
Crist for-beode þat þov euere &punctelev; swuch folie do
Onneþe comez þare ani a-&yogh;en &punctelev; þat doth þare-In i-wende;
Nolde god þat þov þe dede dudest &punctelev; bodi and soule to schende
Ake wend into religion and bi-lef þare &punctelev; to þine liues ende
Þine sunnes þou mi&yogh;t bete wel &punctelev; &yogh;if god þe wole grace sende."
"Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille
For þulke penaunce ichulle do &punctelev; &yogh;if it is godes wille;
For ase muche ase ich habbe of-serued &punctelev; Ine mai nou&yogh;t habe of wo
Þere-fore sei&yogh;e &yogh;wat i schal &punctelev; for þudere ichulle go."
¶ Þe bischop prechede him faste i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; for-to chaungi is þou&yogh;t;
Ake atþe laste, þo he isai&yogh; &punctelev; þat it was al for nou&yogh;t
To þe prior of þe stude &punctelev; his lettres made sone
Þat he scholde bi him do &punctelev; ase bi swuch a man was to done
¶ Þe prior prechede him faste i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and schewede him resones i-nowe
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te changi is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he him with-drowe;
bote is prechinge was al for nou&yogh;t. &punctelev; ase he sai&yogh; atþen ende
Þat he nolde lete for no-þing &punctelev; þene perilouse wei to wende
Þe prior nam him bi þe hond &punctelev; and in-to churche him brou&yogh;te
Þare he ful akne adoun &punctelev; and ore louerdes grace bi-sou&yogh;te;
In fastingues and in oresones &punctelev; fourtene ni&yogh;t he lai
Forte bidde ore louerdes grace. &punctelev; and in þe fourteþe dai
Þat Couent cam a-boute him &punctelev; and oþere preostes al-so
And clerkes, with procession &punctelev; þe seruise for him to do
¶ For him heo songun þe hei&yogh;e-masse &punctelev; and to ore louerd criden faste
And ore louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; heo &yogh;euen him atþe laste
And spreinden him with holi watur &punctelev; and heore oresones heo seide
With Croiz and with procession &punctelev; to þe put heo gonne him lede
And hei&yogh;liche songun þe letanie &punctelev; and holi water with hem bere
And alle louerdes halewe beden &punctelev; þat heo heore[r. his] help were
Þe prior on-lek þe puttes dore &punctelev; bi-fore heom ech-on
And seide &punctelev; "beu frere, lo here þe wei &punctelev; þat þou wilnest for-to gon
Ake &yogh;if þou wolt bi ore rede do &punctelev; þi þou&yogh;t þou schalt wende
And in oþur manere þine sunnes bete &punctelev; ase god þe grace wole sende;
Fewe here comen euere a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat wenden here-In bi-fore
Ake heo beoth for tormentingue and for wo &punctelev; lif and soule for-lore."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "rede &yogh;wat þov me rede
In ore louerdes name þane wei ich take &punctelev; to bete mine misdede
Ake for is loue þat us deore bou&yogh;te &punctelev; biddez for me ech-on
Lif and soule god ich bi-take &punctelev; and In his name ichulle In gon."
he blessede him, and wende forth In &punctelev; and bi-tok god is flesch and is bon;
Þe prior spreinde him with holi water &punctelev; and lek þe dore a-non
Þis guode kni&yogh;t wende him forth &punctelev; wel baldeliche and faste
In one holewe weie onder eorþe &punctelev; and to god is heorte caste;
Swyþe deork it was, þat he ne say ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne no-þing him ne a-gaste
So longe þat him þou&yogh;te he i-sai&yogh; &punctelev; wel feor li&yogh;t atþe laste
Þuderward he wende baldeliche &punctelev; so þat he cam þere nei&yogh;
Þe faireste feld þat mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; atþe wei&yogh;es ende he isei&yogh;.[Pulchra via.]
¶ Þare-Inne he wende murie i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and a-midde þe felde he fond
Þe faireste halle and þe nobleste &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;te beo in ani lond
Ake þet weder nas nou&yogh;t cler &punctelev; bote ase it were nei&yogh; eue
Forto bi-holde þat noble weork &punctelev; ane stounde he gan bi-leue
Þe walles neren nou&yogh;t i-hole &punctelev; ake al a-boute i-wis
With pilers and with qvoynte Arches &punctelev; ase þis Monekene cloistre is
In he wende a godes name &punctelev; and sette him al one an hei&yogh;;
he bi-heold a-boute in-to eche huyrne &punctelev; and þat quoy[n]te weork he sei&yogh;
Ase he bi-heold al-so a-boute &punctelev; þare come In at þe on ende
Twelf men in &yogh;wite cloþes &punctelev; swiþe faire and hende;
Alle heore crounes weren newe schaue— &punctelev; and suyþe faire heo him gretten
And alle heo seten faire a-doun &punctelev; and þane [kni&yogh;t] bi heom heo setten
¶ Þo seide on of heom, ase þei it þe prior were &punctelev; wel mildeliche and stille
"bev frere, i-hered beo Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat on þe brou&yogh;te swuche wille
And late þe þat þou&yogh; a-godes name hast bi-gonne &punctelev; for is holi grace wel ende
leue broþur, &yogh;wane þou woldest þis wei &punctelev; for þine sunnes wende
Oþur þov most beon studefast and hardi &punctelev; and in none manere tuyrne þi þou&yogh;t
Oþur þov worst for-lore, lif and soule &punctelev; and sone to þe deuel i-brou&yogh;t
For also-sone ase we beth heonne i-went &punctelev; þe feondes luþere and wicke
heo wollez come a-boute þe &punctelev; In-to þis hous ful þicke
And don þe tormens and wo i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; and bi-hote þe wel more;
And heo wollez also bi-hote þe Ioye i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; &yogh;if þov wolt leue heore lore;
And &yogh;if heo mouwen þoru&yogh; ani bi-heste &punctelev; oþur enie gile, þe ouer-come
For-soþe þov worst, lif and soule &punctelev; a-deuele wei al clene i-nome
Ake &yogh;if þov art studefast of heorte &punctelev; and on Ihesu crist wolt þenche
Ne for bi-heste[MS. heste heste] ne for wo &punctelev; fram him þou nelle blenche
Þou worst quit of alle þine sunnes &punctelev; þat þov hast euere i-wrou&yogh;t
And þov schalt i-seo alle þe Ioies &punctelev; þat guode men beoth inne i-brou&yogh;t
And al-so þe pine þat luþere men &punctelev; habbez for heore mis-dede
Ake in &yogh;wat wo þat þov euere art &punctelev; euere þench on god, ich rede
¶ And euere &yogh;wane heo tormentiez þe &punctelev; cri Iesu milce and ore
And, &yogh;if þou art studefast in gode bi-leue &punctelev; heo ne schullen defouli þe non-more
We bi-takez þe god of heuene &punctelev; and ich rede þov do bi ovre lore."
Þo nuste þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;ware heo bi-comen. &punctelev; he sat and si&yogh;te sore
Elinge he bilefte alone &punctelev; and cride on godes mi&yogh;te
And Armede him with holie beden &punctelev; a&yogh;en þe deuelene to fi&yogh;te
On þe holi gost he cride faste &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him faile;
he lokede euere &yogh;wane heo comen &punctelev; him for-to a-saille
Ase he sat a-godes name &punctelev; þe bataille for-to a-bide
Þare cam a sori reuful cri &punctelev; a-boute in eche side
Ase alþe world to-borste and to-breke &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te it was al-so
Þat, þei alle þe bestes of þe worlde &punctelev; to-gadere weren i-do
Ase[al. & ase] loude and ase grisliche ase heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; &yogh;eollinde ech-one heo were
Ake[al. om.] heo ne mi&yogh;ten a-mong heom alle &punctelev; make so grisliche bere
Þat[al. þat &yogh;if] is hope and is heorte on ihesu crist &punctelev; euere-more heo were,[r. nere]
Elles he hadde wod bi-come &punctelev; and i-lore is wit for fere
¶ Þo comen heo a-bouten him &punctelev; þicke and grisliche þere
&YOGH;eonijnde and grenninde on him &punctelev; with ful lodlich chere
"bel ami," quath þe on of heom &punctelev; "þou hast a-ri&yogh;t i-do
We owez wel alle a-nouri þe &punctelev; for al to fewe doth so
For alle oþere men wollez a-bide &punctelev; þat heore lif heom beo bi-nome
And &yogh;eot it is a&yogh;en heore wille &punctelev; þat heo schullen hidere come
And þov art i-come al bi þine liue &punctelev; and bi þine guode wille al-so;
Wel ou&yogh;te we þine mede &yogh;elde &punctelev; and gre[t] þonk also þe do
&YOGH;wane þov hast boþe bodi and soule &punctelev; i&yogh;yuen us bi þine liue
Saunt faille we ne beoth nou&yogh;t so onkuynde &punctelev; þat we it nellez &yogh;elde þe bliue
For þe kundenesse þat þov to us come &punctelev; al bi þine owene lore
Ake naþeles, &yogh;if þou wolt on eorþe &punctelev; habbe Ioye more
Sikere us an hond þat þov wolt &punctelev; In ore seruise bi-leue
And we þe wollez a&yogh;en to eorþe bringe &punctelev; al sauf, are hit beo eue
And þov schalt habbe þare Ioye i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; in halle and eke in boure
For none men ne fareth so murie þare &punctelev; ase þulke þat beoth ovre
hei&yogh; man and noble þov schalt beo &punctelev; and alle men schullen honouri þe
&YOGH;wane þov art ded ant comest to us &punctelev; þou schalt habbe ase guod ase we."
Þis kni&yogh;t þou&yogh;te euere on Iesu crist &punctelev; and nolde chaungi is wille
For þretninge ne for fair bi-heste &punctelev; ake sat him euere stille
Þo he nolde graunti nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to heom for-to wende
heo &yogh;ollen and grenneden on him foule &punctelev; and strong fuyr bi-gonne for-to tiende;
¶ Þis kni&yogh;t heo bounden honden and fet &punctelev; and a-midde þe fuyre him[Prima pena.] caste
With Irene Ovles and pikes &punctelev; heo to-drowen him wel faste
Þis kni&yogh;t hadde gret pine &punctelev; wel loude he cride a-non
"Ihesus, Ihesus, help me nouþe &punctelev; and do a-wei mine fon!"
A-non so [he] hadde þis word i-seid &punctelev; þat fuyr a-queinte ech spronke
And þe deuelene ne mi&yogh;ten him non more to-drawe. &punctelev; ore louerd he gan þonke
And þe hardiore he was i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þo he þis i-sei&yogh;
And þe lasse he was of heom a-drad &punctelev; þat weren him so nei&yogh;
Wel grisliche heo &yogh;ollen, þe schrewes &punctelev; þo heom faillede heore mi&yogh;t
And flouwen echone out of þe halle &punctelev; and drowen with heom þis kni&yogh;t
A-&yogh;en þe grounde heo drowen him harde &punctelev; boþe bi fet and honde
longe, him þou&yogh;te, and swiþe feor &punctelev; al-a-boute in a waste londe
So blac and deork was al þat lond &punctelev; þat no-þing he ne sei&yogh;
bote þe feondes þat him to-drowen &punctelev; þat so þicke weren him nei&yogh;
Ake swiþe softe wind þare was &punctelev; þat he heorde onneþe
Ake so scharpe he bleu&yogh; and colde &punctelev; þat brou&yogh;te him nei&yogh; to deþe;
Ri&yogh;t colde he wende þoru&yogh; is heorte &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; al is bodi also
Þat him were leouere þane al þe world &punctelev; þat þe pine were ido
Þus colde heo drowen him, ase heom[r. him] þou&yogh;te &punctelev; forth ri&yogh;t est, i-wis
Ase þe sonne a-rist in somer &punctelev; &yogh;wane þe dai lengest is
Þo heo comen, ase heom[r. prima Secunda1 pena] þou&yogh;te &punctelev; ri&yogh;t to þe worldes ende
bi a brod valeie heo torneden heom &punctelev; and southward gonne i-wende
toward þe stude þat þe sonne &punctelev; In winter doth a-rise
Þis seli kni&yogh;t was i-drawe &punctelev; and i-pined in fale wise
Þo þou&yogh;te him þat he i-heorde feor &punctelev; bi-fore him ase it were
Swiþe deolful cri and wop &punctelev; and swyþe revful bere;
Euere þe neor þat heo comen &punctelev; þe revlokur was þat cri
So longe [heo] drowen him, þat him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo weren ri&yogh;t þer-bi
¶ Þo comen heo into a wid feld &punctelev; non more ne mi&yogh;te beo
So long and brod in eche side &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende i-seo
Of men and of wummen þis feld was &punctelev; ful in eche side
Þe wombene to-ward þe grounde &punctelev; i-spradde a-brod ful wide
hondene and fet al a-brod &punctelev; to þe eorþe faste i-bounde
With Irene nailles al fuyrie &punctelev; i-smite þoru&yogh; heom to grounde
Þis wrechche gostes weren[al. om.] so i-pinede &punctelev; with Irene and with fuyre
So deolful cri heo maden þare &punctelev; þat gret deol it was to huyre;
heo criden merci deolfulliche &punctelev; Ake no merci men nolde heom do;
For Anguische þe eorþe heo freten &punctelev; and hore tongene gnowen al-so
Þe deoulene ornen opon hem &punctelev; and treden heom to þe grounde
And with Ovles swiþe kene &punctelev; maden heom mani a wounde.
Allas, &yogh;wy nellez men beon i-war &punctelev; and heore sunnes here bete
Are heo comen to purgatorie &punctelev; and with þe luþere gostes mete
For ase wel beth þe schrewes in purgatorie &punctelev; and ouer-al, ase in helle
And schullen for-to þe dai&yogh;e of dome come &punctelev; telle &yogh;wat men telle.
Þe feondes seiden, "ri&yogh;t ase [þis] men beoth i-pinede &punctelev; þov schalt beo also
bote þov wolle þi þou&yogh;t wende &punctelev; and after ovre rede do."
¶ And þo he nolde in none manere &punctelev; to grounde harde heo him caste
And tormenteden him ase þe oþere weren &punctelev; and to þe eorþe naileden him faste
Ake he criede a-non to ihesu crist &punctelev; þo him smert so sore
Þare nas non of þe schrewes þo &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;ten serui him so more
[Tertia pena.]Þo þe schrewes i-sei&yogh;en þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; heore wille habben þo
heo drowen him into an oþur felde &punctelev; wel ful of more wo
Of Men and wummen it was ful &punctelev; op-ri&yogh;t i-sprad to grounde
Fet and hondene a-to i-drawe &punctelev; and to þe eorþe faste i-bounde
With glowinde biendes al of Ire &punctelev; i-nailede heo weren þer-to;
Al fuyrie naddrene ope heom seten &punctelev; and foule crapoudes al-so
Some of þe naddrene bi-clupten heom &punctelev; so faste al a-boute
Þat heom þou&yogh;te heo scholden to-berste &punctelev; so streite heo gurden heom with-oute;
Some seten ope heom &punctelev; and heore flesch al-to-gnowe
And with kene tieth al fuyrie &punctelev; wombe and breoste to-drowe
Some with hore scharpe tounges &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe heorte sore heom smite;
Some heo gnowen, and some heo stounge &punctelev; and some with scharpe tieth heom bite
Þe Crapoudes al-so, þat weren so foule &punctelev; op-on heore breostene sete
And stoungen heom þoru&yogh; heore heortene &punctelev; with heore foule wrottes grete
Þe luþere gostes ornen al-so &punctelev; a-boute heom i-nowe
With hokes and with ou&yogh;les &punctelev; a[nd][MS. a] with gret eir heom to-drowe
Þe wrechche gostes, so for-pinede &punctelev; in swuch torment weren[al. om.] i-brou&yogh;t
heo criden alle deolfulliche &punctelev; ake hit ne halp heom nou&yogh;t
¶ Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and wolden him pini al-so
Ake anon so he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;ten heo bringe him þer-to
&YOGH;eot þe feondes eft-sone him nomen &punctelev; and to þe þridde feld him[Quarta pena.] brou&yogh;te
In stronge pine he sai&yogh; þare wrechche gostes &punctelev; þat of heom-self luyte rou&yogh;te
Þat weren i-spradde on þe eorþe abrod &punctelev; and i-smiten þoru&yogh;-out ech-one
with nailes þicke al abrod &punctelev; ase þare mi&yogh;ten stikie one
Þat man ne mi&yogh;te finde ane amtie place &punctelev; on al heore bodie so luyte
Þat man mi&yogh;te for þe þicke nailles &punctelev; a fingres ende to heom puyte
¶ A smart wind also to oþur wo &punctelev; on heom bleu&yogh; wel faste
Þat heom þou&yogh;te heo weren i-barnd &punctelev; þoru&yogh;-out with eche blaste
Þe feondes ornen faste a-boute &punctelev; fram ech to oþur i-nowe
And heore wrechche flesch with oþur wo &punctelev; mid Ovles heom to-drowe
Þeos wrechche gostes, so fur-pinede &punctelev; and in swuch torment i-brou&yogh;t
Revliche heo criden ase heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; ake it ne halp heom ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t;
For heo weren so clene ouer-come &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten onneþe
Ani voiz out-bringe bote ase a man &punctelev; þat were ope þe pointe of deþe
In heore þrote heo criden dimmeliche &punctelev; for heore strencþe heom was bi-nome
With muche pine, and no wonder it nas &punctelev; þei heo weren ouer-come
Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and to grounde him caste
And seiden, bote he wolde turne is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; heo wolden naili him þare wel faste
Ake he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and nemde is holi name
Þe schrewes ne hadden none mi&yogh;te þo &punctelev; to don him more schame
[Quinta pena.]&YOGH;eot heo nomen and drowen him &punctelev; into þe feorþe felde
Ful of brumston al brenninde &punctelev; with stronge lei&yogh;e and spelde
¶ Ech manere pine þat mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; In þulke felde he sei&yogh;
Some with chaines of Ire &punctelev; al fuyrie, hengen on hei&yogh;
Some bi Armes, some bi fet &punctelev; and bi þe necke mani on
heo weren an-hangede in stronge fuyre &punctelev; of pich and eke brumston;
Some hengen bi stronge crokus &punctelev; I-pulte þoru&yogh; eiþur Ey&yogh;e
Þoru&yogh; þe þrote some also &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; eiþur ere wel hei&yogh;e
And some þoru&yogh; heore derne limes &punctelev; and some þoru&yogh; þe tete
Þat leuere heom were þane al þe world &punctelev; heore lyf to habbe i-lete
Some op-on grediles of Ire &punctelev; i-rostede weren also
Some ase gyes, þe spites of Ire &punctelev; þoru&yogh;-out heom i-do;
Some leyen opri&yogh;t a-&yogh;ein þe grounde &punctelev; &yogh;eonijnde wel faste
Þe feondes welden led and bras &punctelev; and in heore mouþes caste
he ne mi&yogh;te bi-þenche no manere pine &punctelev; þat he ne sai&yogh; mo þer
him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; þare mani on &punctelev; þat he knev on eorþe her
Þe feondes him casten a-midde þis pine &punctelev; a-mong þis oþere ech-on
And he cride on Iesu crist &punctelev; and was deliured a-non
[Sexta pena.]¶ &YOGH;eot þis feondes þis selie kni&yogh;t &punctelev; into an oþur place huy drowe
Þare-Inne he i-sai&yogh; a grislich &yogh;weol &punctelev; with spokene longe i-nowe;
Þat on ende hangede toward þe grounde &punctelev; þat oþur op-on hei&yogh;
Ful it was of hokes and pikes &punctelev; wel þicke, ase he i-sei&yogh;;
Þis hokes and þis pikes weren &punctelev; faste i-riuen al-so
With wrechche gostes al-a-boute &punctelev; þat þaron weren i-do
Al brenninde was þis sorie &yogh;weol &punctelev; and stinkinde of brumston;
Þe wrechche gostes þat þar-on hengen &punctelev; brenninde weren ech-on
Þis feondes wenden forth a-non &punctelev; and heore hokes þaron caste
In eiþur side, a[nd][MS. a] tur[n]den a-boute &punctelev; þis sori &yogh;weol so faste
Þat of þe gostus þat þaron hengen &punctelev; no-þing heo ne sei&yogh;e
So faste heo torneden þat &yogh;weol a-boute— &punctelev; bote þe brenninde lei&yogh;e;
Ake deolfulliche heo criden and &yogh;ollen &punctelev; euer-ech in is ende.
Alas, &yogh;wi nellez men beon i-war &punctelev; are heo heonnes wende
&YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;ten here with a luytel pine &punctelev; bete heore mis-dede
And þare heo schullen so bitere a-bugge &punctelev; alas, þe wrechhede!
Þis feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and on þis &yogh;weol him caste
And with þis oþere wrechche gostes &punctelev; torneden him a-boute faste
Sone he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; deliuered he was a-non;
Þe feondes stoden and bi-heolden &punctelev; with dreori mod ech-on
[Septima pena.]¶ Eft heo nomen him bitterliche &punctelev; and ferrore &yogh;uyt him ladde
And harleden him forth wel revfulliche &punctelev; and loude &yogh;ollen and gradde
bi-fore him he sai&yogh; an hous stonde &punctelev; long and brod i-nov&yogh;;
stunch and hete þat þarof cam &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te al-mest [him] a-slou&yogh;
he with-stod, and nolde, is þonkes &punctelev; for stunche gon non ner;
"Ferrore þov schalt," þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t a-bide her;
A bath it is þat þov isijcst &punctelev; and þar-inne þov schalt beo
And baþi with oþere þat þare beoth &punctelev; ne schalt þov nou&yogh;t so fleo."
Þe gostes þat þare-inne weren &punctelev; wel deolfulliche cride
And &yogh;ollen loude, ase he i-heorde &punctelev; a-boute in eche side
Þis kni&yogh;t with þis foule wi&yogh;tes &punctelev; Into þe grete house cam
Of tormens þat he þare isai&yogh; &punctelev; gret gome with-alle he nam
ful of puttes and of diches &punctelev; þat hous with-inne it was;
More seoruwe ne more stunch &punctelev; neuere i-sei&yogh;e nas
heo weren folle of stronge tormens &punctelev; boillinde euer-ech-on
Of wallinde led, and i-fulde heo weren &punctelev; of piche and brumston
Wrechche gostus þare-inne seten &punctelev; þe torment tilde wel hei&yogh;e
Some a-boue þe heued &punctelev; and some ri&yogh;t to þe Ey&yogh;e
Some to þe nose, and some to þe mouth &punctelev; and some op to þe swere
And some to heore breostene &punctelev; and a-bou&yogh;ten heore sunnes ful deore
And some to heore nauele &punctelev; and some neþerrore more
And some stoden op to heore knen &punctelev; and criden and weopen sore
And some stoden In with boþe fet &punctelev; and some with þat on;
Deolfolliche heo weopen and criden &punctelev; and &yogh;ollen euerechon
¶ "Nov þov i-sixt," queþen þe feondes &punctelev; "&yogh;woder-In þov schalt gon
bote þov wolle an-oþur speke &punctelev; and to us tuyrne a-non."
heo nomen and casten him In a putte. &punctelev; on Iesus a-non he cride
Op he cam a-non a-&yogh;en &punctelev; and no lengore he ne moste þare a-bide
[Octaua pena.]heo nomen him in grete wrathþe &punctelev; and harleden him ferrere more
And brou&yogh;ten him opon a swyþe gret hul &punctelev; ful of sorewe and sore
he stod and bi-heold a-boute &punctelev; þo he cam þare-op an hei&yogh;;
him wondrede of þe manie gostes &punctelev; þat he þare i-sei&yogh;
Alle þe pinene[al. þat alle] þat he hadde er i-sei&yogh;e &punctelev; þare-a&yogh;en nou&yogh;t nere
I-clui&yogh;te heo seten ope heore ton &punctelev; and quakeden revliche for fere
In þe south-half of þe hul &punctelev; a deop water þare was and lou&yogh;
Þat foule stonk, and caldore was &punctelev; þane ani ys oþur snov&yogh;
A norþerne wind faste blev&yogh; &punctelev; þat him þou&yogh;te is flesch to-rende;
Euere þare seten gostes &punctelev; and a-&yogh;ein þe winde heom wende
heo quakeden and chyuereden faste &punctelev; in grete pine and stronge
Ase ho-so seith a-bidet þare heore time &punctelev; heore deth for-to a-fonge
"lo," seide on of þe feondes &punctelev; "þov nost nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat istis;
bote þov torne þi þou&yogh;t sone &punctelev; þou schalt i-wite, i-wis."
Ne hadde he bote þis word i-seid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam a wind blowe
And drof alle þis wrechche gostes &punctelev; into þe deope watur ful lowe;
¶ Þe Norþerne wynd drof heom a-doun &punctelev; al mid one blaste
And alle þe gostes, and þene kni&yogh;t &punctelev; a-midde þe watere hem caste
More pine ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; of stronge chele ne of stunche
Þane þis gostes þarinne hadden &punctelev; þare ne mi&yogh;te non at-blenche
Þo þe kni&yogh;t þe stronge pine &punctelev; of þis water i-felde
he gan to crie on Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat faillede him ful selde
A-non-ri&yogh;t with-oute lette &punctelev; op of þis watere man him[al. he (man om.)] drov&yogh;
Ake þis wrechche gostes lefden þere &punctelev; with sorewe and wo i-nov&yogh;
For in þat water, þat was so cold &punctelev; and so foule stonk also
Þis gostes swymden op and doun &punctelev; in muche sorewe and wo;
Þe feondes ornen opon þe watere &punctelev; so men doth on þe londe
And &yogh;wane ani wolde coueri[al. cleueri] op &punctelev; with fote oþur with honde
heo pulten him a-doun a-&yogh;en &punctelev; þat þare ne a-scapede non;
Þare was wo and sorewe i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; a-mong heom euerechon
¶ Þis feondes wenden forth a-non &punctelev; and þe seli kni&yogh;t eft nome
And drowen him into a sori stude &punctelev; þare neuer er heo ne come
heo comen and stoden ouer a put &punctelev; wyd it was and deop i-nov&yogh;;
A brenninde smoke, þat foule stonk &punctelev; op of þe putte drov&yogh;
Þat onneþe þe kny&yogh;t mi&yogh;te stonde &punctelev; for sori stunch þare-nei&yogh;
Wrechche gostes in þis put &punctelev; in þat sori smoke he sei&yogh;
Fleo op and doun al brenninde &punctelev; ase speldene doth of fuyre
And in-to þe putte eft fullen a-doun &punctelev; þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng duyre
him þou&yogh;te he was al ouer-come &punctelev; for þe stunche þat þar-op of drov&yogh;;
Þare-bi him þou&yogh;te þat in þe grounde &punctelev; was soruwe and deol i-nov&yogh;
"&YOGH;wy stanst þov so?" þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þinchþ þe þarof wonder
Of þis swete smoke þat here bloweth &punctelev; and &yogh;wat put beo þare-onder
[Puteum Inferni.]¶ In þis put is ovre woneingue &punctelev; for þe put of helle it is;
And, for þov us hast i-serued wel &punctelev; here þov schalt wonie, i-wis
For alle þat us seruieth wel &punctelev; hidere heo schullen wende;
And, &yogh;if þov comest here-in with us &punctelev; þov worst here with-outen ende
Þare-fore i rede torne þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; and do us here man-rede
And we schullen þene wei ase we come[MS. conne] &punctelev; al sauf a-&yogh;en þe lede;
Þov schalt on eorþe al þi lijf habbe &punctelev; richesse, and Ioye al-so
For we schullen on eorþe þe finde i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is þat we do."
Þo þe kni&yogh;t for-sok heore bi-heste &punctelev; ase he hadde er i-lome
heo smiten heom a-doun into þe putte &punctelev; and þene kni&yogh;t with heom nome
Þe deoppore þat heo comen &punctelev; þ[e] braddere þe put was;
Ake[al. þat] al þe wo þat he isai&yogh; er &punctelev; a-&yogh;ein þat nou&yogh;t it nas
Of stunch, of brenninge, and of oþur wo &punctelev; þe kni&yogh;t was so ouer-come
Þat is þov&yogh;t toward Iesu crist &punctelev; nei&yogh; him was bi-nome;
So muche pine nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e— &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te ase þei he felde
Þat he was nei&yogh; ope þe pointe &punctelev; þene gost op to &yogh;elde
Ake ore louerd a-mong al is wo &punctelev; grace him &yogh;af atþe laste
Þat he þou&yogh;te on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and to him cride [faste].[MS. atþe laste]
A smoke þare cam smite up a-non &punctelev; mid one wel stronge blaste
Þene kni&yogh;t an hei&yogh; a-boue þe putte &punctelev; and manie oþere[al. om.] gostes, caste
Þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;wirlede op in þis blast &punctelev; ase speldene doth, wel wide
Atþe laste he li&yogh;te a-doun &punctelev; a-boue þe putte bi side
Þare he stod and bi-heold a-boute &punctelev; ase man þat witles were
Þat for þe pine þat he hadde i-haued &punctelev; he nuste hov he cam þere
Þo he hadde longe i-stonde al one &punctelev; and bi-holde a-boute
Þare comen blaste op of þe putte &punctelev; deuelene a gret rou&yogh;te
And [stoden] bi him al a-boute &punctelev; al newe as þei heo were;
Ase him þou&yogh;te, he ne sai&yogh; hem &punctelev; neuer er bote þo þere
heo bi-heolden him wel grisliche &punctelev; and grenneden on him al-a-boute
And seiden, "&yogh;wi stanst þov here al one? &punctelev; þov most come into ovre rovte."
heo seiden, "tolden ore felawes þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle
hit nis nou&yogh;t so, ake we wollez sone &punctelev; for ri&yogh;te soþe þe telle
Nostþov nou&yogh;t þat it is ore ri&yogh;te &punctelev; to li&yogh;en euere-mo
And þat we with lesingues bi-traieth men &punctelev; bote it mowe oþur go
And so ore felawes louwen þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle;
Ake þov schalt come þudere with us &punctelev; and þe soþe we wollez þe telle."
¶ Þis deouelene harleden þane kni&yogh;t forth &punctelev; þat wo was him to-drawe
Þat him were leouere þane ani-þing &punctelev; þat he hadde i-beo of lif-dawe
So þat heo comen to a swyþe gret watur &punctelev; deop and brod i-nov&yogh;;
A strong mist, þat foule stonk &punctelev; op of þis watere drov&yogh;
Of brumston and of oþur wo— &punctelev; so strong stunch neuere he ne sei&yogh;
Þat mid al þe pine of þe world &punctelev; onneþe he stod þere-nei&yogh;
A brugge þare was ouer þat watur &punctelev; smallere ne mi&yogh;te non beo;
Þe smoke was so þicke al-a-boute &punctelev; þat onneþe he mi&yogh;te [it] i-seo
þo seiden þe sorie fendes &punctelev; "we seggez þe i-wis
Þat onder þis deope watere &punctelev; þe put of helle so is
And þat þov schalt sone i-wite &punctelev; for þov schalt sone a-non
ouer þis watur, þat is so deop &punctelev; opon þis brugge gon
And we schullen þe sende swuch a wynd &punctelev; þat schal þe amidde caste
And ore felawes þat beoth bi-neothe &punctelev; schullen þe nime wel faste
And drawe þe doun forth with hem &punctelev; Into helle grounde a-non
Cum novþe forth and þou&yogh; schalt &punctelev; op-on þis brugge gon."
heo nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and op-on þis brugge drowe
And maden him go þere, is on-þonkes &punctelev; with wrechhedes i-nowe
Þreo þingus vuele i-nowe &punctelev; on þis brugge were
Þare-oppe gon and so deope a-doun &punctelev; habbe so grisliche si&yogh;te;
Þare-oppe sette ani fot &punctelev; þat he ne fulle a-doun a-non;
Þe þridde, þat heo was so slider &punctelev; þat man ne mi&yogh;te þare-oppe gon
bote he slide and felle a-doun &punctelev; so slei&yogh; man neuere nere
Þeos þreo þinges þesne selie kni&yogh;t &punctelev; brou&yogh;ten in grete fere
For heo was narov&yogh;, and slider, and hei&yogh; &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him so bi-telle
&YOGH;if þat he glufte[al. glide] in ani half &punctelev; þat he ne fulle in-to helle
¶ Þare-oppe he was with strencþe i-brou&yogh;t &punctelev; and þare-oppe i-maket to gon
So gret drede, ase him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; ne hadde he neuer er non
Ake sone he þou&yogh;te on ihesu crist &punctelev; þat so ofte him sauede er
And cride on is holie name &punctelev; þat he were is helpe þer
he eode forth we[l] baldeliche &punctelev; and þe innore þat he cam
Þe hardiore him þou&yogh;te he was &punctelev; and þe betere heorte to him he nam
And þe braddore was is wei— &punctelev; so longe forth he eode
Þat it was so brod þat þere mi&yogh;te &punctelev; a carte gon for neode
And so longe, þat tuei cartes mi&yogh;te &punctelev; meten heom wel i-nov&yogh;
Þe kni&yogh;t þo wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase a maister forth him drou&yogh;
Þe feondes stoden bi-neþe þe brugge &punctelev; and sei&yogh;en him so faste gon
And for al þe wo þat heo him duden &punctelev; ne ouer-cam him nou&yogh;t on;
heom þou&yogh;te, it was al for nou&yogh;t &punctelev; after him to honten more
grisliche heo gonne forto &yogh;eolle &punctelev; ant to crie and wepe suyþe sore
Þat for þe &yogh;eollinge þat heo maden &punctelev; he hadde wel more fere
Þane of al þe pine þat he hadde er &punctelev; so lodlich was þe bere;
¶ heore Oules heo nomen and heore hokes &punctelev; and toward him casten an hei&yogh;;
Ake þare nas non þat him touchi mi&yogh;te &punctelev; ne no-þing come him nei&yogh;
So þat al sauf with alle Ioye &punctelev; ouer þis watere he him drov&yogh;
And þe feondes lefden bi-hinde &punctelev; with grete soruwe ant sor i-nou&yogh;
In helle is heore kuynde heritage &punctelev; and elles for-soþe it were wov&yogh;
heo leten him go &yogh;wodere he wolde &punctelev; and ne fondeden him non more
And heolden heom cleneliche ouer-come &punctelev; for al heore false lore
Þis kni&yogh;t wende him forth, sauf i-nou&yogh;— &punctelev; þat he hadde erore deore a|bou&yogh;t
And þonkede &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat þe feondes ne siweden him nou&yogh;t
Þat watur he passede sauf inov&yogh; &punctelev; and forþere þene wey he nam
Þe contrie him þou&yogh;te murie i-nou&yogh; &punctelev; þare-forth þat he cam;
Þe forþere þat he wende &punctelev; þe more murevþe he sei&yogh;
So [longe] þat he i-sai&yogh; ane wal &punctelev; swiþe noble and hei&yogh;
So riche weork nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e &punctelev; ase him [þou&yogh;te] þat þar-on was;
And swyþe fair &yogh;at þaron he sai&yogh; &punctelev; þat neuere swuch i-sei&yogh;e nas;
Þat &yogh;at schon swyþe bri&yogh;te &punctelev; ase þei it al gold were
Folle of derewurþe stones i-pi&yogh;te &punctelev; none richere neuere nere
him þou&yogh;te, are he þudere cam &punctelev; is wei ful longe laste
Þo he cam forþere a luytel wi&yogh;t &punctelev; he stod and bi-heold it faste
Þat [&yogh;at][om.] wende op a&yogh;en him &punctelev; and a-non-ri&yogh;t with þe dede
Þare cam smite out a swote smel &punctelev; and wide a-boute gan sprede
Þat him þou&yogh;te, þei al þe world &punctelev; swote spices were
So muche swotnesse ne mi&yogh;te &yogh;iuen &punctelev; ase þat suote smul dude þere
In so gret Ioye him þou&yogh;te he was &punctelev; þat þei he hadde beo i-brou&yogh;t
In-to al þe soruwe þat he was er &punctelev; it ne schulde him habbe i-greued nou&yogh;t
he bi-heold in at þis &yogh;ate &punctelev; þo he cam þer-nei&yogh;
More clernesse nas neuere i-sei&yogh;e &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, þane he þere i-sei&yogh;
Ase he wolde þare-In wende &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him þare cam gon
A procession fair i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; of noble men ech-on
with creoiz and with taperes &punctelev; and with baneres clere;
I-reuested faire muche folk was &punctelev; and ech hadde is fere
Some were bischopus and Ercedeknes &punctelev; and some Monekes and freres
And euerech, him þou&yogh;te, hadde þe Abite &punctelev; þat heo wereden here
with þe meste Ioye þat mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; þis kni&yogh;t was onder-fonge
And i-lad In with Ioye i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; mid solas and murie songe
Þo þis murie song was i-do &punctelev; to him sone þare come
Tweien ase it maistres weren &punctelev; and bi þe honde him nome
And welcomeden him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkeden ore louerd faste
Þat him sende so guode bi-leue &punctelev; so stableliche for-to laste
heo ladden him a-boute and scheweden him &punctelev; þat lond fer and ner
So muche Ioie and clernesse &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te he ne sai&yogh; neuer er
¶ Ase þe sonne bi-nimez þe li&yogh;t &punctelev; of Candle a-boute Midday
So long and brod þe place was &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende i-seo
A fair Medwe he sai&yogh;[al. Al murie med] with swete floures : swottere ne mi&yogh;te non beo
Treon al-so with noble fruyt &punctelev; þat smulde swote Inov&yogh;;
And þe[al. So gret] swotnesse of euer-ech stude &punctelev; al a-boute op drou&yogh;
Þat þare with-oute mete and drunch &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, euere-mo
he mi&yogh;te libbe with alle Ioie &punctelev; &yogh;if he moste þare-Inne go
It was þere euere i-liche li&yogh;t &punctelev; and euere it was dai
So muche folk in none place, him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; neuer er he ne sai&yogh;
Ech Compaygnie to oþur drov&yogh; &punctelev; and ech bi oþur stod
With murie song and Melodie &punctelev; and gladnesse in heore mod
Þat ech of oþur þe more Ioye &punctelev; to-gadere heo mi&yogh;ten a-fonge;
Al-mi&yogh;ti god, þat heom schop &punctelev; heo hereden In heore songe
And ase sum steorre þat &yogh;e i-seoth &punctelev; bri&yogh;tore þane oþur is
Also was bi heom, for some weren &punctelev; clerore þane some, i-wis;
Ake þulke þat mest dosk was &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, was more cler
And bri&yogh;tore schon, þane ani gold &punctelev; þat he i-sai&yogh; euer er
¶ Ech werede cloþes of þe en-taile &punctelev; þat heo wereden on eorþe here
Monekes ase it to Monek bi-feol &punctelev; and freres ase to frere;
So þat heo hadden heore ri&yogh;te fourme &punctelev; ake wel bri&yogh;tore was hore hev
Ant &yogh;wat men heo were on eorþe &punctelev; bi heore cloþinge he knev
Some hadden þe croune of golde &punctelev; an-ouewarde þe heued ido
And some beren in heore hond &punctelev; &yogh;eordene of golde al-so
And alle heo þonkeden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat so studefast heorte him sende
Þe kni&yogh;t, for al þe pine þat he hadde &punctelev; is heorte enes ne wende;
Ech-one heom þou&yogh;te þat for him &punctelev; In þe more Ioye heo were
he stod and bi-heold al þis Ioie &punctelev; as þei no wit on him nere
Þe on, ase it heore maister were &punctelev; is Mouth ondude wel softe
And welcomede him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkede ore louerd ofte
Þat swuch porpos him hadde i-send &punctelev; and studefast heorte al-so
Þat he ne chaungede nou&yogh;t is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; for al þat him was i-do
"bev frere," he seide, "i-herd beo god &punctelev; þat þe hauez hidere i-brou&yogh;t
And a-mong alle þine stronge fon &punctelev; studefast i-wust þi þou&yogh;t
Of þe pine of sunfule gostes &punctelev; I-fondet þov hauest i-nou&yogh;
And þare-with þine sunnes i-bet &punctelev; and elles it were wou&yogh;
¶ Þov mi&yogh;t here sumdel i-seo &punctelev; þat þov wilnest more
Of þe Ioye þat guode soulene habbez &punctelev; þat comieth to milce and ore
Þis place þat we inne beoth &punctelev; ich wene þov ne knowest nou&yogh;t
It is eorþelich parays &punctelev; þat Adam was Inne i-brou&yogh;t
And þat he was Inne ymad &punctelev; and sethþe for is mis-dede
he was i-cast out þar-of, and we also &punctelev; on eorþe into alle wrechchehede;
¶ Al þe Ioye þat þov i-sixt her &punctelev; he hadde to is wille
Ake he ne mi&yogh;te, þo he was out i-cast &punctelev; þar-of i-seo wurth a fille
Of wrechhede we beoth i-kened &punctelev; and of sunful blode i-come
And þat us is þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; ant þoru&yogh; ore cristinedom bi-nome
Ak þat we aftur ore cristindom &punctelev; of sunne on eorþe wrou&yogh;te
On eorþe oþur in purgatorie &punctelev; wel deore we it bou&yogh;te
For we alle þat þou here i-sixt &punctelev; þare-forth hidere come
And ore sunnes þare betten &punctelev; and harde penaunce nome
Ne mi&yogh;te we elles here come. &punctelev; ase guod bi þe it is
For &yogh;if þine sunnes nere for-&yogh;iue &punctelev; þov ne come nou&yogh;t here, i-wis
And alle þat þov þare i-sei&yogh;e &punctelev; to us þudere heo schullen wende
And al dai doth some, &yogh;wane heo habbez &punctelev; heore penaunce i-brou&yogh;t to ende
Neuer on not hov longe he schal &punctelev; þare bi-leue, i-wis;
For ho-so ani freond on eorþe hath &punctelev; mid him þe betere it is
Þoru&yogh; massene and þoru&yogh; oþur beden &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; almes-dede
Man mai hore pine muche a-legge &punctelev; and þe sonore ovt þar-of heom lede
And &yogh;wane ani of heom hidere comez &punctelev; a&yogh;en him we wendez ech-on
Ase we duden a-&yogh;ein þe, with Ioye &punctelev; and ledez him In a-non
Ake non of us nis &yogh;uyt wuyrthþe &punctelev; in-to heuene for-to wende
Ne neuere on not &yogh;wane ovre louerd &punctelev; after ani of us wole sende;
For ech man þat in-to heuene schal &punctelev; þoru&yogh; purgatorie mot
