And sethþe into eorþeliche parays &punctelev; ase we beoth novþe, wel ich wot
For þis is ovre kuynde heritage &punctelev; i-wrou&yogh;t we weren þar-to
Al for-to ore furste fader it a-gulte &punctelev; and for-to he hadde mis-do;
here we scholden alle habbe i-beon i-bore &punctelev; and i-leoued ore lif al-so
For ore louerd wold þat we weren &punctelev; In þe more Ioye i-do
Þei men beon ovt heonnes i-cast &punctelev; here-forth heo moten wende
And[om. and] a&yogh;en, ar heo to heouene come &punctelev; aftur heore liues ende
Ake al þe Ioye þat is here &punctelev; nis no-þing, i-wis
A-&yogh;ein þe leste Ioye of heouene &punctelev; wel muche þe meste is
Sum-þing þov schalt of heuene i-seo &punctelev; In a place here-nei&yogh;."
he ladde him op-on an hei&yogh; hul &punctelev; and bad him bi-holde on hei&yogh;
And axede him of &yogh;wuch colur were &punctelev; heuene op-ri&yogh;t þere
he seide, him þou&yogh;te ri&yogh;t ase gold &punctelev; þat puyr wallinde were
"&YOGH;e," seide þis oþur, "þis is þe wei &punctelev; þat geth ri&yogh;t to heuene blis
And þat is þe &yogh;at of parays &punctelev; þat with-oute heuene &yogh;eond is
¶ Ech day some of purgatorie &punctelev; comez hidere us to
And some of us to heuene wendez &punctelev; euer-eche daye also;
So þat [we] wexez eche daie &punctelev; and waniez, þov sixt lo;
We nutez &yogh;wuch of us it schal beo next &punctelev; bote as god wole habbe i-do
Ech dai þe &yogh;wuyle we here beoth &punctelev; ore louerd us fedez ene
with riche metes of heuene &punctelev; þat swete is and clene;
&yogh;wuche þulke metes beon &punctelev; are þov heonnes wende
with us þov schalt sone i-wite &punctelev; &yogh;wane god it wole us sende."
Ne hadde he bote o word i-seid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam a-li&yogh;te
A manere brez fram heouene a-doun &punctelev; þat schon wel clere and bri&yogh;te
Þat ouer-spradde al þat lond &punctelev; and a cler leome þare-with-oute
And[al. om.] opon euereches heued a-li&yogh;te a-doun &punctelev; wel faire, with-outen doute,[al. clerore þane aboute]
And op-on þis kni&yogh;tes heued al-so &punctelev; an þoru&yogh; him smot a-non
And þoru&yogh; euerech lime and lith of him &punctelev; þat swete li&yogh;t gan gon;
Þa[t] so muche wille[r. winne?] and Ioye &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, neuere he nadde
he stod, ase þei he were i-nomen &punctelev; for Ioye þat he þo hadde
&YOGH;weþur he were quik oþur ded &punctelev; bote ase he in metingue were
louerd, murie is þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; ase he i-felde wel þere
Ake it ne laste heom bote luytele &yogh;wile &punctelev; þat þe leome ne with|drov&yogh;;
And naþeles, þei it luyte laste &punctelev; þar-of heo weren fulle i-nov&yogh;
Þe kni&yogh;t stod and bi-heold a-boute &punctelev; and is ri&yogh;te stat onder-stod
So fol he was of þat holi leome &punctelev; þat so swete was and guod
him þou&yogh;te, þei he leouede euere-more &punctelev; and neuereft more ne ete
Ne scholde him neuer-eft to mete luste &punctelev; so guod was þe leome and swete
"Lo," seide þis oþur gost &punctelev; þat schewede him al þis place
"Sum-del þov hast nouþe isei&yogh;e &punctelev; of ore louerdes grace
¶ Of þe pine þat þe wrechche gostes &punctelev; habbeth for heore mis|dede
And of þe Ioye þat guode gostes &punctelev; in parays doth lede
And sum-del of þe grete Ioie &punctelev; þat in þe ri&yogh;te heuene is
Eche dai&yogh;e we beoth i-fedde &punctelev; ones with swuche Ioie and blis
And þanne beo we al dai fulle i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; for-to ore louerd more us sende
In swuche Ioie heo beoth þat beoth in heouene &punctelev; and worþez with|oute ende
And &yogh;uyt sum-del in more &punctelev; it ne faillez heom neuere mo
And we ne beoth a day bote enes &punctelev; for-to we þudere go;
And &yogh;wan þat we þudere comieth &punctelev; we schulle with-outen ende
And þou, &yogh;if þov a-seruest heuene forth &punctelev; þudere for-to wende
Þov mi&yogh;t don ase þov wolt &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe, i-wis
And þudere anon a-&yogh;en þou most— &punctelev; for-soþe, at þe time it is;
And &yogh;if þov wolt guod lif lede &punctelev; þine mede þov mi&yogh;t i-seo;
And &yogh;wat pine heo habbez, þov hast i-seie &punctelev; þat luþere wollez beo
A-&yogh;ein þou most wende a-non &punctelev; go forth a-godes name
For sikerliche þov mi&yogh;t gon &punctelev; þe feondes ne mowen don þe no schame;
heo beoth a-dradde wel sore of þe &punctelev; and a-schamede in eche side
A-godes name go forth þi wei &punctelev; þov ne mi&yogh;t no leng here a-bide!"
"A, sire, merci!" quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "bi-tide &yogh;wat me bi-tide
A fote i-nelle fram eov go &punctelev; for wrechche-hede[MS. hedede] goth so wide
¶ Ake soffriez me bi-leue here with ov! &punctelev; for, &yogh;if ich fram eov wende
A-drad ich am of þe feondene mi&yogh;te &punctelev; laste heo with sunne me schende."
"Do wei, beu frere," þis oþur seide &punctelev; "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille
And &yogh;if þov seruest wel ore louerd þere &punctelev; siker þov mi&yogh;t beo
to comen a-&yogh;ein hidere to us &punctelev; and sethþe to heuene fteo
A-godes half wend a-&yogh;en a-non &punctelev; for-soþe, þov schalt so."
"Alas, alas!" quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "&yogh;wat schal ich nouþe do
Al þe Ioye þat ich habbe nouþe isei&yogh;e &punctelev; it worth me bi-nome
And to þe wrechhede of þe worlde &punctelev; alas, schal ich novþe come!"
Ovt ate &yogh;ate heo brou&yogh;ten him &punctelev; wepinde, at þe laste
And beden him gon wel hardiliche &punctelev; and herien ore louerd wel faste;
A-non so he was with-oute i-gon &punctelev; þat &yogh;at heo maden wel bliue
With dreori mod he wende a-&yogh;en &punctelev; and was a-drad of is liue;
Ase he cam er, with careful mod &punctelev; þene wei a-&yogh;ein he nam
And, &yogh;wane ani deuel þat him pinede er &punctelev; ou&yogh;were a-&yogh;en him cam
Ase wode schrewene heo flouwen faste &punctelev; and ne dorsten a-bide him nou&yogh;t
So atþe laste þis kni&yogh;t was &punctelev; to þe halle a-&yogh;ein i-brou&yogh;t
Þare as þe holie compaygnie &punctelev; þuder-ward to him wende;
And sat him a-doun wel softe þere &punctelev; for-to ore louerd him grace sende
Ase he sat and bi-heold a-boute &punctelev; to him heo comen þere
Al þat faire compaygnie &punctelev; þat a-&yogh;ein him cam er
And honoureden him wel faire &punctelev; and conforteden him wel faste
And þonkeden Iesus, godes sone &punctelev; þat his bi-leue so wel i-laste
¶ "bev frere," heo seiden, "&yogh;wane þov hast &punctelev; swuch penaunce i|driue
Siker beo þou þat þine sunnes &punctelev; al clene þe beoth for-&yogh;iue
loke, &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe a-&yogh;en &punctelev; þat þov clene lif lede
So þat þov neuer-eft in pine ne come &punctelev; for sunne ne for mis-dede
Þov most don þe heonnes a-non &punctelev; for at hom in þine londe
hit dawez clere and is nei&yogh; dai &punctelev; ase ich me onder-stonde
And þe prior with procession &punctelev; to þe &yogh;ate comez wel sone
to loki &yogh;weþur þov beo i-come &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is forto done
And, bote he þe finde þere &punctelev; he wole maken þat &yogh;at a-non
And wole beo siker þat þou ne comest non-more &punctelev; and sori wole a-&yogh;en gon."[This verse on the margin.]
Þene kni&yogh;t heo brou&yogh;ten out of þe halle &punctelev; and blesseden him ech-on
And bi-tei&yogh;ten god boþe lif and soule &punctelev; fel and flesch and bon
Forth he wende wel dreoriliche &punctelev; bote ase he nede moste it do
And ri&yogh;t ase he cam to þe &yogh;ate &punctelev; þe prior cam al-so
A-&yogh;ein him with procession &punctelev; to loke hou it were
A-non so he hadde þe &yogh;ate on-loke &punctelev; þene kni&yogh;t heo founden þere
Þare was Ioye and blisse i-nov&yogh; &punctelev; þo huy to-gadere come
With song and oþur melodie &punctelev; þane kny&yogh;t þare-out huy nome
Ant ladden him forth to churche a-non &punctelev; ant þonkeden god wel faste
Þis kni&yogh;t bi-fore þe hei&yogh;e auctere &punctelev; a-knes wel sone him caste
Ant stableliche in his oresones &punctelev; fiftene dawes he lay
And þonkede ore louerd & on him cride &punctelev; boþe ny&yogh;t and day
And sethþe on his bare flesch &punctelev; þe holie croiz he nam
And wende to þe holie lond &punctelev; ant suyþe holi man bi-cam
he ne tolde neuere-eft nou&yogh;t of þe world &punctelev; bote ase he were euere in þou&yogh;te
Ake wende euere forth wel stilleliche[al. simpleliche] &punctelev; as he of no-þing ne rou&yogh;te
Ofte he tolde of alle þe men &punctelev; þat in parays were;
As him þou&yogh;te, grei&yogh;e Monekes &punctelev; mest Ioye hadden þere
None-manere men in so gret Ioye &punctelev; ne in so grete honour he ne sei&yogh;
hit nis no wonder sikerliche &punctelev; for þe ordre is noble and hei&yogh;.
Novþe &yogh;e habbez alle i-heord &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
hou seint paterik þulke purgatorie &punctelev; founde in þat place
For-to warni men a-boute &punctelev; heore sunnes here to bete
For þe loue of Iesu crist &punctelev; and of is moder swete
Alle ower sunnes betez here &punctelev; as god ov wole grace sende
Þat &yogh;e mouwen with-oute pine &punctelev; to parays hennes wende
god leue us ovre sunnes here so biete &punctelev; for is holie wounde
Þat we ne þoruen in purgatorie &punctelev; bi-leue bote luyte stounde
